Name: Expensive but not value
Review Content: The hotel is well located but the facilities provided were not to the level of the Hilton. The staff were trying to help but there are things which could not be translated into the service. The room i was allocated on the first floor smells of strong cigarette smoke even though the staff assured me that the rooms are non-smoking. Some of the amenities in the room were broken and not fixed and bedsheets/pillowcases are not changed for my stay (i stayed 4 nights).

Name: Nice, clean hotel
Review Content: After 2 weeks of a trip around Namibia, it was a welcome change to be in this 'corporate like' clean Hilton. Due to our diamond status, we were upgraded to a large suite room and had access to the executive lounge. Parking was convenient and cost a small amount of money.

Name: Long wait for checkin
Review Content: the hotel has beautiful rooms, an incomparable view from the pool, and the breakfast was very good, but: when we arrived in the afternoon around 3:00, most of the rooms booked for us were not yet ready, so we could not move in. The staff at the reception seemed disinterested or overwhelmed, also the manager did not show whether he was interested in our problem. Finally, after more than three hours of waiting, we were able to move into our rooms. I have never been treated so disrespectfully in any hotel. This was not worthy of a hotel with the Hilton name.

Name: Lage perfekt
Review Content: Ich bin ein Hilton-Fan, so habe ich mich auch in Windhoek in dieser Kette einquartiert. Die Hauptstadt Namibias gibt nicht so viel her und ist recht klein, doch steht das Hilton wenige Meter vom Zentrum entfernt. Die Bedienung ist nett, manchmal leider etwas √ºberfordert. Die Zimmer sind luxuri√∂s, mich st√∂rt nur das integrierte Badezimmer und das WC, welches lediglich durch eine Milchglasscheibe vom Zimmer getrennt ist. Das Fr√ºhst√ºcksbuffet ist reichhaltig, besonders zu empfehlen ist das Abendbuffet um ca. 25 Dollar. Niemals zuvor habe ich bessere Austern gegessen.

Name: Nice upscale property in the heart of Windhoek - great skybar and pool!
Review Content: It is important to note that I am ranking all the hotels we stayed at (7) based upon where these hotels are (e.g., Ranking them on Southern African standards not European or America...so a 4 star hotel in Southern Africa is not necessarily a 4 star hotel in Chicago. I did this to be fair and give my readers proper perspective)..okay on to the review....We stayed here for just one night on an 18 day trip through Southern Africa. The property is very modern and seems newer.  It is a full service hotel with a great pool and sky deck bar.  The rooms all seem updated and were quite nice.Here are the pros and cons:1.  The rooms are very nice and modern;2.  The on property restaurants were very nice and the food was good;3.  The sky deck bar and pool were outstanding;4.  Nice central location5.  Really nice staff and service.  We had a 3 am departure to catch a flight and the staff went out of their way to make sure that coffee service was set up for us at 2:45am and breakfast boxes were ready so we had the ability to eat.  This was for 13 people - I would  have given them 5 stars just for that...outstanding effort.6.  Wifi was excellent.  In Southern Africa Wifi is hit or really miss...the Hilton's wifi was a 5 star experience.Cons:1.  Only one real issue.  Their is tight security on the elevators to ALL the floors (which is great given that their is a very happening bar open to the public on the top floor), however, the staircase is unregulated.  We literally were able to walk up the staircase and access our various floors without any access control.  I think the hotel would be wise to tighten that up.2.  The room is the new "modern open" concept...so there is really no privacy between the room and the bath.  Some people like this and some don't.  It is fine but just want people to be aware.All in the property was one of the best we stayed at during the 18 days and I have rated as such.  I would highly recommend it.
Date: Date of stay: July 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Some good, some bad
Review Content: Stayed there for two occasions, both times for three nights. The airportpickup was fine, yet when I arrived to the hotel during the aerly hours they claimed that they had given my room away.. Since I arrived early in the morning I booked the room for the night before - it was prepaid and the reservation also had a note telling about my late arrival. Plus of course the hotel managed my pickup so they should have been well aware of my arrival time. After a serious argument they gave me the room. It was hot, really hot.. I called the reception and they sent someone from maintenance up. The guy said that AC can only be switched on for the whole floor and since it was freezing outside he would really not want to do that. Ok, I asked if he could turn it on later, he said yes but of course this was the end of the story, I checked out for a weekend in Etosha and came back two days later and again - they claimed that they do not have my reservation.. even though I had a prepaid voucher that I presented to them. This time I only got the room as I had to present at a seminar that took place in the hotel the next day.. But when I got to the room it was not cleaned. So down I went again.. This night I also got some free entertainment as there as a nightclub somewhere below my room (not sure whether it was in the hotel but the music was loud)Now it was not all negative though. Rooms are ok, bed is comfortable. Room service food was good and not expensive. Internet is decent. Breakfast was very good. The hotel has a nice rooftop bar and a small swimming pool. Conference facilites are ok.I rate this property as poor simply because there was way too much mess for my stays.
Date: Date of stay: June 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Cozy atmosphere

Name: Nice kickoff to trip around Namibia
Review Content: I spent 2 nights here before joining a 12-day safari all around the country.  It was a very comfortable, quiet couple of days.  A couple of notes:1) as others have said, the bedroom/bath are somewhat open to each other, so be aware.  Not a problem for those traveling solo, but....2) the premium lounge was very nice, and the rooftop bar and pool provided a lovely place to lounge away the afternoon3) I had a very nice massage--not the best message I've ever had in my life, but definitely the best $30 1-hour massage I've ever had (thanks to the favorable US-Namibian Rand currency exchange)!!4) as a single female, the desk and bell staff were quite concerned about me walking around the city by myself.  I arrived early-afternoon on a Saturday, and wanted to go out somewhere to experience the city, and received several warnings about how to stay safe and where not to go.  I should note that I felt perfectly safe the whole time, but appreciated the warnings.All in all, it was a very nice stay, and i would stay there again for certain!
Date: Date of stay: June 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: 5 Sterne ist nur die Einrichtung und der Preis
Review Content: Das Hotel ist zentral gelegen im Stadtzentrum, der historische Teil von Windhoek ist gut zu Fuss erreichbar. Design und Ausstattung des Hotel ist modern und hat alles von (kleinem) Swimmingpool auf dem Dach "mitten' neben der Bar, bis hin zum Fitnessraum, usw. Die Zimmer sind sauber und modern im √ºblichen Hilton Standard. Das Hotel ist relativ neu und das meiste funktioniert (noch). Der Schwachpunkt des Hotels ist der Standard des Personal. Sei es an der Rezeption, beim Concierge, im Speisesaal, in der Executive Lounge, an der Bar usw: meistens inkompetent, unzuverl√§ssig, unwillig und zuweilen auch unfreundlich. Nach 4 Tagen konnte ich immerhin jeweils eine Person je Abteilung/Fundktion identifizieren, welche hilfsbereit war und versuchte zu helfen. Die Liste aller negativen Erfahrungen w√§re schlicht zu lang, ich gebe daher nur eine allgemeine W√ºrdigung der Erlebnisse mit dem Personal.Insgesamt ist die Service Qualit√§t Meilen entfernt von Hilton Standard, geschweige von 5 Sterne Qualit√§t.
Date: Date of stay: October 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hhm, not convinced...
Review Content: I booked here as a treat to myself after nights of touring and camping, but I'm not convinced it was a good choice. Room nice, but no robe or slippers. Really wanted to get comfy and pad around in slippers! My main problem was with the Sky Bar/Pool area. I had to find my own towel, nobody takes care in welcoming guests to the area and in four hours I was never shown a menu or offered a drink. On going up to the bar myself, it took 5 minutes to even be acknowledged, staff too busy serving ice buckets of champagne to others. Other members of staff just simply kept walking past me. I would put it down to the staff not being in control of the area. Men at a table next to me brought their own laptop and pumped out their own rap music (also kept cutting off songs midway and changing tracks). Resulted in me moving away with a thumping headache. The bar should have control by providing chill out background tunes thereby dictating the vibe. It shouldn't be an area for wannabe gangsta rap djs! No class. In the evening, I went back up to enjoy outdoor dining under the stars. I ordered a pizza but 10 mins later, waitress had to double check which pizza as she'd forgotten. Again no real service. With no waitress walking around, I had to order at the bar which resulted in someone taking my table when I stood up! Upon asking for Tabasco or Mayonnaise, I was brought mustard and told there wasn't anything else. I'd like to draw a parallel with the Shangri-la Dubai. They also have a pool/bar area which changes into a bar/club at night. The difference is that the vibe is created by the setting and the clientele respond to it. Not the other way round.
Date: Date of stay: April 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A very good hotel
Review Content: I spent four nights here and the service was excellent.  The location downtown is great for business travellers.  Staff went out of their way to help me get transport and find places I needed to visit.  Room very comfortable

Name: New but poorly functioning
Review Content: Here just 12 hours as part of a tour of southern Africa.  This is a modern appearing facility that didn't just run right and/or wasn't laid out properly.  Key card system in elevators didn't work, wouldn't stop as programmed; shower and bathroom doors didn't shut properly, hot and cold faucets in rooms mislabeled, towel bars on sinks had protruding handles that caught whatever you were wearing; long wait to check in while manager stared at the overworked receptionist and obviously could not be bothered to lend a hand, etc, etc.  This was a study in how NOT to manage a hotel!  The bright spot was breakfast-lovely house muffins and a full assortment of goodies; smiling staff.
Date: Date of stay: June 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Encore plus sympa quand la nuit est tomb√©e. Les prix sont raisonnable pour cet endroit.

Die Burger mit Pommes kamen auf Anfrage nach 50 Minuten, waren eiskalt, so als ob das Fleisch nicht ganz aufgetaut worden w√§re. Auf die Beschwerde nahm man die Burger mit zum Aufw√§rmen. Ergebnis war nur geringf√ºgig besser, alles in allem ungenie√übar. Und das zu dem doppelten Preis von anderen Lokalit√§ten. F√ºr ein Hilton absolut unw√ºrdig.

There is nothing to see/do, but there are some stores if you need them.Service was sometimes slow - check-in and checkout was too slow, as was the service in the concierge lounge.

Name: Horrible experience at Hilton Windhoek Namibia
Review Content: Horrible Experience at Hilton Honors Windhoek. Nothing extra which one expects at 5 star hotels. Kettle instead of Coffee maker. No rusk/biscuits. No minibar stocked. Poor amenities.Park your own car and pay for parking. No robes/slippers/flower/welcome drink nothing extra. No turn down service. No Pillow offerings.. Pool bar deck music so loud you cannot conduct a conversation or enjoy the sunset. Poorest 5star hotel experience ever.
Date: Date of stay: June 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: I was quite pleased
Review Content: The room was clean and is well laid out and illuminated.  The desk/laptop arrangement worked well.  I did not like the bathroom vis a vis its relationship to the room -- it is in effect, a part of the room; no door separating it from the room.  Lots of frosted glass.  All very modern, boutique-ie.  Not my taste.  But it works just fine, except that the toilet mini-room is under-lit and the sink is very slow to yield hot water.  The shower gets HOT fast.  Iron and board in the room.The selection of TV channels was so poor that I never watched it.The internet was easy to log into and after an initial interruption when I checked in, worked fine all week, but very slow on Sunday.  However, the desk chair was far too low, and uncomfortable to boot.Laundering a man's shirt, undies, and sox costs N$110/US$8.00, a bargain.The breakfast buffet was good; the coffee was hot, served from a thermos carried by staff.  They were not always there when you wanted them.  There is a wonderful fresh-fruit juice bar.Staff friendly, service-oriented.In the midst of a vibrant neighborhood.
Date: Date of stay: February 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Internet speed here is HOPELESS!!
Review Content: Internet speed here is HOPELESS!!Cost for more powerful modems is tiny. Stayed here 3 times over 14 days. EACH time internet was terrible speed. Each time this was reported to desk staff who of course all promised it would be fixed immediately. This is Africa ‚Äì nothing changed.  BAD. We spend many hours on internet each day in Hotels. Reported this to a Duty Manager. Nothing occurred for me via the Hilton ‚ÄùMake It Right‚Äù program.  No surprise.  This is Africa.Arrived late afternoon and even then room not ready.  Took 2 hours to get room key.  When we got to room, the Hilton internet did not recognise were were guests. This meant we need to phone someone. Room phones are a joke. Nothing works. 10 department buttons and only ONE works - just front desk line - which may or may not be busy. Phone in room 807 said on it, this was room 614.  LAZY. 2 of the 3 Elevators were not working when we made our first stay. This is Africa.I am a high level Elite at Hilton, so rooms we got were nice.  In fact overall Hotel good.  Nice breakfast.  Average Executive Lounge at Hilton Windhoek.  We were there for New Years Eve, and no wine of any kind.  Desk person claimed all the wine was all taken for NYE party in Skybar. (Wine in Namibia costs about $US1 a bottle wholesale.)  After a few guests complained she reluctantly went out and found 1 bottle red, 1 bottle white. Both bottles were empty in 5 minutes, and were never replaced.  APPALLING for a Hilton alleged ‚Äò‚ÄôExecutive Lounge.‚Äô‚Äô  This is Africa.FIX THE APPALLING INTERNET SPEED.  We had FAR faster speed in remote bush tent camps in Etosha and Soussavlei, and even in a humble guest house in Swakopmund ‚Äì even coffee shop Internet everywhere was much faster than Hilton Windhoek and that is DISGRACEFUL for any Hilton.  This is Africa.BEFORE you book, email them and ask if the Internet now works.  Maybe if they get 100 such emails the General Manger might get organised to FIX this simple issue.
Date: Date of stay: January 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Beautifull Hilton with excellent service
Review Content: As Hilton Honors member we have stayed in this hotel for the very first time. Check in was very -rofessional and we were offered an u-grade. Room was spotless clean, with all necessary amenities. Very nice terrace, breakfastroom and Sky bar with swimmingpool on the roof. Most friendly and efficient staffmembers which made our stay perfect. Executive lounge was perfect. We had a great stay and can recommend this hotel during a stay in Windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: September 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Best Hotel in Windhoek
Review Content: This hotel is without any doubt no 1 in Windhoek .Well trained staff , new facilities , nice rooms , good restaurant and centrally located . It has all amenities including a roof top pool .Yes it‚Äôs a larger hotel , but still friendly .
Date: Date of stay: August 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Perfectly comfortable chain experience
Review Content: The Hilton Windhoek is very centrally located, with large-ish rooms, restaurants on site, a sky bar and an attached casino.  It serves its purpose very well - there is not a whole lot to do in Windhoek so it is more of a waypoint to the more interesting parts of Namibia - being very comfortable and familiar.  The Sky Bar seemed like a popular after work spot, with a great view of the city and outdoor pool.  On the night we stayed, there was a band performing in one of the restaurants (a local band that drew local residents - not a cheesy experience directly solely at tourists).  In short, there is enough there to keep you busy and comfortable for a short stay, particularly after a stay in the desert or other remote parts of Namibia.
Date: Date of stay: February 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Decent and enjoyable
Review Content: Nice Hilton property that's worth carrying its brand. The decors are nice of all restaurants, rooms and other aminities. Spa offers great treatments, rooftop pool is small, but nice and the sushi restaurant is devine as its name suggests. Do book this hotel to unwind after your 2000, 3000, 4000 or 5000+ km of driving through Namibia before flying back home.
Date: Date of stay: October 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: TLC Required
Review Content: Nice facility but we spot a training or service quality shortfall. For this Rated hotel one expect;1. Aprons and slip-on as well as wash cloth. We travelled light to join a camping group. Thought 2 nights in Hilton will make up for the camping adventure that lies ahead!2. Attention to detail such as the toilet paper. It seems a used roll was provided, just a simple fold will tell you its been attended to.3. Soap or shower cleaner spots...in blue... on the shower head give impression the cleaner did not get to the obvious spots... so what then about the not so obvious dirt.4. Toilet door does not close properly and about one cm of space between entrance door to floor. This clearly leaves a sounds problem into and from the room...privacy?5. Hanging space for wet towels...we want to save water so would like to dry towels for re-use...need a towel rail.6. No welcoming drink, sweet on pillow, flower, fruit or ice + water carafe in fridge...Namibia can be extremely hot. Any or all of the above can be achieved with just a bit of initiative...and TLC. Thank you
Date: Date of stay: July 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Not brilliant but the best choice in Windhoek
Review Content: The rooms are OK but ours were not particularly clean and the air con seemed to be regulated centrally and the rooms were far too warm. WLAN is only free of charge in public areas and you get access codes at the reception.   Food in the restaurant was OK but the Pizzas tasted the best.  Breakfast was Ok but service slow.  Nice sports bar and good beer but be prepared to get propositioned by the numerous prostitutes who sit there every evening.  As all areas of the hotel entrance  and the bar are monitored by big and numerous  video cameras I presume the prostitutes are tolerated by Hilton management.  There is an African street market just beside the hotel and prices there some 20% below the craft centre but the products are identical and you support local families by purchasing souvernirs at the street market.
Date: Date of stay: June 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Stay at Hilton in Windhoek
Review Content: My partner and I stayed at the Hilton on 9/10 December 2016.  The only dissapointment we had were the quality of the towels.  They were well worn and abrasive,  more like befitting a 1star hotel rather than a 5star hotel.  To the management please sort out the quality of your towels.

Leider gab es dort nicht mal was zu trinken. 2 Stunden sp√§ter sind wir nochmal runter, dann war das Zimmer fertig. Also hat man uns auch noch vergessen. Das ist f√ºr ein Hotel was 5Sterne beansprucht schon etwas schwach. "We are sorry" war alles... anscheinend kommt das √∂fter vor, da neben uns noch 2 weitere Paare in die Sitzecke( Lounge) zum Warten geschickt wurden. Auch am Abreisetag wo wir am Pool warteten sind ein paar Gruppen da rein.Bei der Abreise w√ºrde uns dann noch eine Internetgeb√ºhr f√ºr das W-LAN berechnet, das uns am Anreisetag zus√§tzlich zum Lobby WLAN explizit als Kostenlos angeboten wurde.Eine riesen Blamage f√ºr Hilton!Ansonsten ist das Hotel Ok. Zimmer und √∂ffentliche Bereiche etwas abgenutzt was aber f√ºr Afrika noch ok ist. Fr√ºhst√ºck ist das Beste an dem Haus. Passt zu 5Sterne.Sky Bar ist sehr sch√∂n. Leider √∂ffentlich zug√§nglich daher zum Sonnenuntergang voll.F√ºr Gesch√§ftsreisen OK, alles Andere ein No-Go!

Das Zimmer war sch√∂n und die Aussicht von der Dachterrasse toll, w√ºrden aber wohl trotzdem kein zweites Mal dort hin.

Name: Een aangenaam verblijf gehad
Review Content: Ik heb een week in dit hotel verbleven en was zeer tevreden.Checkin verliep zeer vlotjes. Had eerst een kamer langs een constructie site maar heb zonder probleem een andere kamer gekregen.De kamers zelf hier en daar een beetje afgeleefd maar nog steeds zeer ok. Het ontbijt is zeer goed en heb er elke morgen van genoten.Hebben zelfs een ontbijt-box ontvangen bij een vroeg vertrek.In het algemeen is het personeel super vriendelijk en zeer behulpzaam.Mis zeker de pool area en bar niet, aangenaam om te vertoeven.Zeer jammer is de te betalen wifi, in 2016 zou dit gerust gratis mogen zijn.Pluspunten: personeel, ontbijt, serviceMinpunten: wifi te betalen, dunne muren voor lawaai
Date: Date of stay: April 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Probably best in Windoek but out of international Standards
Review Content: I will say that it is a good choice while visiting Windoek. It deserves 5 stars for Namibia standards but 4 stars for European standards. No fresh orange juice, nothing special for breakfast and quite slow at front desk. A tip if you are gone to stay there is that you make your booking from Booking.com as if you done directly through Hilton it will cost you 30%. More.
Date: Date of stay: February 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Die Zimmer sind sch√∂n und haben unheimlich komfortable Betten, allerdings hat die Sauberkeit nachgelassen. Im Zimmer liegt Teppichboden, auf dem ich leider einiges an Schmutz gefunden habe. Leider auch Staub an einigen Stellen und die Minibar war ebenfalls nicht sauber. Das Personal ist in der Regel sehr nett und engagiert, aber auch hier l√§sst die Motivation zeitweise nach.

Name: Horrendous
Review Content: If you have travelled even infrequently you will spot that this is a far cry from Hiltons elsewhere. It's a soulless, unloved, corporate hotel with bored and disinterested staff, service station food and a noisy bar that is busy with locals and pumps music loud and late. I had to remind myself, working through the incessant pump of the music, that I was paying to stay here. Good location, but that's all. Windhoek is tiny, stay elsewhere and travel two minutes longer.
Date: Date of stay: April 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: good hotel for business
Review Content: A great hotel for night if you are on business. Clean helpful staff. Best place to stay in town that has very little else to offer.The food is what you should become to expect of a Hilton lots of choice  and well prepared. A great breakfast. Pool area is a nice place to chill out .
Date: Date of stay: February 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hilton Stay Dec 2014
Review Content: I booked our stay at the Hilton in August 2014 and was really looking forward to 5* accommodation....to our disappointment.  The rooms we were allocated was not next to or even  close to each other...this after I had informed them that I have a 1.5 and 4yr old that would be sharing a room with my mother.On top of that - we get into Namibia at over 35" heat and there is NO WATER in the rooms. When we called housekeeping - we were told that they were "out of stock"....REALLY??????Hilton did try and make up for it by relocating us to a Superior room on another floor with the children closer, but the after taste of the supposedly 5* hasn't left...
Date: Date of stay: December 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Only decent hotel in Windhoek
Review Content: There are lots of nice guest houses in Windhoek where you can stay at a decent cost.  But since it opened a few years ago, the Hilton is really the only decent hotel -- better that the Windhoek Country Club (a bit out of the city), better than the Kalahari Sands (now a bit dated), and certainly better than the Safari Court (a bit of a dump).  I've stayed at the Hilton for a number of multiple week visits over the last few years. It's not perfect.  The service could be better in some ways, especially the cleaning of rooms.  But the Executive Lounge is quite pleasant, with a wonderful fellow by the name of 'Privilege' (seriously!) taking good care of you, and free drinks after 6 pm.  All in all, a nice hotel experience with better than average sized and modern rooms that are being adequately maintained.
Date: Date of stay: October 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Fitness center ok, une seule machine ayant une t√©l√© fonctionnant. Piscine parfaite pour faire des longueurs. Points n√©gatifs: internet. Name: Great

Date: Date of stay: June 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: The rooms are nice, but the rooftop pool area is nicer
Review Content: We stayed here our first night in Namibia as well as out last, and it's a lovely place. While it lacks the soul of a more established property, it's relatively new, convenient, and well-situated with good service. It's right near the center of town, so you can walk to restaurants, shops and cafes, and it's on the top of a hill, so you have great views of Windhoek from the rooms and rooftop pool. We truly enjoyed our hours sitting poolside soaking up the sun. And the front desk staff was particularly warm, helpful, and professional, especially Judy, Christiaan, and Brian. The property is off to a good start, and I'd highly recommend it as a comfortable place to stay.
Date: Date of stay: March 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hilton Windhoek
Review Content: The stay was overall nice, but the fact we were a group of people and I as a women had to be placed in a smoking room because there was no other rooms available really was dissapointing. The room and the bedding smelled bad.

Name: One of the best Hilton Hotels in Africa
Review Content: I stayed here in May and was pleasantly surprised with the quality of the hotel. Rooms are brilliant and very modern with everything you need and comfortable beds. Since I only spent a night on business I didn't eat in the restaurants but I did meet people for drinks at the Sky Bar at the top of the hotel which has fantastic views over Windhoek and definitely the place for sundowners. The gym is well equipped and the executive bar and meeting area is well kitted out. Service was very good and the staff are friendly.The rates were very reasonable when compared to other hotels in the area which are far older, and it will definitely be my hotel of choice in Windhoek. I would rate it as in the Top 5 hotels on the African continent.
Date: Date of stay: May 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A first-class experience
Review Content: From arrival to departure all the staff went out of their way to be helpful and make you feel welcome.The hotel is spacious, spotless, and in a very central position in the City.The breakfast was one of the best I have experienced anywhere in the world, everything being fresh, the pastries, and rolls all warm. Stacks of fruits, and cereals.Hot dishes cooked to order. Something for everyone. Tables immaculateThe room was instantly welcoming, with large beds covered in pristine white linen. My only reservation was that the bathroom was open-plan (toilet enclosed and shower separate). My problem no doubt, but I'm a bit choosey about who I want to watch having a bath. But, it was all spotless.I watched with horror the way some of the guests behaved, fingers in the fruit salad bowl straight to the mouth, and they would no doubt blame the hotel if anything went wrong.I visit a lot of hotels around the world, and this is one of the best.
Date: Date of stay: November 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hotel is good but my father was stolen (not a good area where hotel is!)
Review Content: Reception was a bit slow and while I was in my room the phone was stolen from my pocket by my father next to the hotel. So in front of the hotel it is safe there is security and if they go out and go to their right side it is safer than on the left! On the right there were cameras and even 2 armed security men at a parking lot. On the other hand, there was no camera and no security!

Wir sind hier sehr freundlich empfangen worden und die Organisation des Flughafentransfers hat auch sehr gut geklappt. Zimmer waren beide Male super. Name: Excellent Location, good breakfast, very helpful staff.
Review Content: We stayed two nights, the first independently and on the second we joined a small tour party. We found the reception staff extremely helpful not least in arranging dinner for us, but also throughout our stay.This is a modern hotel and our room was spacious and clean with all the expected facilities such as safe and tea making. The bed was large and comfortable and whilst in the city centre it was quiet. See separate report on dinner at the Epika restaurant. Breakfast in the same location was very good with great porridge, chopped fruit and an egg station. The hotel is in walking distance of a number of the things to see such as the Parliament, Christ Church and the Museum. A good place to stay for a couple of nights pre or post touring Namibia.

Name: I love coming back...

It took them 40 minutes to serve me a glass of wine that I had ordered on one occasion and 30 minutes on another occasion . There were many people experiencing the same problem . This is not the standard one would expect at a Hilton hotel .

Name: Sehr gutes Hotel
Review Content: Am Ende unserer Rundreise haben wir zwei N√§chte im Hilton verbracht. Wenig netter Empfang an der Rezeption. Die Zimmer sind gro√ü, sauber und modern ausgestattet mit traumhaften Betten. Die Reklamationsbew√§ltigung war nicht einem 5-Sterne-Haus angemessen, da haben wir uns doch sehr ge√§rgert.Was auf jeden Fall sehenswert ist: die Sky-Bar, Kleinigkeiten am Abend und man braucht das Hotel nicht mehr zu verlassen. Das Fr√ºhst√ºck ist empfehlenswert und sehr umfangreich. Leider mussten wir l√§nger auf den Kaffee warten. Hier g√§be es Verbesserungspotential.

Name: Just okay
Review Content: The Windhoek Hilton could be a far better hotel than it is, if only the front desk and concierge desks were better run.First of all, the good things:Wonderful room - I was upgraded to a suite because of my Diamond status.  The suite was huge and comfortable. Very, very good housekeeping staff.  Each day my room was cleaned to an immaculate condition. Executive Lounge Happy Hour was great.  Free drinks and extensive canap√©s. The staff in the Lounge, particularly the woman who greets people at the front desk, were extremely friendly and accommodating. The breakfast buffet in the main restaurant was quite good.  Extensive selection of foods.Now for the not so good:The concierge desk is a mess.  I wanted to book a tour to the Sossusvlei Dunes National Park (which, I was told, was the only tour available a day ahead of time) but I was whipsawed between one tour guide and the Hertz people who share the concierge desk.   It was very difficult to know which tour to take as full information was sorely lacking. No brochures at all are available. The Hilton should have one or two designated tour agencies with brochures - and the concierge staff should be trained in what tours are available.Check out was unpleasant.  One of the main flights to J'burg leaves at 6:30 am, so it‚Äôs necessary to get airport transport at 4:00.  When I arrived at the front desk at 3:45  to check out, there was no one there, and none of the bell hops knew where the attendant was.  He eventually showed up (and I have to admit he apologized) and I proceeded to check out.  But I wanted to get some change to pay the driver to the airport (as they purport never to carry change), but the front desk attendant said that no money was available as he had already deposited the money from the night before. He did offer the ‚Äúhelpful‚Äù suggestion that we could stop at a store on the way to the airport to get change.Finally, transport to the airport was chaotic even though there were very few people around.  This was largely because the concierge staff/ bell persons have no knowledge or take responsibility for anything. I had made arrangements to be picked up by a tour company driver.  However, the Hertz driver at the front door insisted that he was my driver.  I doubted this but he put my luggage in the Hertz van.  Then someone else came out from the hotel who HAD booked the Hertz driver and the driver said he could take us both.  I asked (again) whether he was sure he was my driver and he said yes.  At that moment a tour company driver arrived (it was a little after 4:00 am when my driver was supposed to arrive) who said he was my driver (and the bell staff agreed) and my luggage was transferred to his car.  We took off for the airport and were within 1 km of the departure area when the driver got a call that his real fare was waiting at the hotel and that he wasn‚Äôt my driver after all.  He actually turned around in the road and was going to go back to the city but because we were so close to the airport, I insisted that he take me there first.  All three arrangements for transport - the one Hertz guy, my tour company guy and the person who booked my actual car - had been arranged through the hotel.  The hotel staff needs to bring some order out of the arrangements for airport transportation, particularly early in the morning when no one seems to know anything about which cars are for which hotel guests.
Date: Date of stay: July 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good Place to Stay

I had room 804 on the eighth floor with access to the Executive Lounge.This was an very modern and very comfortable room. The quality of the furnishings and of the bathroom and bedroom were very high indeed. Inn fact, I would go so far to say that this was one of the best Hiltons I have stayed in for quite a while.For me it is the only place to stay in town. I was a little under the weather during my trip so did not really get to appreciate the rooftop pool or the rooftop bar. However, I expect to be returning to Windhoek in 2018 and I hope to address these two areas at some future point!

Name: Te duur en onder gangbare Hiltonnormen
Review Content: We hadden gedacht onze Namibi√´reis te moeten beginnen in het enige Hiltonhotel in het land. Goed uitgerust na een lange vlucht beginnen aan een mooie rondreis. Dat viel wat tegen. De executive-kamer was ruim, maar niet overdadig schoon. Dat gold ook voor de badkamer, waar haren herinnerden aan eerdere passanten. Gelukkig was de badkamer in deze dure kamer niet geheel open en was de wc geplaatst achter een eigen glazen deur. Inchecken verliep niet vlot, personeel aan balie ( een werkend, twee toekijkend) was niet vriendelijk. Dat voor wifi per creditkaart betaald moet worden en dat dit later weer verrekend wordt is een vreemde gang van zaken, zeker als uiteindelijk een definitieve afrekening niet gegeven kan worden omdat de printer kapot is. Rare zaak, Hilton onwaardig. Vreemd was ook dat drie medewerkers voortdurend met de liften in de weer waren, maar dat vreemden zo via de trappen in het hotel konden. Het eten in de executivelounge was benedenmaats, zowel de karige snacks als het ontbijt. De bediening was niet bestaand. Hotel had een mooie bar en openluchtbad op bovenste verdieping, dat maakte veel, maar lang niet alles goed. Het hotel is van buiten architectonisch heel aardig, ligt centraal, met een parkeergarage ( beveilig en betaald) in de kelder, maar functioneert dik onder de gangbare Hiltonnormen.

Name: A disgrace of the Hilton brand
Review Content: We stayed at the Hilton Windhock near the city center and their service was very BAD.  It took a long time to check in a group. It seems that the clerks do not know how to use the computer. They printed out check-in paper work with wrong names and room numbers and had to manual wrote over them. There were only three lefts to the rooms. In the PM, one was working. The early morning checkout supervisor was the worse. I asked him to give me notes for the coins. He lied to me for having no money. When I found him lying he challenged me to report it to Hilton. The hotel entrance is awful; you have to climb the hill in and out. There are constructions next to Hotel. Watch out for nails. The good thing is that my room was okay. I would stay somewhere else next time.

Name: Overall great stay
Review Content: We stayed at the Hilton after a week of camping and enjoyed the hotel time. The SkyBar pool area is lovely and felt very posh. I ordered two glasses of champagne for as it was my friend's birthday and the server brought over two shots with the drinks, which was a nice treat and considerate of him. We had a great dinner and fantastic service in the restaurant downstairs (Ekipa). The bathroom in our room was very open concept- I felt we had less privacy than out in the bush! Only the toilet has a closed door and the side of the shower is see through, so it required some rotations through the room for us all to have privacy. We had also booked online and requested a room with two beds- they didn't have one available for us and it took quite awhile for us to find a solution. We ended up having to wait for a room with two beds to be cleaned. They organized a shuttle to the airport which was helpful (although the driver was going 160km/h in the dark, so be comfortable to request a slower speed!).

Es wurde aber kein F√∂hn vorbeigebracht, vielleicht eine Woche sp√§ter aber da f√∂hnte ich bereits meine Haare in einer anderen besser ausgestatteten Lodge.Auch das Wlan ist von gestern. Alle 8 Stunden muss man einen neuen Code anfordern. Das kann jede Lodge im entferntesten Winkel von Namibia besser. Wirklich gut ist das Restaurant. Hier stimmt alles! Netter kompetenter Service, superzartes Steak. Bei meinem n√§chsten Aufenthalt werde ich ein anderes Hotel f√ºr die √úbernachtung buchen aber im Hilton essen gehen.

Name: Arrogant Attitude of Front desk employees
Review Content: Arrived at hilton and busy checking in. We're told that we had only booked one Room and the hotel is fully booked front desk employees giving us very very bad attitude! After showing them confirmation of  booking for 2 rooms 2 nights they still did not care and said they don't have rooms available. absolutely discusting! we obviously did not step down because we had a booking confirmation and had paid. we asked to speak to the duty manager 6 times and eventually they took out a flip file to find the number/name of the duty manager. finally after 30 min asking to speak to the manager the security manager arrives which doesn't help us much. Even with confirmation and hilton messing us around for over an hour not apologising once or even offering us a water they suddenly had another room available. You Hilton Windhoek have wasted my time! Irritated and agitated me and really made me angry. you made me wait 1 hour for another room and I had to deal with unfriendly/bad attitude and arrogant front desk ladies! unacceptable for a hotel chain like hilton! the only reason you are getting 2 stars is because the following day the duty manager Amos came and apologised.  the first person that actually acknowledged that hilton windhoek messed up! thank you Amos.  house keeping was also very friendly and efficient. otherwise will I support hilton again in windhoek and around the world? NEVER!
Date: Date of stay: February 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Review Content: This is a very modern hotel. Nice clean lobby, excellent rooms, good wifi coverage (except for the pool area). The staff were very helpful and professional. And the covered parking in the basement is very convenient. I'd happily stay here again.

Name: Horrible service
Review Content: The service was really terrible and they are giving Hilton a bad name. The front desk staff on check in were quite rude and very unprofessional. I suppose that's how they are because I saw the same thing happen to another guest who was checking in as I was checking out. I had asked for an executive room and was told the day before check in that it would be available for a fee which I was happy with but on the day it was a different story and they were quite rude about it. Service at the spa was as bad as the front desk. I had to find another spa to redo my nails because they were too embarrassing to go out in public with them. Bar service was no better, I had to wait 2 hours to pay for a drink that I couldn't even drink because it was so horrible and it never dawned on them to find out why I didn't drink it. It's such a shame that we got such bad service because the hotel is really nice.
Date: Date of stay: January 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Many. Problems. Always.
Review Content: It's the second time I stay there on business trips. It's a big property, with a cool top floor sky bar, very nice rooms, good restaurants and probably the best breakfast in town. But the pluses end there.Service is weird. They make an effort to be pleasant, but always mess things up. Staff seems to be always new, probably high turn over. The first time I stayed there was bad. Dismissive lady at reception said our rooms were not ready and couldn't tell us when they would be. They lost our clothes in the laundry (and never found them and offered no compensation or explanation). I decided to give it another chance this week, and oh boy did I regret it. They forgot my wake up call in the morning and I almost missed an appointment. I ordered the soup of the day and they took 1h and 15 minutes to deliver.

Name: Excellent

Das Bad ist offen gestaltet mit Regendusche und Badewanne, WC separat. Die Betten waren bequem. Als am 2. Tag vergessen wurde frische Handt√ºcher hinzuh√§ngen, wurde dies sofort nachgeholt und mit 2 Flaschen Wasser und etwas Schokolade als Wiedergutmachung erledigt. Das Parkhaus ist f√ºr einen SUV etwas eng und kostet extra. WLAN funktioniert gut. Die Skybar mit Ausblick ist toll. Empfehlen k√∂nnen wir auch die "local-is-lekker" Aktion im Restaurant. Dort werden typisch Namibische Speisen in Buffettform dargereicht. (Inkl. Mopane-Raumen, getrocknetem Huhn, Malipap..) Auch das Fr√ºhst√ºcksbuffett ist sehr reichhaltig und lecker. In Sachen Reisetipps sollten die Mitarbeiter allerdings noch besser geschult werden. Auf unsere Fragen (z.B. wo es die Permits f√ºr Nationalparks gibt) konnte keine Antwort gegeben werden. Leider hat man es auch vers√§umt uns dann einfach zur direkt neben dem Hotel liegenden Touristeninfo zu verweisen.

The wifi connection, that has to be it... It connects easily enough, but I repeatedly lost connection having to go through it all over again. Petty, I know, but that was the only issue I had for a week, but it was a continuous problem! But this is Namibia... having worked here on and off for 5 years I can say the Internet reliability varies, so in all honesty this may not be Hilton Windhoek's fault.

Name: Not Inspired - motel room in the sky
Review Content: Hilton business hotels world-wide are pretty much the same and Windhoek didn't disappoint in that regard reminding me how dull some hotels can be in just being motel rooms in the sky. From a purely sleep perspective - the Hilton Windhoek was comfortable - clean sheets yay!; From a food aspect - breakfast was delicious giving a good choice with fresh options; From a service point - not so personal; From an inspirational level - pretty uneventful with limited views and pinned windows - although the view from the roof top bar was lovely across Windhoek but it was something of a pickup bar for the lost and lonely.  Condom packets in the bedside table draws confirmed the fears.  Still, we flew in late and left the hotel early and I was thinking comfortable bed. I was hoping it might have had a Windhoek flavour and I was happy to find Windhoek had a better flavour than the one I found at the Hilton Windhoek.  Suffice to say I wasn't inspired by the Hilton Windhoek - I am just not into business hotels.

Name: Breakfast disaster  but okish overall
Review Content: Stayed there for two nights, Check in was effortless . got a room on the 1st floor right next to the construction site. the thumping of a jack hammer even at 14h00 in the afternoon was too much to bear. Requested another room and was accommodated immediately on the 6 th floor. Asked for two shirts to be valet , was informed that eh machine was broken . asked if it could be ironed, was told yes and had to wait for two hours and only after numerous calls to housekeeping eventually got my semi ironed shirts back( Not good at all). Had a good nights sleep . on the 6th floor sleep quality is excellent.  On the check out morning at breakfast I found some hair in the scrambled eggs that I dished needless to say that spoiled my whole breakfast. Although the Chef de partie did apologise  breakfast was still ruined . And for some one who intends to sign a long term agreement they will have to do a lot more to convince me that they should be the Company's hotel of choice.

Name: The only real 5 star option in town
Review Content: Stayed a week on business.Overall a comfortable stay in this hotel which is a good location. This is a quiet city with limited hotel options so this is your best choice.The good - nice well appointed rooms, spacious which meets the needs of a business traveler. Good location, pleasant staff, nice rooftop bar.What can improve - the elevators were a constant problem and needs to be addressed, the hotel know about this but the solution is not evident. The gym is on the rooftop but the two treadmills were not working. It also is a bit small and stuffy for a gym. Enjoyed the stay despite these small issues. Some tips for travelers:- take taxis from the hotel to get around- try some good restaurants for wonderful charm and food 1) Stellenbosch 2) Joe's beerhouse 3) Sardinia's Blue Olive. The first was the best, and the meats are fabulous. For daytime work meals try Gourmet in the hear of the city, which is a piece of Austria, and charming.
Date: Date of stay: May 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Gateway to Namibia
Review Content: Stayed 2 nights on arrival in Namibia before touring the country. Excellent hotel and really helpful staff. Great location too. On a recommendation by a member of staff I went to The Warehouse around the corner from hotel at The Diamond Works and saw a live band. Really good and felt very safe. Will go again.
Date: Date of stay: May 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Unfassbare Aussicht
Review Content: Wir gehen abundzu nachmittags zum hilton um an der rooftopbar zu entspannen und eine fantastische Aussicht zu genie√üen. Der Pool ist eine gelegene Erfrischung, jedoch sind die liegen zwar futuristisch jedoch unfassbar unbequem. Gestern haben wir eine Pizza gegessen, die super geschmeckt hat, jedoch war ein St√ºck Plastik von der fetaverpackung hineingerutscht. Fehler sind menschlich und k√∂nnen passieren.Wir haben uns an das sehr freundliche Personal gewandt und haben unser Essen als Entsch√§digung umsonst bekommen.Zu den zimmern kann ich nichts sagen. Das Hotel macht von Aussen schon Eindruck und auch die Lobby so wie die Zimmeretagen sind sehr gro√üz√ºgig und sch√∂n gestaltet.Fazit: ich w√ºrde nicht z√∂gern 5Sterne zu geben, jedoch ziehe ich f√ºr die unbequemen Liegen und das St√ºck Platik einen Stern ab
Date: Date of stay: April 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Bar on Terrrace
Review Content: ‚ÄúGreat business hotel‚ÄùI have not stayed in this Hotel but i visited it with my Business Associates for a Dinner one fine evening. The Terrace BAR is too good. Enjoyed it on a rainy evening WOW what a cold breeze it was jus awesome on the Terrace Bar.
Date: Date of stay: March 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Excellent
Review Content: Stayed here on business for two weeks. Prior to my arrival (2 weeks) I had difficulty communicating with this hotel regarding my reservation, emails (contact details taken from Hilton website) went unanswered and calls were ineffective. On arrival there was no record of my reservation but then the genuinely friendly staff resolved the issues and things got much better. Rooms are clean, well equiped and up to date, good selection of TV channels, wifi good (but only because I dont have to pay for it).This is the best breakfast I've experienced at a Hilton - faultless with a great range of items and the unique fresh smoothie service was an unexpected bonus. The service in the roof top lounge was excellent even though its on the small side. As a Diamond member I was disapointed not to have received a room upgrade even though rooms were available. Hotel has a taxi service to/from the airport which takes around 45mins though it's not free. Overall a nice stay made more so by the friendliness of the staff
Date: Date of stay: February 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Quite hotel
Review Content: Rooms were nice and with good equipment such as hair dryer. Fresh drinking water was missing. That wasn¬¥t good. Pool area is nice although the pool was quite small. Hilton in Windhoek didn¬¥t fill my expectations. Wi-fi wasn¬¥t in free usage in the rooms and in lobby you needed to ask for code once in a while. It¬¥s mandatory when travelling for business purposes. Hotel was quiet, not nosy with night clubs. Also smoking rooms available.
Date: Date of stay: February 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: An upmarket Hilton
Review Content: We only stayed one night at the beginning of our Namibia tour. The room was excellent and well appointed. The pool area on the roof was very nice and a meeting place for well off locals on a Saturday. It was quiet in our room though. Breakfast was excellent with lots of choice and nicely presented. Freshly squeezed orange juice was available if asked for. We were very pleased to have such a good start in Namibia.
Date: Date of stay: January 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A high standard Hilton
Review Content: We stayed here twice in a one week trip to Namibia.  The rooms were of a high standard, comfortable and clean.  We ate in the restaurant three times and on each occasion the food was of a high standard.  On each occasion one of the Chefs came and spoje to us.  The staff were efficient, friendly and helpful.  The service in the Kalibar was the only thing that let the hotel down. There was always one efficient and friendly waiter who seemed to be doing all the work, the rest of the staff seemed to be treating work as an extension of their social life with more focus on chatting to each other than on serving customers. This is a management and training issue.  I would stay here again.
Date: Date of stay: January 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Guter Startpunkt f√ºr Namibia
Review Content: Wir sind mit der Abendmaschine in Windhoek gelandet und haben die ersten N√§chte in Nambia im Hilton verbracht. Die Fahrt vom Flughafen dauert ca. 30 Minuten.Leider stand das eigentlich gebuchte Raucherzimmer nicht zur Verf√ºgung, aber das konnten wir dann direkt am n√§chsten Tag beziehen. Freundliche Aufmerksamkeit des Managements in Form von hausgemachten Pralinen auf dem Tisch im Zimmer. Sehr lecker! Das Bad ist sehr gro√üz√ºgig gestattet, allerdings in den eigentlichen Raum integriert. Dusche und Wanne getrennt. Die Dusche hat sowohl einen Regenwaldkopf, als auch eine Handbrause. Uns hat das sehr gut gefallen, anderen fehlt vielleicht ein wenig Intimsph√§re - die aber auf dem WC definitiv gew√§hrleistet ist. Das Zimmer ist ger√§umig, das Bett sehr bequem. Safe, internationales TV (auch ARD und ZDF), Klimaanlage, Kaffee- und Teezubereitung sowie Minibar vorhanden. Handt√ºcher, Bademantel und Hausschuhe sind zwar eigentlich vorhanden, allerdings nicht immer in ausreichender Zahl. Auf Nachfrage bekommt man alles, aber eigentlich sollte das bei einem Hilton nicht erforderlich sein.Die Einrichtungen des Hotels sind auch sehr sch√∂n. Rooftop-Pool & Bar mit Blick √ºber Windhoek laden zum Entspannen ein. Das Fr√ºhst√ºck ist hervorragend - alles was das Herz und die H√ºfte begehrt. Einzig der Kaffeeservice ist etwas schleppend und k√∂nnte etwas aufmerksamer sein. Die Backwaren, die Smoothie-Station und die Omelette-Zubereitung sind dagegen hervorragend!  Die Lage des Hilton ist absolut zentral, man kann alle Sehensw√ºrdigkeiten problemlos zu Fu√ü erreichen.W-Lan in der Lobby kostenlos verf√ºgbar. Man muss sich nur einen Code an der Rezeption holen, dann bekommt man 8 Stunden Zugriff gew√§hrt. Danach wird ein neuer Code ben√∂tigt.Wir w√ºrden bei unserem n√§chsten Besuch wieder dort unsere Reise beginnen.
Date: Date of stay: November 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Loved my stay - great Hilton property
Review Content: Stayed for ten days while on a business trip and would absolutely return to this great Hilton property. Great rooms - comfortable and clean with nice decor. Loved they layout of the hotel from the open spaces/lobby to the rooftop pool/bar area with beautiful views of Windhoek. The breakfast buffet is fantastic and the standout of all the evening buffets and restaurant offerings. There is such a great variety of breads, cooked to order eggs, cereals, fruit, fresh squeezed juices etc. The other buffets are fine but the breakfast is the star with great service. Prices at the restaurants and bars are not outrageous. A couple of my colleagues enjoyed and raved about the massages they had at the spa - also on the roof top - and also well priced. Concierge and other service staff were always helpful. The rooftop Sky bar has quickly become the trendy hang out place on weekend nights and can be a little loud but some people like this!Two small points of concern - the glasses and mugs in the rooms were cleaned every day but with what I do not know as they had such a strong chemical smell each time. Much has been written about house cleaning staff  using  products other than soap and water to clean and I suspect this is true here. I noted this on my evaluation and received an immediate response apologizing for this. I would hope this can be remedied. Finally there were small inconsistencies that my colleagues and I experienced in our rooms - some would receive a free bottle of water and a chocolate/turn down service in the evening on some days and not on others - and one never received the chocolate and turn down service. Obviously not a big deal in light of my overall experience.. Other than this no complaints and loved my stay and wish I was back in warm, sunny Namibia as I write this!
Date: Date of stay: November 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Decent hotel
Review Content: The hotel was nice and clean with very comfortable surroundings. The resturant in the hotel is not very good.  But the surrounding area is great for small local cafes and shopping. The staff at the hotel was good.
Date: Date of stay: December 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Business
Review Content: It was well wecolming and top service from the staff, It just surpass my expertation knowing Lesuthu being a small country.Facitities were well maintained given that the hotel is old. Looking at  the shop outlet: Chinees Restutant good experience

Name: Hilton Windhoek Hotel
Review Content: This is home away from home for me. The service and staff friendliness is outstanding. Its also a great location because you can walk everywhere. I love staying at this Hilton Hotel. I especially love the front desk staff that goes out of their way to make you feel welcome and at home.

Name: Hilton hotel Windhoek
Review Content: Overall stay was excellent. The front desk staff, Emmarandia, judy, Brandon and Aubrey were excellent. The Cooks: Lahja and Bethea were pleasant and great. Chef's Immanuel and Justice were superb. Ask for them when you get there.

Name: Accommodation in Windhoek
Review Content: I have always stayed in other hotels while visiting Windhoek, but based on the fact their Internet services was bad, I decided to try the Hilton. I am really enjoying my stay in this great hotel. The rooms are great and the service is brilliant. I am not to impress with the restaurants, but luckily Windhoek offers great places to eat. I will visit The Hilton regularly going forward.

Name: Good Hotel
Review Content: Despite a little slow service the Hotel is good and provides value for money. The best on it are the rooms. During my presence it was Winter and it was a bid cold in the Bar at evening. do not know why nobody closed the window/door.

Name: Too Noisy - not 5 star
Review Content: Nice room, friendly staff, all as expected. Nice view of city from roof bar. Breakfast decent, not wow. Nightclub noise and noise from passages intrusive - not soundproof, not 5 star! Missing the little touches of 5 star hotel

Name: Good Hotel - No Free WiFi
Review Content: Hotel staff were attentive, friendly and efficient. Rooms were good and on par with most upper end hotels around the world. Breakfast was good with a great buffet selection. Small fitness centre on the top floor with a great view. Located on the same floor is also a small pool as well as bar, great view and nice location to relax. Only gripe is the Wifi which in this day and age should be complementary. Especially for a hotel of this calibre.

Name: The best place in Windhoek
Review Content: I have stayed here about 6 times.  Always at the exec. floor.  Their exec. lounge is fine, but if it's busy morning or evening it's just too small.  Two floors lounge, but no one wants to go upstairs..The property is good, the rooms as good as they get in Windhoek.  I have stayed at several other places there.  This hotel is where you would want to stay in Windhoek.It's easy to eat at various places in the hotel, and there is the Italian place not far from the hotel..

Name: Mediocre Windhoek Hilton
Review Content: Service at Skybar was almost non-existent and that on Christmas day. Don't trust the lifts - we got stuck for a few minutes. Breakfast was very mediocre.  No warm fish. Coffee service very bad. Apart from that , the rooms are lovely and clean and the staff are friendly at least. You have to pay for Wi-Fi. Situated in the centre of town.
Date: Date of stay: December 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great Hotel
Review Content: Lovely surroundings, in a quiet part of the city, helpful staff, great food, fantastic rooms. Sky bar & roof top pool are a lovely addition. Mini bar is well priced so dont be shy. Executive lounge is as lovely scerene environment. And a nice place to meet fellow travellers.
Date: Date of stay: August 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Windhoek
Review Content: Great Hotel but having problem with the staff cancelling security deposit on my CC, one week later they are still ignoring my e mails. Rooms are clean and linen in very good condition, overall appearance is great. Location of hotel is also very good. Not happy with the hotel's driver that took me to the airport, sending numerous text messages while driving is just idiotic.
Date: Date of stay: November 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Business trip
Review Content: The interior design of the hotel is excellent. Very modern. I enjoyed my stay very much. I found the WIFI in my room difficult to use and understand. The water on the bathroom floor caused me to slip . but overall I was very happy with the stay. very good.
Date: Date of stay: October 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Outstanding Windhoek Hilton
Review Content: I travel endlessly around the world, it seems, and yet here am I filling in a  review of a hotel in distant Namibia..  I was really refreshed by my stay here, the quality of the hotel, and the wonderful efficiency, helpfulness and friendliness of all the staff.  The bedroom was excellent with a light airy design.  Restaurant had a good selection of food, and I loved the girl coming round at breakfast with special bakery of the day compete with a menu card to take home!!
Date: Date of stay: September 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Bad Transport and Terrible Bathroom for Father and Daughter
Review Content: Please absolutely do not use Hilton Windhoek. There was bad service from the start. Our confirmed airport transfer did not arrive and we had to ward off people trying to put us in their cars instead. How would you feel when you arrive in a strange land and the first thing start going wrong!??Secondly, when our car finally arrived after umpteen calls at 30 mins, luckily their transportation sub-contractor had another driver there, picking up someone else. Through their rearrangement to send his own guest to Hilton as well, Mr. Driver sent us to Hilton.In the car, you start to feel unsafe as there are cracks and crooks on the wind screen. With the constant hitting on this stony road from the airport, the wind screen would just fall onto Mr. Driver and my father sitting infront. They sent their drivers and guests around in unsafe calls? Had and should always go super slow in order to reduce the effect of the hitting.When we reached the hotel, we asked to speak to the in-charge. The second in-charge finally appeared without even handing us his namecard, gave a few words to Mr. Driver and just left us alone after giving us his nonchalant attitude and words.The third worst thing, their front-desk service was not warm at all. Thus, infuriating the already-upset-me.Fourth terrible-experience point, Hilton's bathroom are the stupidest whether it is in Sydney or Windhoek, there is a see-through slab at the side of the bathroom?????? The rest of the bathroom was very translucent as well!!!When I have my shower, my father has to wait at the restaurant. What nonsense is this!!My conclusion - no more Hiltons for us. Full-stop.HuiSingapore04 Sept 2013, WedM
Date: Date of stay: June 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Perfect Hilton service, but without african atmosphere.
Review Content: Perfect in many ways, and right in the city centre.  Relaxed atmosphere (first Hilton I've been where I feel I fit in even I wear fleece sweater and sneakers). We had breakfast, made use of in-room dining and the coffee shop, and felt we got value for money (but we also live in Norway where everything is very expensive). The pool area was quite windy sometimes, but we also stayed at the hotel during the Namibian winter (which is short). We got anyway a short dip in the pool which is 28 Celsius. The hotel is quite new and everything is what you expect of a Hilton hotel. As you can see from pictures, the bathrooms have a very "open solution", so think careful who you want to share you room with :). The best part is anyway the staff who are very friendly and perceptive. Many tourists use the hotel as a first or last stop in Namibia. If you feel you want some affordable comfort before or after a round trip in the country, then I can highly recommend the hotel. But if you seek a more local African atmosphere, you might should consider a good guest house in the suburbs, or guest farm outside the city. Even the price quickly can be the same if you want same comfort and service as Hilton offers.  Hilton offers airport transfer at scheduled departure times via Vulkan Ruin Tours & Transfers for 150 ZAR/NS per person one way, or private car with flexible departure times for 180 ZAR/NS (ask concierge). We used the private solution and here they didn't charge us for our 7 year old child. Book the day before to get sure you get the departure time you want.
Date: Date of stay: August 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Excellent service in modern hotel
Review Content: We really enjoyed the elegant and modern conveniences of the hotel, such as the rooftop patio and pool. Our suite was amazing with a deep tub and rainshower head. The staff were exceptionally helpful and went above and beyond. The local dishes night was a little too exotic for me.
Date: Date of stay: August 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great Stay!
Review Content: I stayed for 2 non-consecutive nights in June; I know Windhoek very well, and was a little hesitant to stay at a big hotel, but it was wonderful.   Clean, good amenities, very comfortable rooms and stay was extremely friendly and helpful.  Overall, it can be hard to find good service in Namibia (with some very notable exceptions), but without fail I found the staff helpful with a number of issues.  Treat yourself to a drink or snack on the roof bar with a great view.
Date: Date of stay: June 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: One of the best in Windhoek
Review Content: This is a great premium chain hotel on par with any other Hilton internationally. Excellent linen and towels, premium toiletries and clean, well furnished rooms. Good restaurant and bar with excellent pool and recreation facilities on the roof top. I would highly recommned if you are in need of a stop over

Name: Friendly and great beds
Review Content: Spent. 3 nights here and was not disappointed. Well appointed rooms, quiet, food good and very nice roof top bar. As with all Hilton's book early to get good rates. Staff very friendly and helpful. Good location and trips to airport not too outrageous. Have drink in the sky lounge!!!

Name: Conference at the Hilton
Review Content: I spent 2 nights at the Hilton while attending a conference at the hotel.   Overall, I have been impressed by the friendliness and efficiency of staff, clean, comfortable and spacious accommodation (executive room) and the quality of the food at breakfast and lunch (buffet meals).  Conference room facilities were good, though the hotel design means that there is a lack of space for exhibitors and delegates at larger events.
