Name: Almost Perfect
Review Content: A lovely, first class property in the Namibian capital. Rooms are modern and well equipped with a funky bathroom and a VERY comfy bed.The wi-fi wasn't included in the room price, but it worked OK.Only gripe was the air-con wasn't working when I arrived in my room. A quick call got someone to attend and confirm it wasn't working. But never got fixed. Hopefully just teething troubles, but spoiled an otherwise perfect stay.Would stay again.
Date: Date of stay: March 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Excellent choice for a touch of luxury and central location
Review Content: I would not normally opt for a hotel in the centre of Windhoek but would rather head out to the suburbs to a cheaper and comfortable guest house. On this occasion, I booked the Hilton for our last night before flying back home after a long driving holiday around Namibia, I'm pleased I did! I booked the rooms well in advance and got an extremely good advance rate which was not much more than an average B&B. The hotels is new and that is echoed throughout, the rooms are very spacious with great views of Windhoek, beds extremely comfortable and the breakfast very, very good with great service. There was lots of underground parking for the Toyota Hylux we had and the staff were very helpful assisting us gather out lives together and get to reception and our rooms (I was a little surprised we had to pay 60 dollars to park there, very strange for such a big hotel!). If you are not a couple I would be careful in selecting your room, ours was a twin double but the bathroom (bath, sink and shower) is open plan (I have to say it was the best bath I have taken in years!). We all slept very well and the location was great for a quick wander in the morning up to the Parliament Buildings and garden before heading off.If you are finishing a trip and after a bit of luxury and a very good nights sleep before flying out I would recommend it (a little fancy but hey once in a while I can cope :-) ). Service was very formal but courteous.Excellent
Date: Date of stay: November 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Oasis in Windhoek
Review Content: Excellent value, excellent hotel! Roof bar is great to watch the sun go down.Rooms are clean and comfortable! Internet good. The staff are really freindly and helpful! Great breakfast! Gym not all that well equipped but ok!
Date: Date of stay: February 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Excellent Spa and Bar
Review Content: I visited a friend who stayed at this hotel. The Spa is excellent and great value for money. The best part is they work until 9pm so you can come after a work meeting and still get a massage. The sky bar has one of the best views of the city
Date: Date of stay: November 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Spectacular views
Review Content: This new hotel right in the centre of Windhoek, has the most spectacular views around the surrounding mountains . Also on the rooftop is a bar and swimming pool, where you can relax when the weather is suitable. Being a brand new hotel everything is new.. the rooms and facilities, and the business people of Windhoek seem to use it.
Date: Date of stay: February 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: An excellent hotel in the heart of Windhoek
Review Content: I have spent one night at Hilton Windhoek with my family (wife and two kids). Very good experience for all of us. Location is strategic to walk around and visit some shops in the city center. Room we stayed at the Hilton was very good, we had very good meals (dinner and lunch) at hotel restaurant, personnel were keen to please us, breakfast was very good as well. Recommended.
Date: Date of stay: August 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: The only hotel to stay at in Windhoek
Review Content: This hotel beats any in Windhoek and IS the hotel of choice for tourists, business people and locals. Well set out, sharp design, staff willing to assist, efficiently run, not sterile, nice atmosphere, conveniently and centrally located. Reasonable rates, booking made online.Arrival - easy, efficient check-in, nice welcome, good assistance with hire vehicle and parking, explanation of where breakfast is served, location of the sports bar, where the lifts were, discussion as to what floor level our room was and our intended checkout time.Accommodation - large and spacious room, queen size bed, comfy, nice linen, separate bath, shower, loo and washbasin area, hair dryer, power points for recharging, desk with chair, occasional chair, large flat screen TV, minibar (well stocked), safe, coffee/tea facilitiesFood - Dinner was offered in the Ekipa Restaurant either al a carte (limited and small menu with grill options also) or the buffet. We chose the buffet which was really good quality and great selection. Glance at the buffet before deciding, you should not be disappointed. Wine list had a good range available. Staff during dinner were attentive, friendly, and kept themselves busy. Breakfast is served in the same location as the Ekipa Restaurant. Food quality and buffet selection was good but during our visit we experienced sleepy, sloppy service - harmless though (its just breakfast really!) and would not deter us from recommending this hotel to others.Reservations - Book directly with hotel via website, online, instant confirmation, secure credit card system, great prices and options offered.Facilities - comfortable lounge areas on the ground level (indoor and outdoor), shade provided outside. Toilet facilities on the ground and mezzanine level. Small shop (cigarettes, postcards, lollies) on mezzanine level near lifts. Curio shop on ground level with good selection of gifts, jewellery, t-shirts cds etc and staff were efficient here. Sports bar had a great vibe, TV screens, staff were attentive, also comfy indoor and outdoor seating (plus heaters). A separate wine cellar room is near the sports bar and looked well stocked and intimate, would suit private meetings or functions.Best - dinner buffet (quality of food and service received), sports bar (atmosphere and service received) and the room overall. Check-out was 12.00pm - fantastic! The night manager Pieter went above and beyond to deliver a special dessert platter to us, with a lovely message - thank you!Improvements - lack of rubbish bins in room (we only had one tiny bin in the actual loo area) and offer complimentary water for cautious tourists.Verdict - The only hotel to stay at in Windhoek!
Date: Date of stay: June 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Date: Date of stay: November 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hilton is Hilton...
Review Content: Five star hotel in Windhoek. Staff was friendly and helpfull. Rooms were clean and well equiped. Lack of a bottle opener was not a problem for a room service. lol....We spent all together three nights in this hotel. Breakfast buffet was exelent. Enough for a dayBut remember, don`t ever order your transportation to airport at the front desk. It`s three times expensive than a taxi, and it`s not a limo.
Date: Date of stay: July 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Chic style in Namibia?
Review Content: If you are looking for an Africa experience, skip it. But it you want a true 4 star westernized-urban business-like hotel in downtown Windhoek then go for it. Did this whole place just drop into Namibia? Very lovely modern setting, room decoration is strange with bathtub open to the whole room. Roof top deck is fantastic, but small.  BEWARE of flaky wifi service that only works in some seats in the lobby, does not work in the rooms or roof top deck. Internet in the room is plug in...no plug on an iPad or smart phone so worthless for me. And they charge for internet access - annoying.
Date: Date of stay: July 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good choice in Windhoek
Review Content: The hotel is centrally located with a range of sights nearby. We stayed in the very large presidential suite. The suite was generously furnished with lots of lovely decorative items. The bathroom was spacious with all amenities one can think of. The lounge is rather small but has everything you need with a good buffet breakfast and free flow in the evening hours. Service staff is very friendly and helpful. There is a fantastic view from the lounge. The rooftop pool is great as well as the rooftop bar with a great vibe, especially in the evening when you have the best view of Windhoek by night. Hotel staff is friendly and professional.
Date: Date of stay: May 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great Overnight Stays
Review Content: We overnighted at the Hilton at the start and the end of a 12 day tour of Namibia with the excellent Wild Wind Safaris. This ensured we had a good rest after long flights prior to starting our tour. We were especially pleased to be upgraded to the Executive rooms as gold members. Service was excellent and all staff were friendly and helpful. We are very happy to recommend this hotel.
Date: Date of stay: September 2023This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Average
Review Content: The staff are very friendly and helpful.The rooms need to be updated and could do with a proper clean. There was dirt splattered on the walls and roof, the linen had stains and the furniture is damaged. The breakfast is dead average.Other than that the sky bar and pool is nice and it is located near all the tourist attractions.
Date: Date of stay: January 2021This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Lovely hotel with a killer rooftop bar
Review Content: We were upgraded to a garden room on the 7th (executive) floor. Lovely room with a terrace. Though we booked for two adults and a child, they didn't provide anywhere for the child to sleep - but we were only there one night so he just jumped in bed with us.The executive lounge on the 9th floor is characterless and hot. Horrible place with dated decor. And very strict about what you can have at what times. We arrived 5 minutes after they put away the snacks but 55 minutes too early for supper. So there was nothing to eat. Host just shrugged.Beers and wine were locked away for another 55 minutes too apparently. Had a coke and went outside (though not allowed to take your coke outside either). Wonderful rooftop bar with slow service. Pool available. Not heated so pretty cold in the winter. The spa was closed for redecoration. Views from the roof are nice - great place for some sundowners.Parking garage beneath the hotel. You are supposed to pay for this so keep your receipt that you get when you enter it. We lost ours.The main restaurant was ok. Food was not bad but nothing to write home about. Breakfast was nice.Staff were all friendly, and overall a good place for a stopover.
Date: Date of stay: July 2022This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A very solid choice
Review Content: I stayed in the Hilton for six nights. Overall this hotel is a very solid choice. The room was large and comfortable with most of the core amenities. It could be improved by stocking the mini bar, adding some bath robes and a hairdryer. The breakfast has a decent buffet with an omelette station. The staff are friendly and helpful. It is well located - with the Supreme Court building across the road and several banks nearby. The gym has a couple of running machines, a cycle and two cross trainers. There‚Äôs a small selection of free weights. The swimming pool is a bit incidental. There is also the sky bar which offers a good view across the city.
Date: Date of stay: July 2024This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good choice for a few nights in Windhoek
Review Content: Most people don't spend long in Windhoek.  It's not the most exciting city nor the most safest.  I spent a few nights here after travelling around Namibia.  There are not that many 4 or 5 star options in the area and I wanted something with a bit of nightlife within the hotel.  Normally I would go out but as I said Windhoek has limited options with regards to this.  This was a good choice to relax after a hectic trip but at the same time I could do some local sightseeing and last minute shopping.  Nice room.  Spacious and clean.  Close to some attractions and eateries.  The hotel has some good dining options itself.  Big lobby.  Nice atmosphere.  Secure.  Staff are pleasant.  Prior to my trip around Namibia, I spent a night in another hotel in Windhoek which was more a luxury lodge.  This was also nice but very isolated and more for people who wanted total peace.  After being on safari in lodges and guest houses, I was quite glad to get back to the city and the Hilton was a good choice.  Would recommend.
Date: Date of stay: March 2022This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Lovely, modern hotel
Review Content: A lovely hotel, centrally located in Windhoek. Modern, and lovely roof top bar and small swimming pool. Rooms are spacious, with a well sized bathroom, with separate bath and shower. Bed is comfy, my only complaint was noise insulation. Whilst not excessive, I did hear some road noise and the couple next door. Good aircon and reasonable wifi.Breakfast was ok, but not the usual Hilton standard.
Date: Date of stay: September 2023This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Taauli Shivute
Review Content: My visit was excellent and im please coming back most definite all thanks to Mrs Rosalia and Mrs Kavemunu. My room was neat and comfortable,food was amazing . Again is the best and staff is amazing and friendly
Date: Date of stay: June 2022This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Amazing experience
Review Content: We travelled to the hotel on business and had an amazing experience from check-in to check-out. The staff are all very friendly and very helpful.I would recommend this hotel to any traveler, business or leisure. Looking forward to my next stay at Hilton Windhoek
Date: Date of stay: September 2024This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good stay but inconsistent service
Review Content: A comfortable modern hotel in a great central location. The rooms are large and comfortable with all amenities one would expect. My bathroom was well fitted with a shower and bath with a separate toilet, the bathroom did however open on to the room so no privacy if it was desired. The internet connection in the room was good. Breakfast was great, good range of hot and cold food. The buffet for dinner was also pretty good. The service at all times in the restaurant was however pretty slack, we often had to wait to get someone's attention and had to ask for things that you would expect to be anticipated, such as coffee at breakfast.Only disappointment of the four night stay was room service one evening. On two nights I ordered a steak, the same steak, the first night the steak was significantly larger the on the second. I was also given different  side dishes to what I ordered, even after the person who took my order repeated it back to me.Reception staff were very helpful, organising transfers and an excursion when I had some free time.Would recommend the hotel and would stay again.
Date: Date of stay: June 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Absolutes Spitzenhotel - sehr empfehlenswert
Review Content: Wir waren bereits das zweite Mal als Familie im Hilton Windhuk und waren auch diesmal von dem Hotel, der Freundlichkeit und Hilfsbereitschaft der Angestellten sehr angetan. Der ideale Platz f√ºr die Ankunft in Namibia bevor es auf Rundreise geht. Absolut familienfreundlich, sehr um das Wohlergehen der G√§ste bem√ºht und sehr aufmerksam. Die Zimmer sind sehr sch√∂n und modern eingerichtet und bieten genug Platz f√ºr gross und klein. Die Lage des Hotels ist f√ºr Ausfl√ºge zu den Sehensw√ºrdigkeiten der Stadt ideal. Unbedingt das Pool auf dem Dach ausprobieren, schwimmen mit diesem Ausblick, sensationell. Das Preis/Leistungverh√§ltnis im Hilton stimmt absolut, jederzeit sehr gerne wieder.
Date: Date of stay: December 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hit and miss....
Review Content: I stayed twice in the past month, from Jan 14-18 and again Jan 25-29. THE GOODCheck-In:Was friendly and efficient. I was very fortunate to be upgraded both times. The Room:I was on Level 8 and the rooms were fine. The curtains blocked out any light when closed so great for sleeping. A good size and nice views from my high-floor.The Bathroom: It's open plan and fine if you are a single traveller or a couple. If you are 2 friends traveling together and not sharing a bed, the bathroom lacks any privacy. Towels are large and fresh every day and the usual Hilton toiletries, although they did tend to skimp a bit with them. Soap is obviously in short supply, as is Conditioner. The Bed:Nice king bed in this room and was reasonably comfortable. Comfort-o-meter: 6.5/10. Clean linens and duvee, 4 pillows, soft. I did order foam pillows but that didn't happen. But no big deal. TV:Is a 36" LG TV's in the room with ample choice of English, German, Afrikaan and local channels. Lots of good sports channels too.Room Facilities: A large bottle of still water is supplied daily ( a necessity because the colour of the water coming out of the tap was suspicious ). Also tea and coffee making with a nice choice of teas. Milk is the small containers of long-life liquid, much better than powdered chemicals. But do yourself a favour and bring your own milk and water. There is a mini bar with the usual offerings. Dining / Room Service:Was excellent and very reasonably priced. The food quality was good and the service with a smile was always nice. And quick. Executive Lounge: I have mixed feelings about the Lounge. The staff are fantastic, the food offering is as good as any Hilton I have stayed, from lamb to chicken to seafood along with cheeses, and a great varity of wines and beers and liquors. I indulged in Ballantines more ofen than not. The lounge itself is over 2 floors. I didn't go upstairs. But downstairs there is not enough seating. I think it needs a rethink with better seating arrangements. It was 3 lounge areas. Sometimes in a lounge one needs to sit quietly and work but you cannot do it here because you are always sharing a sofa with a stranger. I am also a bit of a stickler for dress codes. Here, German women parading around in the skimpiest of shorts, or their sweaty gym gear, leaving nothing to the imagination. I'm all for seeing women in skimpy shorts to be honest, but not in the Executive lounge. I thought Exec Lounges were a place for people to relax and work and have a drink. Anyway, call me old fashioned I guess. The staff: Very high standards ( the main restaurant downstairs was hit & miss ) but that was the exception. Everyone else was very helpful, smiling, and seemed to be enjoying themselves. The team in the Exec Lounge were a cut above the rest. Very friendly and courteous. The Location: Situated in downtown area, the location is ideal. You can park under the hotel for a very modest daily fee. It's an easy walk to some of the local restaurants and supermarkets and local arts and crafts stores. Beware of pick-pockets though. The place is rampant with them. Just be careful if venturing out on foot. Hotel Facilities: There is a fantastic bar on Level 9 with a lap pool. It has nice views overlooking parts of Windhoek. The gym is on this floor too and is adequate. There are a number of restaurants in the Lobby area and a bar. The bar is interesting to say the least with quite pushy ladies of the night. Let's leave it at that. Security did nothing about it making me think commission is a possibility.THE NOT SO GOODBreakfast:I took breakfast in th Executive Lounge a few times and other times in the main restaurant. Neither was particulary good to be frank. Very little choice in the Executive Lounge and the problem of no where to sit if there are more than half dozen people in the Lounge at the same time. In the main restaurant, the buffet was a bit of a mess, the staff look disinterested in service. Housekeeping: Very hit and miss. I wanted bed linen changed on only one of the 4 days and was told they had run out that day and could I wait until tomorrow. I did. But it never happened. I usually do the 3 day thing ( you know, saving the plant, global warming, environment, climate change blah blah blah ) but this time they had run out of sheets and slips. And I never had enough soap or shampoos. It was a bit frustrating to be honest. I didn't bother asking for more. Wi-Fi:Very bad. Slow slow slow. But they are improving and upgrading I was told, so hopefully when you visit after March 1st the speeds will resemble normal civilised world standards. But to not be able to even have a simple email download under a minute is a bit poor. And at the tim of my stays, there is no Premium wi-fi for Diamond members. SummaryI think the good things about this Hilton outweigh the not so good. The staff make or break any hotel and here they are very good ( except in restaurant ).Would I stay Again: Hard to say. As a Hilton Honors Diamond the answer is probably yes because of the benefits. There is a new Hilton Garden Inn being built next door, owned by the same Chinese owners. I will probably take a look at that place next time I come.Would I recommend: Sure, why not. Just don't expect too much. But it's an OK, average Hilton.
Date: Date of stay: January 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: First Hilton experience, not worth returning.
Review Content: Arrived at the Windhoek Hilton on Feb 17th. The staff were quick to greet us at the front door and grab our luggage. The front entrance and lobby were really beautiful. That is where the good impression ended.  Our reservation, booked and paid for months ago was nowhere to be found. We were finally assigned room 211.  The room looked quite nice with the exception of the shower. The cover plate for one of the taps was missing. Minor detail but not something you would expect from the Hilton brand. The minibar was also half empty so we had to call room service to get it filled. Not sure how they bill for items if it's not being checked/restocked in between guests. My travel companion spent the $20 for 24 hours of wifi. Incredibly overpriced to begin with so the frustration mounts when it's unreliable. She spent 2 hours on the phone with the IT department to get it working properly. Totally unacceptable. Further to that, there were charges for phonecalls to the IT department that we had to dispute on checkout.During our stay we were browsing the gift shop. My companion brushed her leg up against the corner of a counter. A chipped glass shelf sliced through her pants and into her knee.  She was bleeding all over the floor. The employee just stood there, we had to ask for a cloth or paper towel to slow the bleeding. All she had was toilet paper so I had to run to the front desk to ask for something else. The front desk supervisor came to the gift shop and said a few words to the other employee then left.  At no point did anyone ask how she was, ask if we needed anything or if they could call anyone. We made our way to the hospital where she received sutures. The broken shelf was still in place when we returned and the next morning before we left so clearly they were not concerned about the injury whatsoever. The shower the morning of checkout was also ridiculous. The water pressure was poor to begin with but mid shower the pressure kept dropping until the water shut off all together. The front desk was notified and said they would get someone to work on it. Eventually we discovered the cold water was still working but of course that is less than ideal. I stood in the shower for 10 mins and finally moved back to bed to warm up. My hair was full of shampoo so I couldnt dry off and get dressed.  After 45 mins and worried I was going to leave late to the airport I finished my shower with cold water. We stopped at the front desk on the way out to ensure any additional charges were dealt with so our guide didn't get stuck with anything inappropriate. As mentioned above, there were charges for the internet and calls to the IT department which all were voided.  We had also ordered a bottle of wine and I explained the shower situation and said they could at least comp the bottle for my trouble. They ignored me completely until I spoke up and brought the cold shower to their attention again. I got attitude from from the clerk at that point. She asked if I told anyone about the cold shower. In fact, my companion made 2 calls and our guide also went directly to the front desk after I notified him of the problem. They eventually agreed to void the charges for the wine.I will add that the breakfast buffet was quite good. Had a great selection and made to order options. I would hope that this property was just having an off day during our stay but from my perspective the staff are either poorly trained or completely indifferent. Perhaps a combination of the two.  I had never stayed at Hilton property before and was so looking forward to my first experience.  Unfortunately it was incredibly disappointing.  Maybe one day I'll try a Hilton again but not anytime soon.
Date: Date of stay: February 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Guter Abschluss unserer Namibiarundreise
Review Content: Wir waren bereits zum zweiten Mal hier und f√ºhlten uns wieder sehr wohl. Das Personal ist sehr zuvorkommend aber nicht aufdringlich, das Fr√ºhst√ºcksangebot sehr vielf√§ltig (nicht selbstverst√§ndlich f√ºr Namibia) und das Zimmer sehr sauber.Wir konnten die letzten 2 Tage unserer Namibiarundreise gem√ºtlich im Hilton ausklingen lassen.
Date: Date of stay: January 2020This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: SOSTA STRATEGICA
Review Content: Hotel bello in centro citt√†!  Una tappa strategica per l‚Äôarrivo o la partenza dall‚Äôaeroporto. La camere belle e ben tenute. Ottima colazione. Considerati gli standard locali direi che √® un ottima  soluzione.
Date: Date of stay: August 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: First stop in Namibia
Review Content: Great introduction into Namibia and Windhoek. The staff is so kind and the rooms were modern and comfortable. Only hiccup was a cold shower in the morning - but, the bathtub had wonderful warm water, so that saved the day! Super convenient to downtown and all sights, too!
Date: Date of stay: March 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great location, beautiful roof top pool
Review Content: The hotel is not new but the location lobby are great. Staff very friendly, executive lounge great service and food although the lounge is very small and closed in, no sunset views only from roof top pool same floor. The rooms need new mattresses and furniture.  Although very clean the chair and ottoman was old, dirty stained and marked.  Mattress was hard and old , not up to Hilton mattress standards. Used points for this stay, 30-40 minutes from airport, same street as local shopping, safe to walk around .
Date: Date of stay: September 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: hotel with pluses and minuses
Review Content: we booked this hotel for the beginning and end of our stay while visiting namibia.  due to bad weather we were not able to catch our connector flight and couldn't make it for our stay at the hilton. i emailed them right away with much notice hoping to cancel but didn't get any reply from them.  on our stay at the end of the trip, the front desk didn't give me any help on any action that was taken from maybe cancelling my first night.  they said that they would contact me later, and i'm still waiting after 1 month.  check in was good, the rooms are nice and comfortable.  the pool upstairs is small but sufficient.  the gym was small and some of the equipement didn't work very well.  we tried to book massages at the spa but they were all booked up. we had pizza and wings at the bar that was pretty good.  all i wanted to drink was water and the bartender was not happy and said that i was using all her glasses.  i think the best part of this hotel was the breakfast. wide selection of foods and they were delicious.  they even had a juicer that made fresh juice in the morning.  the funny thing about this hotel is trying to find the best way to get to the airport.  no one could really tell me and everyone had a different recommendation and the prices were everywhere.  i found the cheapest to be the hertz rental car in the front of the hotel, they will give you transport to the airport.  the taxis were more expensive. at times i found the front desk people almost had some conflict of interest of who they want you take the transport from.  also i asked the front desk where i could visit and if its safe. they said not safe, and nothing to see! (still daylight) don't go outside.  overall nice hotel, bad customer service.
Date: Date of stay: January 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: International hotel in a nice location
Review Content: The location of the Hilton Windhoek is great. The staff at the reception and the door man are very friendly and helpful, however the daily room cleaning in the morning was too slow and took until the afternoon, even after having complained twice. The snack at the roof top bar was nice and of good quality. The shower in the bathroom should really have a door in front of the shower. Even after showering very careful, the floor is wet, very slippery and therefore really dangerous, since the door to the shower is missing.
Date: Date of stay: July 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Outstanding
Review Content: This Hilton is up to the standard of any city Hilton anywhere in the world. It is faultless. We were really concerned about staying here after such negative reviews but we really didn't need to be.Firstly, the rooms are spotless, modern, big and comfortable. The beds are excellent. The bathroom is huge and so clean. You have a safe, fridge, tv, hairdryer etc all as expected.There are a few dining options in the hotel including a sushi and wine bar which we didn't try out. However, we did use the sky bar on the roof on level 9 for a sundowner. I'm so pleased we did. It was breathtaking to see Windhoek at night against the African sky. Kids are allowed at the Sky bar and there is a great selection of non-alcoholic and alcoholic cocktails as well as all the typical bar fare. There was a small pool menu at the Sky bar too (pool is on the roof) but we chose to eat at the main restaurant and I'm so pleased we did! It was cook yourself buffet night and the chefs invited us along with our own chef hats in to the kitchen to choose our own food which they then cooked to your specification. The chefs were fantastic, so friendly and keen to help you. It was an amazing experience for our daughter and whoever thought up the idea should be highly congratulated. I heard such negative reviews about the restaurant but this showed it has been massively turned around. Breakfast was equally excellent with a huge selection of options and really good value for a Hilton breakfast. The only negative in the restaurant at both dinner and breakfast was the waitress team who are quite frosty towards us and mega slow.The concierge team were always on hand to help, really friendly as were the Reception team. Takeaway coffee from the cafe in the Reception area is excellent too, with a friendly barista and costs $20 Namibian dollars. The car park is secure and underground but as our car was quite big we were allowed to stay parked in the forecourt. We would definitely stay here again.
Date: Date of stay: August 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hier bleiben ein paar W√ºnsche offen
Review Content: Wir waren vor einer Fly-in Safari eine Nacht im Hilton. Wir wurden mit den Worten begr√ºsst: wenn Sie etwas zu reklamieren haben, z√∂gern Sie nicht, uns zu kontaktieren...anstatt..enjoy your stay.Man wollte uns den "early check-in" um 11.50 Uhr verrechnen, am n√§chsten Tag erfuhren wir, dass es ab 12.00 Uhr gratis gewesen w√§re, man hatte dies dann wieder storniert. Die Zimmer sind sehr sch√∂n, nette moderne Dachterrasse mit Blick √ºber ganz Windhoek, gute Lage in der Stadt. Nur der Service war etwas schwerf√§llig, als ob es zu wenig Personal gab. Auch das Internet funktionierte nicht, an beiden Tagen, das kann schon schwierig werden, wenn man eigentlich arbeiten wollte.
Date: Date of stay: January 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: This Hotel needs maintenance
Review Content: I am regularly staying at this hotel, but it is really going backwards and it needs maintenance. For about a year now the boom at the parking does not work. Every time you want to exit, it does not work and then you need to wait for someone to open it for you. The one escalator is also not working. You need to use your room key card to allow you to go up to your floor. The key card in this escalator is not working which mean you need to wait for another escalator before you can go up to your room. The network in this hotel is more down than working. For a person on business it is not acceptable. It is just my view that the hotel is not managed that well anymore and they need new management or investment in order to get it back to standard.
Date: Date of stay: June 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hilton decor standard for sure but the location ,service & food not quite
Review Content: -Externally imposing & impressive other than the area it's been build around-Internally equally stunning with a lovely small but modern gym, a rooftop bar-Beautiful rooms until you lookout the window at the surroundings-Wine Room & an informal Lounge -Warm reception-irons &  boards in rooms - a rarity in the region generally downside:-poor room service was experienced-buffet options were not the tastiest-lifts on  -certain floors were not working(a month before colleagues had reported similar) -this was not openly communicated at reception. one just found a note under their door some PR in the Food & Beverage area could benefit this establishment
Date: Date of stay: May 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Very disappointing experience
Review Content: Upon checking into the hotel I was charged $1200 Namibian dollars on my credit card in case I wanted to use items from the Mini bar. There was nothing in the mini bar which I reported immediately at 3 and when I left for dinner at 8 it still had not been stocked. I did not have menus for room service, no trash container, no hairdry and each problem required several phone calls to resolve.
Date: Date of stay: October 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: The hotel is beautiful. The positive stops there.
Review Content: I stayed at the Hilton for 5 days on business in August 2012. The hotel is beautiful and the rooms gorgeous, probably one of the better looking business hotels I have stayed in. Unfortunately the food and management does not live up to this standard. There is only one regular restaurant and two more that serve light food only. The regular one has mostly meat as the few choices of seafood on the menu were not available when i was there. Similarly, the choice of room service is poor and in any case the quality of  food is not what one would expect from the Hilton. I ordered the soup of the day yesterday (pepper soup) and was barely edible. The cheese plate was made up of cheap cheddar and gouda, the kind that people use to make cheap sandwiches. Besides issues with room service forgetting my room or not refilling the bathroom supplies, the worst experience was at the check-out. I asked to separate expenses into two bills and pay with two different credit cards. I simply asked for meals and laundry on one bill and all the rest together. Apparently, this was too complicated and the staff at the receptionist split the bill according to her own judgement, irrespective of what I has asked for. After over minutes, she managed to produce two different bills. After I paid, it turned out that the amount on the bills she put in the envelope didn't correspond to what was charged to my credit card. When i asked for that to be rectified, it turned out she had overcharged me and one of the supervisors came to help. Another 30 minutes passed and they could not sort out the mess in any sensible way so I had to ask to get refunded for the previous payments and start afresh by paying the full bill with just one credit card as clearly they were not able to handle splitting the bill into two. They still tried to charge me more for the airport pick up than the rate given by reservation and thoroughly discussed with staff the night before. I still can't believe something like that would happen at the Hilton. Some of the staff at the reception should definitely not be there or not entrusted with people's credit cards. Also, the hilton needs to fix its transportation issues and be able to offer a reliable taxi service to its customers. The management has a lot to do to straighten this place up. There are a gazillion staff working there and all look impeccable and are very polite but they need to learn how to actually do their job well.
Date: Date of stay: August 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Wie immer, habe ich mich in diesem Hotel sehr wohl gef√ºhlt.
Review Content: Das Hotel verf√ºgt √ºber sch√∂ne und saubere Zimmer. Leider war auch dieses Mal Corona bedingt die Executive Lounge geschlossen. Alternativ wurde im Restaurant ein Bereich eingerichtet, in dem sowohl das Fr√ºhst√ºck als auch am Abend Kleinigkeiten serviert werden. Die Skybar mit Pool bietet einen angenehmen Ort zur Entspannung. Alles in Allem ein sehr empfehlenswertes Hotel in Windhoek. Ich komme sehr gerne wieder.
Date: Date of stay: March 2021This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Perfect way to start Namibia
Review Content: Staff were excellent the entire stay, we upgraded to a room with club benefits of food & free drinks during happy hours for an extra $75 AUD, which was well worth it. Food was tasty  - wine/beer was great. Rooftop pool / bar area has a great view of the city. Bed was comfortable, no complaints.
Date: Date of stay: October 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Best hotel in town, close to shopping places
Review Content: Executive room on top floors where great and modern, normal rooms on the first few floors need more careful maintenance or modernization. Great rooftop bar with pool and gym, excellent breakfast, highly recommended (on the top floors)
Date: Date of stay: April 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good hotel
Review Content: As a diamond member we were upgraded to a good executive room on 8th floor which had outstanding views over the city. Best feature is the rooftop bar and pool. There are plenty of sun loungers of all types and the views are outstanding. Good cocktails at the roof bar but obviously not cheap as it is probably the best located bar in town. Hotel very clean and well presented Executive lounge has a good selection of hot and cold food as well as good selection of alcoholic drinks during evening reception. We kept being told by staff that it wasn‚Äôt safe to walk outside as too many pickpockets so organised a half day city tour which was pretty good. There were 3 tour guides with 4x4 outside the hotel ready and waiting to do tours. Probably one of the better hotels in Windhoek
Date: Date of stay: February 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Modern Hotel; Poor WiFi
Review Content: The Hilton is located near to the most important sights in Windhoek. It has a modern design and offers a Sky Bar and restaurants. The rooms are clean with a basic equipment. The WiFi connection was pretty poor during our stay.
Date: Date of stay: December 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Generally good stay
Review Content: I stayed at the Hilton for 3 nights and my experience was generally good.The facilities are really great and easily accessible. The rooftop bar is tops. They have a nice drinks and tapas menu and the sunset views are amazing!!!The hotel is well located with a craft market and shopping centre within 5min walking distance.If you're travelling for work, the hotel is also great as most of the financial services businesses are located within walking distance.The staff were friendly across the board, from check in to the shuttle service to the restaurant.Both room service and the restaurant served some good food, with the daily buffet menu also with a good variety.The only point of improvement I'd note is the WiFi. The connectivity was very patchy.
Date: Date of stay: September 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Tr√®s bon hotel
Review Content: Bonne adresse sur cette ville dont l‚Äôoffre n‚Äôest pas pl√©thoriqueChambres spacieuses et au standard de la marqueNous avons choisi le buffet √† volont√© qui nous a permis de go√ªter aux diff√©rents plats locaux. Tr√®s bon et pas cher si vous avez bon app√©tit Accueil tr√®s pro et petit d√©jeuner fid√®le √† la marque donc sans surprise et qualitatif
Date: Date of stay: July 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Dachterrasse
Review Content: Ich kenne nur die Bar auf der Dachterrasse. Die ist ein Muss zum Sonnenuntergang in Windhoek.Professionelle Barkeeper mixen leckere Cocktails f√ºr 75 NAD. Die Aussicht ist in der D√§mmerung atemberaubend.
Date: Date of stay: January 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Stuck in the elevator!!
Review Content: The lift wasn't working & they never put 'out of service' note, I got in the elevator me & 2 of my friends & got stuck for 30 full minutes!!!! Until they got someone to sorted out! & said they need to get someone from Schindler themselves & when they very late & we where inside they said it's the traffic! Can you believe it!?? They can't open the elevator door & help us until someone drives all the way to the hotel from Schindler! Poor service! Poor security! No apology! Not recommended what so ever!! The front desk manager 'imoji' is a complete disgrace to this hotel, she said you're bills are paid in full & I can't compensate you! & that nothing in her hands! Worst handling of a situation! No empathy!
Date: Date of stay: September 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Fiz o anivers√°rio do meu filho neste hotel.
Review Content: A reserva foi feita pelo Booking.com mas o recepcionista de servi√ßo n√£o tinha dom√≠nio da reserva. Fiz uma reserva para o jantar de anivers√°rio pelo site e reforcei no Check in. Quando chegamos ao restaurante n√£o havia reserva nenhuma. A respons√°vel do restaurante foi muito antip√°tica, por fim o bolo de anivers√°rio que encomendei n√£o foi feito. O quarto no entanto foi encantador e confort√°vel. O hotel ofereceu ao meu filho que fez 6 anos uma fatia de bolo.
Date: Date of stay: July 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Sch√∂nes Stadthotel in idealer Lage
Review Content: Allgemein:Bedingt durch ein Mi√üverst√§ndnis unseres Veranstalters war unsere Buchung im urspr√ºnglich gebuchten Hotel nicht verf√ºgbar. Wir wurden aber schnell und unb√ºrokratisch ins Hilton umgebucht.Lage und Umgebung:Das Hotel liegt im Stadtzentrum von Windhoek ca. 45 km entfernt vom internationalen Flughafen. Die Zentrale Lage erm√∂glicht es einige Sehensw√ºrdigkeiten, wie die Christuskirche, Alte Feste mit Reiterstatue oder auch das Unabh√§ngigkeitsmuseum fu√ül√§ufig zu erreichen.Zimmer:Das Hotel verf√ºgt √ºber 150 Zimmer. Wir bewohnten eines im 4. Stock. Gleich am Eingang im Flur befindet sich der frei programmierbare Safe, im Anschlu√ü daran die R√ºckwand des Badezimmerspiegels der als Raumteiler fungiert, dann der Kleiderschrank. Zus√§tzlich gibt es einen gro√üen Schreib-Ablagetisch, mit Fernseher, Minibar, Schubladen und gen√ºgend Stromanschl√ºssen. Der Haartrockner ist in einer der Schubladen fest installiert. Das gro√üe Doppelbett war sehr hoch, aber bequem. Im Badezimmer gab es eine Dusche, eine Badewanne und ein Waschbecken. Die Toilette hatte nochmals eine separate Abtrennung. Ansonsten war das Bad zum Schlafraum hin offen.Service:Check-in und out waren schnell erledigt. V√∂llig unb√ºrokratisch wurde der Voucher unseres urspr√ºnglich gebuchten Hotels akzeptiert. Die Koffer wurden schnell zu unserem Zimmer gebracht. Bereits um 10 Uhr vormittags konnten wir unser Zimmer beziehen. Die Reinigung nach Check-out des vorherigen Gastes h√§tte etwas gr√ºndlicher sein d√ºrfen, wir fanden auf dem Stuhl eine abgebrochene Rasierklinge. Das sollte nat√ºrlich nicht passieren.Gastronomie:Wir hatten √úF gebucht und konnten am Abreisetag das Fr√ºhst√ºck in Buffetform genie√üen. Hier fehlte es an nichts. Br√∂tchen, Brot, Wurstvariationen (hier merkt man die deutsche Vergangenheit), K√§se, Salat, Joghurt, M√ºsli, Obst, warme Speisen, Station f√ºr Eier oder Waffeln. Sehr gut sortiert und schmackhaft.Am Tag unserer Anreise entschieden wir uns abends im Hotel zu essen. Hier wurden wir sehr nett bedient. Das Essen war geschmacklich sehr gut und wie bestellt. Und das alles zu einem sehr fairen Preis.Abends besuchten wir noch die Sky-Bar auf dem Dach. Diese ist auf jeden Fall sehenswert. Wenn man auf die Dachterasse kommt ist dort zuerst der Pool, dann etliche Nischen, in die man sitzen kann. Die Bar ist im Freien und man hat einen sehr sch√∂nen Blick auf das n√§chtliche Windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: May 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great place to stay with great location inWindhoek
Review Content: I had a great stayed here with a really friendly staffs at hand to provide me the support I need.  The rooftop bar is great with views to the city, restaurant serves great food both √† la carte and buffet.  I was abled to leave my luggage here when I went off for my 4 days safari trip without any problems.
Date: Date of stay: March 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Delivers on the Hilton name
Review Content: Very centrally located and comfortable though I prefer bathrooms with doors instead of the open style that they have in the rooms. The rainfall shower made my mornings and the wine list, my evenings. The bed was firm and comfortable and sound proofing is good to the extent that you can not hear all the work going on next to the hotel on the extension. Decently priced Beyerskloof Pinotage if you prefer red would be my recommendation. The hotel has quite some entertainment going on in the roof terrace or restaurant/bar and the jazz band on the Friday was great! The gym could do with some weights but quite functional for most travelers. Indian buffet on Thursdays (or was it Wednesday!) was nice and offered variety.Outside the hotel, you can walk around nearby to see probably most of what Windhoek has to offer including the church, the artisans market, the independence monument, parliament etc. It was safe to walk around as long as you do not start flashing expensive stuff.And yes, the staff were very helpful and service was great. All that you would expect from another great Hilton.
Date: Date of stay: November 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Almost there
Review Content: The Hilton Windhoek is one of the best hotels in Windhoek for both business and leisure.  However, they should really look into fine-tuning their Reception.  It has been, each time I have visited, the worst check-in I have ever experienced anywhere in the world. It is staffed with employees who don't seem to be well trained.  As a result, they are inefficient, and when the queue for service at their desk becomes longer than 2, they become overwhelmed, rude and unhelpful. Having a Front Office Manager in FRONT their team, instead of in the office at the BACK of reception, would go a long way towards creating a better professional impression.The rooms, restaurants and housekeeping, are all very good.On Fridays, the staff dress in their traditional tribal attire.  It is wondrous.
Date: Date of stay: August 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hotel needs TLC
Review Content: I spent 8 nights at the Hilton and I was very unimpressed.Firstly on arrival I was booked into a room next to the main air con unit. The continuous noise was very disruptive.I asked to be moved and was put into room 320. The first thing I noticed was the main lights didn't work and the light in one of the cupboards didn't switch off. The other thing that was fixed during the stay was the shower. After the first shower the floor in bathroom was flooded.That was the easy part when returning one evening the access boom to the basement parking broke and fell on the roof of my rental car. To add to the annoyance and inconvenience the staff at the hotel didn't handle the matter professionally at all.The food at the hotel is extremely overpriced for the quality and the cleaning service of the rooms is very substandard.Hilton please give this hotel the tlc it requires to be at the level it should be!And please check the pool it looks like it's going to fall through the roof.
Date: Date of stay: August 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: The Place to be in Windhoek
Review Content: This Hilton is well situated in the CBD close to all the key places on would want to visit in Windhoek. The check-in process was a breeze, loved the 'online self check-in' process which is very easy to use and I even got an upgrade here. The rooms are super super clean, well maintained with very comfortable beds. The internet though not so bad, may need some improvement. I honestly loved this hotel. A step up above other Hiltons. A complaint though, related to the airport transfer. I request an express service so I could get to my meetings on time. However when I got to the airport, I was told I had to wait for other passengers first as we were to share a van. This wait took a good 30+ minutes and is the reason I rarely check-in baggage. Interesting thing is I was still charged for the express car service yet I didn't get to use it. The same thing happened when I left, worse still, the contracted Taxi guy stated that he was even paid less than what was on my bill. I think you guys need to clean up whatever happens there. I'm interested to help should you need it. Otherwise, a lovely stay in Namibia and can't wait to come back. This was actually my second visit after about 3 years.
Date: Date of stay: April 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Watch out for hidden extras, doesn't feel like a Hilton
Review Content: Stayed on the first floor here in January 2016.  I booked my room via the Hilton website, during their sale.The room was fine, perfectly comfortable.  Just a couple of problems, one being that I had no hot water one morning, the other being the intermittent WIFI outages.  Nothing major wrong though.On going to Breakfast on the first day I was asked my room number, and I was informed that my room didn't include breakfast. I told them it did, and they said they would change it.  The same thing happened the second day, and every day after that.  (My room rate did include breakfast and it was pretty clear on the reservation).When checking out they attempted to charge me for making a phone call.  The phone call was in fact INCOMING.  The value they were charging was low, but it was more to do with them even trying to do that.  They actually had the cheek to blame the Hilton Group for this.The food was fine as was the gym. The pool is a bit odd, being next to a rooftop bar that has aspirations to be a cool place to hang out.  It just didn't seem inviting to go for a swim.   Having said that, the bar was very good.If I were to come back to Windhoek I think I would avoid paying the premium to stay at the Hilton.  It really wasn't any better than a number of the other hotels / lodges that my colleagues were at- and they cost around half the price.
Date: Date of stay: January 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Leider nur f√ºr eine Nacht
Review Content: Leider hatten wir nur eine Nacht im Hilton gebucht. Tolles Hotel, netter Service, sehr sch√∂ne Zimmer,  toller Pool auf der Dachterrasse mit herrlichem Ausblick,  gute Lounge und dann erst der Zimmerservice. Wir hatten uns kurzfristig entschlossen auf dem Zimmer zu essen. Hammer was f√ºr eine Qualit√§t und das Preis-Leistungsverh√§ltnis ist perfekt.
Date: Date of stay: November 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good hardware, pity about the service
Review Content: This hotel is the newest and most impressive building in the city. That's where it ends. Our check in experience was horrid from the start.No bellboy to help us lug our luggage from the taxi. The receptionist was a little haughty. She told us the hotel was fully booked and we did not have the twin rooms which I clearly indicated when I booked. Also my HHonors card number was not communicated properly.She "informed" me that our rate did not include breakfast and I had to fish out the booking voucher from my email - making us feel like untrustworthy people instead of regular business travelers which we are.We were led to the rooms in a most unprofessional manner. The bellboy cramped into the already small lifts with the luggage trolley. In most sensible hotels, the luggage comes separately so guests can be comfortable in the lifts. We called the duty manager about the mess up and suddenly a twin room suddenly became available!The kind gentleman who helped us move room was a gem but by then the damage had been done.In the new room, the shower drainage was clogged. Complimentary water non-existent.My colleague and I checked out and swore never to return. We stay in African hotels a lot and this is a very bad experience for a supposedly five star hotel.
Date: Date of stay: August 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Stay away!
Review Content: Bad service, bad attitude best describe this Hotel. does not represent the Hilton brand at all. There was a band staying at the hotel that the staff seemed bent on satisfying at the expense of the other guests. Not one Manager seemed capable of helping with our issues. The worst breakfast experience ever.

Name: good hotel for business
Review Content: Windhoek is not a nice place(I mean not much to see or do) and hotels in town are quite dreadful(Kalahari sands where I nornally stay is awful and full of ladies of the night).Hilton is by far the best choice. +Nice clean helpful staff, no noticeable ladies of the night presence(This is Africa....) decent dining, nice view from the roof bar- Ridicuolous gym, pool pathetic, high price.
Date: Date of stay: November 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Average city hotel
Review Content: This is your average city hotel with average service. I walked into the non-smoking room and my friend and I could immediately smell something bad in the room. Reception indicated that the room had been a smoking room until June 2014, which explained the smell. I would have expected a conversion like this to have been done better, particularly to smell like that 7 months later. The bathrooms are completely open, so no provacy, which made staying with a friend rather awkward. Wifi is free in the communal areas but you need to pay for wifi if you want it in you room - which seems rather 'cheap' of a Hilton hotel! I had to try 8 of the communal wifi codes before one worked. The pool area is next to a bar on the 9th floor. The pool was so full when we arrived and it didn't look like anyone was checking who was actually staying at the hotel and who wasn't - so felt like a bit of a 'free for all'. The breakfast was realy good!!
Date: Date of stay: January 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

The restaurant Ekipa had great food and a great host (Peter),but again, don't expect service like we get at Hilton hotels in the USA.  The Springbok carpaccio was excellent.  The lamb is BETTER than the lamb we get in the USA.  The gift shop was good curio shopping.

Name: Hilton Hotel
Review Content: I was terribly disappointed in this hotel. I had a problem with hot water in my room and getting it sorted out was a mission. Service at the Sky Bar was extremely poor and in the end I didn't eat or drink anything since no one even offered to take my order. I forgot a jacket at the hotel and went back there to ask whether house keeping handed it in. I had to wait 45 minutes for them to go and have a look in lost and found. The jacket was not there. I also didn't have a good nights rest since it was very noisy in the hallways. I will not recommend this hotel since I think there are better options.

Preise absolut ok. Leider wird man(n) zum Teil von Prosituierten bel√§stigt. Da sollte das Management durchgreifen. Internet Access kostenpflichtig. Ist das noch Zeitgem√§√ü?? Review Content: I stayed at this hotel in July and found the service to be very poor. The rooms are really nice and well laid out, but the staff were arrogant and lazy. A very bad experience at the Sky Bar with service and quality of the meal. It was served cold, and took 90 minutes. Breakfast was not up to Hilton normal standard. Pretty much the same as a normal 3 to 4 star. Many people that have been here have complained about similar issues. When a complaint to management was sent it was not dealt with ver well.

Review Content: Les plus :- chambre spatieuse et agreable- bon petit dejeuner- personnel agreableLes moins :- panne d'eau chaude durant notre sejour- probleme d'ascenceur, attente consequente- jeunes clients ext√©rieurs bruyant en terrasse et dernier etage de l'hotel, manque d'espace et de calme pour les clients

Name: A greatly desgined hotel, but as far as could be from 5 star service!
Review Content: The Hilton in Windhoek is probably the most modernly designed hotel in Windhoek, very comfortable and convenient rooms opened almost a year ago. Breakfast is more than average, but's that's all what's positive about it. Even though I frequently stay there ( and currently staying there) I still get inadequate service every time I stay there. My room does not always get properly cleaned, one time the cleaning person even forgot some of his/her cleaning equipment in the room. Internet is slow, the Wireless flaps evey minute, housekeeping take a lot to reply, the new TV magazine which has the monthly programs never came even though we were 2 days in the new month,  room service is frequently out of the dishes I want, and the menu is very poor as well, the business lounge was rented out when I asked to use it , I was told to use the executive lounge on the top floor for which you have to wait for at least 10 - 15 minutes for someone to let you in (since those who work there seem frequently away) Clearly there seems to be a huge managerial problem. When I checked in the lady who checked me in told me breakfast and internet were included in my rate, a couple of days later, the waitress in the restaurant embarrassed me and literally told me in public that I have not been signing my breakfast bill ever since I came and that I need to see reception for that! When I went to reception the lady who checked me in was there and she actually denied ever telling me that the breakfast was included in my rate! Her manager told me that the misunderstanding was that the fact that rate was BB was written as a side note and they have not updated the restaurant system. I have waited for an official apology from the management, that unfortunately never came. If anyone from the global Hilton management is reading this I'd like to say that I do not appreciate the lack of integrity of some of the staff , nor the lack of professionalism of the management. I really hope you do something about it. This is by no means Hilton Standards!!
Date: Date of stay: December 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: An evening in Hilton Hotel
Review Content: An evening in Hilton Hotel Elvis Mboya On 6 August 2011 was not my first time to sample services on offer at Hilton Windhoek. I had been there before to attend a pre-opening media brief, the official opening ceremony and a corporate function hosted by Windhoek Observer.  As an entertainment and lifestyles writer with nearly a decade of experience in the country and southern Africa, I have witnessed the rise and fall of taverns, but, Hilton‚Äôs superior services, facilities and gentle and seductive atmosphere, are poised to thrust this first five-star facility in the country to greater heights. The 10-storey landmark facility that was officially opened by President Hifikepunye Pohamba in June,  is the completed N$300 million project that forms part of the N$2 billion Eliakim Namundjebo Plaza owned by United Africa Group (UAG), a pet project of Martha Namundjebo-Tilahun and Addis Tilahun. The launch was graced by the who is who of the country‚Äôs politics, economic and social spectrum. The scorecardSince its doors opened to the public, the facility instantly became the place to be for socialites thirsty for entertainment as well as offering conference and meeting hub for businesspeople yearning for five-star service and soothing environment.  In recent times, eager guests have been flocking in their hundreds to the spectacular landmark nestled in the heart of the city, barely 20 a-minutes‚Äô drive from Hosea Kutako International Airport. Since then, there have been flurry of debate on social utility networks, and on the streets, with revellers worried about the prices at the hotel. However, they soon realised that the facility‚Äôs uncompromised hospitality standards come at a relatively affordable price compared to most of its peers in hospitality and tourism industry that have a 4- and 3-star rating. Value for moneyFor instance, a Windhoek Lager beer costs N$18 at Hilton compared to several sprouting restaurants and lounges in the city that charge the same for the bottle or more. A decent meal costs about N150 and cheapest accommodation N$1,400 per night. That does not mean the quality of the service is compromised. The management understands that there are different groups of economic classes that can afford to mingle with the high and mighty, with a beer that costs N$18 in the same facility. The upper class client are catered for with drinks like the Johnny Walker blue label that costs N$200 a tot.  Still, exclusivity, class, and superior facilities are uncompromised for those who can afford it. Guests with deeper pockets can be ushered into the superior comfort of presidential, diplomatic suites in exclusive lounges for those who want value for their money.   Dining at Hilton Windhoek is an experience worth trying out. There are restaurants of choice that include Ekipa, Kalabar, Terrace, Centrum Lounge, Divine Wine Bar and Sky Bar.  Superior facilities The Sky Bar is located on the roof top of the building next to a swimming pool. The spot offers a spectacular view of the city‚Äôs central business district. The facility offers varied leisure activities that include a 24-hour wellness and fitness centre (gym and massage room), heated lap pool complete with sundeck located at the roof top.  Business travellers, tourists and local corporate executives have varied choices of conference rooms with a capacity of accommodating 250 guests. The facility also offers a convenient tuck shop, an ATM, internet facilities, laundry, and exclusive executive floor lounge. Luxurious accommodation includes one presidential suite, 124 king rooms (including eight king deluxe, four executive guest rooms), 22 executive rooms, 12 double rooms.  Pride of the nationThe facility forms the first phase of Windhoek‚Äôs new N$2 billion Freedom Plaza complex. The  building integrates retail, offices, residential and entertainment with the hotel. This is the first five-star hotel, and one of the largest developments of this nature in Namibian hospitality industry and is set to transform the urban face and dynamics of the Windhoek CBD.Namibia becomes the 50th in the world, and seventh country in Africa to have the prestige of Hilton branded hotel, joining South Africa, Ethiopia, Kenya, Cameroon, Nigeria and Tanzania.A day or evening at Hilton Windhoek is an experience to remember.The author is a Kenyan born Namibian investigative journalist working in Southern Africa since 2002. This review was published in Windhoek Observer (12 August 2011). Email: elvismboya@yahoo.comPictures: Elvis Mboya & Hilton Hotel
Date: Date of stay: August 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Leider nicht mehr so gut wie fr√ºher
Review Content: Wir haben unsere Namibiarundreise bereits zum dritten Mal im Hilton Hotel Windhoek ausklingen lassen (2018/2019/2023). Wir hatten uns schon sehr auf den Aufenthalt gefreut, da wir die Jahre davor immer sehr zufrieden waren. Leider wurden wir entt√§uscht. Aus welchen Gr√ºnden auch immer hat vor allem der Service sehr nachgelassen (die MA scheinen sich nicht richtig auszukennen, m√ºssen st√§ndig bei Kolleg:innen nachfragen, sehr langsamer Service). Leider ist auch die Qualit√§t des Essens nicht mehr dieselbe (keine Avocados im Avocadosalat, abgespecktes Fr√ºhst√ºcksbuffet, "wir haben dies nicht, wir haben das nicht mehr"). Auch die Einrichtung im Zimmer war teilweise kaputt. Leider wurden wir diesmal entt√§uscht und hoffen, dass das Hotel an den M√§ngeln arbeitet und zuk√ºnftig wieder die gewohnte Qualit√§t bieten kann.
Date: Date of stay: January 2023This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Worst Customer Service EVER
Review Content: The rooms are fine - typical hotel chain quality.  The bathrooms are a bit more upscale with separate shower stall, bathtub and separate toilet.  However the bathroom is open to the room so no privacy for bath or shower.  The reason I rated this hotel a 2 - and that was generous - was largely based on the incompetence and lack of customer service we experienced during both of our stays.  We bookended our 3 week trip of Namibia with a stay at this hotel.  Our first stay we had electrical fan noises in our room - so loud as to be disturbing.  We reported it and were told someone would fix it.  We went out for dinner and upon our return our room was open - unlocked - with all of our belongings available to anyone who wished to help themselves!!!  We notified and voiced our displeasure to the Management who apologized and promised to upgrade us to an executive room with lounge access for our return stay.  The return stay - checked into our ‚Äòexecutive‚Äô room which was no different than the original room. We did have lounge access and the food and amenities in the lounge were quite good.  In preparation for our departure to the airport we prebooked and prepaid for airport transfer through the hotel the day before for a 10am pickup.  The next morning we went to check out and:a) we were charged for the upgraded room which was supposed to be a complimentary upgrade.  This problem was sorted after some time.  B) our 10am transfer did not appear.  No one seemed to know what was going on and no one seemed to be able to secure us an alternative transport.  We kept getting told - just 10 minutes - then another 10 - then another. The staff and Management seemed to have the competence of Guinea fowl. Finally I insisted on a refund of our money and once refunded the Manager was ready to leave us to our own devices.  This is NOT customer service.  If you mess up and leave customers in the lurch Management needs to fix the issue. As a customer it shouldn‚Äôt be up to me to get Hilton to take responsibility for their ineptitude and get us transport and pick up the tab for the transfer.  In the end, we did get transport - 40min late - and hopefully Hilton will pay the driver. Suggest to stay elsewhere in Windhoek.  Avani Hotel looked like a reasonable alternative.
Date: Date of stay: June 2022This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

However, I hate the room design - I've never seen the need for the bathroom to be part of the bedroom and it's useless if you‚Äôre not both getting up at the same time. Also no hairdryer, which is annoying if you have long hair. Won't be staying again despite the staff.
