Name: Located at great location and excellent services from the staffs
Review Content: I stayed at Hilton for longer days and the hotel is located at middle of the city and very convenient for shopping and restaurant experience around the hotel. The room is spacious and clean. The required amenities are available including TV, WiFi, safe, fridge, daily drinking bottle water, iron etc. the bed is comfortable. All staffs at front desk, housekeeping and restaurant provide excellent services. Breakfast is included and it is buffet. If you stay longer, the breakfast is mostly the same and I suggest to the management variety changes daily. Fresh fruits are provided and it is refreshing. Room service orders are available and $5 is added on the order. For me, $5 added on room services is a lot and could discourage room service orders. In general, Hilton is one of the best hotel in Windhoek.

Internet has the problem that you need to connect often even if you‚Äôre registered to stay for a long time. Gym is smaller than what looks like in the pictures.

Name: Great hotel, wifi not great, everything overpriced
Review Content: If you want to make sure that the facilities is good, then you can't go wrong with the Hilton.  The rooms are spacious and well equipped.  It has a feel of luxury, as you would expect.There are great options for meals, snacks or drinks - all inside the hotel.My problem was, I was there on business and the wifi was terrible.  Difficult to get work done with bad wifi.Also, everything in the hotel is overpriced.  It just feels as if you are being screwed everything you order something.  I will try another hotel next time.

Name: Great hotel in Windhoek
Review Content: Our family stayed here one night before the start of a 7 day Safari through Namibia and then one night on the way back. The first stay we had regular rooms and they way back the executive suite. This property looks very new. Nicely decorated. We had an issue our second stay with a leak in the executive suite and staff immediately moved us into Presidential suite which was 5 star all the way. The hotel restaurant breakfast is an amazing spread. Complete with gluten free options and a juice bar. Worth getting it added to your room rate. Top floor has a nice outdoor sky bar with great views of the city, along with a small pool and sun deck. Small but adequate fitness center an d spa. Executive lounge was nice with computer and printers. Hotel is walking distance to shopping , museum and drug store. The staff is incredibly accommodating and friendly. I hope to make a trip back again for a longer stay.

Br√∂tchen, gute Auswahl an Wurst, warme Speisen, zahlreiche S√§fte, und und und.Sonstiges: Wifi in guter Geschwindigkeit auch auf dem Zimmer zu empfangen. Christuskirche und Nationalmuseum) und die Preise f√ºr einen Burger mit Pommes sind mit ca. 15 EUR auch fair. Zudem befindet sich dort ein (gesch√§tzt) 1,5 x 10 Meter Schwimmbad.

Name: Very nice and impressive hotel in the middle of the city
Review Content: We stayed here for 1 night upon arrival into Windhoek.  The hotel was very new and modern.  I am a Hilton Gold member and we had access to the lounge and it didn't disappoint.  Self service appetizers and drinks.  (Alcoholic and non-alcoholic) They had a nice variety and even smoked salmon in the mornings.  The pool is on the rooftop along with a bar, and while we didn't get a chance to use it, it looked very nice.  Great modern American style gym.  Cardio machines, free weights, all the works and big space.  Breakfast in the morning was phenomenal.  One of the best I have ever had.  Tons of options something for everybody.  Too much good stuff to list.  It was free for gold and platinum members.  I think it was pretty expensive otherwise maybe around $25 USD.  The rooms were very modern and spacious.  Service was excellent.  It was like being in a nice Hilton in America, but in Namibia.  And after the month we spent in Africa it was a nice taste of home.  The location was right in the middle of the city.  About a 10-15 walk to the mall and right next to the street markets.  Would 100% recommend.  I think it cost about 30,000 Hilton points or around $140-150 USD each night.  Worth it

The desk could have been better and it would have been good to be able to look a the view whilst working.Comfortable beds are a feature of Hiltons and this one is no exception.The food was very good. We had to eat several meals in the hotel and we're pleased with all of them. Obviously the choice of venison was a major plus.The staff were efficient and friendly. Name: Affordable Luxury in Africa
Review Content: The Hilton in Windhoek comes loaded with all the comforts, luxury elements and benifits you would expect from a Hilton chain outpost in Africa(like the ones in Equatorial Guinea, South Africa etc.) But the nice part is this one comes at a much cheaper price than its cousins in other African locations , which makes it a great bang-for-the-buck property to treat yourself to some luxury in Africa without boring a hole into your wallet! The Rooftop SKYBAR is a uber chic place to lounge and gets crowded with fancy folks and who's-who of the town. The sports bar and the other restaurants on the first floor are top rated establishments too. The BREAKFAST is a huge highlight too and comes with a Mindblowing spread, fine gourmet baked items, Local and international choices, fantastic hot and cold food, refreshing juices & smoothies, barista made hot beverages & espressos.. the list goes on. Absolute steal if your package includes Breakfast!!LOCATION: Great location and not too far from key points of interest or top rated eating and drinking establishments(if you have a car or a taxi at your disposal)THE ROOM: Since i am a HHonors DIAMOND member, i was upgraded to the EXECUTIVE SUITE room -So this is based off that. AIR CONDITIONING:Very controlled but after tinkering with the Power controls could get the stuff going in the Living room at least; SIZE: HUMOUNGOUS! The suite came with a Huge living room , dining area and a massive Bed room ; AMENTITIES: Wonderful toileteries(PETER ROTH Branded); BED - Lovely bed for a good night's sleep; BATHROOM -HUGE and stylish bathroom with a good stand-in showerFITNESS FACILITIES: Decent Fitness center that comes with all the key Cardio machines. Weights are limited to Dumbells that dont go beyond 10KG. However there is one workout station that you can train with(see photos). And the best part is the gym comes with spectacular views of the city since it is located on the Rooftop! Lovely pool which cannot be used during cold and normal days as it is outdoor on the rooftop and it gets chilly and windy on most days.SERVICE : Friendly service and very polite staffHOW WIRED YOU WOULD BE: FREE Wifi that worked all around the property, but not the fastest connections you would expect from a Luxury chain hotel. Good choice of TV channels - both English and international covering Music, movies, sports and other entertainment
Date: Date of stay: August 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Odd rooms

But I would be amiss if I didn't mention the room layout.  It is hard to describe but there is no privacy in the main part of the bathroom.  The shower is enclosed & the toilet has a closet but these open up into the no-privacy zone.  So as other reviewers have noted, you had better really like your roommate.

Review Content: Stayed at this hotel last week. Rooms are superb, wifi fast and the food of very high standard. The Sky Bar has to provide on of the most wonderful city views around, and on a good day the sunset is spectacular

Name: Fantastic
Review Content: This is the only 5 star hotel in Windhoek .  It's very  clean and new and situated well, near the city centre. Rooms are very modern... And huge! - Large comfy bed,flat  screen TV,one British electric socket( rest Namibian 3 pin round)tea and coffee making facilities, and mini bar. Room has a safe,open plan bathroom with separate bath and shower with toilet cubicle at end. Large selection of toiletries. Hotel is very secure- you need  to scan your room key card  to get to your floor.  Very nice and helpful front desk staff -Wifi is free throughout the hotel. I had a job getting my i-pad to connect but the guy at the front desk persevered till it connected. Breakfast selection is extensive and very high quality of food ,Thoroughly enjoyed our stay here.
Date: Date of stay: August 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Fantastic
Review Content: We only had one night here at this lovely hotel but it was great!  Our room was a suite so it was all you could wish for and more.  Located on the 8th floor, we had a large living room plus spacious bedroom, two delightful bathrooms - one with a bath.   Everything was absolutely amazing and so much more than we ever needed but being totally spoiled for one night was wonderful!We ate at the coffee shop there and the food was very nice.  It is very convenient to be able to walk out the back of the hotel as a shortcut to the shops and market which we spent some time looking around the afternoon we arrived.  Great place to stay.Staff were friendly and helpful ensuring we were looked after.
Date: Date of stay: July 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great hotel
Review Content: A very pleasant hotel. Very comfortable rooms. Friendly and helpful staff. I did not use in room dining, did not use the restaurants. The breakfast was excellent. In Namibia tradition, plenty of meat at breakfast.

Review Content: The Hilton was an overall very positive experience. Can't complain about too much. Very clean, very comfortable rooms and great bar and lounge facilities. It is central and service is good. Have to pay for wifi and parking.

Name: Comfortable stay
Review Content: Right from the start we found the staff very friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is impressive at first glance. The rooms are of good standard. The location was within walking distance of the downtown area.  Overall it was a comfortable stay.
Date: Date of stay: April 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: You get what you pay for
Review Content: I have had bad experiences at other hotels in Windhoek so this time it was the Hiltons turn. I must say I am very impressed. The room is very nice. The staff are friendly. The food is good. Just wave your room card by the sensor in the lift to activate it otherwise you will look like a chop like I did! Otherwise it's great.

Name: Torneremo
Review Content: Ottimo albergo posizionato a soli 150 metri dal centro e dai negozi per lo shopping. Il personale √® molto gentile e le camere molto belle. Da non perdere la prima colazione. Il negozio dell'hotel ha per√≤ prezzi carissimi rispetto ad altri trovati nei lodge durante il nostro viaggio
Date: Date of stay: April 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Small details matter the most
Review Content: I am getting ready to check out of the Hilton in Windhoek. Its a fantastic hotel on the surface. Great looking building, fantastic modern rooms and a great location with a lovely pool deck and bar on the 9th floor.I was however really aggravated by a few small, but important things for me.1. The bedroom walls seem thin. One can hear many sounds in the room next door, so if your neighbor is an early riser - or a noisy one, you will hear it all, from the opening of medicine containers to the flushing of the loo.2. Room service is slow. Not the kitchen, but the delivery to the room. When you order, expect it to arrive cold.3. In a modern world, and hotel charging R3000 ($270) per night should not be charging their guest for internet access. And this Internet access is a disgrace!.  The only part that works well is the billing system.  After that, the connection is slow and intermittent.  I really hope the Hilton people are ashamed of this, and maybe they will address it. If its junk - don't charge for it.4. The design of  the property results in there being an atrium from the 1st floor to the 8th. If there is noisy on floor 2, it affects all floors - and the resultant sleep quality.Rooms  x13 and x14 are slightly immune to this due to their location - try and book these.Not sure I will return.
Date: Date of stay: March 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: One of the best Hiltons
Review Content: This hotel is one of the best Hiltons we have stayed in.   We could not fault it.   The food was good in the Restaurant, the staff were very helpful, everyone had a smile and the place was clean.   the rooms are large and well equipped.   We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in this hotel and would definitely stay there again.   It is right in the middle of town so Restaurants and Museums etc are all close by or a short taxi ride away.
Date: Date of stay: January 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Resting on its five-star laurels
Review Content: The Windhoek Hilton is the only five-star show in town (apart from one or two boutique options) and they rest on these laurels. The hotel has all the right amenities, but absolutely no charm. Its fine for a night or two (or a quick business trip) but if you are in town for longer,  I would make a concerted effort to find something else. This is a cookie cutter hotel chain experience with a hefty price tag. Sometimes, great staff can lift an average hotel experience to another level, but even here the Hilton does not really manage to make an impression. The overall impression is that everyone is simply going through the motions. I find it quite depressing to stay here for longer than a night or two.
Date: Date of stay: February 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hilton Windhoek
Review Content: The Hotel was good on several areas but it  needs to include complimentary wiFi. Otherwise the food was delicious and there was good variety. Breakfast had many choices.  The bathroom and toilet were very clean. The meeting rooms were well arranged. But there can be a lot of improvement on the snacks for tea for meetings.  the bars were clean. Especially sky bar. the attendants were professional.  The calls to reception were answered timeously. The reception staff were welcoming and friendly.
Date: Date of stay: February 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice hotel
Review Content: We stayed twice in this hotel, in December and also in January. We chose it as a starting point for our safari tour. The rooms were clean and spacious, beds are comfortable. Very good breakfast, nice roof pool. Perfect location, very close to the centre. free garage available.Free internet is available in the lobby only.Recommended.
Date: Date of stay: January 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: five star????
Review Content: stayed here for three nights in total.  well let me start with the 5 star story ok beautiful building entrance stunning bedrooms lovely etc but sorry that is were it ends!  i can say that the staff at this hotel need some training in certain areas!  we arrived and were starving so we ordered room service.  first of all charged 50 dollars for bringing the tray to our room.  ordered a sandwich which i could not eat it was disgusting !!  forest ham pannini well the ham was so hard we could not eat it looked as if it had been left out in the sun for a few day!  they thought it was a good idea to first cover the plate with balsamic glaze which is very sticky and then put the bread on top why i do not know !!!  they have the smallest pool i have ever seen for such a huge pool.  pool is on the top floor next to the sky bar well that is another story.  they have 8 loungers which i can tell you now you would need to get up there at 6 am to get one!  the bar is open to the public so you have every tom dick and harry passing you by so if you want  a relaxing day by the pool this is not for you rather stay in your room!  bar staff at this bar are very disorganised and took them half a hour to do a cocktail which i then told them not to bother as my daughter had already gone back to her room.i just got the impression that staff we're very disorganised which is a pity as it has potential to be a good hotel but for me i won't be back.
Date: Date of stay: December 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Amazing country, Great Hotel
Review Content: The Hotel offers fantastic rooms, very modern layout, great restaurants and a very scenic roof top bar. The staff was knowledgeable and helpful ‚Äì service in all places were good. My only gripe is that Wi-Fi ‚Äì it should be included. Wi-Fi in the lobby is free, but paying hotel guests are charged if you work from your room.
Date: Date of stay: November 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great experience, oasis in the city centre!
Review Content: Stayed for 4 nights on business and this hotel exceeded my expectations. I was in an 'executive suite'. Rooms were tastefully furnished and modern with huge bathrooms. The rooftop pool was great, morning swims were the order of the day. Rooftop bar great for after work drinks. Breakfast was exceptional with a huge variety. Smoothies made to order a great touch and local 'date muffins' a treat. Chef came to table and engaged with guests. Service generally was great and definitely 5*. Free wifi in general areas and not in room is not ideal in today's environment. Will be back :)
Date: Date of stay: October 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Best option in Windhoek
Review Content: We stayed here one evening en route to Etosha. We chose the Hilton as it was an international brand, meaning we could at least guess the experience. This also makes it one of the better hotels in Windhoek.Sadly, some of the challenges associated with staying in Africa become clear. The staff are not always well trained, and service is sometimes lacklustre. but overall, it's okay.In the afternoon, a glorious sunny day, we went to the pool bar upstairs. Loud music, a strange slice of the local set, and underwhelming service, sadly.  As an example, my wife ordered a Bloody Mary cocktail, and it was transparent green when it arrived: 40 minutes later.On the plus side, the sushi bar is a wonderful experience. Some of the freshest, best presented sushi I've seen, even when compared to Cape Town. They have a good South African wine selection which is good.Dinner in the restaurant is fairly agreeable. Certainly go for the a la carte, rather than the buffet.This hotel is good as a stop over, certainly not a destination...
Date: Date of stay: October 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Sauberes, komfortables Hotel
Review Content: Wir waren f√ºr eine Nacht in Windhoek. Zentral gelegen. Das Hotel ist sauber, wir hatten ein ruhiges Zimmer trotz N√§he zum Aufzug.  Restaurant ist f√ºr Hotelk√ºche zu empfehlen, wir wollten mit unseren Kindern nachts nicht raus. Sehr gute Fleischzubereitung.  Der Pool auf dem Dach ist klein (schmal), daf√ºr ist das Wasser SEHR warm.  W√ºrden es noch einmal buchen.
Date: Date of stay: October 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hakuna matata
Review Content: Windhoek merecer√≠a el t√≠tulo de capital mundial de la tranquilidad. Todo parece detenerse all√≠... a veces literalmente...Ubicado en pleno centro de la ciudad, si uno sale de √©l a la calle en fin de semana puede parecer que uno est√° en el desierto o en un pel√≠cula post-apocaliptica: nadie a la vista...El hotel es bonito, fino, elegante. La decoraci√≥n aprovecha la riqueza geol√≥gica del pa√≠s y luce sus mejroes gemas.Las habitaciones son bastante acogedoras, con ba√±o de dise√±o bastante acertado.El bar de la primera planta y la piscina del √∫ltimo piso, son lugares estupendos para apsar el tiempo libre.El personal de recepci√≥n es muy amable y siempre dispuesto a resolver los problemas del cliente.Estupenda opci√≥n urbana en Nambia.

Name: Excellent business hotel!
Review Content: I have stayed at this hotel three times in the last year. This hotel has met every need I have had for extended business travel. It has location, restaurant, bar, meeting places, wifi, access to a printer, pool, fitness center, and a grocery store within walking distance. It's hard to improve upon.
Date: Date of stay: September 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great with Poor Details
Review Content: Great location, combined with a complete offer of services and amenities. Awesome rooms, quiet and clean. Amazing skybar. All these combined with very poor details. After driving around Botswana and Namibia we had free WIFI Internet access in every single campsite. We payed here 10 times the average cost of those campsites and still need to pay extra N$75 for 1h Internet access. It is not about the amount, it is the fact of having to pay for it at a city center 5 star hotel. Next day we woke up and no hot watter was running at all. We called the desk and told us that someone would show up. After 1 hour, someone came along to verify the problem. After calling the desk again, we were told that the problem would be fixed soon. At 9.30am we had to shower with cold water and speed-up to take a flight. At the check out, very light apologies were given and made us a bill discount of N$100, 4 Windhoek Lager beers. In such situation, I would have expected another reaction for such a high-class hotel.
Date: Date of stay: August 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: very good
Review Content: good hospitality,good accommodation,good food  overall good experience staying in Hilton worth paying what we paid but if its more competitive then other competitors more people attract and prefer to stay in Hilton Windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: August 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: 5 Stars requires a review
Review Content: Unfortunately does not do 5 Star rating justice. Room was fine however service needs jacking up! Took 90 mins to get a document scanned, card machine was not working in the restaurant during peak dinner period,  and the bar lady on the sky deck enjoyed sucking on the swizzle stick after stirring cocktails! Spa only had one person on duty resulting in only one of us being able to use the service.  Food was ordinary although I must admit that breakfast was really good.  I don't stay at the Hilton  regularly but I think when compared  to others I have been to in Mahe & Sydney, I think one could do better in Windhoek or alternatively rather just opt for a cheaper hotel that offers greater value.
Date: Date of stay: June 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Decent hotel but pathetic housekeeping & lift services
Review Content: It is a well located hotel with imposing structure. Pretty neat rooms and facilities. However, the housekeeping response time is poor, laundry services unsatisfactory and lifts dont work properly! Would have definitely expected more from a so called 5-star hotel!!
Date: Date of stay: May 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Roof top bar great place to see the sunset
Review Content: Don't usually frequent the Hiltons of this world but in Windhoek I was very pleased we went. Great view of the sunset over the garden city of Windhoek from the roof top bar. And great cocktails mixed with aplomb by the barman. Afterwards eat in the dining room and have the filet steak - a HUGE portion for under ‚Ç¨10. Great value. Good service with grace and humour. Overall a very pleasing experience.

Name: Das Personal macht den Unterschied
Review Content: Waren zu Beginn und am Ende unserer Namibiareise je einen Tag im Hilton. Zimmer sind ausgezeichnet. Sehr gutes Fr√ºhst√ºckbuffet. Angenehme Excecutive Lounge im 9. Stock. Parken ganz einfach und sicher im hoteleigenen Parkhaus. Das Besondere f√ºr uns war aber, dass alle Mitarbeiter uns das Gef√ºhl gaben, besondere G√§ste zu sein. Ich hatte meinen Ebook-Reader im Flugzeug vergesssen und nur nach der Telefonnummer von South African Arlines in Windhoek gefragt, schon nahm sich Herman der Sache an und bei unserem zweiten Aufenthalt bekam ich meinen Reader. Was f√ºr ein Service.
Date: Date of stay: April 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Comfortable with helpful staff
Review Content: Very comfortable hotel albeit quite a distance from the airport, although everything is a long way from the airport in Windhoek! The rooms are attractive, and the beds are very comfortable. The bath mats do not fit under the shower doors, but that is a minor glitch, easily fixed.More importantly the staff are very friendly and helpful. One of the reception staff even kindly agreed to make a short notice booking at a local restaurant and book a taxi for us. One niggle, which has been raised by others, is the lack of free wi-fi.
Date: Date of stay: March 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Pretty cool
Review Content: The modern-style rooms are comfortable.  I liked the hard bed and deep bath tub. The staff are friendly and helpful.  Its in a good location which gives you great access to sights and shopping in Windhoek.  There is a great sky-bar on the 9th floor with a swimming pool. The view of the city is stunning from here. Well worth a visit just for that.  Great place for sundowners. You get to meet the local middle class lot, black and white.  The restaurants are good too, offering a variety of food to satisfy all sorts of palates.  Ask for  a room on as high a floor as they have. Make sure to visit Katatula township when in Whk. Day visits are safe.  If venturing out to She-beens (local drinking dens) go with a local and don‚Äôt flash your bling and shiny little machines.
Date: Date of stay: February 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Beautiful rooms but lack of supervision
Review Content: The hotel is very good and modern, but when it comes to service there is a great need of supervision. Three times I've tried to exchange money and the concierge did not have any amount. I've tried to book a tour and it was not possible to get any help. The food was good and breakfast excelent. Very expensive internet.
Date: Date of stay: January 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hilton Windhoek Review
Review Content: Average compared to hotels in other countries but most likely the best in Windhoek. There is still a lot of improvement that can be made to really make this hotel at par and live up to the Hilton name and reputation.
Date: Date of stay: January 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: The Hilton brand, in a place one might not expect.
Review Content: I stayed a total of 5 nights on 3 separate occasions, during a 3-week visit to Namibia in Dec., 2013. My company does a fair bit of business w. Hilton in the U.S. and Canada, so I'm a Hilton Honors member. I stayed at the Hilton Windhoek using a combination points and payment.From my perspective, the Hilton Windhoek proved to be a solid, comfortable base from which to explore the country in 3 different directions. It was nice, for example, after spending several nights at the Sesrium campsite on the edge of the Namib Desert, at a campsite w/out water for the better part of 2 days (a water pump broke prior to New Year's Eve, shutting off water to the entire campsite) to have a hot shower and be able to wash the grit out.The Hilton Windhoek caters to a mix of tourists, many from Europe or S.Africa, and Namibian and other businesspersons from across Africa. It's clean, pleasant, modern-looking with a really stylish interior and exterior design, and well-maintained. It's Africa ‚Äî to expect the standards of the Beverly Hilton (which I'm familiar with) is somewhat misguided.The positives: The rooms are well-designed, with a large double bed, African and European power plugs (a nice touch: those Namibian and South African 3-prong plugs are ludicrous, and even a lot of "all-country" power adaptors, with plugs for about 7 different continents, don't accommodate  the bizarre S.African plug). I stayed in 3 different rooms; all were pleasant, comfortable and clean.I mainlined coffee in the Centrum bar ‚Äî the only decent cup of coffee, for my taste, I found anywhere in Namibia. Some of the coffee, especially on safari, was so awful I was reduced to drinking tea, because at least pre-fab tea bags can be depended on. The Centrum coffee is quite good: It takes a while, but they brew the cup while you wait. I ordered a hamburger with a friend (she ordered chicken wrap) and, surprise, it was really quite good,much better than you would expect from a lobby-level coffee shop. The Centrum has indoor and outdoor seating on plush chairs, couches and proper tables.Check-in ‚Äî I don't normally name names, but I will here: Emmarendia ‚Äî could not have been more warm and welcoming. Dealing with employees is the luck of the draw; when you come across someone as forthright and helpful as Emmarendia, you know they won't be fronting a reception desk for long: They're management material, and it'll only be a matter of time before they move up. The next person may not be so on the ball.I've gone into detail because some of the reviews on this site ‚Äî perfectly valid, I imagine ‚Äî have complained about the service. I can only speak for myself and my own visit, but I found the service to be impeccable. As I visited on 3 separate occasions, that must count for something.An example: My first night, my shower flooded (a combination of a design flaw and a blocked drain). Hotel maintenance repaired the drain less than an hour after I reported it (trust me, you wouldn't get that kind of service in California, and I know) and housekeeping seemed brisk and efficient,. Some staff are friendlier than others, but Emmarendia and a couple of the converges I dealt with were above & beyond the call.To sum: I couldn't have asked for more. I was looking for a clean, comfortable "base" from which to rest and freshen up after some gnarly excursions into the back country, and that's exactly what I got. I won't hesitate to stay here on future layovers  in Windhoek.The hotel itself is centrally located, by the way, across the street from a grocery store and chicken takeout, down the street from the Kalahari Sands mall and about a 3-block walk away from a 24-hour KFC (useful when it's a holiday or Saturday, and everything else is closed). The KFC seems especially popular w. locals ‚Äî always a good sign. (North Americans note: The chicken pieces are much bigger than the ratty, expensive, over-priced portions we're used to back home: Namibian fried chicken, even KFC, puts North American fast food to shame. And it's less expensive, too.)A caveat for those who don't like street noise: I did find the street noise to be quieter on the rooms on the right side of the hotel; rooms on the left side of the hotel can be a bit noisy, especially at night, when sometimes it sounds as if some drivers are drag-racing. Didn't bother me much ‚Äî I use ear plugs, when in doubt ‚Äî but it may bother some.In all, a pleasant place to stay that I did not expect from southern Africa, at least outside South Africa. In my view, as a Hilton Honors member, certainly a credit to the Hilton name. My only fear would be if Hilton walks away one day ‚Äî it happens in the hotel business ‚Äî leaving some other chain to take over. For now, for me, it's perfect.
Date: Date of stay: December 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great place!
Review Content: Great hotel for start to finish. Rooms are huge and very nice. It's in a very nice area and close or the few best restaurants in the town. The staff are friendly and the breakfast is good, although a little slow on the re stocking of the empty products. Don't stay at any other places in the town. Well done!
Date: Date of stay: December 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Skybar with beautiful view - even as non resident
Review Content: By accident we went into the lobby and asked if we are allowed to go up to the skybar at the Hilton. Suprisingly, it was allowed and didn't cost anything either. So don't miss the possibility to watch the sunset over Windhoek while enjoying a good drink (prices were to my astonishment not too bad - 23N$ for a coke).
Date: Date of stay: October 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Sch√∂nes Hotel in Zentrumsn√§he leider mit Riesen Baustelle
Review Content: Das Hotel liegt leicht zu finden an der Verl√§ngerung der Stra√üe, die vom Flughafen kommt und ist sehr leicht zu finden.  Man wir direkt an der Vorfahrt freundlich empfangen und die Koffer werden ausgeladen. Die Tiefgarage ist direkt am Haus. Bei uns gab es beim Check-in leider ziemliche Probleme. Von vier Zimmern waren 2 erst gegen 16 Uhr fertig. Wir wurden nicht telefonisch informiert, sondern haben es quasi zuf√§llig durch eine Nachfrage informiert, dass die Zimmer fertig waren. Leider war der Pool au√üer Betrieb und da laute, staubige Arbeiten durchgef√ºhrt werden, war auch das Sonnendeck nicht zu nutzen. Hinzu kommt, dass neben dem Haus eine gro√üe Baustelle ist. Zum jetzigen Zeitpunkt (18.10.13) war gerade das Fundament fertig - es wird wohl noch was dauern bis das Haus fertig ist. Daher war es ab morgens fr√ºh recht laut. Die Zimmer sind sehr sch√∂n eingerichtet, die Betten hervorragend. Das Fr√ºhst√ºck war auch ok.
Date: Date of stay: October 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great addition to Windhoek's hotels
Review Content: I've stayed in many of Windhoek's hotels and this is in my view the best. The architecture is spacious and attractive with a delightful reception hall and coffee bar, very spacious well equipped bedrooms, excellent restaurant and wonderful panoramic rooftop bar with pool. We spent 2 nights 14 days apart and the hotel was full, buzzing with activity. Staff were friendly. The 2nd room we had had some maintenance problems which could have been checked by housekeeping but I suspect were overlooked in a full hotel. Breakfast was as good as anything I've had in Namibia. The hotel loses a * because of the shambles mentioned by others over wifi. Not only is it unreasonably expensive(free at all the other hotels we stayed in Namibia) but mine collapsed after an hour after having to speak to the service provider and asked for 24hrs. I only paid for an hour! This was simply not good enough in a hotel claiming  5* and welcoming guests from all over the world.
Date: Date of stay: September 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Perfect for Business Travel
Review Content: I stayed at the Hilton on 2 occasions in August for business purposes, and was pleased with the service and quality of rooms. The 9th floor business lounge was a perfect semi-private meeting space with excellent food and drink to offer. The buffet breakfast and theme-night dinners in the restaurant offered exceptional choice and quality.  The downtown location of the Hilton is convenient for souvenir shopping and general daytime errands.  My only complaints are regarding the internet (hit and miss; mostly miss) and the system to exit the parking garage (we had to revisit reception twice to exit the garage successfully). A warning to be vigilant with personal belongings in the public spaces as a colleague had his phone stolen from the bar on the mezzanine level.
Date: Date of stay: August 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Pleasant stay
Review Content: A very comfortable hotel with friendly and helpful people. Secure and safe. Great view from the bar on the roof. Rooms are spacious and comfortable.  Make other arrangements for internet connectivity as it is very expensive.
Date: Date of stay: August 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: room service
Review Content: Nice rooms,very spacious and good. The room service is slow and not up to standard. The rooftop bar is good for town view too. Avoid been mislead at the club. Advised to improve on service if they want clients to call again.
Date: Date of stay: October 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: All the review items are five star
Review Content: Bed, more than comfortable, shower, excellent, amenities all there except for a hair dryer, big deal. Service excellent and with authentic pleasantness. Room, large. Value for money, yes. Restaurants very good. Stay here especially if you are on business! They could've give WIFI away, but they don't.

Name: Recommendable to my colleagues
Review Content: Enterance road beside the Hotel to parking area is too narrow to drive for the first visitor. Upon leaving the parking. each time we have to wait for hotel employee's coming down, who will open a gate bar. This procedures should be improved, since this gate bar can be worked by a electric card.

Name: Great stay at Hilton
Review Content: I had an great, comftable 5 STAR stay. I totaly enjoyed myself and the room was tidy, neat and the view is Beautifull. The staff is extra friendly and room service was very fast and friendly aswell. Check inn and check out was also very fast, Tosaline and Imogen was very friendly and helpful at reception upon check out. cant wait to come and stay here again :)
Date: Date of stay: May 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Excellent Hotel
Review Content: I've stayed for one night at the Hilton in Windhoek. This is a new and upmarket hotel with a modern touch. The hotel is well situated within the city, the staff were friendly, rooms are modern and clean and the hotel has a swimming pool on the 9th floor with a great view over the city.The only negative was the restaurant eKapi as the service were slow, the steak bland and the waitress managed to screw up our order both times we had lunch there. Overall a great hotel and I would definitely stay there again though I would not visit the restaurant.
Date: Date of stay: May 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice
Review Content: Very good downtown location with good parking for fly drive cars.New and well appointed.Staff a little unfriendly on check in and getting free Internet for Hilton Honours members a struggle.We had to pay first then feta refundwhenthey decided it was free for HH.Points never came through to my BA card which should have.
Date: Date of stay: July 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A nice and friendly hotel. Suitable for business as well as leisure travel.
Review Content: The hotel is new and the location is perfect. The view of the Windhoek city from the hotel rooftop is a real treat to the eyes. The rooftop bar and the swimming pool are a perfect place to enjoy a drink and relax after a day's work. The food is good and the restaurant staff is very polite. The rooms are very well done and the beds are comfortable. The Gym is well equipped and there is also a SPA for the holiday crowds.Overall I think it is good value for money for a business visit !!
Date: Date of stay: March 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Enjoyable for business
Review Content: I stayed for 1 week for business and enjoyed my stay. The rooftop bar is the best sunset bar in the region. The pool is a little small but hey, its ON THE ROOF so...The room I had was big and the bed very comfortable. Room service was tasty and breakfast buffet was better than average.
Date: Date of stay: October 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: central modern hotel
Review Content: We got upgraded to the diplomat suite 2 times for a total of 4 nights!  Superb. The business lounge is great and even helped me find a replacement camera for mine that was ruined in the sand storms of Souslavesi dunes.  Well done.roof top pool small but suitable for a dip and some sun overlooking the town. Very central to all museums and main shopping street....about 5 min walk.  Front desk was awesome.For 150 bucks a night including the lounge breakfast, lunch an dinner what else could you want. One of the best Hiltons and I have stayed at a few as a diamond member. Keep up the good work Namibia!!
Date: Date of stay: November 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Modern, well-equipped hotel located in the heart of the city
Review Content: The Hilton Windhoek is a reasonably new hotel with modern well-equipped rooms and quality facilities. The staff are friendly and helpful although front desk service can be slow. Rooftop bar and pool area are great in the evening with views across the city.
Date: Date of stay: September 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Convient location of a modern very comfortable hotel
Review Content: You want to be next to the business center and nevertheless in an almost brand new hotel complex, then choose the Hilton Windhoek! Nice room, all amenities, good location! Yes, it's a kind of high-rise, and some may not appreciate this kind of architecture.
Date: Date of stay: July 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Service above what could be expected
Review Content: My son was in a car accident in Namibia and had to stay at the hotel for one night with an injured neck after being released from hospital before I could get out to be with him. The duty manager said to him that he would check regularly that all was OK and then he duly did this - every two hours.We did not ask for this, it was on his initiative.That is truly thinking of the customer. Well done.
Date: Date of stay: June 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Expensive but brand new luxury
Review Content: Week-long business trip flew by with the comfort experienced at this hotel.  Centrally located with a few of the city.  Large selection in the restaurant.  I found the hotel to be expensive and quite busy.  Check-out took very long.
Date: Date of stay: November 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A  very welcome addition
Review Content: I recently   had to fly into Windhoek on Business.. having endured  some  awful hotels  in the past - the hilton was a  welcoem  reprieve. Great  hotel, modern ambience.Great room facilities.Internet is pay  as you go which I was suprised by. Make  sure you ask  for your bar fridge to be filled before arrival !Otherwise  very pleasant in deed and I will  definitely stay again
