Name: Not that impressive
Review Content: On holiday with my family and stayed overnight in the Hilton Windhoek. I do travel a lot and is used to the best hotels in the world, this one was pretty disappointing.The Hilton is luxurious (as you would expect) with a friendly staff and good clean accommodation. This is were is ends. The heated pool was was cold (heat pump broke). We were allocated a room with an inter-leading door for the children. The children's room was not ready at the time of check-in so we initially unpacked our luggage in the 1 room. After numerous phone calls to reception (without response), eventually we were told we had to move to a different room all together. This is after we unpacked! I was not happy. We ordered Mojitos but they did not have mint leaves!We had dinner in the hotel restaurant and waited for our food for more than an hour and they got the whole order wrong!! The next morning we had breakfast in the same restaurant. On arrival the buffet area was empty with no sausages, eggs, bacon etc etc etc. I made a fuss and after 15 min this was stocked up again. I ordered a omelet, this never arrived. The whole experience was pretty disappointing and not what you expect from a Hilton hotel. I'm not convinced I will go there again.
Date: Date of stay: June 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Outwardly impressive; inwardly needs a considerable re-think.
Review Content: Although occupying a prime city centre site and with notable architecture the Hilton Windhoek is tired and needs a refresh. The main problem is its restaurant, which has limited opening hours but really (really!) bad food. Having stayed before when we didn't fancy anything from the buffet we ordered pizza plus a chicken dish from the a la carte menu. It took the metaphorical 'hours' for these simple dishes to arrive, and not without several complaints, which were treated with indifference. This time we tried the buffet for speed and it was - not to out too finer a point it - dreadful. Half cold and indifferent with bread rolls that were worse than something offered in a filling station shop. Quite how so much noise, chatter and activity in their open kitchen could produce food so bad is beyond me and is a considerable negative achievement.The irony was that a quick buffet in their casual executive facility, which we had used previously, was excellent. From the same kitchen I wonder? What was noticeable was that on a Friday night at 7 pm there were only two couples, one being us. So perhaps the restaurant has declining patronage.Also, on previous stay we found the restaurant does not serve breakfast until 7 am - hardly in keeping with international travellers' schedules.We did ask if a quick meal could be served in their rooftop pool and bar area, to which the answer was affirmative. However, as this was occupied by two blatantly obvious instances of ladies of the night entertaining their gentlemen clients by day and with rap music repeating 'I can't breath' it was not somewhere we wished to linger.The rooms are not that bad but really need a critical staff eye to spot worn out features that seem to be left to guests to discover. In one room the shower was jammed and in another the security lock did not function properly.This hotel should be highly convenient and of excellent standard but on our next visit to Namibia we will, sadly, be looking elsewhere.It's four years since we visited last and little seems to have changed in the restaurant so perhaps this review could contribute to a wake up call for the hotel's management.
Date: Date of stay: September 2023This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Disappointing stay
Review Content: It was not all bad: the hotel has central location, a tasty breakfast buffet, good bathrooms - and they provided great service with an antigen test. But we arrived after a five hour car ride, only to be informed that the room was not ready as normal at 15:00. It was only made available to us at 15:45. The rooms (we had two) were underwhelming: stains on the carpet, very dirty windows (bird droppings), partially worn-down furniture, and unstable wifi. At a certain point our key cards stopped working due to a technical error, so we couldn‚Äôt use the elevator without assistance. I‚Äôve been to other Hiltons, generally with positive experiences. But for the price I paid I cannot recommend Hilton Windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: April 2023This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Parking charged exorbitant
Review Content: My room had no towels, staff slow. But quiet  good food.But the worst was the parking! Apparently it is managed by another company charging exorbitant fees! I had to pay 174N$ for 1 night. They only accept cash which I didn't have. They wanted me to walk across the street to the ATM!!! Upon booking the room I was told parking is 10N$! When talking to Hotel about it, the staff just shrugs shoulders.Cancelled my stay next week. I refuse to be exploited!
Date: Date of stay: November 2023This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: The Home of Excellence & Hospitality
Review Content: Hilton is the epitome of hospitality, where leisure meets with relaxation and tranquility. My home away from home. Unmatchable room ambience and bedding. Hilton is heaven on earth! Unparalleled room service, unmatchable quality and finest restaurants, with tantalising cuisines.
Date: Date of stay: January 2023This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Up to Hilton standards, and a great location
Review Content: The staff were friendly. And the rooms are virtually identical to Hilton rooms around the world. The restaurant is good and serves a nice breakfast buffet. Only warning: I was told that if you add a tip to your bill, the service person will not get that money. So use cash!
Date: Date of stay: August 2022This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Incredible staff & location
Review Content: The staff was friendly and gave us a great upgrade but beyond that helped us find a pharmacy for medicine we needed. told us where to go and where not to. They were always checking on us too. The food was delicious and service very friendly- the Spa is excellent too Marta is a great therapist.
Date: Date of stay: March 2023This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great Hilton Hotel in Windhoek
Review Content: I just arrived to the Hilton Windhoek after 4 nights in Sossusvlei. This was one of my favourite Hilton stays anywhere in the world. Check-in was friendly & prompt. My room was spotless & a good size with all the required amenities & great wifi. The shower was fantastic!  Lovely rooftop pool area & bar. I enjoyed apps & wine in the executive lounge followed by a light breakfast the following morning. Hilton arranged a car to the airport for me at a reasonable price. Unfortunately my stay was too short for only one night. Thanks for your hospitality!
Date: Date of stay: October 2024This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice stay in Windhoek!
Review Content: Excellent hotel. Attentive staff, very clean and comfortable rooms & nice executive lounge with very nice food presentation. Stayed twice, once in February and once in March. Both times were upgraded to wonderful rooms. Pool is located on the rooftop, a bit small, but still very nice. Overall another great Hilton experience.
Date: Date of stay: March 2024This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Highly recommend
Review Content: Staff was fantastic! Front desk personnel were friendly and very helpful throughout the stay. I will be recommending this hotel to friends and coworkers for future stays! The hotel is located in a great location for restaurants and shopping.
Date: Date of stay: September 2024This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: How can they call that 5 stars???
Review Content: No water in the rooms, dirty windows, dirty public spaces, dirty table clothes in the restaurant, noisy lobby, no turn down of the rooms in the evening, no water in the room, no possibility to have a shower in the room without spraying some water everywhere in the bathroom, ughly buffet for dinner. How can they be so bad with such a nice staff? Where is the management??? Where is Hilton control???
Date: Date of stay: November 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Mixed results
Review Content: I stayed for 4 nights whilst on business. The hotel is one of only a few centrally located, premium hotels. Despite being modern, comfortable and well maintained, there was no internet connection available in my room throughout the stay. To compensate I was directed to use the executive lounge. Here, the staff were friendly and the internet connection worked well.  The rooftop bar and pool area is one of the hotel‚Äôs most appealing facilities. It was a lovely place to relax and enjoy the bar food and panorama of Windhoek. A major area needing improvement is the front-desk experience. I had more two separate bookings of two days each. This situation presented staff with a challenge that took a long time to resolve. A more distressing situation was the response of Benjamin the front-desk manager, to the local (female) business partners who joined us for a coffee and meeting in the lounge bar. He questioned ‚Äúwhat‚Äù we were doing, and if we ‚Äúhad permission to take photos‚Äù (of the meeting). His tone made it very clear that they were not welcome. Overall my experience at the Windhoek Hilton was mixed. Whilst I was very satisfied with the hotel facilities (other than internet), and most staff were friendly and professional, it was an inconsistent experience.
Date: Date of stay: September 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Chaos in the lobby
Review Content: This is just based on check-in so far. When we arrived we were told no rooms were ready even though it was after 3 pm. People were all over the lobby and luggage was everywhere!  There was no apology and no indication of .when rooms might be ready.  Three of our party of seven are Hilton gold or above but we were told we could not access the executive lounge sine all seven were not but we could split up and the others could stand in the lobby waiting.  We asked to see the manager and she neither apologized or offered any real help. She told us we could go up and sit by the pool in a private space. It w as however raining.  After two weeks in Namibia staying in wilderness lodges and camps this was the first bad welcome and lack of accommodation we had received--in an American hotel no less!  Which is the third world country?  I was embarrassed to be American!
Date: Date of stay: October 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Rip-off WiFi
Review Content: The only hotel in Namibia that I know that charges guests for WiFi. N$75 (US$7) per hour. When I complained to Reception, the staff said "We agree with you. WiFi should be free for guests". A tour operator standing next to me said that several of his clients had also complained. C'mon, Hilton, up your game!
Date: Date of stay: December 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Best hotel in town, but far from being perfect
Review Content: My room key had to be changed every day and sometimes twice a day.Executive lounge was open only two hours a day. staff at reception friendly and polite but not knowledgeable and not helpful.Room: noisy air condition, very small television screen and very few channels, bathroom floor slipperybreakfast: i was offered tea/coffee only on two of of the four days i stayed in the hotel, bread/rolls are tastelessswimming pool on the roof is tinyi ordered club sandwich and fries in the lobby, it arrived without ketchupwhen i checked in i ask the reception to book a guide for the following day, i was told to wait in the room for a phone call. waited for six hours and no one called, went downstairs and found out that nothing was done about it
Date: Date of stay: December 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Fab hotel
Review Content: This hotel is lovely. Plush without being pretentious and very welcoming. Stunning 9th floor with a small pool, a large bar area, executive centre and well equipped gym. The rooms are lovely with beautiful bathrooms and comfy beds. Breakfast was decent with a good selection. I would definitely recommend this hotel.
Date: Date of stay: August 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: First stay
Review Content: A truly stunning experience. The hotel is upmarket and located in the city centre. The rooms are very modern with excellent facilities.The WiFi is great and fast. Breakfast is excellent with an amazing variety of foods to choose from.The laundry service was very good and my clothing was laundered and delivered on the same day. The hotel has a stunning sky lounge on the 9th floor with a pool and gym. I would certainly recommend choosing the Hilton in Windhoek for both business and leisure.
Date: Date of stay: March 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great Terrace and nice pool with view on the city
Review Content: The hotel has a very good location for visiting the not too many interesting things in Windhoek. The rooms are big and good. The service is excellent.They offer a great breakfast with fresh juices and a high variety of bread, sausages, cheese and other delights
Date: Date of stay: August 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: 5 Sterne im Central Business District
Review Content: Hier hat eigentlich alles gepasst. Der Check-In ging schnell vonstatten, das Zimmer war gross und modern. Der Nassbereich war ebenfalls gross (sowohl separate Dusche, als auch Badewanne sind vorhanden, die Toilette ist durch eine T√ºr abgetrennt). Das Zimmer ist in Beige- und Braunt√∂nen gehalten und vermittelt dadurch ein angenehmes afrikanisches Flair. Das Hilton Windhoek befindet sich inmitten des CBD, zentraler geht es nicht mehr. Christuskirche, Alte Feste und andere Sehensw√ºrdigkeiten (Independence Museum, etc.) k√∂nnen zu Fuss in 5 Minuten erreicht werden. Falls es mich jemals wieder nach Windhuk verschl√§gt, komme ich gerne wieder ...
Date: Date of stay: December 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Long Weekend Windhoek
Review Content: This is a good place to stay in Windhoek city center where you can enjoy the city at night and centrally located for day excursions to safaris and the such.  Exactly what I did on a 4 day weekend.  Chose this hotel as I am familiar with the Hilton experience and for the most part this hotel lives up to the brand name. No real complaints other than the showers are very slow to react to temp adjustments.
Date: Date of stay: May 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Another great stay!
Review Content: One of the best hotel in Namibia. Caring staff and well appointed rooms. Housekeeping staff Ms Nadia is always responsive to our needs. The supplies and cleanliness could not better. Our thanks to her and the team for making the stay a very pleasant one. The chief chef made our dinner in 2 occasions very special by cooking Singapore food using some chilli crab and sambal sauces. Delightful and skillful kitchen staffs prepared the food so well that both nights we felt so st home. Many thanks to them for taking on the challenge!Will definitely be back again!
Date: Date of stay: August 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: they will give your room away and send you to a dump.
Review Content: it appears to be one of the better hotels in Windhoek  but the problem is that if you are not from Namibia,  they will quite happily give your confirmed room away to a local travel agent. Windhoek was busy and when we arrived after an extremely long flight, we were told they had no room and had rebooked us (at a two star hotel). lets be clear, this was not an oversold situation. people were still checking-in even as my family (including small children) were told we could not have a room.  because these other people were locals  they got priority and our family were sent to a dump with exposed wiring, poor security  and gas cylinders in the hall. Even my Hilton status didn‚Äôt help.  Especially  frustrating was that the next day  our safari guide told us that he could have booked us into much better accommodation. So apparently this management team couldn‚Äôt be bothered.  If you are from out of town, stay somewhere else (you might have to anyway).
Date: Date of stay: February 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great location, good food and service
Review Content: We walked from the hotel up and down the streets to many shops.  There is an open air market right beside the hotel, so you can see local Himba women selling many hand crafted items and take interesting photos.
Date: Date of stay: February 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great Experience
Review Content: The Hilton Hotel, Windhoek, provides excellent service and beautifully appointed accommodation at a great rate, in a very accessible and centralised location. It is the ideal place to unwind after a tough day at the office - or to refresh before embarking on a holiday in Namibia. Thank you for your wonderful hospitality!
Date: Date of stay: June 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Comfortable rooms, good restaurant, rip off wifi charge
Review Content: Whilst a Hilton Hotel would not normally be our first choice, it was actually an enjoyable nights stay.The room was a good size with a huge bed which allowed us a comfortable nights sleep.  The bathroom was also of a good size and included both a bath and separate shower and for once, water didn‚Äôt leak all over the room when you used it.We used the coffee shop for an afternoon drink and it has a pleasant outside space ‚Äì but does overlook a car park.As this was a Sunday, the city was quiet and not much was open so we chose to have a drink in the Skybar and dinner in the restaurant.  The Skybar is clearly quiet a trendy space for locals to drink as well as hotel guests and it has a lovely view, although it was windy which didn‚Äôt make it quite so much fun as we‚Äôd hoped.  Not sure I‚Äôd like to eat here either as the food would go cold very quickly.  Dinner in the restaurant was something of a revelation ‚Äì the restaurant is billed as a ‚ÄòGrill‚Äô so we both had steaks and they were excellent both in quality and accuracy of cooking.  It wasn‚Äôt expensive either (for us Londoners).  Staff are a little hit and miss ‚Äì the receptionists aren‚Äôt that enthusiastic about helping ‚Äì we asked them to contact Wilderness Safaris to confirm a pick up but were met with a lofty ‚Äùthere‚Äôs a phone in your room‚Äù.The major criticism is the charge for the wifi.  The cost is ridiculously high ‚Äì it costs more than a steak.  I suspect Hilton get away with this because lots of people are staying here on business and aren‚Äôt paying for it out of their own pocket, however, that really is no justification for ripping people off.
Date: Date of stay: September 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Professioneller Hotelbetrieb auf sehr hohem Niveau
Review Content: Wir - eine vierk√∂pfige Familie - w√§hlten das Hilton Windhoek f√ºr die erste Nacht in Namibia und - um es kurz zu machen - es war beeindruckend. Bereits der Empfang war professionell, wir wurden trotz unseres fr√ºhen Erscheinens umsorgt und nach kurzem Warten wurde uns unser Zimmer bereits vormittags zur Verf√ºgung gestellt. Die Annehmlichkeiten des Hotels machten es fast schwer, Windhoek zu erkunden. Zu verf√ºhrerisch waren die kulinarischen M√∂glichkeiten, und der Pool auf dem Dach sucht von Lage und Erscheinung seinesgleichen. Das Hilton verk√∂rpert Eleganz und Luxus, nat√ºrlich in der Pr√§gung einer internationalen Kette. Wer die abendliche lange Tafel einer namibischen Guestfarm sucht, wird hier nicht f√ºndig. Hier kann man sich aber nach einem langen Flug und einer schlafarmen Nacht bestens verw√∂hnen lassen.Das Hilton Windhoek hat uns auch in Details √ºberzeugt, nach meinem Eindruck hat es das Zeug, sich mit internationalen Tophotels zu messen. Das alles zu √§u√üerst attraktiven Preisen, seien es die Zimmer selbst, Getr√§nke oder Speisen.Die Architektur im Gro√üen (Lobby und Mezzanine) wie auch im Kleinen (Zimmer) ist modern, attraktiv und "stylish" - eventuell etwas austauschbar, dieses Hilton k√∂nnte man auch in einigen anderen St√§dten auch au√üerhalb Afrikas vermuten.Die Klientel ist gemischt, uns erschien es prim√§r als Businesshotel. Spezielle Unterhaltungsprogramme f√ºr Touristen werden halt nicht geboten, aber das braucht hier auch niemand. Die Lage selbst ist so zentral, dass fu√ül√§ufig viel erreicht werden kann. Wer dazu zu m√ºde ist, kann auch einfach von der Dachterrasse aus die Stadt betrachten.Der Restaurantbetrieb war professionell und insbesondere bez√ºglich des Fr√ºhst√ºcks auf einem Stand, den wir so in Namibia nicht wieder vorgefunden haben. Ein kleines Highlight ist die frische Zubereitung von Frucht- und Gem√ºses√§ften nach Wunsch - also keine "Ceres"-Produkte, wie sie gelegentlich andernorts als "100 % natural" angeboten werden.Wir fanden das Hilton derma√üen angenehm, dass wir auch vor unserer Heimreise noch ein paar Stunden zum Mittagessen hier g√∂nnten - und bedauert haben, nicht noch mehr Zeit hier verbringen zu d√ºrfen.
Date: Date of stay: August 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Toller Beginn unserer Reise
Review Content: Ein super Cityhotel in zentraler Lager von Windhoek. Wir wurden sehr freundlich begr√º√üt, unsere Zimmer waren bei Ankunft am Mittag noch nicht fertig, also erholten wir uns vom langen Flug auf der Dachterrasse bei gutem Service und Getr√§nken. Auch am Abend genossen wir bei guter Musik ein paar leckere Drinks. Wir hatten standard Zimmer gebucht, Zimmer sind gut ausgestattet und das Bett sehr bequem, Zimmer ist mit einem gro√üz√ºgigen Bad ausgestattet und das wichtigste, alles sehr sauber. Auch das Fr√ºhst√ºck bietet alles was man sich w√ºnscht, ob s√º√üe oder Herzhafte Speisen, sehr leckere S√§fte die einem vor den Augen frisch gepresst werden. √úberall im Hotel war der Service sehr sehr freundlich und zuvorkommend, Daumen hoch ‚úåüèª
Date: Date of stay: February 2020This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A √∫nica coisa que vale a pena √© a localiza√ß√£o
Review Content: Comparado a outros hot√©is da rede Hilton espalhadas pelo mundo, o hotel Hilton Windhoek √© bem fraco do que diz respeito a estrutura e servi√ßos prestados. Fiquei em duas oportunidades diferentes (e em quartos diferentes) durante a minha road trip pela Nam√≠bia, e nas duas oportunidades tive algum problema com o meu quarto. Banheira/chuveiro com problema, demora na libera√ß√£o do meu checkin (que ocorreu ap√≥s o hor√°rio que o hotel estipula pois segundo a recep√ß√£o, n√£o haviam quartos dispon√≠veis). Mas o pior ocorreu em uma das noites que fiquei hospedado, e fui no bar no t√©rreo do hotel onde deveriam apenas ter acesso os hospedes, por√©m haviam 3 garotas de programa no bar "assediando" os estrangeiros. S√©rio isso Hilton? Cade a seguran√ßa dos h√≥spedes? Se entraram garotas de programa, poderiam ter entrado qualquer pessoa l√°. E se eu estivesse com minha familia, filhos? No mais, os produtos e servi√ßos do restaurante e do bar s√£o extremamente caros, e a seguran√ßa em volta do hotel, em especial √† noite, √© horr√≠vel (mas claro, entendo que nesse caso foge da responsabilidade do Hilton, sendo esse um problema p√∫blico). Se resolver sair do hotel para andar a p√© por Windhoek, deixe todos os pertences de valor guardados no cofre, porque com certeza j√° na primeira esquina ir√£o te assediar pedindo dinheiro. O √∫nico ponto positivo √© a cobertura, aonde fica o bar, em que podemos ter uma bela vista da cidade e do por-do-sol.
Date: Date of stay: September 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Ok, but not more
Review Content: This business hotel is quite new but already falling apart. Quite spacious rooms with all you need in it. Roof bar and pool are much smaller than indicated by the pictures. Anyway it was "closed" due to not existing staff. Breakfast buffet is nice.
Date: Date of stay: April 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Lock away your possessions if you stay here
Review Content: I went back to my room unexpectedly and caught one cleaner searching through my bag whilst the other kept watch in the doorway.  I was then made to feel completely overwhelmed in a security meeting where the cleaners denied everything and accused me of not being truthful!!!   Security Managers words, 'there's nothing we can do about this'.  I did receive an apology email from the General Manager but only after I complained at a higher level.Soooo disappointed as I'm in and out of Windhoek all the time and always previously looked forward to staying here.  My advice - stay well away!!
Date: Date of stay: December 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: En noget blandet oplevelse
Review Content: Hotellet er rigtigt dejligt, og v√¶relset med egen have p√• 6. sal var ogs√• super. Servicen p√• hotellet er derimod en noget blandet oplevelse. Vi spiste i sushi og winebaren. Name: Neat and tidy
Review Content: The hotel is well located, with great views. The Hilton has a standard when it comes to cleanliness, service and rooms and I think they hit their mark here. Disappointed to not see seafood in the restaurant and a dangerously priced mini bar that might be fine for the foreign market but way off mark for the regional market. The visit is not complete with a drink in the evening at the Skybar. Breakfast choices at cost benefit ratio slightly below par. Shower roof either had soap sud or mould that is not easily noticable to the naked eye. Having said all this and knowing the current hotel brands in town, you will be hard pressed to find a more luxurious hotel.
Date: Date of stay: August 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Complacent & incompetent reception
Review Content: Receptionist managed to give us a room which was already occupied, very embarassing! They programmed a wake up call at 3:30am on the first night, instead of the second night. After complaining, wake up call  was not made on the second night. Room not clean, dirt on the carpet!Unfriendly staff at the reception
Date: Date of stay: January 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Best Hotel in town
Review Content: Best Hotel in town, friendly staff, good Food, perfect location in the middle of the city, nice rooms, nice sky bar, helpful, Concierge is organising everything you Need, an luxurious oasis in Windhoek
Date: Date of stay: September 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice Business Hotel with perfect location
Review Content: The location of Hilton Windhoek is perfect as it is in the middle of the city. Additionally the view from the rooftop up to the mountains is amazing. Also a plus is the Hertz car rental agency which is located directly in the building. The internet was a bit slow (like probably everywhere in Namibia) and the room a bit small but everything else was fine. Especially the breakfast buffet was excellent (healthy fresh juices, directly prepared in front of the guests, various fresh egg options, delicious bread (even "Bretzeln") plus muffins and coffee/tea "to go" at the entrance). Would definitely book it again.
Date: Date of stay: July 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Very disappointing and unpleasant stay for a hotel in 5 star category
Review Content: For the standard which Hilton should offer worldwide, I consider this hotel very very poor.  It was mainly about the details, but altogether it was so many of them that they created a bad impression. In the room,  AC did not work at nights and most of the day! although we ask to fix it repeatedly. We could not sleep all nights. Management just explained that ALL rooms at one floor either cool or all heat and since there were some which want to heat we can not cool. It means that In this hotel, AC or heating could be only set up centrally. Riticulous! Hair dryer blows only cold air. No slippers, no bathrobes. Windows dirty from inside... electronic keys had to be constantly recharged couple of times a day, sometimes we only got one towel insted of four, etc. Cleaning ladies are very noisy in the corridors and were smashing doors from their storage constantly, so one can hear it all the time while in the room. First day we were told that we have to pay for breakfast, although we have paid for B&B. When complained, it was fixed at the reception. And watch ou! There is no free wi-fi. Wi-fi is charged! And it does not work well either. Altogether, services are on the level of three if not two star hotel (and I apologise to all well managed three star hotels and those who are helpful in this hotel.)
Date: Date of stay: May 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Excellent Hotel
Review Content: The hotel is situated and a very convenient location, offers high standard rooms and good food. During my staying in March the internet was really bad, was very very slow to the point that I gave up trying to use it. Apart from that I had a nice staying there.
Date: Date of stay: March 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Review Content: Good hotel, well located very pleasant stay will recommend it for business and pleasure, room service was very good and the meals are excellent Roof top bar is very nice with a great view of Windhoek very nice staff and wonderful drinks and light meals

Not so keen on the theme nights in the restaurant as the a la carte service seems to suffer. Please don't freeze the burgers! Quality of fish is not very good.its time to replace carpets in the rooms! Please don't get me wrong this is a great hotel for a business visit. Oh and before I forget - the WIFI very slow. (download at 1mb/sec)

Name: Niente di che
Review Content: Ho alloggiato in questo hotel per una notte, √® stata la mia ultima notte in Namibia e sono rimasta un po' delusa. Struttura orribile con due ingressi uno dei quali √® situato alla fine di una sala giochi, personale poco disponibile, ascensori che non funzionavano emettendo un fischio fastidiosissimo. Camere ampie,colazione buonissima e piscina molto bella. La cosa pi√π grave di questo hotel √® il WI-FI A PAGAMENTO nelle stanze! Nel 2016 in un hotel Hilton devo pagare il Wi-Fi in stanza? Assurdo neanche negli ostelli a Barcellona.
Date: Date of stay: March 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Uncomfortable experience at an otherwise great hotel
Review Content: I booked well in advance for a twin bed room as I was sharing with another male colleague. When he arrived first, he was shown to the room and there was only one King bed. He enquired and was told a twin bed room was not available even though we had booked such and it was confirmed. He knew I was to arrive at midnight, so he want and found a hostel to stay. When I arrived I learned of this and was told a twin room as we booked was not available. You don't want to learn this at midnight. We stayed for two nights. The twin room was also not given to us for the second night. I am highly embarrassed that my work colleague had to go out and find and pay for a backpackers hostel for his two nights that we were there together for work. This was handled very poorly by the hotel staff there.  Otherwise - room was nice and hotel is great and staff are friendly. No other complaints.
Date: Date of stay: February 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Traumhafte Dachterasse mit Pool (auch f√ºr Externe offen)
Review Content: Die Dachterasse ist der Hit. Unbedingt zum Sundowner hingehen. Zivile Preise. Tiefgarage ist auch preiswert. Man ist ach als Externer willkommen, wird aber im Poolbereich (durch den man zur Dachterasse durch muss) recht schnell und unfreundlich durchgescheucht.
Date: Date of stay: December 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Looks good from the outside....but the staff ruins it.
Review Content: While the building itself is nice and the rooms are large with comfortable beds, the staff is not responsive in most cases and desperately needs training in how to properly run a hotel and restaurants.  I stayed for 12 nights on business and n 8 of those days when my room was serviced - the maid forgot towels and in some cases the toiletries. In each case when I called the front desk it took a very long time (up to an hour) to get towels.  Additionally after checking in I requested additional hangers for my work clothes - it took four calls and a trip to the front desk to get the hangers....and the look on the staffs face indicated that I had interrupted a very important chat with their mates at the front desk.  This was the theme of the hotel - they loved talking to each other but doing their jobs, not so much.  In the bar where I ate dinner on 6 nights - it was a major inconvenience to ask for a beer, a menu or to get the bill and it was not just me - every person that came in and sat at the bar had to ask for everything - the staff not once asked the patron if they needed anything.  Oh, and the bar staff definitely like to sample the drinks they make for the customers, especially the fruity blender drinks - there was always some left over for the staff to share.  I travel for a living and travel in Africa almost exclusively and while this is one of the nicest buildings I have seen, the staff ruins it.  In a country where the cost of waitstaff is affordable there is plenty of personnel - it is the apparent total lack of training and oversight that ruins it.  I also used the gym almost every day - if you can call it a gym.  Two treadmills, two ellipticals and a bike...a few dumbbells and some mats.  The equipment is in need of repair and there is no ventilation in the gym (it stinks like a locker room).  I would recommend staying at the Avani or another hotel in Windhoek where the staff are better trained, more responsive and actually care if you need something.  With considerable training and better management this could be a great hotel, they are just not there yet.
Date: Date of stay: August 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A great place to stay in Windhoek
Review Content: We stayed at this Hilton in April and May for a few days whilst visiting Windhoek. The service was excellent, the staff were all really helpful, the food was good, the rooms were spacious and comfortable and the public areas were very light airy and welcoming. We will definitely return to this hotel.
Date: Date of stay: April 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Over priced, under serviced.very poor customer relations
Review Content: Room price moved from NAM D 2300 pre-booked via Internet to 3300 over 4 days reduced to 2700 after much hassle. Really horrible experience. Plus room aircon did not work. Never again.Dinner food was good but breakfast in room cold. Awful
Date: Date of stay: January 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Very good indeed, thumbs up!
Review Content: I have read some mixed reviews on Tripadvisor so I was a bit curious what to expect. After two nights stay my verdict is clear: This is a gem and THE place to stay at when visiting Windhoek. This just three year old hotel is very very good.I had a "Executive room" which was very nice, clean and modern on the 8th floor. This room gives you access to a nice Executive lounge on the 9th floor with complimentary drinks and snacks. I did read about some complaints about the limited breakfast offering in the lounge. Why not have the full breakfast and pay for it if this isn't enough? I mean it's not very expensive and the lounge simply doesn't have the room nor the facilities for a full English breakfast.The outdoor Skybar at the 9th floor is excellent and with impressive views of the city. Here you also find a pool and lounge area. The Kalabar Bar at the Mezzanine level has an outdoor terrace and a simple but good food menu.God knows I have stayed at many hotels including Hiltons all over the World, this is in the top League. I find some reviews a bit disturbing, be nice to the staff and tip them and you will be treated well, I mean it's not difficult and the standard for any luxury hotel in the World.My only complaint is directed to the senior management staff. Where are you? You should be visible in the hotel supporting and helping your staff. Not hiding behind the door at the reception. The staff is very good and deserves a more proactive and supporting senior management.I will for sure be back at Hilton the next time I'm in Windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: December 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: –°—Ç–∞–Ω–¥–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω—ã–π —Ö–∏–ª—Ç–æ–Ω

Name: Good hotel but could do better.
Review Content: We stayed here for 4 nights at the start of our holiday and one night at the end. Our checkin experience after a long flight was not a good one. The reception staff asked me to sign for a much higher room rate than I had booked. They also said that breakfast was not included. It was only when I produced evidence from the Hilton website that they agreed to honour the booking terms. We were then given a room beside an elevator and facing noisy roadworks. It took 3 telephone calls to get a room change. A further point is that the charge for WiFi is the highest I have experienced at any hotel. On the positive side the restaurant and bars are well staffed and the food is good. The breakfast buffet is great and the cook who makes the eggs is an asset. The rooms are clean and well appointed.
Date: Date of stay: July 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Wonderful place to start or end your trip
Review Content: Very central hotel. Very clean. Great rooftop bar/restaurant. Good live music in the evening in the restaurant. The breakfast buffet was wonderful. The bathrooms are incredible.... Although not very private but I was alone so it was not an issue for me. The internet could have been better, but this is true in most of the country. It wad a little of a challenge as I was there for work. I tried to try the spa 3 times, but it was always fully booked... Book ahead.
Date: Date of stay: February 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Incompetent Staff and Terrible Business Facilities
Review Content: This is my second stay at the Hilton Windhoek and the experience just keeps getting worse and worse. The only reason I was booked there was because the Windhoek Country Club was fully booked. The Staff at the Hilton Windhoek are incompetent and very junior. My Check out of the hotel took nearly 30 minutes because the person conducting the check out did not know how to split invoices or how the credit card machine worked. I tried to get documents scanned and it took almost 2 hours because they did not know how to scan documents. Out of frustration, I went somewhere else where it only took me 5 minutes. You can also start seeing the neglect in maintenance in the rooms. The carpet was starting to look dirty. That doesn't bother me too much though. The mini-bar was never restocked after I had been there for 2 days. If I can recommend a hotel, rather go to the Windhoek Country Club, because their service and business facilities are excellent. They have competent and efficient Staff and their price is slightly cheaper than the Hilton Windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: April 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good
Review Content: Stayed for one night at the Hilton. It is right in the centre of town near to most business so it makes it quite easy for business meetings. It is really a good hotel with nothing notable. Service is good, the overall look is ok. The rooftop bar has sensational views.Had a good stay.
Date: Date of stay: February 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great New Luxury Downtown Location
Review Content: I stayed here for 6 nights on a business trip to Windhoek, Namibia. This is a brand-new modern hotel in a great central downtown location. I stayed up on the Club Floor, and had access to the typical Hilton Lounge for nightly snacks and drinks. Rooms were large, modern and spacious,and the food at breakfast was hearty with a large variety. There are several restaurants in the hotel, plus room services also offers a great variety, I used both options.The Hotel offers underground secure parking if you have a car rental. Its locations in downtown allows for easy access to all parts of the city, and is very well serviced by both taxis and buses. The Views of the entire city are amazing from the Club lounge as this is a tall Building on the side of a hill as compared to the rest of the downtown city center, and even better views of the entire region can be seen from the upper deck infinity Pool and sky-top Bar. The staff was very friendly and always willing and able to assist.
Date: Date of stay: August 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: First Time to Windhoek
Review Content: This is a modern hotel with well appointed rooms. The lap pool and the sky bar is a nice place to relax and has a good atmosphere and service. The bar on the Mezzanine level is also fun with music and again a good atmosphere. Close to the centre of town and probably the best place in the capital.Friendly service, breakfast was everything you could want. The restaurant though at Dinner was very slow service (from the kitchen) which let it down as the waiter service was all you could ask for. Over all it was a good place to stay.
Date: Date of stay: October 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

The rooftop bar has a good view over Windhoek and a nice pool area too.The service is slow. We had dinner and breakfast in the main restaurant and it was disappointing. They forgot our starters and where very slow.We lived in a clubroom and the room was good but the service in the clubroom was terrible, with almost nothing to eat or drink ‚Äì haven‚Äôt seen a cheaper club ever.Conclusion: Nice building, very good rooftop bar. Avoid the club and the restaurant.

Name: good stay
Review Content: when people are in windhoek they should have in mind that the options right now are zero,unless you wish to pay 500 usd...i know the city well and for this price you could not get better..there are bed and breakfast that call themselves a boutique hotel and are an absolute joke..not to mention price...overall...public spaces clean and well decorated...rooftop was an excellent idea...piano at night a bit loud but the sound did not go up to the rooms...room and bath cleaned and again well decorated..shower in closed glass .. turn down service...food in room service so so...fast pick and deliver lugage...wi fi was fast at the price of 7.5 eu/hour...reception was attentive ..i will be back

Name: Best hotel I have ever been in!
Review Content: I was only in Windhoek for one night on business.  I was suffering from flu, so was really hoping that the accomodation would be decent.  Much to my surprise, I was greeted by a Mercedes-Benz to drive me to the hotel.  There were other guests who had also arrived on my flight and were staying at the Hilton and they were also picked up....but in their own Mercedes.  I arrived and they quickly checked me in.  It was when I opened the door to my room......wow!  A good size, with an amazing bathtub (perfect for my achy flu) and all the amenities you would need.  The bed.....the most amazing comfortable bed ever.  The food was beyond what I normally expect in Southern African countries and the staff were so helpful.  This is a new hotel, and I have to say that I am normally cautious of new hotels because of all the kinks and new staff...but the staff at the Hilton in Windhoek are definitley top class.  For a weary business traveller....this Hilton nin Windhoek is a dream.

Name: Rettung in der Not
Review Content: Da ich ein schlechtes Backpackers gebucht hatte, kam ich mitten in der Nacht zum Hilton Hotel, in der Hoffnung dass sie noch ein Zimmer f√ºr mich hatten. Ich hatte wirklich einen chaotischen Tag und der sehr zuvorkommende und nette Switchboard Operator, Giovanni Narlenqe half mir sofort. Name: Just what I needed.

Name: Disappointing stay
Review Content: We decided to stay in the Hilton on our last night in Namibia after a long road trip. Room was decent and reception staff was friendly. Unfortunately, the spa was closed when we were there, the 'heated' outdoor pool was ice-cold. We decided to have cocktails on the rooftop which was a disappointment (though the view of the city is great). The three man staff were clowning around, it took them 45 mins to serve us a gin-tonic and martini. They did charge us only one drink, but their attitude was not really what you'd expect in this kind of a hotel.

Name: Lovely hotel in the center of Windhoek, close to the Arts Center, the Christukirche and other attractions.
Review Content: This is a nice way to get introduced to WDH - and to Namibia in general. We had a lovely room with a view of the surrounding mountains. The breakfast is sumptuous (don't miss the freshly-squeezed fruit juice) and the rooftop bar offers unparalleled views of the city, the hills. At sunset, the views are sublime and in darkness, the stars and several planets come to life (remember that this is a desert with clear skies, so the views are crisp). Also, remember that this is a desert, so it can get very cold at night, so take a good jacket when you're on the rooftop.My only gripe was that the Wi-Fi was dead due to some serious technical issues. Luckily we were able to get a Namibian SIM card, so we were able to have conference calls using that SIM. However, I will give credit to the manager Hilya who was very professional about the situation and gave us a small break on the room rates to make up for the inconvenience.

Name: Fine, but not usual Hilton standards
Review Content: The hotel is fine, and undoubtedly one of the best in Windhoek. But don't get your hopes us. Rooms have nicely renovated bathrooms but still have creepy, dirty carpets and furniture from the 80s. (You'll want onto use the slippers). Breakfast buffet is fine, but water for tea was lukewarm, flask for hot milk empty, boiled eggs not quite cooked. Hint: they tell you there is no cappuccino/latte but if you insist one appears. Sky bar has lively view, gym is small but good.

Name: Excellent hotel - clean and great food!
Review Content: I was in Namibia for a week, including 2 nights in Windhoek. I stayed at the Hilton both nights and it was great. The hotel is modern and clean with nice rooms and great showers. There are a few restaurants in the hotel - the buffet was great for breakfast! The rooftop patio is excellent - it gives you a great view of the city and serves lovely drinks. Make sure you try the burger - Namibia is known for its beef and I think the burger the Hilton serves is the best I've ever had. I would highly recommend the Hilton if you have to spend any time in Windhoek.

Nous y avons pass√©s deux fois une nuit.L'endroit est un peu glauque (mais bon Windhoek en g√©n√©ral n'est pas une ville flamboyante) Mais surtout, il y a une connivence malsaine de la conciergerie avec les taxis.J'ai pay√© mes deux nuits avec mes points Hilton. Name: Best Choice in Windhoek!
Review Content: The Hilton Windhoek delivers typical Hilton Service. The Reception Team was excellent, while the bar team was uninspired, rather slow. All in all a good choice when coming to Windhoek. ¬¥Breakfast was good and offered a nice variety.

Name: Lovely end to the trip around Namibia
Review Content: The room was spacious, with the expected amenities, such as:~fridge~hairdryer~safe~bath & showerThere was also aircon, however was quite intermittent. When working, it cooled the room, however it stayed on for a maximum of 1 hour. Once turned off, the room became stuffy and clammy, however upon departure, we became aware that the left hand window could be opened slightly. This is likely to relieve some of the issues, however I am not sure if you would want these open over night, as bugs could fly in.The staff in the lobby were faultless, upon arrival they were smiley, and loaded our bags onto the trolley to take the luggage to the room. Breakfast was stunning, with an incredible array of food. In fact, they were the only place that served English sausages, as well as another type of sausage. Pastries and cakes were freshly baked every morning, as well as smoothies mixed with fresh fruit before your very eyes. There is also a rooftop swimming pool, which is very nice, however not the best for wanting to do lengths, as it is so slim. Although, there is a well equipped gym, that has weights, cardio machines as well as space for personal floor workouts on fitness mats.All in all a lovely stay, rooms up-to-date.
Date: Date of stay: April 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice hotel, but poor wifi

Their system was totally down upon check-out and I'm still waiting on my receipt.  Otherwise, nice clean rooms, friendly staff, good quality & selection breakfast, and beautiful views from the rooftop pool/lounge.

Review Content: HILTON is well situated and if you arrive by car, you have also a parking. Name: A welcomed relaxing

There is a good small pool on the roof level and the water was a perfect temperature.   A lovely finish to our holiday.

Name: Birthday week
Review Content: Came to Hilton Windhoek to end my birthday week celebration. From the entrance it was all that i expected and more.The guestroom was big and comfortable. The Sky Bar was absolutely amazing and a nice chilling spot and it offers great views of the city. The restaurant dinner and breakfast  was worth it and had variety of food to choose from. Name: Central and modern
Review Content: A nice hotel in an interesting city.  Centrally located.  I was here on business and there were a few frustrations in this regard.  I can't believe a 5-star property charges for internet, especially not at the business end of the market!  Surely business travellers need reliable fast internet included in their room rate?  Secondly, breakfast on Saturdays start later... not great for those that need to be up early.  That said, rooms were spacious, well appointed and afforded nice views of downtown Windhoek.  The pool on the roof provides space to unwind.   I found it easy to walk to the central business district from the hotel - and even to some of the sights.  I would stay here again.
Date: Date of stay: November 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Really disappointed....
Review Content: The chain of Hilton hotels around the world are famous very popular. I booked a 3 night stay at Hilton Windhoek in Namibia and it was a big big  disappointment. I could call it a desastre if we take into account that we are talking about "the Hilton hotel".Let first give you the good side of it. The hotel is well located in the city center which is a positive aspect.Another positive thing is the hotel name which can make you feel posh when talking to your friend. Well that is all about positive aspectsNow the negative ones....First at the check in. I used 3 different credit cards that were declined. Had to take cash from an ATM machine and pay.The room were not bad but were small.There was something wrong with the bathtub. While using it, the water leaked out flooding the entire bathroom.The most ridiculous thing is the parking. Guests have to pay for parking. This is absurd and never seem happening before.The internet is charge. Please, at this point in time, internet is not luxury, it is a must. I don't recall the last time I paid for a internet in a hotel.The room service... well that was as well a big failure. It was clear that they never changed the bed sheet.I mean, that was a big disappointment from me.Last but not least, I booked the room through Booking.com and during the booking it was mentioned that the room includes breakfast but when I arrived, I was informed that I had to pay for the breakfast. Seriously?In conclusion, I do not recommend this hotel. You can get better services ( free internet, parking etc ) for the same price or lower. Do not let the name fool you. Unfortunately it did fool me but never again.
Date: Date of stay: November 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hilton is standard.

A bit disappointed with the lack of maintenance in the rooms. There was free wifi..The Hilton breakfasts are excellent and should not be missed. Ample parking for all. Staff at the Skybar were very helpful and the pool area well furnished and a good way to spend an hour or two.

Wifi is for extra fee, if you are not a member of Hilton Honours loyalty program. It worked in the room very bad, and I had troubles to connect in the lobby too. Nice, helpful staff. Comfortable stay.

Name: Faulty Towers without the charm, but there is hope
Review Content: The main and only five star business hotel in Windhoek - and it behaves marginally better than a government monopoly.  No attention to details, service slow, staff unable to make a difference even if they wanted.This time, my room was not ready until 7pm despite having tried to check in at 1pm. 2pm is what my reservation says. Then, room key did not work, the gym and spa were blocked because of some event, room service took forever, and no one offered anything material but excuses. Next morning, early, but of course the car booked the previous evening was not there. These are easy fixes, and the hotel is basically sound, were there interest. But there is hope. Another large luxury hotel is being built next door. So hold your trip for a year or two if these things above matter.Namibia and Windhoek are worth the trip though
Date: Date of stay: September 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Very Good Hotel for Business
Review Content: When I come for business to Windhoek The Hilton is the preferred Hotel. It is easy to find coming from the airport, not much GPS needed. It is still very central. If you need a break you can easily stroll down the road to get to the center for some shopping or you walk the other way to see some landmarks like the Fort for example. The staff is always super friendly. I also like the lounge area with the little coffee shop, which offers the opportunity to meet with business friends and discuss in a nice atmosphere with really good coffee. The rooms are very clean and well equipped just what I expect from Hilton Hotels. This time I attended the first conference held at the Hilton in Windhoek and it was a very good experience as well.

Name: Comfortable visit, some attention to detail missing
Review Content: This is my 3rd stay at this hotel.  It's in a central location to the main business areas in Windhoek and the rooms are comfortable.  Staff are friendly and assist where they can (great effort in getting me an additional night) but some things are starting to slip:- HHonnors membership.  I joined this programme during my first visit and on the second stay the team found my membership details without me having to supply any details.  This time around I was informed that they needed my membership details, which is a pity as Wi-Fi didn't connect and I couldn't find the details- Towels.  Attention to ensuring hand towels are provided in the rooms (was there on the first and third day but not on the second) will ensure less wastage as guests wouldn't need to use the bigger towels- Additional hairdryers.  I requested a hairdryer as the room didn't have one and after a wait of almost an hour gave up and checked out.  Different staff gave different reasons as to the delay.  It is highly recommended to ensure that there are additional hairdryers available as these things to break and, in this instance, wasn't in the roomA bit of a conflicting experience, which is a pity as the hotel has ongoing potential and the central location is a major plus
Date: Date of stay: June 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: My stay 2016...oh sorry, I didn't even get that far.
Review Content: I would love to report my experience regarding my stay at this supposedly high standard hotel but due to the extremely non-existent customer service I have not even been able to book...I am a UK resident and tried to book a reservation via the hotel website as per the process - filling in an inquiry form with a promise you will receive a response imminently with a quote and then you can proceed with your booking. However, despite sending two inquiry forms I have still yet to receive a response approximately 2 weeks later. For a popular chain of hotel this inadequate service is shocking. I can only surmise that the reservations team are on holiday or they are so popular with people wanting to stay there they simply do not care to respond to let me know they are full...Suffice it to say, I have moved on and booked elsewhere. The Olive Exclusive and other hotels I made inquiries with responded immediately and certainly within 12 hours never mind 24. Hilton Windhoek - you need to address your online reservation service because it is simply rubbish.

Review Content: Wir haben das 2te Mal im Hilton gewohnt (das erste Mal 2013), es ist am Ende einer Rundreise eine gute Wahl, da es in der N√§he aller Gesch√§fte und Souvenirl√§den liegt und man zu Fuss auch sehr schnell zu den wenigen Sehensw√ºrdigkeiten der Stadt gelangt (Christuskirche, Alte Feste, Tintenpalast, Meteoritenbrunnen usw.) Das Hotel hat einen guten Service, hilfsbereite Mitarbeiter und ein excellentes Fr√ºhst√ºck. Lediglich der Zugang zum kostenfreien W-lan ist ziemlich kompliziert und auf nur 8 Std. begrenzt. Danach muss man sich einen neuen Zugangscode besorgen und sich neu anmelden. Wenn man gar nicht klarkommt, helfen die Mitarbeiter aber gerne weiter. Sensationell ist der Ausblick auf die Stadt von der Dachterrasse mit Pool und Bar am Abend
Date: Date of stay: September 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hotel stay business
Review Content: Relaxing and quiet hotel, good facilities for staying for business. Accommodation clean and tidy. Staff polite and very helpful. Easy to get transport from and to. Only minor issue that one device only for the wifi connection.
Date: Date of stay: September 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Clean modern design with fantastic rooftop pool bar
Review Content: A good modern hotel at the start or finish of a trip in the bush, or for business. Ecxellent rooms and breakfast. The main draw is the fantastic rooftop pool bar with great views over Windhoek. Similar view from fitness center. Service varies, but good for African standards. Closest hotel to airport.
Date: Date of stay: August 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: No Honour at this Hilton
Review Content: Booked long in advance was excited about my stay. My requests for room preference were not met, some phoney excuse offered up. hilton honours member but no rewards. Told they would move me when room became available, that never came. Every day I asked just a different reason why not. Construction across street stated work at 6am, noisy beyond belief also traffic noise on lower floor starts at 5.30am. B&B package apparently does not include breakfast or parking or wifi. It seemed I had to try & negotiate everything again on a daily basis. Now don't let this take away from the room size or the unique walk in shower & bathroom. Staff in each of the 4 places to eat were mostly very good, sky bar was worst of 4 I tried. Even have a sushi bar, a little shocking but not bad. Turn down service at 8pm nice touch with chocolate. Security probably necessity but when trying to leave parking even with ticket thought the guy was just plain angry at me because gate didn't work with tickets, they had to override manually. The only reason to choose this hotel is if you need down town. I saw what colleagues gift for almost 1/2 my price paid and very even more upset. Watch your final bill, I was 3rd in line & each had charges we should not be paying. I give it 2 stars for fantastic food & some real nice staff in food service.
Date: Date of stay: August 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Excellent stay over
Review Content: Hilton Windhoek is an excellent hotel, very clean facilites and friendly staff. The rooms are comfortable with all your needs catered for. It is centrally located to the CBD which is ideal for business trips.
Date: Date of stay: July 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: The best option in downtown Windhoek
Review Content: Very nice hotel and perfect location. Was a bit disturbed by a construction next to the building, but other than that everything was excellent. The pool was very nice to relax after a hard working day. the staff is very friendly. For some reason, Hilton did not give me points for this stay.
Date: Date of stay: June 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice property, some minor issues
Review Content: We spent a night here with another couple while transiting from Swakopmund to Victoria Falls. This hotel does seem to be the one business hotel in Windhoek, capital of Namibia.The large bed was very comfortable. The room has a personal safe for valuables and it had the amenities you'd expect from a Hilton Hotel.We had two minor issues during our stay: 1) The security lock inside our room door had been broken which made us a little nervous, although we had no problems.2) When we checked-in the woman on reception didn't want to/wasn't able to find my wife's Hilton Honours number to link to our stay and was completely unhelpful in trying to do so. But shortly afterwards a different, trainee reception desk, staff member quickly found the required number and linked it to our booking. There are choices for in-house dining; we ate bar food at the casual deck area, and later had dinner in the main restaurant. Both meals were fine but nothing special.It's disappointing when major hotel chains charge for wifi access in the room as internet access is a traveller's requirement these days, and Hilton Windhoek does charge for in-room access. You can access wifi for free in the public areas if the access code works - we went through several trips to reception until we finally got one that worked.If you are travelling via Windhoek's international airport allow sufficient time to get there from the Hilton - it's a 40 km long taxi or shuttle drive.
Date: Date of stay: April 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Like the Curate's egg
Review Content: The Hilton in Windhoek is line the Curate's egg - good in parts. The rooms are very good being spacious, clean, well equipped and with really wonderfully comfortable beds and good showers. It is however a shame that no beer, wine or spirits are available from the mini bar - this the Hilton is behaving like a third rate B&B, not trusting either the guest, it staff or systems to manage alcohol beverages. The breakfast is good, the service less so. Dinner is again a mixed affair. My Pan died Line fish was bizarrely served on what looked and tasted lime rice pudding. The staff are pleasant and helpful, though service delivery is very hit and miss. Breakfast room service ordered for 7am failed to arrive by 7:30 despite a call to remind them at 7:10. Nuts ordered at the stunning sky bar took 45 minutes to materialise and then turned out to be popcorn. Getting tea or coffee served at breakfast was a challenge, the hotel ran out of still water in rooms, restaurants and bars as it did for 2/3rds of the red wines on the wine list. The barman at the 1st floor bar kept wandering off for 10 minutes at a time and the lifts were somewhat erratic - then again TIA as those who know Africa well say. What was really unacceptable was the state of the Sky Bar area around the pool and the gym in the early morning. Dirty plates, broken glass, overturned furniture etc. a disgrace at at hotel. T
Date: Date of stay: May 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Windhoek
Review Content: Stayed overnight en route to soussusvlei and a night on our return. Hotel more than average, quite dated in appearance but service overall good. A lot of building going on next door so room really noisy. Generally staff helpful. Really irritating when you have to pay for wifi in your room but free in public areas within the hotel.
Date: Date of stay: April 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Cama super gostosa com roupa de cama top. Na cobertura, onde se descortina uma das melhores vistas da cidade, encontra-se uma piscina lind√≠ssima e uma academia bem moderna. Todos os empregados s√£o bastante simp√°ticos e realmente se esfor√ßam para lhe proporcionar o m√°ximo surante sua estadia. Atendimento acima da m√©dia. Custo-benef√≠cio espetacular! Recomendo.

Name: Hilton Windhoek / Good business hotel
Review Content: Did not have a chance to spend much time there, but would recommend this hotel - very comfortable and modern bedrooms. Unfortunately, I did not have the opportunity to try out the restaurant on this trip but hope to do so in the future. I will definitely return to this hotel!
