Name: Great hotel, excellent breakfast & very good staff.
Review Content: We stayed for four nights. This Hilton is very well run & the staff are on the whole excellent.The breakfast is outstanding & room service is good. The pizzas were much better than expected.The pool bar has quite slow service and had run out of white wine when we visited on a Saturday afternoon. Our baby was sick & the reception & restaurant team could not have been more helpful.
Date: Date of stay: February 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice hotel, perfect location
Review Content: Excellent location, easy to get from the airport , easy walk to the city centre. There is a parking where you can let your car. Large and clean and comfortable rooms. Nice food (not expensive and high quality) and attentious staff.
Date: Date of stay: January 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: An oasis when visiting over December
Review Content: The staff was very friendly, the hotel really beautiful and neat. Rooms are spacious and luxurious. The sky bar and swimming pool has an extraordinary view, cold beer and really an oasis when you arrive at noon in summer. Only problem was that a roller bed was not provided and the kids did not sleep well. We took it up with management the next day and the only explanation could be that one staff member slipped up. Apology excepted. The breakfast buffet is world class. Would highly recommend. It was a wonderful stay.
Date: Date of stay: December 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Five Star Service and very Friendly Staff
Review Content: Centrally located in downtown Windhoek. In walking distance to some very nice restaurants. The executive rooms are stylish and spacious and the beds are very comfortable. Very attentive and friendly staff. The pool bar is a phantastic hang out for a sundowner.Just one thing on the lows: the executive lounge is tiny and the breakfast there is very poor.Otherwise, the hotel is highly recommended!!
Date: Date of stay: December 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A TRUE FIND IN AFRICA
Review Content: My time in Windhoek was really made easier and more pleasurable having found and stayed here during my time in Namibia.  The food was wonderful and the staff was extremely helpful.  The people in Namibia were also friendly and very kind.  The management staff always handled situations promptly and very professionally.  I stayed there for three months and had a wonderful time.  Thanks to all the hard working staff. The sky bar had a beautiful view.
Date: Date of stay: May 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: End in luxury
Review Content: Our last night in Namibia was great! We arrived here at 15h and enjoyed the roof swimmingpool & bar with drinks and bites.At night we ate great sushi at the D'vine bar, the staff is very friendly and they have a high service level. Because this hotel is in the city center it is easy to go shopping.We checked out late and went to the airport very relaxed.There is some construction across the hotel but we didn't hear any noise from that.The whole city is very quiet at night.

Name: Hilton Windhoek
Review Content: I had a superb stay at this hotel. The rooms are clean and spacious. The restaurants and the food is excellent. It was indeed a home away from home experience.....  I had a superb stay at this hotel. The rooms are clean and spacious. The restaurants and the food is excellent. It was indeed a home away from home experience.....

Name: Great food but some kinks to be ironed out
Review Content: I stayed here in April 2014 on a   business trip. The hotel is new and thus lots of kinks still needed to be ironed out. My shower cubicle flooded, one glass wall on the side of the atrium came shattering down one evening and it was just the grace of God that there was no one standing nearby as they would've been seriously injured. The food was pretty good, however the service in the main restaurant would vary from very good to downright odd. The rooms are spacious with lovely views of the CBD and the wifi was decent. I'd go back again.
Date: Date of stay: April 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hilton Windhoek.
Review Content: Hi all, Probably the best place to stay in Windhoek, its centrally located, staff are really friendly and helpful.HighlightsManagement are involved and always visible.Rooms are spacious.Showers are awesome. Modern look and feel leaves you energetic. Friendly waiter in the ekipa resturantThursday buffet (Indian night) is the best. Lo-lightsThe room service menu need improvement, the portions are small. A colleague had a room that was a bit musty. (Mine was perfect)The cost of staying here is becoming increasingly high. With the current economic pressures businesses are reducing travel allowances making eating and drinking at the Hilton difficult. Staff need to be trained on the Hilton honours program. (I enquired about benefits and the front desk were unclear).
Date: Date of stay: August 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: No complaints
Review Content: Lovely and relaxing place to end long trip around Namibia.  Great views of sunset from Sky Bar.  Loved the modern bathrooms.  Breakfast had huge choice and was excellent value for money.  Would recommend this hotel.
Date: Date of stay: August 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Not living up to International standards
Review Content: Comparing the pricing of a garden suite to other local accommodation within the same price range has one wondering what the fuss is all about. Maintenance is not done to the exacting standard one came to expect from this group. Outside parking is a nightmare and not only due to the ongoing construction activities in the area. The ablution facilities at reception had neither hand towels nor toiletpaper. One of the lifts was out of order, the aerial photographs mounted against the walls damaged and clearly in need of replacement. The coffee is tired and the breakfast much ado about nothing. The ground personnel were friendly but seem to lack experience. It took a considerable time to trace our pre-paid booking and proof of payment had to be presented before the actual booking could be traced.As a parting note I find it a bit needy that the Hilton could not provide free Wifi access for its clientele... A bit of a let down for Namibia and a clear indication that a name is just that - a name and not necessarily indicative of the elegance and sophistication associated with the marketing hype...
Date: Date of stay: June 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: The only 5 star in Namibia
Review Content: Very good hotel with nice view of the city . the sky bar is divine  . Make sure u have jersey or jumper on standby it can get chilly after 5 pm  .  Hotel duty manager named Imogen is very good and solves all problems promptly and efficiently . Value for money if you book ahead of time and close to highway to airport .
Date: Date of stay: May 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Relaxing

Name: Vista stupenda
Review Content: Siamo una coppia e abbiamo fatto l aperitivo sulla terrazza: direi veramente stupendo!! Vista mozzafiato su tutta la citt√†. Tipico stile hotel di lusso, piscina al 9* piano con sdraio e sky bar. Da provare se sostate in capitale almeno due giorni.

Name: Unplanned stay at the Hilton Windhoek
Review Content: We were had an unplanned stay in the Hilton, Windhoek, this due to missing our flights back to SA. After an 11 hour driving ordeal in getting from Soosusvlei to Windhoek due to flooding, we missed our flights back to SA. We arrived at the Hilton just before 10pm. We were assisted by staff, and special arrangements were made to accommodate us and offer us a meal in the executive lounge, even after closing time. Staff stayed on to ensure that we were accommodated and comfortable after our ordeal. This hotel is of a very high standard, and rooms are superb. This would definitely be our hotel of choice in Windoek.
Date: Date of stay: March 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Overall good experience, but....
Review Content: The Hilton is very conveniently located in that it is close to restaurants and shopping, and has beautiful views.  It also has an excellent breakfast, with mostly accomodating staff (Peter is a gem).    I did have issues resolving the internet problems and charges (was supposed to be part of my package), and my first room hadn't been prepared for the next guest (though this was quickly resolved).    The rooms were clean, secure, and mostly with the amenities one would expect on a business stay.  I will definitely stay here again, and tell others about it.
Date: Date of stay: February 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Excellent stay at Windhoek Hilton
Review Content: Everything about the hotel was very good. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very comfortable and well kept. Lastly the food was excellent. A lot better than any Hilton I have stayed at in North America.
Date: Date of stay: January 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Ausgezeichnet f√ºr einen Zwischenstop in Windhoek
Review Content: Die komfortablen Zimmer mit hervorragenden Betten, der tolle Swimmingpool auf dem Dach mit sch√∂nem Blick √ºber der Stadt und der angrenzenden Skybar sowie die Lage direkt im Zentrum machen das Hotel zur 1. Wahl f√ºr uns in Windhoek. Wir waren auch schon 2 x dort. Jederzeit wieder.

Name: Zentral und komfortabel
Review Content: Eine Nacht im komfortablen Hilton nach einer Safari-Tour tut gut. Sehr nettes, hilfsbereites Personal, toller Blick von der Dachterrasse inklusive Pool und Bar. Das Hotel liegt im Zentrum, Gesch√§fte und Restaurants k√∂nnen zu Fu√ü erreicht werden. Die Gegend wirkte auf mich sicher. Besonders gut zum Fr√ºhst√ºck: frisch gepresste Obst- und Gem√ºses√§fte, die man selbst zusammenstellen kann und im Entsafter zubereitet werden. Unbedingt auf besondere Angebote der einschl√§gigen Online-Hotel-Buchungsportale achten. Kann sich lohnen.
Date: Date of stay: December 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: They much try much harder to reach 5 star level!
Review Content: We stayed last week 3 nights in Hilton Windhoek. It felt like all the time this hotel was teasing us in a negative way not to enjoy our stay here. Many things are not working here, communication between staff and operational director Teun Engbers, is not working well. Also Teun gives the impression he will help you, but finally he is doing nothing.Ok there was a strike of staff, but some things had nothing to do with that strike. Why is still on your website Mr Teun that you have complimentary wifi which you do not have?Why guests are just sending out of the pool because they was a private party, it was really rude. Breakfast was different every day, the nice bread of one day just was not there the next day, pancakes finished and so on. On day of departure  late check out was first free of charge, later 50 % of our room rate on which we agreed, but when we were at the pool on our last day staff came up to inform us that is was much higher because it was 50 % of the rate of that day which was much higher. We saw people complaining at reception about many things. I would not stay here again because you can not rely on their quality, you can not rely on their promise that the pool is open and so on.
Date: Date of stay: December 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Extremely comfy, but service varies...
Review Content: I recently spent a week at the Hilton in Windhoek for business.  The hotel was incredibly comfortable for the business traveler:  amazing bed with sleek sheets and quality bedding, great blackout curtains, strong air conditioning that never faltered (amazing for such a hot place!), reliable wifi, and a gorgeous bathroom.  The bathtub was perfectly sized for soaking and the shower was powerful.  Even the hair dryer in the room blew me away - the mamba has to be the best in-room hair dryer EVER.Praise should also be heaped upon the dining options in the hotel.  The breakfast buffet was incredibly delicious.  I loved the variety of foods, especially the fresh smoothies and juices (omg, orange and pineapple!).  Specialty coffees can be ordered (cappuccinos, lattes, etc). and there is a variety of tea available, although I must say that the filter coffee was delish. The yogurt and fruits (both fresh and dry) rounded out a delightful breakfast each morning.  My colleague and I decided to dine in one night (we walked to Sardinia around the corner every other night, but it is closed on Tuesdays) and were delightfully surprised at the healthy menu offerings in the main restaurant.  I enjoyed a grilled chicken breast (on the bone!) with fresh grilled veggies and peri-peri sauce.  Also of note was the amazing wine list, which featured several South African winners.  I adore SA wine so was pleased that we had so many great options to choose from (yay, Kleine Zalze!).  Service was an absolute delight that night and we truly enjoyed our dining experience there, which is saying a lot for a hotel!I also took advantage of the spa on my first night there, having critically injured my pedicure by having a bag dropped on my feet at the Namibian airport.  I scored an appointment in the spa for that same day; the mani/pedi I ordered took 2 delicious hours of relaxing time.  And the mani/pedi looked fab!  Prices were definitely ex pat prices, but the convenience made it worth it - plus I was so relaxed, I actually fell asleep during the service!Speaking of the spa, the rooftop bar is quite lovely and a relaxing spot.  I must note that the lap pool is a lot smaller than I expected and is right in the middle of the roof, so be aware that if you want to swim to work out, anyone in the bar area will be watching you.  Checkout was a BREEZE!  My bill was 100% correct and it was no problem at all to divide out lodging costs from personal costs.  Great job Hilton!So, what could possibly have caused a variable service comment?  Here we go.... On our very first night, the power in my colleague's room went out around 9:00pm, just as she was heading to bed.  She called and found out it was only out in her room and that someone would take care of it.  2 hours later - sitting in the dark in her room - she essentially had to wrangle someone to get them to come up and resolve the power issue.  Note - she hadn't plugged anything so she hadn't tripped a breaker, yet the folks she spoke to made her feel at fault and that they shouldn't help her.  Super duper weird and made for a rough start to her week.I needed to exchange money one day so went to the front desk to change it out.  I was told no money had arrived; come back at 7:00.  I came back at 7:00 and was told no, the money hadn't arrived, check back.  I called down at 8:00 and got a curt reply that no money had come yet.  I called back at 9:00 and was firmly told that no, no money was coming, they only accepted credit cards and didn't keep cash on hand, and no, they couldn't even change $20 (that's all I wanted to change out), all while being very huffy on the line.  Just very rude, and not the customer service I expect from a HIlton.We also had a surly waitress every morning at breakfast.  We'd see her smile at other patrons, but to us, we got snarls.  It actually got comical to see her face change when she would happily look at someone else, and then look at us and frown.  I never quite understood why she was so rude to us, but she definitely was.  Boohoo.Making a spa appointment was confusing - I got told the line was busy and that someone would call me... but after an hour, nothing.  So I called directly and got a booking.  Just no follow-up one would expect from a hotel of this caliber.Other small things:  water bottles were in the room on day 1, but never replaced.  I got stuck on the elevator one morning and rode all the way up when I needed to go down, and then stopped at several floors on the way.  The shape of the sink makes water splash out everywhere, so although the look is aesthetically pleasing, it isn't very functional.All in all, I would recommend staying here for the central location, comfortable rooms, and delicious healthy food.  Just be aware that you won't always get service with a smile....
Date: Date of stay: November 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great Staff
Review Content: When traveling around Africa, it was nice to find a familiar hotel chain to stay at.  We knew the hilton would have the amenities we desired and the staff went out of their way to assure that we enjoyed our stay.
Date: Date of stay: October 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Excellence
Review Content: Overall experience and stay was excellent. Would recommend it to anyone visiting Namibia The staff is very help-full and friendly. They strive to make your stay enjoyable. Activities within the hotel are also well planned to meet the needs of any visiting business-person.
Date: Date of stay: September 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Muito bom
Review Content: O atendimento foi fraco, funcion√°rios muito enrolados, por√©m o resto foi considerado bom.Os quartos sao espa√ßosos e muito confort√°veis.O cafe da manha foi excelente.Outra v√™s o acesso a internet foi um ponto fraco, primeiro pelo preco e depois pela velocidade, muito lente.

Name: Prima Aufenthalt
Review Content: Sehr sch√∂nes Hotel mit freundlichen Angestellten und tollem Fr√ºhst√ºcksbuffet. Zentral gelegen mit sch√∂nen Bars. Zu den wichtigsten Anlaufstellen in Windhoek ist es nur ein Katzensprung. Absolut empfehlenswert.

Name: Modern and clean but....
Review Content: I've stayed here 3 or 4 times: The rooms are modern, clean and well laid out. The beds are perfect and make for a good nights sleep. The Skytop bar is great with wonderful views over the city. It's centrally located and pleasant. However, they need to be aware that standards need to be maintained in the competitive business travel market as I've noticed slippage since I've been staying here.
Date: Date of stay: June 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Comfortable stay
Review Content: The Hilton hotel is within walking distance of Windhoek CBD, which makes it convenient for business travellers.  The hotel is comfortable and the stay was enjoyable while being away from home on business.  Good service was received in every area of the hotel.  Good value for money.
Date: Date of stay: June 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Business as usual
Review Content: The Hilton Hotel is conveniently located on the fringes of Windhoek CBD. A full range of facilities, although I did not get an opportunity to enjoy any of them.I enjoyed the piano man that entertains the guests during dinner. Breakfast was decent as can be expected and the rooms are high quality and equipped with all the necessaries. I was a bit annoyed that hand towels were not available in the rooms (and not quite sure if this was an oversight).Wifi is also not included in the rate and you pay for it separately. I would expect more from a 5 star hotel. And I did not see any bell boys to assist with luggage. This didn't bother me because I was traveling light bit if I did have luggage I would be annoyed.But all in all a good experience.
Date: Date of stay: June 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Perfect
Review Content: Best Hilton I have stayed in, great value for the quality of the hotel. Staff very friendly and helpful, food was very good, excellent breakfast choice, the  view from roof stunning particularly at sunset and great central location cant wait to return.
Date: Date of stay: May 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Decent business hotel in Windhoek
Review Content: The Hilton Windhoek is a reasonably comfortable business hotel. I had a few issues connecting up to the (paid for) wifi, but the staff helped me out. The staff were pleasant, ready to help and polite. The rooms were very clean and spacious and the conference facilities more than adequate. A limited choice in the restaurant, but in the grand scheme of things its a small hotel in a small town and well placed in terms of access to the business community of Windhoek. If I returned to the city, I would stay again.
Date: Date of stay: April 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: LOVED IT!
Review Content: I loved this hotel in many ways! I love the ambiance, the decor, the stylish nature of the hotel. The colors are serene and blend together quite nicely. I loved the hotel staff who are friendly, and helpful, although they don't always get things right. I LOVED the food, so good. Most importantly, I loved sun-downers by the pool on the 9th floor, with the best views of the city. Lastly, the price is quite reasonable. From the hotel is was convenient to walk to cafes, restaurants and craft markets around. I'll be back!
Date: Date of stay: May 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Excellent comfort in the heart of Windhoek
Review Content: Rooms (and beds) are very comfortable.  This new hotel makes business travel in Namibia very enjoyable.  The staff were very courteous and knowledgeable about the area.  The rooftop bar and pool are not to be missed - great views of the city.
Date: Date of stay: February 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: ON TOP OF THE WORLD
Review Content: A fabulous modern hotel near to all the amenities of the City Centre. Welcome was courteous by all the staff making us feel like valued customers of the Hilton group. The room was one of the best we have stayed in - large, airy, clean, comfortable bed and chairs, the shower and the bath are to die for plus the cosmetics are what the label says. High speed Wi-Fi connected seamlessly as did the computers in the Busiess Centre. All requests were responded to in doube quicktime but as is allways the ase in Southern Africa the programs are rubbish. However if you are going to watch TV you will miss the fabulous view and facilities on the roof. This is the place if your budget is 5 star dont look any further.
Date: Date of stay: March 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Best hotel in town
Review Content: To summarize, this is an excellent hotel with spacy, clean and well-designed rooms. The hotel staff is very friendly and service-oriented. On the 9th floor (roof-top) there is an outdoor swimmig pool (very long one) with a nice view over the city. Breakfast was delicious with fresh fruit juices and plenty of choice.
Date: Date of stay: November 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Pool
Review Content: Der Pool war tagelang ohne Wasser ! Ok ! Das muss man akzeptieren . Aber heute wurde der gesamte Pool Bereich ge√∂lt , sodass es lebensgef√§hrlich war dort langzugehen , vom Geruch ( Formaldehyd?) ganz abgesehen . Niemand interessierte es wirklich , man hatte b√∂se ausrutschen k√∂nnen . Unter den Schuhen ist es voller √ñl , welches nun flei√üig durchs Hotel getragen wird !  Das Personal ist aber durchgehend freundlich und sehr sehr hilfsbereit . Hier ist eher ein Entscheidungstr√§ger  gefragt !
Date: Date of stay: September 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: nella media ma non da 5 stelle
Review Content: il migliore hotel di windhoek, bello dentro camere spaziose, eleganti ma non perfette. persdonale che si sforza di fare di tutto ma con molti limiti, non si poteva fare il cambio dei soldi, mancava ils ervizio rent a car, il ristorante √® sotto il livello medio, anchela colazione non troppo ben fatta. il prezzo non troppo alto per un 5 stelle , ma si capiscono i limiti del servizio.

Name: Fantastic service & views
Review Content: Staff was very nice.  The views are lovely.  As an international Hilton, it does not disappoint.  I would definitely stay here again if returning to Windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: June 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Really enjoyed our stay here
Review Content: Great attentive friendly staff, ever helpful.Beautiful new hotel and a fun layout of the bathroom.Comfy beds and yummy breakfast.We really enjoyed our night there.
Date: Date of stay: January 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Smart and comfortable ‚Äì another great stay at the Hilton.
Review Content: Staying in the Hilton was one of the highlights of my business trip to Windhoek. It is a smart and modern building and top-notch in all aspects. The location couldn‚Äôt be any better, right in the heart of the central city, but not hemmed in by other urban buildings, providing the sense of openness. The views over Windhoek from the very attractive rooftop bar and pool are among the best in the city.My room was outstanding and I can‚Äôt really find anything to be critical of ‚Äì high quality furnishings, great views, effective climate control, spotlessly clean, well-maintained, etc. The open flow between bathroom and bedroom is a nice touch and the shower, with a choice of 2 showerheads, was excellent. The huge flat screen TV had a great range of channels and the room had cable internet (which you have to pay extra for). Wifi is available in all the public areas of the hotel.The rooftop gym was so-so. It has a good range of new high quality cardio machines, however the weights selection is fairly poor ‚Äì essentially a multigym and a light set of dumbbells. It is hoped that they will improve on this facility in the near future. Can‚Äôt complain about the views though! The wood-decked outdoor rooftop pool area is quite attractive but the pool is only about 2m wide ‚Äì good for swimming laps or the quick cool-off plunge. The buffet breakfast was awesome, a great selection of fruit, juices, cold and hot foods - a great way to start the day. I found the service at the hotel to be very good, from reception to the doormen to the cleaners, all very friendly and helpful. The lobby and public areas are all very attractive, comfortable and smartly decorated. The frosted glass elevators were neat.Overall I had a great stay and rate this hotel very highly. I will definitely stay here again on future trips to Windhoek and I recommend it to all other travelers. You can get decent rates on the internet, around $150/night ‚Äì good value.
Date: Date of stay: September 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Outstanding
Review Content: We stayed at the Hilton Windhoek for 1 night. It was great. Only been open for 3 weeks. Very welcome amenities after being on a safari for a week.  Very modern. Great open roof-top bar. Everything was very nice.
Date: Date of stay: June 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hotel not up to the mark
Review Content: Stayed twice in the last 3 weeks in the Hilton. The hotel suppose to be one of the best in town but unfortunately it is not anymore. The best experience we had we with the reception. They are friendly, supportive and try to really help with all kind of topics. The restaurant is the opposite. Breakfast had cold scrambled eggs, black (water) coffee - for the cappuccino you had to pay extra. The only highlight was the fresh juice counter. The gym exists but is not well maintained. Pool was closed for maintenance. While the rooms were clean, they are dated. Overall I will try the Avani Hotel on the other side of the street next time.
Date: Date of stay: August 2022This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Fabulous staff make this hotel really special
Review Content: The reception area is clean, welcoming and the check in was friendly and efficient. A great start!  My room was a great size; the bed, the space, the bathroom was all great.  It was clean and had good provisions - fridge and good toiletries with bottled water.All the staff from the door staff, to housekeeping, to reception are all friendly and manage that balance of being interested but not in your face.  They are warm and happy to chat but quick to get the message if you don't want a long conversation.The hotel was near shops and some museums so a good location.  Although I was there for work so didn't really go anywhere to be able to comment about how far it was to walk to the museum.
Date: Date of stay: March 2020This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Modern and stylish
Review Content: Stayed twice on business on two different floors. Check in easy with no issues. Lift and card access need for security to use lifts. Rooms modern and stylish with fresh water provided, quiet AC.  No hotel market but there is a Checkers food store in the Mall 5mins stroll down the road. Breakfast had plenty of options so no issues, Evening meals tended to have out or at the Skybar for a quick meal, the service is a little slow between ordering and receiving however. For business its a good hotel with good services and internet speed.
Date: Date of stay: August 2023This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great location
Review Content: Clean hotel and attentive staff who really cares for their guests. I was pleasantly surprised at the level of service provided with a minimal staff contingent. Rooms are very well kept and serviced including sanitation
Date: Date of stay: October 2021This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Disappointing for a Hilton Hotel
Review Content: Central location .  Stayed for two nights before starting our tour.  Our room was lovely.Main problem was that when eating at the restaurant, the food took a very long time and no explanation given.  Staff not engaged.  No gluten free food items.  This was disappointing since I had made the request when booked in May. The pool and the sky bar were really good.
Date: Date of stay: December 2022This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Modern, comfortable and efficient
Review Content: Hilton Windhoek is situated in the center of Windhoek. The hotel is modern architecture, and room is spacious and comfortable. Service is efficient and food is generally very good.  It is highly recommended for business and leisure alike.
Date: Date of stay: November 2023This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A good launch pad
Review Content: We stayed for 1 night at the start of our Namibia adventure - 2 rooms, 2 couples. The hotel was chosen based on our friends having HH points and my husband & I having used Hilton for business many times.Our expectation was good quality, functional, not 5 star at a fair price. The hotel achieved that. The room was huge, clean and more than we required. Roof top pool, not used, but looked nice. Roof top bar fine & not priced at a premium. We ate out but breakfast was good. No additional charge for drinks?Useful also to be able to park our hire car here.All i would say is that I preferred previously staying in a couple of B&B‚Äôs at the start / end of a holiday, as the corporate nature of a Hilton loses some charm when on holiday. However, absolutely no complaints, clean, safe, friendly & central.
Date: Date of stay: March 2023This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Best Choice in Windhoek
Review Content: Excellent location, great staff - knowledgeable, smiling, helpful and efficient! Impeccable room of outstanding interior. Toproof swimming pool and bar with magnificent view over the capital of Namibia. Exceptionally clean. Breakfast and restaurant options - flawless! No need to look for anything else in Windhoek!
Date: Date of stay: May 2024This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Rooftop bar dissapointing
Review Content: Visited the Hilton hotel rooftop bar. Place was pretty full in the late afternoon. One barman and an assistant on duty. Waited about 10 minutes for him to take our order at the bar. Two cocktail s and two G & T's. Said he would bring the drinks to the table. After a 20 minute wait I went to remind him. After another 20 minutes we got up and left. Pathetic.
Date: Date of stay: April 2024This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Seltsam
Review Content: Das Hilton ist das einzige f√ºnf Sterne Hotel in Namibia. Da stellt sich die Frage, ob man es nach namibianischen oder internationalen Ma√üst√§ben bewerten sollte.Um es kurz zu machen: f√ºr Namibia ist es ein hervorragendes Hotel mit sehr guter Ausstattung. Nach internationalen Ma√üst√§ben ist es nicht wirklich ein F√ºnf Sterne Hotel, daf√ºr ist der Service insgesamt viel zu schlafm√ºtzig. Aktive Ansprache oder unaufgeregte Zuvorkommenheit findet man hier nicht. Wenn man etwas bestellt, zum Beispiel in der Bar, dann kommt es oder nicht, vollst√§ndig oder nicht, irgendwann halt. Wir waren um 11:00 Uhr bereits im Hotel, Das zu diesem Zeitpunkt unsere Suite noch nicht zur Verf√ºgung stand, ist nachvollziehbar. Aber trotz 4 Stunden Vorlauf war sie das auch um 15:00 Uhr nicht. So etwas darf nicht passieren, schon gar nicht, wenn das Hotel nicht ausgebucht ist.Highlight ist aber die Rooftop-Bar, hervorragend geeignet f√ºr den sundowner.
Date: Date of stay: September 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Very nice property and kind management
Review Content: I stayed here one night following an intensive photo tour in Namibia and we arrived much later than expected (about 4 a.m.). The manager was so kind and efficient in re-instating our rooms and providing a rate that reflected the fact we would only be sleeping a few hours before we needed to leave for the airport. The rooms were comfortable and clean and I al the facilities very nice. I was sorry there was no time to use the pool or executive lounge as the they appeared to be well above your average Hilton (I am Diamond with Hilton so stay with them frequently). All around I would highly recommend this Hilton.
Date: Date of stay: June 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Distinctly average with terrible wifi
Review Content: A hotel that offers so much promise but that fails to deliver on expectation. My stay started badly - I arrived at 16:30 and my room was not even ready for me. I was offered not offered anything other than a seat on which to wait. The rooms are a good standard (when you eventually get in one), but the service is very average - not in the least attentive. If you need to use wifi, do not get your hopes up - the worst I have experienced on my travels around many hotels this year. Checking in and out takes an age as well - I feel for you if you are in a rush. In summary, this is not a hotel I will remember with any fondness.
Date: Date of stay: October 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Slipping into Africa
Review Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice since my initial review but the time interval was too short to review the second visit seperately. On the second visit the accommodations were ok but there were decidedly dodgy looking folk hanging about in the lobby and on the mezzanine floor near the bar plus we were bothered by a rather persistant 'lady of the evening' who was not ejected by the staff till we complained most strongly. On this visit there was evidence of further slippage. Internet access did not work when we spent our forst night and still did nto work when we returend after an absence of 2 nights. The service in the mezzanine level bar was very poor. We enetered, were ignored for a while by the staff who were gathered round the end of the bar gossiping. I went up and asked if we could get some drinks and they said yes. Sat down to watch a argumeht betweem them as to who was going to actually work....after that service was good till we moved inside as it was cold, ordered a last round of drinks and waited 20 mins for it not to arrive....The room one of my party was given was a smoking room though my HH Honors says non-smoking and I am not sure what was being smoked in there but the air was unbreathable! When the guest asked for another room she was initially told this was impossible but then another desk staff approached and made the change. The Desk staff seem to face a smile range. As you approach they regard you with sort of disdain till you are a few feet away and then break into a smile - sorry but the damage was done on the approach! The service in the restaurant is great however - very freindly folk and the food is good! But dont ask for a paoched egg for breakfast - cant do it! I think we will try the Kalahari for a while or a Luxury Room at Roof of Africa....Lastly the cleanliness of the room was very poor in the toilet - we arrived quite late at night and did not notice what was on the glass wall till we got up the next morning!
Date: Date of stay: November 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Zentrale Lage, sehr gutes Hotel
Review Content: Sch√∂nes Hotel in zentraler Lage, sehr freundliches Personal, moderne und saubere Zimmer. Sehr sch√∂ne Executive Lounge mit guter Auswahl. Wunderbarer Pool auf dem Dach und eine tolle Bar zum Betrachten des Sonnenuntergangs.
Date: Date of stay: November 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Stayed three times in last 8 days
Review Content: We stayed here at the Hilton cause it‚Äôs central in the city and you can walk around rather than taking taxis.  The concierge welcome you warmly and took our bags to reception. Check in each time was done quickly.  Staff are friendly and seem to like there job.  We had executive rooms each time but things varied a bit. In the first room there was no room service where there was in the second and third stay.  There was a spa menu in the room however one time they said they were not taking bookings and two times it was kept closed.   The executive lounge is smaller than usual however you are greeted warmly. The meals here we have found the buffet breakfast good. In the evening you can have buffet or a la carte and they have pizza on the menu However every time we were told no they didn‚Äôt light the oven. That‚Äôs fine just don‚Äôt have it on the menu then and you need a few more choices on the a la carte menu in that case. Something upset me the first stay in the meal area so have been careful the last two stays what I eat. There is a sky deck and pool if you are that way inclined. The pool obviously has a problem with the roof of inside the hotel as plaster has come off and has been repainted over.  It‚Äôs not the usual Hilton experience we have had.  The staff though have been very friendly
Date: Date of stay: August 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good stopover in Windhoek
Review Content: Convenient stop over in the Capital Hilton is a good place for an overnight stay in Windhoek as it is located in the city center in close foot distance to shopping malls and other stores.Lobby/reception - is big and spacious, but at the same it has some cozy seating area with a small stall where you can buy light snacks and drinks. There is also an outside lounge area with access to the casino.Room - standard rooms are decent. It has a relatively big sleeping area and bathroom with both a shower and a tub. However, the bathroom and room cannot be separated except the toilet. The bed is very comfortable. Two waters, small chocolates, tea and coffer was complementary. WIFI - complementary and works perfectly around the property and in the room. Restaurant - we tried the restaurants and they were both really good. The breakfast buffet was though so-so as there are not that much variety of options. You can opt to get the breakfast delivered to your room if you have an early flight, which was a big plus for us.Rooftop - the hotel has a rooftop with a small pool and laying chairs as well as small seating areas. There is also a bar that serves food.SPA - The hotel has, but we did not try.Gym - poor options and only focus on cardio with 5 different machines. Common toilets - outdated and poorly maintained. Could use a refurbishment. But the property is in general very clean and tidy.Casino - have an ok size casino with 5 table options incl. blackjack and roulette as well as lots of slot machines.
Date: Date of stay: March 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Catastrophe : totalement d√©sorganis√© et probl√®me de s√©curit√©, mieux vaut aller au Heinitzburg
Review Content: Apr√®s un long voyage en avion et un temps infini pass√© √† l'a√©roport en formalit√©s administratives, nous nous r√©jouissions d'arriver dans un h√¥tel moderne et efficace o√π tout fonctionne bien.- cruelle d√©sillusion 1 : le check-in prend 30 minutes, en raison d'un probl√®me dans le syst√®me informatique de l'h√¥tel. La chambre donn√©e ne correspond pas √† notre r√©servation booking (lits jumeaux). Nous demandons une nouvelle chambre et le transfert de nos bagages. Deux heures plus tard, nos bagages ne sont toujours pas l√†. L'organisation semble d√©plorable.- cruelle d√©sillusion 2 : nous commandons un rapide d√Æner au bar de l'h√¥tel en rooftop avec vue sur Windhoek. Nous avons mis 1 heure √† √™tre servis ! Entre temps, la nuit √©tait tomb√©e et il faisait tr√®s froid. Impossible de r√©cup√©rer des v√™tements car nos bagages n'√©taient toujours pas mont√©s dans nos chambres...- cruelle d√©sillusion 3 : le check-out prend encore du temps, parce que l'h√¥tel n'a pas de monnaie sur une somme pourtant ridicule. Franchement...- le wifi est payant, ou gratuit si vous faites partie du programme de fid√©lisation Hilton. Clairement, il s'agit d'une strat√©gie mesquine et malvenue pour contraindre les clients √† se faire spammer par la cha√Æne.- les ascenseurs sont extr√™mement lents, on passe sa vie √† les attendre.- nous avons not√© un √©norme probl√®me de s√©curit√©. A force d'attendre l'ascenseur, nous avons voulu privil√©gier les escaliers. Toutefois, la porte du rez-de-chauss√©e donnant sur le hall ne s'ouvre pas de l'int√©rieur : en cas d'incendie, les clients sont pi√©g√©s (ils doivent remonter au 1er et faire tout un d√©tour). - les toilettes ne ferment que par une porte en verre avec la salle de bain, elle-m√™me compl√®tement ouverte sur la chambre. Bonjour l'intimit√©.Au global, nous avons pr√©f√©r√© de loin l'Hotel Heinitzburg de Windhoek (sauf son restaurant qui nous a d√©plu.Toutefois l'h√¥tel dispose de vrais atouts : - Le petit d√©jeuner est tr√®s complet et plut√¥t bon- Les chambres sont grandes et confortables

Name: Great stay
Review Content: Lovely stay at the Hilton Windhoek. Beautiful and uniquely modern, definitely worth the price! The skybar, the gym, the pool, the spa...all so elegant...proper VIP standards. Look forward to visiting, this time for leisure
Date: Date of stay: November 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice Hotel, But Falls Short of Potential
Review Content: First, the positives: the hotel has an attractive design and layout with comfortable beds.  The front desk staff was efficient and recognized my Hilton status and upgraded me to an executive room and access to the executive lounge.  The lounge staff was friendly and helpful, and get bonus points for remembering my name the following day!  The view from the sky bar is gorgeous (although the new high rises next door detract from the view), and indeed is a pleasant location for a sundowner.However, the hotel has some notable deficiencies which merit the immediate attention of management.  As noted in other reviews, the hotel's wifi ranged from non-existent to horrible.  This is unacceptable in a business class hotel in a city where 4G LTE service is available.  The apparent lack of urgency in remedying this shortcoming is concerning.  For travelers who depend on connectivity, I recommend you go elsewhere.The lounge, while attractive, offers a minimal (cold) breakfast offering.  The management should consider some modest additions to make it truly an alternative to the main restaurant for its business visitors.I also believe the Hilton Windhoek could provide nicer amenities for its "executive" rooms in addition to being on a high floor.  Nescaf√© doesn't cut it in 2017.  Even Keurig would have been a step up from freeze-dried coffee.
Date: Date of stay: March 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Stadthotel

Name: Absolut ungen√ºgender Service

Allerdings wird dies durch das regelrecht ignorante, unfreundliche und unaufmerksame Personal wieder zunichte gemacht. Das Personal ist haupts√§chlich mit seinen Mobiltelefonen, anstatt mit der Kundschaft besch√§ftigt. St√§ndig fehlt irgendwo etwas, wie beispielsweise  Handt√ºcher im Fitness oder am Pool, Bestellungen von Mahlzeiten oder Getr√§nken. Die wird vomeinheimischen Personal jedoch hartn√§ckig ignoriert. Genau wie alle anderen Anliegen des Gastes. Ich habe noch nie solch ein schlecht gef√ºhrtes Hotel erlebt. Mangels der fehlenden alternativen und Windhuk w√ºrde ich meinen Aufenthalt hier k√ºnftig auf ein Minimum reduzieren bzw preiswertere Hotels bevorzugen.

Name: Bad experience
Review Content: The Hotel has a good room, but it has the misfortune of having a neighbour that gives you disco rumbling till 6 am, and we also dindn't had any hot water for our morning shower. During our early mornig check-out we complaint this, but there was no compensation!This was during an only Saturday night stay... maybe we were just having bad luck, but be sure to ask for this.Besides this, the bed is great, and the morning buffet is also nice... but still, we left with a bad resting night before our trip to Etosha!

Name: O melhor de Windhoek

Name: Dodgy food at the pool bar
Review Content: We go to the pool every weekend and I've had food poisoning twice from the food at the snack bar. Questionable prawns and a dodgy salad, in huge space of 4 weeks. Some of the staff are great, go the extra mile and are extremely friendly. On the other hand, some are rude and very unhelpful. The pool bar is also always understaffed.
Date: Date of stay: September 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: tasteless
Review Content: The hotel is tasteless and very strange. You don't at all feel that you're in Africa. Standard, tasteless, ugly. Service is so-so, I would even say a bit disappointing. We spent a Saturday at the Country club, and we wished we had been staying there. The building of this Hilton property stands out, it visibly spoils the city. It is very very ugly, I will say this five times more, ugly.
Date: Date of stay: January 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Surely the best hotel in Windhoek
Review Content: We‚Äôve stayed at this Hilton many times over the years and it really does provide consistent quality of service and product.  The hotel, rooms etc look great.  All hotels have technical malfunctions - this one no exception - key cards and water supply this stay were the challenges- but handled really well.  The HHonors lounge area was really useful during our stay also - thx.  We would not hesitate to stay here again and would highly recommend.  Sent from my iPhone

Name: Excellent City Hotel
Review Content: Nice, comfortable large modern hotel with atrium. Only stayed one night and the breakfast was excellent.The rooms are spacious and well equipped and served by good lifts. The Sky Bar is a nice touch with good views of the city and tasty food.
Date: Date of stay: March 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great place
Review Content: Whilst in Windhoek for business, I stayed at the Hilton. Well located, friendly staff and nice spacious rooms. I was impressed with the dinner we had one evening. The one thing all guests should do is to have a drink at the rooftop bar; it has a stunning view across Windhoek and the surrounding mountains.
