Name: Comfortable city hotel
Review Content: We stayed for 1 night on a tour of Namibia. We had a large room with comfortable beds and soft pillows. Toiletries were provided and the shower was good, although some people may not like the open plan bathroom!  A user-friendly safe, tea and coffee making facilities and great breakfast.  A huge variety of cold options plus hot food to order from the open kitchen.  Plenty of friendly and efficient staff - a relaxing first night after a long journey.
Date: Date of stay: July 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Comfortable,  great location
Review Content: Stayed here for 1 night before & after a tour. The hotel is in a great location, walking distance to shops and restaurants. It's about 30 minutes from the airport and the hotel can arrange transport. Nice rooftop bar and pool, and excellent breakfast, including made to order fresh juice. Friendly check in staff. Comfortable beds. The only drawback was the lack a door on the bathroom in atwin share room. While the toilet has a door, the rest of the bathroom is open to the room. As friends sharing for the first time it was a little awkward stripping for a shower with just the frosted shower door to stand behind.  Not an issue for couples in a double room, but a bathroom door would be nice in the twin share rooms for a bit of privacy.
Date: Date of stay: June 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice Hotel, nice staff
Review Content: Situated in the middle of town, friendly helpfull staff, rooms are ok, spacious and clean, a bit old fashioned. Internet is good, we skipped the breakfast. Guarded safe parking available  underneath the hotel
Date: Date of stay: January 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Top of the line
Review Content: This was one of the nicest Hiltons that I have ever stayed at.  Sleek, stylish, immaculate rooms with every comfort and convenience. Close to craft market and museums. Good wifi.  Great shower and bathroom .
Date: Date of stay: September 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Terrible stay at Hilton
Review Content: I have visited many hiltons, yet this hotel does not meet the Hilton standard. The check-in procedure was a terrible experience (took 3 hours to get actually a room assigned) with 3 young children waiting (we did arrive after 14h00). Also dinner ordered, not delivered. Taxi booked, did not come. I believe the processes are not under control. Avoid this hotel under all conditions.
Date: Date of stay: January 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Very badly managed
Review Content: We were a party of eight people. One of our rooms (room 112) was only ready at 18h00. The shower drain in our room , 614 was blocked so it flooded the bathroom and carpet when we showered. There was no coffee cups in one of the rooms ( room 117) and it took for ever to get ones in the morning. Dirty towels was left on the bed in one of the rooms ( room 177 ) which was supposed to be ready. Two of the three lifts was broken and we waited a long time for the lifts. So I had to take the stairs from the 6th floor. The only plus point was that the hotel staff is very friendly.
Date: Date of stay: May 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Best hotel in Namibia
Review Content: After 2 weeks of other hotels wonderful to arrive here. Air-conditioned modern trained staff. If internet had been better would have been perfect.Slight issue with noise from skybar but stopped early enough
Date: Date of stay: March 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Sch√∂ner Aufenthalt
Review Content: Wir haben zwei N√§chte dort gewohnt. Das Einchecken war sehr m√ºhsam, da die Zimmerauswahl sehr schwer eine Einigung fand. Auch das inkludierte Fr√ºhst√ºck wurde erst nach l√§ngerer Diskussion erkannt und akzeptiert. Der Zimmerpreis war ebenfalls zuerst inkorrekt zu hoch, wurde dann aber korrigiert. Das Zimmer war qualitativ sehr hochwertig, ruhige Klimaanlage, sch√∂nes Bad mit separater gro√üer Dusche und gutes, breites Bett. Gro√üer K√ºhlschrank und Sitzgelegenheiten komplettieren dies. Das Parken in der Tiefgarage kostet 80 N$ pro Nacht, was sehr g√ºnstig ist. Die Lage ist sehr zentral und man kann zu Fu√ü das Zentrum von Windhoek erkunden. Der Pool auf dem Dach ist gro√ü und hat eine tolle Aussicht, mit Bar dabei und sch√∂nen Sitzgelegenheiten. Fr√ºhst√ºck ist Hilton International gut, es gibt auch Espresso. Insgesamt ein sehr sch√∂ner Aufenthalt.
Date: Date of stay: November 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Service has severely declined in past year
Review Content: Stayed here twice in 2015 and, in general, the services were good then.  Recently stayed in October 2016 and in the past year both the internet has become much poorer and the general level of service is not good.  There are now other, better options in Windhoek.  Won't go back.
Date: Date of stay: October 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: bezahlen f√ºr WIFI / kaputter Eimer im 5 Sterne Hotel???
Review Content: Sehr gut gelegen. Service ok, aber nicht √ºberargend. Das ich im 5 Sterne Haus f√ºr Interent bezahlen muss befremdet mich eher. Das Zimmer mit Kingzisebett--- aber f√ºr das Bett der Tochter muss man Druck machen, denn sonst wird erwartet, dass diese auch im gleichen Bett schl√§ft wie die Eltern. Qualit√§t beim Fr√ºhst√ºck habe ich schon besser erlebt in Namibia und das waren 3 Stern Lodges!! Alles in allem ok, aber f√ºr mich sicher nicht 5 Sterne wert!
Date: Date of stay: August 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: An Oasis in the desert
Review Content: Without question the best hotel in Namibia. I've stayed there twice and it is totally consistent in room quality, attentiveness of staff, and the quality of the restaurant. The breakfast is particularly superb, especially the local fig muffins. Internet was a bit slow which made Skype Video a problem, but Skype speech was OK.
Date: Date of stay: May 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: √úbernachtung im Hilton Windhoek
Review Content: Leider, waren wir diesesmal nicht zufrieden mit dem Hilton Hotel. Das Personal ist doch sehr ignorant, man kann stundenlang warten bis man bedient wird. Die Butter am Fr√ºhst√ºcksb√ºffet war ranzig. Die Kellnerin kippt Kaffe √ºber den Tassenrand und √ºber meine Hand ohne sich zu entschuldigen.
Date: Date of stay: January 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: No white wine!?!?
Review Content: We visited on a Friday night and were looking forward to a lovely evening admiring the views. With it being a Hilton we were expecting it to be a treat. However, upon ordering our first drink - a bottle of wine - we soon realised this would not be the case. They were out of the wine we asked for so we went to look at the menu to pick another bottle only to be told they were completely out of white wine. This was at around 8pm on a Friday night! The waitress then said they had enough wine for 1 glass but that was all they had. When my partner asked for a gin and tonic we were then told there was no tonic water. We were literally speechless! Because we had been looking forward to coming here all day we decided to make the best of it and he had a gin and dry lemon. After deciding to stay for one more drink and asking for a vodka lemonade only to be told there was no lemonade we just decided to leave. After sitting for a while waiting for the bill to be brought over we noticed one of the waitresses waving over at us from the bar. My partner went over to be told the printer wasn't working so he would need to check the bill on the till. I understand these things happen but the waitress was so rude and lazy. She clearly couldn't be bothered coming across to speak to us.We were really disappointed with our visit to the roof top bar. Also the entire time we were there there was a plate of what must have originally been chicken wings sitting on the bar half eaten. No one went near it to remove the plate. Not what you want to see while enjoying a drink. I must also mention the 'dj' who was playing horrendous music. He spend most of the time strutting around speaking to his friends and popping behind the bar. Maybe his wage could go towards the drinks order to ensure you have enough stock for the weekend????
Date: Date of stay: October 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Overbooked Hilton!
Review Content: The hotel was overbooked and my room given away. I am then upgraded and told that I will have to pack and move after the first night. Highly irritating! I need to be happy as the next guest, who had a prepaid booking was moved to another hotel!!
Date: Date of stay: August 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Highly over rated!
Review Content: you have to pay for wifi in your room and bottled water (none was provided in room); very limited choice of equipment in fitness center and main ones were not even working; menu items were not always available :(
Date: Date of stay: May 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Top Hotel,Personal,Lage und Service
Review Content: Wir sind in der Nacht angekommen, ohne Reservierung das Personal an der Reception freundlich und hilfsbereit.Koennen wir nur empfehlen.Die Zimmer sauber und ohne L√§rm.Fruestuecksbuffett sehr lekker,frische Produkte,jede Station besetzt.Parkmoeglichkeit Ideal.
Date: Date of stay: January 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: My Hilton, My Home
Review Content: the best hotel ever. my Hilton, my home away from home. its a lifetime experience. best of all. l like all the services provided. the room service is out of this world. l have to many places around the world, but there is no place like Hilton hotel.
Date: Date of stay: December 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Excellent location to explore Windhoek
Review Content: We stayed here for one night after doing a Safari and before catching our flight. It is a perfect location for wandering around Windhoek. The room was clean, comfortable and spacious. Breakfast was average and service seems to always be a bit of a challenge but otherwise no complaints. If you're looking for a bite to eat try Caf√© Craft, it's a few minutes walk from the hotel. Also if you're looking for a unique dining experience try Joe's Beerhouse. It's a must. The concierge can help with reservations and transport, it's about 20 mins taxi ride. It is very popular so make sure you book before going.
Date: Date of stay: October 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: My first trip to Namibia
Review Content: I made my way to Windhoek, Namibia recently for a quick business trip. This was my first time to the country and I can't believe it has taken me this long. I stayed at the Hilton Hotel, which is very central to most facilities and amenities in the city.   The hotel staff are extremely friendly, and they go out of their way to make your stay as pleasant as possible. The rooms are clean, extremely comfortable and I had a great view of the city too. It's a wonderful hotel and it comes highly recommended.
Date: Date of stay: July 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A quiet exciting trip
Review Content: I enjoyed my stay in the Windhoek Hilton Hotel. I hope I could come again if I have the choice. I appreciated the service, the meals and the location. The clothes of the staff were impressive. I think it is the best hotel in Windhoek but I have no idea on the price because I am not the one who paid for my stay.
Date: Date of stay: May 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great Architecture, Service leaves a lot to be desired
Review Content: Our first impressions of this hotel were not good, and at the end of day 1 I was ready to cancel our return stay after out safari. No porters to carry our luggage on arrival, 1 hour wait for room service, and a guest services member who never never followed up on our tour booking until asked when we saw her on the lift. The concierge furthered out frustration by ringing  us to tell is our taxi was in reception and then giving it away to another customer, and then re-ordering us. Taxi  which we had to wait 15 mins. More annoying was the claim you always had to wait in Africa.  Having travelled the length and breadth of Africa, he gives the entire continent a bad rep! After  one night I would have rated this hotel 1star. Having said that, service in the restaurant was great, as was that on the roof top bar. Lucas and Lorna in the spa deserve a special mention, as did Patrick from security who manages to get us a  taxi pronto! The hotel is luxurious with great architecture, and a stunning rooftop bar and pool. Great quality linen and luxury fittings are in line with what you would expect from Hilton group. The bathrooms are a little impractical if you are not staying with close family, as they are completely open to the main room. They could also benefit from a night light, but rooms are great overall, as is the gym on the roof.
Date: Date of stay: April 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: "A Design Flaw"
Review Content: The staff was wonderful and attentive, the rooms fine (but see below), the location excellent, and the breakfast buffet and other food were quite good. A broken shower head was fixed promptly and effectively by competent staff.  It was unfortunate not to have any hot water three mornings during a week's stay (remedied twice after calling for service, but not the third time).  But most important, if there was any water at all on the stone bathroom floor, it became extremely  slippery.  I felt like a competitor in a new Olympic event, akin to curling, as I pushed a towel ahead of me after each shower, carefully assuring that no inch of the floor was lethally damp.When a staff member asked me how I was enjoying my stay I told him about this "feature" of the bathroom floor; he nodded knowingly (indicating he'd heard this before) and said he would report the experience -- but nothing changed.As I checked out after a week and was asked by another staff member, I detailed my slipping and sliding and was told that "yes, this was a design flaw" -- one that had been reported before.A "design flaw" -- a bathroom floor that must remain completely dry? A design flaw indeed -- one that, despite other winning features in the Hilton Windhoek -- leads me to seek alternatives on future visits to Namibia.
Date: Date of stay: February 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Not living up to Hilton standards
Review Content: While the hotel is clean and the rooms are modern and spacious, the service is poor!! The restaurant was a major let down. I am not going to go into specifics, but would only recommend this hotel as a one night stop over. If I had stayed over more than one night, it would have driven me crazy. Now we are on our way back there on the 3rd of January...I am not getting my hopes up that it will be better. There is a management problem at this hotel. I see you respond to complaints, but it does not seem that you are doing anything to rectify the issues. I can also write responses and make promises. Let's see what happens when we go back. (We pre booked our trip)
Date: Date of stay: December 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Not very enjoyable
Review Content: This hotel was booked and paid for as we were looking forward to a little luxury before heading out on an African Safari.  After missing a flight due to inclement weather - the Hilton was contacted advising that we wouldn't be arriving until early next morning, therefore, not sleeping, but just using our paid room for freshening up, eating breakfast before heading on safari. On arrival, we were advised that we were put in as a "no show" and wouldn't be able to access our room. As we had friends staying (who were waiting for our arrival) we then headed off to get breakfast, but had to pay for that (even though it was included in our room rate, that we didn't get to use). Sorry but I wouldn't be recommending this accommodation to anybody.
Date: Date of stay: September 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Slipping badly
Review Content: This is the second time I have stayed in the hotel in the past 6 months and the standard has dropped. During this visit the complementary water in the room was discontinued without explanation. This is the first 4/5 star hotel I have stayed in over 29 countries that this has happened and is an obvious but petty cost saving device. I had problems with my final account and was subjected to a "take it or leave it" approach by the duty manager who obviously needs an interpersonal skills course. Disappointing performance overall
Date: Date of stay: June 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great hotel
Review Content: Have stayed several times at Hilton since it openned. Fantastic rooms and food. Bar and pool on 9th floor are excellent. Still don't understand why have to be charged extra for wifi and parking. I hope this will be resolved soon.
Date: Date of stay: April 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hilton Hotel Windhoek, Namibia
Review Content: Very nice hotel and good location.  This was our first trip to Windhoek, so wasn't sure what to expect.  Breakfast buffet is good and the roof top bar is fun. Hotel offers airport pick up and drop off for an additional charge, but worth it.  Be sure if you are booking a transfer to let them know if it is the international airport as this is considerably further than the domestic airport.  All the staff were very helpful and friendly.
Date: Date of stay: September 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Much Potential
Review Content: I am torn between a 5 star and 3 star review.  I guess, I could have went with a 4 star but one particular incident (which turned out okay) could have been a mess.  The Windhoek Hilton is very cool; modern and not tacky.  The lobby is bright with lots of clever little touches and well staffed.  Well staffed, as in plenty of people to help you out.  All the staff were quite friendly and seemed to know what their own jobs were - general things and requests outside their own description seems to bring a little confusion though.  I don't mean, requesting the elevator guy to give you a pedicure, but asking the person who clears the dishes for coffee was ineffective.  That said, I find that happens quite a bit in Africa.  (I'm a Canadian/American living in Botswana)The rooms were great.  Large, inviting, and CLEAN!  For me, "clean" is the most important hotel adjective, and our rooms were spotless.  Open concept with a separate toilet area, plenty of water pressure, big towels, and lots of amenities in case you forgot something.  (razors, shaving cream, toothbrush, shoe mitt, etc. . . .  My wife thought the lotion was pleasant smelling for what it's worth.Food was good in the restaurant and our caipirinhia at the roof-top pool bar was perfect.  (We have had some really bad drinks in Africa so this was a welcome treat.) Okay, so why the 3 star review?  Well, for starters, check-in was ridiculous.  It was not busy at all yet took forever.  Our reservation had been canceled for starters, and no one could explain why.  I asked if they had rooms available, which they did, so I told them "no big deal" let's just check into some rooms they had available.  There was lots of running around, and discussion, and running around, etc. . . After 15 minutes we were offered a seat and a drink which we declined and waited another ~10 minutes before finally receiving our rooms.  I still am not sure what was happening.  Just put your guests in a room, and figure out any problems you might be having afterward.  (we had just driven up from Swakop and wanted to settle in and grab some lunch.)Lunch was good enough, and guests ate for 130 bucks/buffet.  We live in reasonably rural Bots and wanted to hit a mall, so down to get the car.  They had parked it for me at check-in and handed me a ticket.  We had no idea where it was though (I thought they were valet parking for me)  They pointed out where the garage elevator was and down we go to the upper garage.  Apparently, the upper garage is more love-nest than garage, as it was empty except for 2 amorous couples who appeared to be returning from a rendezvous - glad we weren't a couple minutes earlier. They directed us to the Lower Garage where we found our car. (the seats were not reclined so I took that as a good sign)  The ticket we received would not let us out though the gate though.  Time elapsed, add more money or something.  We backed up and found someone to release us back into the wilds of Windhoek, and were off.Okay, the biggest problem was on our check-out day.  We were traveling with my parents who are pretty well-traveled - and I should add that they liked the hotel on the whole, and they're used to the Ritz/Mombo/and other 5 star fare.  We kept having staff visit us before checking out.  I think the housekeepers stopped by around 9:00AM - whatever, we told them we'd be checking out at 11:00AM. (Check out is noon)  Then someone came by who wanted to check out mini-bar.  Dude, leave us alone, come count when we're gone.  It was the non-staff visitor that was disturbing.  My parents were hanging out in their room and some dude in a military uniform just walks in.  He was pulling a suitcase, so I assume he was trying to check into his room - but this should not happen.  Things happen in hotel rooms that should not be disturbed - not in my parents' room I hope, but in other rooms.  Or who knows, what if nobody was there and the entrant was a thief?  What if my wife was alone and the person was unsavory?  She might kick his a@@, but. . . I hope this is a rare event.  I realize that this could happen anywhere, but it should not.  The staff appeared to be earnest and trying - they were friendly, but it seems like they need a layer of training on becoming capable on general help outside their exact job description.  (I didn't mention the hot coffee at breakfast we requested didn't come until we were finishing up our breakfast - that was a long 3 minutes!)  Great hotel, friendly staff, a little too rough around the edges (staff doesn't really seem to understand what a typical guest is looking for - assuming I know what a typical guest is looking for) - and they need to seriously work on their check-in/check-out procedures.
Date: Date of stay: April 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: a good hotel
Review Content: I was one night at the Windhoek Hilton, and my stay was very good.Reception was very efficient and helpful; romms are very nice  with a fantastic bed, and also service was fantastic.I used the Club Luonge , wich wwas also very good with canapes and drinks ( also main brands),Room service was good.In my opinion a very good hotel
Date: Date of stay: August 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Lost my bag at reception and no one saw anything and the cameras aren‚Äôt working due to error! Very unacceptable service
Review Content: I went to the hotel Skybar and on my way out at midnight places my handbag on the table at the concierge to take a picture and forgot to grab my bag on my way out. I went back to the hotel to claim my bay and they could only say that they did not see it
Date: Date of stay: January 2024This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Stay away
Review Content: This was my second stay at the hotel the first one was uneventful, it seemed like a nice enough place but the first day was only about four or five days. On this last trip we were there for more than two weeks.   I had to change rooms because one room had no air conditioning, and when I got up in the morning to wash my face there was no water coming out of the faucet in the bathroom. So I get moved to another room, this time there‚Äôs no heat! Yes I said heat because it did get rather cool. Also both rooms were an electrical safety issue hazard, if you look at the light on the side of the bed where the switches to turn it on and off the wires are exposed in both of the rooms I was in because they didn‚Äôt have anyone who knew what they were doing put the switches in place probably to save money.  The next thing if you let the water run either the cold or the hot and put it in a clear glass and stir it look at all the yummy stuff floating around in the water!  The staff tries to do what they can but the reality is management is literally out to lunch, all they wanna do is to collect the money there is no upkeep to the property and there‚Äôs no training in food handling for the kitchen staff. You would see people rubbing their crotch or sticking their finger up their nose while they‚Äôre doing food prep we brought it to the attention of the chef but he can‚Äôt watch the people all the time.  All the beds and the linen need to be replaced the beds are very uncomfortable. And now for the highlight of my trip my colleague got food poisoning twice eating breakfast at the hotel, I got food poisoning 3√ó1 time which is literally incapacitated me. All within the first week I got sick I would not eat breakfast which was included in my room, there was a nice German restaurant about a 5 to 8 minute walk away which I had all my meals.   Management has mastered the art of being reactive making lots of promises but delivering on nothing, yes-man is the term. I‚Äôm sorry but Hilton is a brand-name in this property should not be licensed to operate under the Hilton franchise. If anyone from Hilton reads this I have pictures to back me up on the electrical hazard presented by the lamp in both rooms. Seems to me that both of the brand name hotels in Windhoek are pathetic as a Protea is just as bad as the Hilton.
Date: Date of stay: July 2022This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Date: Date of stay: December 2021This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great stay in Windhoek
Review Content: We had to separate stays at the Windhoek Hilton on either side of our safari in Namibia. Our first room was an Executive King room. It was fine for one day, but the bathroom area was quite small.Our second room was the Diplomatic suite. This was very spacious. It had two large bathrooms complete with showers and toilets and a very large sitting area. Happy hour is from 6-8pm. You can order drinks, snacks and dinner. Both rooms had Executive lounge access. The normal Exeuctive lounge is closed for COVID, but they‚Äôve cordoned off a private area in the main restaurant for Executive lounge guests.    The staff are very friendly and helpful. Claudia at the front desk and Jacob, one of the managers, were especially good.The hotel helped us arrange COVID tests. We visited the DiagnoLab. They offer 6-hour, 12-hour and 24-hour turnarounds at different price points. The hotel is clean and well functioning. We would recommend it for a stay in Windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: April 2021This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Sehr gutes Hotel - Inkompetente Rezeptionisten
Review Content: Wir haben insgesamt drei N√§chte im Hilton Windhoek √ºbernachtet und k√∂nnen hinsichtlich der zentralen Lage, der sch√∂nen Zimmer, der Dachterrasse samt Pool und der Speisenqualit√§t nur Positives berichten. Leider ist jedoch das Personal an der Rezeption von einfachsten Dingen √ºberfordert.1. Die von uns vorgebuchte erste √úbernachtung am 18.12.19 wurde, wie ich zu Hause nach Durchsicht meiner Kontoausz√ºge feststellen mussten, meiner Kreditkarte dreimal belastet. Bisher ist trotz mehrfacher emails keine Korrektur erfolgt. 2. Vor unserer Heimreise √ºbernachteten wir erneut im Hilton. Wir buchten zuerst nur f√ºr eine Nacht und erhielten den besten verf√ºgbaren Preis. Als wir etliche Stunden sp√§ter noch eine weitere Nacht hinzubuchten, wurde uns ein wesentlich h√∂herer Preis genannt. Auf unsere Nachfrage hin mussten wir miterleben, wie eine erfahrene Kollegin der anderen erkl√§rte, wie man den besten verf√ºgbaren Preis f√ºr einen Gast im System findet, den wir dann  auch anstandslos erhielten.3. Wir hatten um einen Weckruf f√ºr 5 Uhr morgens gebeten, der nicht erfolgte.4. Beim Auschecken wurde ein Fehler bei der Rechnungsstellung f√ºr diese beiden N√§chte festgestellt, der erst nach 10 Minuten durch Einschalten eines weiteren Mitarbeiters behoben werden konnte. Als Entsch√§digung mussten wir die Parkgeb√ºhren nicht bezahlen. 5. Die Hilton Bonuspunkte sind uns bislang nur f√ºr 2 N√§chte gut geschrieben worden.
Date: Date of stay: December 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Ne m√©rite pas ses 5 etoiles
Review Content: Chambres correctes mais sans plus, nourriture parfaite, mais personnel pas √† la hauteur.Service des excursions totalement inexistant, personnel pas pr√©par√© pour les touristes .Shuttle bien mais Giovani tr√®s incomp√©tent. Merci au personnel des chambres en particulier √† Mac Donald . Quant a  la manager .........
Date: Date of stay: December 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Exploiting the customers due to their monopoly in Windhoek
Review Content: The desired rooms were not made available. Check in and check out experience was terrible each taking more than 45  min. The hotel doesn't have a conceirge to keep luggage. The room service,  restaurant and breakfast food options are limited. The quality of food for the price is extremely sub standard. Despite of being a loyal member and making many requests for lounge access, late check-out etc. were not honoured. Please don't stay here and try other options. Though not 5 star but are good hotels.
Date: Date of stay: November 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great for functions
Review Content: We had a function here last weekend and we really want to thank all the staff.  They were extremely helpful on the evening, nothing was too much trouble.  The bar staff were also excellent.  We had a great function and I can recommend using the Hilton Hotel for any event you might want to have there.
Date: Date of stay: September 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Goto Hilton
Review Content: Goto HiltonThe Hilton is a great place to hang out and among the locals seems to be a place to go for its rooftop pool & bar.Positives+ on-site parking+ there is an outdoor parking area next door where local people sell traditional handmade items; great place to get some local shopping and support the economy (the Namib economy has not been good for everyone)+ lounge staff is very helpful+ big roomsNegatives- A young man running the check-in, and temperamental by nature and possibly a manager or supervisor, and of Afrikaans or of German descent, would yell at the local staff for ridiculous things which reflected poorly on hotel management. He seemed to be under a lot of stress, but considering he is in the hospitality industry, he should know how to conduct himself. Also, as a very young person, surprising to see him ‚Äúsupervising‚Äù when there were many more well-behaved local staff who could probably have done what he was doing better. The Hilton was the only place where we saw non-locals supervising- Rooms are dirty and not well cleaned (nor maintained)- Not able to provide breakfast for early morning starts- This section of town is not good, particularly after-hours
Date: Date of stay: December 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good stay
Review Content: Located in central Windhoek, close to shops and restaurants and the few (German) sights. Car parking was NAD 60 per night. Big room, comfy beds, quiet, good airco, fridge, tv, safe and a partial see-through bathroom. Lunch and dinner at the roof skybar (where the pool is too) offers great views although almost no areas with shade (it gets really hot!). The food is really good at the skybar but more expensive than the local restaurants. Also, there is no kids menu at the skybar or the other restaurant although there is a kids menu in the room service; that doesn't make any sense. Breakfast experience was mixed; on our first morning there was not enough food, items were missing and not refilled, and bread was old; on our second morning (at the same time) there was plenty of food and all was fresh.
Date: Date of stay: July 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Corporate Hotel with a fantastic roof terrace
Review Content: Stayed here for one night in April - standard corporate decor and feel to the hotel, breakfast was good and service was very good. The location is convenient to most attractions although taxi is the recommended method of travel, especially at night, so location is not particularly important in Windhoek. The stand out feature was the rooftop terrace which afforded fantastic views over the city. It was a popular spot and we grabbed the last available seats (on a Thursday night) for a pre-dinner drink to watch the sunset.
Date: Date of stay: April 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Satisfied Guests
Review Content: The room was very clean, the WiFi was awesome, the king size bed was very comfortable, parking was an absolute disaster as the space was very limited as well as the driving indications, but the staff was friendly and helpful, overall a comfortable and satisfactory stay.
Date: Date of stay: June 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Treated like Royalty
Review Content: The staff is always available at hotel entry, check-in desk, elevator, food service and room service.   The rooms are large, beds very comfortable and very quite.   We had a group of over 40 adults and I heard no complaints - only praise for six day stay.   Food served buffet style for the group for breakfast (open to all guests) with eggs to order andand to group in meeting room.    EXCELLANT, tasty food for every meal with great mulitple selections.
Date: Date of stay: May 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: an unexpected delight
Review Content: Ok it is a Hilton but the level of service the staff and comfort were outstanding even for Hilton. Immaculately clean and well taken care of property. The staff are extremely attentive without being a pain in the butt. The rooms are nice sized the beds are comfy. Its smack in the middle of downtown so you are right there for shopping and restaurants. The breakfast bar is perfect its not so large as to be overwhelming but everything there is tasty and cooked correctly. The exec lounge upstairs again is not whelming but there is always two main courses and two sides and they taste good. WiFi is spot on and works well in the room. I stayed here for 10 days was never unhappy...This is the place to stay if you are in Windhoek
Date: Date of stay: May 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Excellent Service, Great Location
Review Content: My 7 year old daughter and I stayed here for 2 nights at the beginning of our 11 night visit to Namibia. Windhoek doesn‚Äôt have much touristy to write home about, but the Hilton gives you a comfortable and central location to explore the capital while preparing to head further afield. The craft market is right next door, supermarket across the street, and a Hertz car rental office is located in the lobby. A short walking tour of the main sights - the church, the independence museum, the Kudu statue - can easily be done from the Hilton. The staff were extremely helpful. When I needed to buy outlet adaptors the staff volunteered to do it for me. We ordered room service and were very pleased with the food quality and the service. Breakfast is quite good - smaller than I expected when I first walked in, though the breakfast room is deigned very nice - but we had plenty to eat. I especially liked the made on the spot fruit smoothies.
Date: Date of stay: April 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Bella vista
Review Content: √à un bel hotel, moderno, pulito e con tutti i comfort. Il Wifi funziona benissimo a differenza della maggioranza degli hotel in cui abbiamo soggiornato in Namibia. La posizione √® strategica per visitare le principali attrazioni. Il personale √® gentile e la colazione √® super! Inoltre dal bar sul tetto si ha un bellissima vista sulla citt√† soprattutto al tramonto. Parcheggio sotterraneo e casin√≤.
Date: Date of stay: February 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: The Home of Leisure Excellence!
Review Content: The Home of Leisure Excellence is Hilton Hotel Windhoek. For decades, Hilton has become my home away from home. It is the Hallmark leisure and hospitality excellence; unparalleled service excellence; out of this world and it is an amazing experience being at Hilton Hotel.
Date: Date of stay: January 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Amazing location excellent service and lovely food
Review Content: Staying here for few days before flying home.The rooms are very comfortable with all modern amenities.The best thing here is the staff.Friendly and extremely professional. For a big hotel chain they are very attentive and admirable in the way they carry out their job.The hotel is 6 mins walk from the Nambian Craft centre where many items can be purchased at reasonable prices after little bargaining. The Ekipa restaurant in the hotel does an ala carte menu at a reasonable price. There is also a buffet for NAD265.This is lot cheaper than other hotels in Etosha and elsewhere. The staff are lovely and Anna particularly was excellent in serving in Ekipa restaurant.I was impressed with the size of the rooms which are big. They are extremely clean and very comfortable. So relaxing being here.
Date: Date of stay: December 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Cosy & Modern Hilton Windhoek
Review Content: We chose the Hilton Windhoek, looking for some creature comforts after arriving into Namibia well after 24 hours of travel time. The hotel is walking distance to the malls. The building is modern with very friendly front desk staff that were friendly and efficient.Our request for a room with a good view was accommodated and we got room 608 which had a nice overall view.The room was of good size and very comfortable with a open concept bathroom with private shower enclosure, WC and a soaking bathtub. Great amenities too.We were expecting bathrobes, but a simple call to housekeeping to request for them had two bathrobes sent up in no time.Two minor grouses to our room:The shower enclosure door did not shut well leaving a slight gap that allowed water to flow out keeping what should be the dry area, wet.Mould trapped in between the silicone and the four sides of the shower stall floor could be easily removed by scraping and removing the old silicone, and resealing the corners again with fresh clean silicone. For some reason the soaking bathtub had better water pressure too.The sky bar was refreshing and a nice place to unwind after a long day.Breakfast was simply wonderful. Quality over quantity, with fresh juices and just a wonderful selection of quality breakfast staple food. Very happy to note the use of biodegradable straws in the restaurant. None of those awful plastic straws that destroy our enviroment. Good thinking Hilton Windhoek!Look out for 'Miss Breakfast' who might come round to interact and enquire on your stay. A fine example of good hospitality.Great internet connection thru out the hotel and not just in the lobby area's (most hotels in Namibia only provide internet in the common areas)Overall a welcome stay after what seemed to be an eternity of traveling time.
Date: Date of stay: November 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Friendly staff
Review Content: A typical central business district hotel with some very friendly staff working at the reception.The breakfast and dinner buffets were great, excellent selection.The rooftop pool (heated) was a big advantage. Only a couple of very rude local boys were really annoying. The got drunk early in the afternoon, passed out on the sofas and treated the staff in a very condescending way. My hubby told them to knock it off...
Date: Date of stay: July 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Dissappointed with room detail
Review Content: A recent one night stay. The room was a good size however it felt very dark and depressing. There had been some renovations but the side tables had the handles broken or hanging off and the drawers in poor order. A bit more attention to detail on the shower edges was also needed. On a positive the dinner menu (not the buffet) was very nice and varied. Breakfast buffet was average and obviously the staff do not like the early start as their faces showed how much they did not wish to be there.
Date: Date of stay: July 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hilton klasse
Review Content: Laatste nacht in Namibi√´ in dit hotel doorgebracht. Mooi verzorgd hotel. Met een prachtig dakterras. Heel ruime kamers met alle comfort. Heel vriendelijk en gedienstig  personeel. Onze zoon was jarig en werd verrast met een leuk cadeautje en taart. Heel attent.
Date: Date of stay: August 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: still the best in town
Review Content: It is for sure not a five star hotel compared with international standards, but a solid 4star place with good value for money, comfortable and clean rooms, good AC and an ok service offering. Staff is friendly and helpful. Mix of upscale tourists in transit and business people. Good breakfast offering, but coffee quality could be improved, same for cappucino which seems to come out of a cheap machine. Building activites next door are inconvenient. Happy to be back on the next trip.
Date: Date of stay: August 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: The usual, high, Hilton standard
Review Content: The Windhoek Hilton was a nice end to a two-week self-drive visit to Namibia: the usual superb bathroom suite with well-designed lighting, nice-sized room with all facilities was very welcome. The room furniture and carpet were, however showing their age, and was a little shabby.I had the most incredible "above-and-beyond" helpful assistance from the young concierge on duty when I arrived! He quickly got a taxi and then escorted me to several nearby bookshops to search for books on Namibian wild flowers, before the bookshops closed; he then printed my boarding passes for my flights. I am most grateful.
Date: Date of stay: June 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Business
Review Content: Fantastisch en veilig hotel. Misschien de 5 sterren niet helemaal waardig. De 5e ster is voor activiteiten. en die ster heb ik niet echt kunnen ontdekken. Wifi is ok√©, however you have to confirm 5 times per Day. which is enoying. Overall I am satisfied. When you visit  remember to apply for Hilton Honors App. You will get free Wifi.Best Regards Dirk
Date: Date of stay: June 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Really nice and comfortable stay with a great sky line roof bar
Review Content: Good hotel with good staffPick up I paid extra for the hotel to pick me up. Which was good nice clean luxury car.  It was only a little bit more money compared to getting a local taxi.  So worth itCheckinNice and simple with welcoming staff who had a big smile. RoomI had the executive room which was massive.Awesome; nice, spacious, clean and immaculate I really couldn‚Äôt fault it. Bed was comfy and I had a very good night sleepBreakfastI had paid for breakfast due to goto the game reserve and flight early morning i didn‚Äôt get to use.  However one morning they let me in a little early and had a quick breakie.  Which I thought was very kind of them. The selection and variety did look good.Sky loungeBar the staff Jeffery was really hard working I ordered a chocolate milkshake which they don‚Äôt serve obviously; but he went out of his way to get it from the resturant downstairs. Location It‚Äôs in the heart of Windhoek and is like a mini land mark in the capital.  Close to most of the sightseeing spotsConcierge Patrick was very good and arranged a tour guide for me called Neville.  When in another city it‚Äôs important to have a tour guide who can be trusted.  Neville was the man.  Guy was so chilled and calm.  If you need a tour guide he is the guy ‚Ä≠+264 814769132‚Ä¨They also reserved the Naansuki game reserve for me. OverallGreat hotel, good staff, great location and overall it was very good.  I would recommend and would go back. If you like my review select YES to helpful.
Date: Date of stay: April 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Everyone stays here because it is the hilton
Review Content: The shower door did not seal properly and the room was flooded. All the people were very helpful, efficient and prompt. But still, Why does a shower door leak!?The location is brilliant - walking distance to wonderful cafes and restaurants, near all the city sights and parks.
Date: Date of stay: April 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great place to stay
Review Content: We stayed our first night in Namibia here and had a very good experience. Staff were friendly and helpful. The room was large (two double beds) and comfortable with good amenities. The only reason I didn't give it the full five stars is that the bathroom gives very little privacy. There is no door between the shower area and the rest of the room, which is awkward if you are traveling with your kid or a friend! The breakfast buffet was really good and staff came by often to check on our meal. The breads were especially good. Free standard wifi was available to HiltonHonors members.This seems like a new property, and it was in very good condition. I would stay here again.
Date: Date of stay: March 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Full service, comfortable and helpful staff
Review Content: First impression of the lobby area is not luxurious.  However the restaurants and rooftop bar are quite nice and the food is good.  The room was large, with good lighting, and a large open bathroom with nice fixtures and closed toilet room.  AC worked well.  Bed firm but comfortable with nice linens.  No bathrobe, but nice towels.  Medium sized TV with decent channels.  Desk and chair very good, with European and UK outlets provided.  Breakfast was normal selection, with a good variety and everything seemed fresh. Closet, safe and toiletries all fine.  Coffee service all instant but plenty of it.  The pool is very small, but the deck is nice.  Fitness room small, with about 6 machines.Cons:  the wifi is not free unless you are an Honors member, and even then I was only able to connect one device and had to renew each day.  Also, the signal was weak.  There is a fridge but it was empty - no minibar, if you are counting on a nice cold beer while you unpack you are out of luck. Only one small bottle of water was provided - I had to buy extra at the coffee bar downstairs.
Date: Date of stay: January 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Excellent service at Hilton whk
Review Content: I had one of the most relaxing weekends at Hilton. The staff all around where so friendly and helpful. At times they go out of the scope of their duties just to help/ assist. It was such a great time having a break away from home . Thank you to the staff and hotel management.
Date: Date of stay: January 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A safe, clean, rejuvenating stay
Review Content: After staying a week in Namibia, i looked forward to coming back to the Hilton. Clean rooms and impeccable customer service. The spa experience was a little annoying as both nights ( spaced one week a part) were booked for all services so I guess they weren‚Äôt getting my money that way. Everything else was great.
Date: Date of stay: January 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: One night stopover
Review Content: Very pleasant experience and helpful staff! I will definitely come back. - The sky bar was beautiful- but not the right environment for a toddler as the music was loud. Definitely a must but not with kids :) - rooms were clean and 5*- concierge service was great- Breakfast was delish - receptionist very helpful and smiling - coffee bar was great too üëåüèº
Date: Date of stay: December 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Comfort and friendliness
Review Content: I always enjoy my stay at this the Hilton when on business in Windhoek. It offers comfortable and luxurious rooms; and very welcoming staff. It is centrally located but offers quality added services. The view from the Sky Lounge at sunset is amazing and the perfect end to a day in the city. The food a is on the pricey side and limited menu at the bars.
Date: Date of stay: November 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great views from top floor bar/dining
Review Content: Only stayed one night with my husband.  Modern hotel, well situated in city centre. Good selection of restaurants and bars in the hotel.  The Ekipa restaurant had an extensive buffet incorporating many Namibian specialities as well as the a la carte menu.  We loved our Kingklip Thermadore. Excellent, spacious rooms well-equipped with facilities including tea/coffee, ironing board, hairdryer, bath and shower - all as you might expect from a Hilton hotel. There is a small health spa and a small gym. I had a back massage in the former which was good although the walls are thin and it was hard to relax with loud music booming through from the sky bar next door conflicting with my soothing spa music.Top floor pool can get a bit busy especially with the gym, the spa, the sky bar and the views all confined to the same small space.  Great cocktails though!  And although we didn't use it, there's a casino in-house too.Charming, pleasant staff throughout. Would recommend.
Date: Date of stay: October 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good stopover for a wider Namibia trip
Review Content: Good modern hotel. Easy to find driving from the airport. Parking is in a secure basement car park, $60 for overnight for hotel guests.Diamond members get treated well. Free room upgrade, and also access to executive lounge. A limited hot food dinner and lots of cakes and snacks in the lounge. Free buffet breakfast too for Diamond members.Buffet breakfast was OK, nothing special, typical 4 star hotel standard.Rooms were as expected 4 star standard. Beds super comfy. Air-conditioning worked well. Wifi was strong and worked well. Shower was powerful with good hot water. Only downside is that the bathroom is open plan to the bedroom, so not ideal if sharing a room with someone you're not intimate with.There's a small pool on the roof, and a rooftop bar/bistro with a pretty good view that is worth checking out. Very busy with both guests and locals, seems to be a trendy place to be seen in Windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: September 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A pleasant stay...
Review Content: I stayed at the Hilton Windhoek with an American friend of mine for a couple of weeks. We both moved rooms a couple of times due to the high occupancy rate at the hotel and our indecisiveness as far as our intended departure date was concerned. The executive floor was convenient (lounge access, extra amenities etc.) even though we spent more time at the Kalabar than anywhere else on the premises. I also had a standard room and a garden room during our stay. My friend opted for a diplomatic suite. The rooms were clean and the staff very friendly. The wifi network's bandwidth/cost is a bit of a bother, but typical for large chain hotels worldwide. Overall, I highly recommend the Hilton Windhoek when visiting Namibia.
Date: Date of stay: August 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hilton is not suitable for families
Review Content: The hotel and rooms are clean and equipped - yet - Hilton. Comfortable bedding and large comfortable beds. The staff was very unkind. Was not attentive to our requests to adapt the rooms to families. The showers are open to rooms without doors. A fact that becomes problematic when staying with teenagers.
Date: Date of stay: July 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hilton windhoek
Review Content: Van 08 jul tm 12 jul in het hotel verbleven. Dit was de tweede keer dat ik in het hotel verbleef. Het is een uitsteken hotel met heel bekwaamt en vriendelijk personeel. De locatie en het uitzicht zijn ook uitsteken.
Date: Date of stay: July 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Very nice and modern hotel, centrally located
Review Content: Modern and clean hotel, located in the city center and offer good service and very nice and clean rooms.Rooms are relatively large and comfortable.Breakfast is wonderful, great variety of food and beverages, nice staff.The hotel offers Gym, very nice roof pool deck and two bars.
Date: Date of stay: July 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great stay and close to CBD
Review Content: I stay here every time I visit Windhoek. I only come once a year. So I can see if the place has improved or not. The staff friendliness and helpfulness has certainly improved. It is at a high standard. Great decor, comfortable environment for business meetings or just to relax after a long day. It is also close to our company building, mall and various heritage sites and government buildings. All depends why you are in Windhoek. Breakfast is great and room service is great. I can recommend the Pork Belly main and the Chocolate Walnut desert. And I don't even normally like desert.
Date: Date of stay: June 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Enjoyable stay in Windhoek
Review Content: The hotel was centrally placed with a beautiful view from the Sky Bar. Breakfast had a great selection. Parking underground was safe and easily accessed. The hotel was very quite and little to no traffic noise.
Date: Date of stay: June 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Muy buen hotel
Review Content: Excelente ubicaci√≥n . Muy buena habitaci√≥n, muy amplia con buena vista. Muy bueno el servicio. Las comidas del restaurant tambi√©n fueron muy buenas. Me recomendaron un chofer para poder conocer la ciudad.
Date: Date of stay: May 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Mixed feelings- Hilton/Windhoek
Review Content: I had a truncated stay at this property late April 2017.After my stay at Hilton Sandton in Joburg  I must say Hilton Windhoek has some catching up to do. The mattresses were very uncomfortable and so I did not rest well. Wi Fi was spotty to say the least. On arrival on my second stay, the room had no lights. The winner at this hotel is the very helpful staff. Gabriel , Daphne and others were very kind and welcoming. The meals were good and enough. Hope to see much improvement on my next stay as Windhoek is growing and I'll be back !!
Date: Date of stay: April 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: The place to stay in Windhoek
Review Content: This Hotel is one of the better hotels that I have stayed in on my travels. The staff are welcoming and friendly and the hotel is very modern and well laid out.On Arrival the check in was friendly and efficient. My room was very comfortable and spacious for a standard room. The bathroom had both a nice big bath and a very nice shower.Every night was a different theme in the restaurant and there was a choice of either a buffet or A la Carte. The quality of the food was great and the restaurant staff were very attentive to our needs etc.Breakfast was also great and I especially enjoyed the freshly squeezed fruit juices.The Skybar on the roof was a nice place to relax after work.The only complaint I had was that both treadmills in their gym were not functioning correctly and the gym is a bit small.Value for Money, well in this day and age I suppose you pay for this quality and comfort.
Date: Date of stay: May 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Inefficiency Service or Fraud attempt
Review Content: As I speakmy bank account is in short of N$2000.  disappeared during checkin/checkout exercise at reception between a girl and a certain John Farmer. Should Hilton Windhoek really concerned how customers are grieved by staff members, the management would made available immediately after any adverse event. They must be ready to rectify the errors swiftly and amicably. A formal or non-formal apology can heal big wounds inflicted to any person of any colour or age. re. The treatment I got at Hilton this week was pathetic, inhuman, dishonest and possible fraudulent.

Name: Good Location. Great Addition to Windhoek
Review Content: Room is opulent and excellent ! Breakfast is excellent with a wonderful buffet. The only flaw was check-in where inspite of a confirmed reservation none could be found. It took a good five minutes and I finally had my room. The location is good and even though the price was steep I can only reccommend this hotel strongly.

Pese a ser un Hilton, al llegar no encontraban nuestra reserva, la piscina estaba inaccesible por mantenimiento, al pedir la cena a la habitaci√≥n no nos permitieron pagar con tarjeta directamente y luego, en el check out, no lo ten√≠an actualizado. Adem√°s, para tener wifi en la habitaci√≥n, hab√≠a que pagar un extra. Demasiado pretencioso y orientado a hotel de negocios para lo que es Namibia. Name: Almost best in Windhoek
Review Content: Will be the best hotel in Windhoek if not Namibia if they sort out their Wifi stability, speed and ease of access (no payment plans). Some small maintenance issues in room (bed side light). 9th floor terrace bar and pool area very nice with great views. Service here can be a bit slow especially the food orders.

Review Content: hotel di gran lusso, camere confortevoli, bene la pulizia e letti comodi ristorante e buffet ricco e vario.Il personale gentile e disponibile. Buona la posizione in citt√†. un p√≤ carente la connessione a internet.

Name: Great modern and central
Review Content: The Hilton Windhoek offers decent size modern rooms with welcoming and attentive staff and friendly service. Great pool deck bar and super yummy freshly squeezed juices for breakfast. Really happy stay.
Date: Date of stay: February 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Top located to start exploring Windhoek
Review Content: 100% value for Money. Hilton Quality at its best. The Restaurant choice and Food Quality, as well as the  Roof top bar view are recommended. Pgerfect located for Meetings downtown and a good starting Point to explore Windhoeks sights.
Date: Date of stay: January 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: One of the best in Windhoek
Review Content: I use this hotel as my default accommodation in Windhoek. I was one of the very first guest to stay in the hotel and return regularly as I do business in Namibia. I find the accommodation really good with generous sized rooms. The food is good with a great breakfast spread, important if you are like me and have bad eating habits, at least I know I will get one good meal a day. Great bar, good view and restaurants on site.The telephone and internet charges are insanely high. I get around this by purchasing a local SIM when I am in Namibia and I get free WiFi access because I am on the Hilton loyalty program. Take this tip and join the Hilton Honors loyalty program when you check in.The maintenance is not up to scratch and some basic things like the showers that wet the floors, the towels are becoming tatty, etc. makes one wonder where else are they cutting corners. Finally the reception staff are not as responsive as I expect at times but overall compared to the rest of Namibia it is pretty good service.
Date: Date of stay: September 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Not authentically Namibian, but a lovely hotel!
Review Content: We started our trip here and it was the perfect treat before grabbing our 4x4 and heading into the dessert. Not typically Namibian (high rise, a pool, etc.) but nice if you're looking for your 'western comforts'. The bar on the roof next to the pool gives excellent city views and the restaurant had a brilliant selection of cuisine with excellent service. I'd probably stay in a BnB next time, but I cannot fault the hotel itself.
Date: Date of stay: March 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Immer wieder gern.
Review Content: Der Pool und die Sky Bar auf dem Dach sind toll und das ganze Hotel ist empfehlenswert.  War schon mehrfach  im Hilton Windhoek und werde wiederkommen. Reservierung ist manchmal langsam aber damit kann man Leben.
Date: Date of stay: December 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: My stay
Review Content: If I was not working over that time I could have left. The room on 1st floor, 103 was really depressing. The furniture, TV channels, everything in that room. Even the tv remote was broken and had no cover at the back. It was the worst experience in a very expensive hotel.
Date: Date of stay: November 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Underwhelmed by staff service
Review Content: Staff were friendly but at our conference they didn't seem to know what was going on. WiFi quality was poor and not free. Food after our conference was bread which is not what we wanted for our guests. Food at restaurant was great.
Date: Date of stay: November 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Annemarie Dunn
Review Content: We stayed for a week at the Hilton Hotel.  I really loved our stay. The room was spacious and lovely with a view of the city. We upgraded to a deluxe room after we went to view it. Little bit more space and a free standing bath. My absolute favorite in the room was the chair, that you can just sink into and relax after a long day out. The bed is King size. The pool area at Sky bar is very relaxing and trendy furniture. Beautiful views over the city from there. The breakfast was the best we had in the whole of Namibia! Crispy Croissants, proper scramble egg.. proper juice that is freshly squeezed .. the only let down is the reception. They need more training. Housekeeping also not very good . They put one chocolate ball on the bed and we two people in the room. This went on for three days.They need training on how to do a Proper turn down..For a 5 star Hotel , they need to work on the English language , they tend to want to speak Afrikaans too much. Waiters at restaurant don't listen carefully to your request. They need to make sure everything on table is functional before service. The salt grinders lid fell of when I was trying to put salt over my food. I had to discard my food! Secondly the Spa didn't motivate me to go for a massage , I just did my nails. They didn't come across as very well trained. My nails started tearing three days after from chemical soaking off.. other than that it's a really great place to stay, apart from small things that can be rectified ..I would definitely let my husband book there again. They must just get proper Spa Therapists there also..
Date: Date of stay: November 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: I officially downgrade this hotel to a 3 star
Review Content: Half of the menu is not available for offer. They serve Bloody Marys but they have no Tabasco or Worcester sauce, half of the ingredients for the drinks not available (they use lemons instead of limes), no pizza because the pizza oven is broken... the list goes on..So disappointed! One truly Namibian owned five star hotel, the only difference is that it is not a five star hotel!
Date: Date of stay: October 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Superbe !

Personnel sympa mais relativement lent (surtout au petit-d√©j et d√Æner).  Propret√© des chambres √† am√©liorer!  Climatisation de la salle de s√©minaire √† revoir.
