Name: Windhoek Hilton
Review Content: The accommodations and hotel staff are absolutely wonderful. There was a good variety of food at the restaurants and the other amenities, i.e. rooftop pool, gym and spa made for a comfortable stay. I would highly recommend it to anyone traveling to the Windhoek area.
Date: Date of stay: September 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Buen conjunto
Review Content: Hotel hotel. Si lo que se busca es un lugar que responda a los c√°nones occidentales de hotel, √©ste es tu sitio. Edificio alto, c√©ntrico, impersonal con todo tipo de servicios: gimnasio (sin monitor, solo hay un trabajador viendo la tele que ni sabe ni te explica el funcionamiento de los aparatos; abierto 24h; dispone de agua y vasos asi como de toallas; para abrir la puerta hay que conectar la llave electronica de la habitacion y por algun fallo cada vez que la acercas suelta una descarga-eso si, para evitar grandes da√±os la manilla est√° aislada con un papel de celof√°n-); piscina peque√±a pero suficiente al aire libre y con vistas increibles a la ciudad; sky bar..de lo mejor-por no decir lo mejor- de la ciudad; habitaciomes grandes, limpias con todo lo necesario para estar c√≥modo. Lo malo: wifi de pago, el agua sale por fuera de la ducha, personal lento en todas partes: recepcion, restaurantes...no hay mapas ni te saben explicar nada de ubicaciones.Lo recomiendo si buscas un hotel, sino es preferible una guest house en zonas mas agradables y visitar su sky bar si cuadra.

Name: Decepcionante . Le sobran dos estrellas
Review Content: Es el primer hotel de cinco estrellas que deja mucho que desear .Tenia muchas ganas de ir , me hice hasta del club honors .Vaya decepcion , me voy a borrar hasta sel club. Lo unico bueno , el desayuno que no es bueno es estupendo, tienen una gran variedad de cosas y todas muy buenas

Name: An oasis of luxury after dusty travel
Review Content: My daughter and I ended up with a spare night in Windhoek, so we decided to stay at the Hilton, a relatively new hotel. The room was lovely, comfortable, beautifully appointed. The location can't be beat. We shopped, returned to our room to drop off our things, then went out again. Didn't have to worry about parking, etc. Dinner there happened to be "Italian night" and was fine. The gift shop had some unusual jewelry that we bought. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would return.
Date: Date of stay: July 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Mooi hotel in centrum van Windhoek
Review Content: Wij hebben hier aan het eind van onze safari geslapen. Het is een mooi hotel midden in het centrum van Windhoek. De stijl is wel erg internationaal waardoor je vergeet dat je in Afrika bent. Echter voor een aantal nachten is dit prima

Name: Bad service and several mistakes!!
Review Content: Bad quality of the service and staff. Middle of the night 3:30am someone from the staff turn on the room speakers and start playing with it, awaking the guests in the several rooms. It's unreasonable such thing in a 5star hotel. Staff didn't excuse for this annoying incident.
Date: Date of stay: August 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Business Traveller
Review Content: Worst experience ever. From blocked shower to slow interned to literally begging the staff to enroll me to the honors programme. Room service also took extremely long to be delivered. The rooms were also not cleaned properly with the shower doors being the worst.
Date: Date of stay: July 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good location, terrible amenities
Review Content: We arrived at Hilton same day as the Indian president delegation. Hotel was full of security checks, police officers and security guards. We booked a room for 2 adults and 1 child but the room was made only for the adults. We had to call reception for an extra bed and the room got very tiny for 2 beds. We had problem with the air conditioner and we had to call 5-6 times for them to solve the problem. Also wifi is only free for HHonors members and connection is terrible. I also had to call for support a couple of times until they fixed the problem. Breakfast was good but the service is very slow. We tried to have the dinner buffet and it took forever to have a waiter to come to our table and take the drinks order and explain the buffet prices and food. Italian night is terrible, I've never seen such Carbonara pasta, may be a Namibian Carbonara. Rooftop swimming pool and bar are really nice ! It was a disappointing stay.
Date: Date of stay: June 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Top nodge as always
Review Content: I have had the pleasure to reside another time in the Hilton. As my flight arrived early in the morning to Windhoek, the friendly and helpful employee Madame Anna A. made sure that I was able to get my booked room way before regular check-in time at 9am, in order to relax after a very long trip.I thank her for the warm welcome and she made my stay very comfortable. Thanks to her and the other friendly employees, I will come again.
Date: Date of stay: June 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: One night stopover after Safari
Review Content: From the moment we arrived the staff at this hotel were friendly, helpful, polite and engaging.  After our safari we were able to chill out and enjoy the rooftop pool and bar, gym, very comfortable, room amenities and wifi.
Date: Date of stay: June 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Everything you'd expect from a Hilton
Review Content: Our one night stay at the Hilton Windhoek was great.  Great central location, amazing room and great food.  We paid for the local buffet dinner where we were able to try some staple Namibian food like mopani worms and the complimentary breakfast in the morning had nice variety and great food.  The Sky Bar was a great location to have a drink at night and look out upon Windhoek
Date: Date of stay: May 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hilton Windhoek
Review Content: The hotel in itself was really good but I do so much work on the road that I depend on Internet. The breakfast is one of the best I have and look forward to my stays there because of it. Staff is friendly and always willing to assist. The internet was terrible but I think it was an issue for the whole country because all the locations I visited, it was the same. Never had internet issues in Windhoek before so I will chalk this up as a problem for the country and not the hotel.
Date: Date of stay: May 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Overated
Review Content: This product is branded as a Hilton. You would expect consistency? After 2x2week stays (Feb 2016 and April 2016) the only consistency is: 1. internet that doesn't work in executive level rooms. 2. Lifts that don't work consistently. 3. Laundry that is returned after you have bedded down (2200hrs) 4. Conferencing staff knock-off at 1500 on a Friday and there is no service over the weekend! 5. The room service menu has many things that don't exist. Really? This is a seriously overrated hotel and poor value for money!!

Name: A tea in the desert
Review Content: After suffering at the Mahogany Springs in Bwindi and the Airport Guest House in Entebbe arrive at Hilton Windhoek was a blessing. My husband had an intestinal infection due to the Mahogany bad food and was very weak when we arrived in Namibia. Thus, the Hilton Windhoek hotel offered us all the best conditions for our rest and my husband recovery. Hilton Windhoek is an excellent hotel.

Name: Great Value and Location
Review Content: We started and ended our Namibia self drive tour at the Hilton.  I have never been a fan of the large corporate hotels, but the management of this hotel has changed my mind.  From the warm welcome to the outstanding breakfast, this hotel tries to make you feel comfortable.  We cannot say enough about Vivian Tjombonde in the executive lounge.  Upon arrival he went out of his way to answer any of our questions and to make us feel welcome.  Rooms are well appointed with all the adequate amenities.  We chose this hotel originally because of its central location but it is always the extra steps that people take that can make your trip special.  Hilton did this so why stay anywhere else?
Date: Date of stay: June 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: BAD SERVICE AND EXPERIENCE
Review Content: Don't accept a room anywhere on the 1st floor, because the disco noice from the basement will make it impossible to sleep, except if one uses medication. Do not expect bottled water in the room unless you call housekeeping to provide it and they might not even give you a choice between still or sparkling.

Name: Great stay at Hilton Windhoek!
Review Content: Just completed a 4 month stay at the Hilton Windhoek.  This is one of the best properties in town in Windhoek. The staff at the hotel go above and beyond to meet your needs.  As a Diamond Hilton Honors member, I have stayed at many properties across the US and abroad, and the executive lounge here is the best that I have experienced. Hats off to Vivian and Gabriel for the personalized attention to each guest in the lounge. Little things like remembering your preferred drink and type of water are greatly appreciated.  I would also like to mention the front desk staff, particularly Elize, Herman, and Christian, for their attention to the many extensions of my stay and excellent customer service.  As a long term guest, the staff at this property really make you feel like a part of the Hilton family. A special thanks is also extended to Chef Emmanuel for his personalized attention to my meals, the 8th floor housekeeping staff (Rakela) and to the amazing porters (Vivian, Gabriel, Fernando, Elvis, and Max) at this property. Job well gone! My only recommendation for improvement is to offer upgrades to your Diamond HHonors members!Dr. Swayzer

Review Content: Das Hilten besuchten wir nach der Ankunft in Windhoek, der Empfang war sehr freundlich und der Check in ging sehr schnell. Das Zimmer war sehr sch√∂n und gro√ü. Das Bad ist ein wahrer Traum. Es sind auch Steckdosen f√ºr deutschen Standard vorhanden. Im  Ein TV gibt es auch ARD und ZDF. Ein Tipp f√ºr Raucher im 4. OG gibt es auch Raucherzimmer. Der W-Lan ist im Lobbybereich frei, an der Rezeption kann man sich einen Code f√ºr den Wifi geben lassen der nach dem login f√ºr 8 Stunden g√ºltig ist. Mit dem Wifi geht auch Skype, auch in der Skybar ist dann W-Lan m√∂glich  so das man am Pool den W-Lan nutzen kann. Der Pool ist mit herrlichem Ausblick √ºber die Stadt auf der Dachterrasse, im Bereich der Skybar. Das Fr√ºhst√ºck l√§st wirklich keine W√ºnsche offen. Alles vorhanden. Besonders lecker fand ich das Omelett. Kalte und Warme speisen, frische S√§fte und Smoothies. Wenn mal etwas fehlen sollte wir dies von der Rezeption sofort erledigt. Vorallem die Lage des Hotels √ºberzeugt, man kann die Sehensw√ºrdigkeiten von Windhoek in kurzer Zeit zu Fu√ü erreichen.Immer gerne wieder. Danke an das Hilton Team

Name: Not recommended for a Sleeping Beauty- but staff do try.
Review Content: Despite being on a high floor, the windows of the hotel do not give 100% protection from construction work noise in the vicinity or any parties from the Sky Bar.  I had to make several phone calls to the duty manager until the DJ in revolt switched off the music 30 minutes late. Food in restaurant at dinner was okay but not breathtaking. Executive Lounge was not what I have experienced in other hotels and the food & beverage quality/quantity needs to be improved. The staff go out of their way to try and resolve things, including the lounge host and duty manager, and reflect the friendliness of Namibia. The concierge staff do need training on what to do around - they were not up to Clefs d'Ors standard. Return to Namibia- definitely. To Hilton Windhoek- possibly.

Name: Dissapointing for the Hilton
Review Content: Cold showers, cold food, slow elevators, and lacklustre service made for a surprisingly average stay in what is normally a hotel you can expect high standards. It could be as the hotel is still relatively new there are still some teething problems, so let's hope these get ironed out. The small pool on the roof is ok for cooling down but not so good for laps, especially as the bottoms and sides are painted all white so be careful not to bang your head! 24 hour gym is a good addition though.
Date: Date of stay: May 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: For a major flag hotel in nation's capital a little short of topnoch
Review Content: I have no comparisons in Windhoek but spent three nights in Hilton recently for conference.  Rooms were nice and clean and okay.  Problems were with magnetic cards for access to rooms and elevators.  Worked at times but had to change at front desk twice.  Food service for lunch on top floor near pool bar  was spotty.  Half the menu was not available and long time for service.Problems with internet connections but IT staff worked hard to rectify but should not have had to call on them twice to resolve connections.  So decent hotel with some problems so only average grade in total.
Date: Date of stay: April 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Not quite 5 value
Review Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 days on a business trip, which was my first experience of this facility, The construction quality is exceptional , with lovely finishing touches and trimmings. This extends to the rooms as well, plenty of space and clever use of glass panels to add artistic ambiance. The bed provides the highest possible comfort. On top of that, the staff is friendly and professional.Bearing my earlier comments in mind, it should provide a solid platform to impress the guest with a memorable experience. Unfortunately significant flaws became apparent. The fillet steak served at dinner was overdone and dry ( ordered medium). Only one side dish served as standard, with my vegetable choice bland and flavorless. Some of the ordered choices at our table were delivered incorrectly. Wrong bill presented to our table. Magnetic room cards frequently lost their information, requiring us to return to the reception desk for reprogramming before entering the room or operating the lift, The lifts, although modern and moving swiftly, required patience for arrival. One of the biggest disappointments was the executive lounge, with peanuts as the primary snack. Wireless is available for a fee, if the guest manage to log in. Out of group of 4 people, only one progressed to successfully use the wireless.In summary, whilst not an unpleasant place to stay, it does not compare well with competitors operating in this hotel category.
Date: Date of stay: April 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Para um Hilton podia ser bem melhor
Review Content: Hotel bem localizado, com comodidade. Pessoal simp√°tico mas servi√ßo aqu√©m da expectativa para um Hilton. Essencialmente necessita de melhor servi√ßo de recep√ß√£o no checkin e checkout e de wifi em condi√ß√µes.

Name: Hilton Hotel world class
Review Content: During my short stay in the hotel i really loved the hotel in prety much all aspects of it,the quality of the rooms is stanning, the restaurant quality is very good, the guest service is very good, overall it is a world class hotel.
Date: Date of stay: February 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Beautiful Rooms but Terrible Dinner Service
Review Content: I am hesitant about recommending this Hilton because of our dining experience, but will still give it a "very good" rating.  Just don't even think of having dinner there!  First, for the positive.  The rooms are beautifully decorated and very well-appointed.  They are modern and spacious.  The architecture of the building is very attractive, and the common areas are comfortable with modern furniture.  They have a roof-top pool with a lovely view.  The shop, although expensive, had a very nice selection of local and regional items.  As for the negative, this must be one of the last hotels in the World to charge for the internet, and at an exorbitant rate as another reviewer pointed out.  Our experience with dinner, unfortunately, was not commensurate with what one would expect at a luxury hotel.  The dining room was quite full that evening and inadequately staffed evidently for a large crowd.  We didn't really understand why - except perhaps that this was a Sunday night?  We were seated at a table that had not been properly cleaned from the previous guests.  We were missing cutlery and napkins, which after 20 minutes of waiting, we ended up pilfering ourselves from another area of the dining room which was evidently laid out for breakfast the next morning.  It took about 45 minutes for our order to be taken.  At this point, we were worried that the kitchen might close before we were served.  We asked for a bread basket since the food was taking so long.  After 15 minutes of waiting, we again resorted to self-service and grabbed a basket ourselves.  The manager was around but seemed completely oblivious to our plight.  The only person who provided decent service and whom we tipped later was the Maitre'D.  She managed to get us a cheese plate for dessert even though we had been told that the kitchen was out of cheese!  Anyway, mixed feelings...
Date: Date of stay: January 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Zu wenig ...
Review Content: Charakterloser, wenn auch zuverl√§ssiger Kettencharakter. Sch√∂ne Bar on top, Pool im Barbereich ist aber zu klein und es f√ºhlt sich komisch an, zwischen Barg√§sten den Pool zu benutzen. Gym ungen√ºgend ausger√ºstet im Kraftbereich. Und der absolute Tiefschlag: WiFi pro Tag und Person USD 17!!!!! Und Fr√ºhst√ºck und Parkplatz auch exklusive!

Name: Great way to start a holiday
Review Content: What a great way to start the holiday. We arrived after a 10 hour journey to the newest hotel in Windhoek. Check in was easy- always a good start. I like the fresh minimalistic look of the hotel.The room was great and the beds super comfortable. My only complaint would be the bathrooms. I am not all for this open door concept. The tub was great and large but no where to put the soap or shampoo. Lived the rooftop bar. Looking forward to a night at the Hilton before we leave.Breakfast was super nice.
Date: Date of stay: December 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: One of the better options in Windhoek
Review Content: I've stayed at the Windhoek Hilton twice now. November 2012 & November 2013.Both times have been pleasant and unproblematic, and you can't beat the location for access on foot to the city centre, the parliament gardens and the Kristuskirche. It also conveniently sits on the main access roads to the big airport and Klein Windhoek in the one direction, and the shortest route to the city bypass/main route connecting North and South. I don't recall being bothered by traffic noise when the windows are closed (air con on).The rooms are a good size and the beds in the double-doubles are comfy with soft linen. The bathrooms are a bit avante guarde for my personal taste in that they're quite "open plan" with the room and involve panels of frosted glass here and there, which is (a) great for adult shadow puppet shows, (b) mildly interesting if you're sharing the room with a loved one and (c) could make for some rather unique holiday memories if there are four adults sharing.The Sky Bar views are lovely, particularly at sunset, however it does seem to be quite a popular drinking hole for the local beautiful people and gets phenomenally crowded with non-resident guests. I wasn't brave enough to have a swim amongst all the bar throng, but some people didn't seem to mind.I was pleased that the Hilton appears to have stopped charging their overnight guests for underground parking in their own building. Although the daily rate in 2012 wasn't extortionate, it did seem an unnecessary annoyance last time. The wi-fi isn't free. It isn't expensive either, but to Europeans used to it being standard and available all over, again, it does come across as an annoying petty revenue stream. In 2012, our room was just outside the reach of the wi-fi transmitter, so the best reception was sitting on the floor outside the room. In 2013 we were fairly close to the lifts and the reception in the room was fine. When a remote tent camp in Sossusvlei can manage free wi-fi, it does seem reasonable that the Hilton brand could chuck it in free too.The breakfast buffet isnt bad, but a limited number of staff are trying to do too many tasks, like serve coffee, clear tables, lay tables and replenish the buffet. And none of them very well as a result. It would probably ease some of the stressload if the coffee was self-service from an urn, rather than guests needing to catch the eye of the over-busy lady zealously guarding the flask. The ladies cooking the eggs to order are just fabulous and their omelettes are lovely. The lifts this visit were a bit confusing at first as nobody had mentioned you needed to touch your key card to the panel to activate the buttons to the room floors. Consequently I had a few extra journeys back and forth from the sky bar to the lobby before the penny dropped. And then the second penny dropped as to why this was possibly the case.I can't comment on the restaurants in the hotel, or the room service as we were keen to explore and eat out. We didn't have a bottle opener in our room for a cold beer from the mini bar, but I guess we could have rung housekeeping if we didn't already have our own with us.The lobby staff were attentive and effective.It's a pleasant enough hotel - certainly one of the better ones in Windhoek. Clearly not in everybody's budget but there are savings to be had with advanced payment. We'll be staying there again next visit.
Date: Date of stay: November 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Central & modern, but anonymous service
Review Content: I spent one night at the Hilton in Windhoek, a new property centrally located, with great terrace bar and spa.  The rooms are elegant but there is no separation between the bedroom and bathroom. You have to pay for wifi and breakfast separately.  The front desk staff is not terribly friendly. For what you pay,  you don't really feel all that welcome.
Date: Date of stay: October 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

The gym and pool facilities and being able to walk to most meetings adds to the pleasure of a visit.  Good value for money, fantastic rooms and a great breakfast.  Improvement opportunities: Internet and Parking are charged as extra's.

Review Content: Hilton Windhoek is.....(one word)....AMAZING!!!!! The staff seem very well trained, they have customer care service and guest relations etiquette. But most of all, the comfort and ambiance surrounding the hotel is refreshing.

Der Service war schlecht, am Konferenztag waren alle Beteiligten und Verantwortlichen des Hotels hilflos und unentschlossen(oder garnicht erst anwesend), auftretende Probleme zu l√∂sen, Alle Versuche, vorher (am Wochenende) einen Probelauf zu veranstalten scheiterten daran, dass niemand an die Ger√§te herankam, eingeschlossen beim Gesch√§ftsf√ºhrer.Dies w√§re in mitteleurop√§ischer Landschaft verschiedenster Anbieter undenkbar ...schade .aber irgendwann wird auch hier der Servicegedanke Einzug halten... irgendwann

Name: Good hotel, lousy transportation service!
Review Content: Very nice hotel, but do not trust them to arrange for your transport to and from the airport. Book your won taxi - you will be much better off. Other than that, the hotel is clean and nice. It is centrally located and good for business meetings, etc.

Name: Good choice
Review Content: Very good central location; great roof-top bar and lap pool. Large comfortable room with good bathroom (except bath overflow not plumbed in so we had a minor flood). Breakfast generally good, especially the juice bar. A good choice if you are going to windhoek, although the city itself appears to have little to offer the average tourist.
Date: Date of stay: May 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Best hotel in Windhoek - pricey but good quality
Review Content: This Hilton does not fall short of expectations you can have of a good business hotel and even provides you with a bit more services than the usual hotel.Very nice room with good facilities.One issue is the price which seems to be the highest in Windhoek for a night. Beware, the Internet is available but is extra ! I tought that at that price, it could have been included. So is the parking !Dont forget to use the gym and /or the pool on the top floor in the morning to start a great day.There is a lounge bar with jazz bands playing every night + a very good restaurant that attracts people from the town. Try it : their beef filet medium rare was excellent and service was slick !
Date: Date of stay: April 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great hotel, but would it be so good without the Sky bar
Review Content: Stayed 11 nights in March and like all the reviews, the sky bar views are amazing. Great sports bar too and good restaurant. Mains are fantastic, but the side dishes are poor. Great staff, special thanks to Aubrey who assisted with my lost luggage and taxi requirements. It's a business traveller hotel really but of a high standard.
Date: Date of stay: March 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Review Content: New hotel, perfect situation and natural kind service. Rooms are silent and clean as new room should be. I have booked tree times to this hotel and I have bee satisfation every time.Thank you! Will come back. Hope very soon!!!

Name: Great hotel in Windhoek
Review Content: I stay at this hotel on a regular basis.The rooms are spacious, clean with wonderful big bathrooms (shower and bath)The WHISKY range is unfortunately poor for a five star establishment.Breakfasts are good with freshly squeezed apple juice.Two cakes of soap would be nice.Great place to stay.
Date: Date of stay: March 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Lovely, Great Location
Review Content: This hotel was wonderful.  Check-in was quick and easy.  I scheduled a taxi to take me to the airport when I checked out.  It was only $35.  The staff was very helpful.  My room was wonderful.  The bed was comfortable with great sheets.  The bathroom was roomy with great lighting and a nice big mirror.  The shower was separate from the tub.  You would not want to stay here with a business colleague though because there was no door separating the room from the bathroom.  The toilet is in its own room, however.  The only annoying part was there were no outlets in the bathroom to plug things in except for a shaver.  Why wouldn't there be outlets for a blow dryer and curling iron?  I ate dinner in the more upscale restaurant.  The steak was wonderful, as was the wine.  Plus, it was really inexpensive.  We then grabbed some drinks at the bar, which was also nice.  The free breakfast in the morning is incredible.  There is so much to pick from.  The only major downfall was the lack of free wifi.  You couldn't even get free wifi in the lobby.  The hotel is in a great location for shopping.  It's a couple minute walk to great souvenir shops and a mall.  I would stay here again.
Date: Date of stay: November 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: a home away from home!
Review Content: Windhoek Hilton is centrally located next to the Kalahari Sands hotel (have not stayed there) and has an amazing view of the downtown and the mountains surounding the city. The rooms are well furnished and brand new. The rooftop swimming pool is rather small and thin but has a sky bar facing the pool and with a view of the city. Many seem to enjoy the rooftop Sky bar. The restaurant is excellent. If you stay on a room only basis, complementary breakfast is offered. Breakfast is wide and varied including crusty croissants, warm food and meat. A good selection of fresh fruit juices and an excellent array of fine teas. We were with children and received an adjoining room with twin beds free of charge. Staff are happy to see the small children, even when they make a bit of noise in the restaurant. It is a childfriendly country. There is free parking. The only downside is the room service. It is extremely slow and the staff are not on a five star level with the knowledge of food. The chef prepares excellent food but the waitress or the cook on duty who brings it can mix it up. When I ordered "pasta with pesto" they managed to put vegetables with the pesto and the on top of it, brought "'kech up" just incase I find it too "boring". The waitress actually looked pitiful at me who would eat a green sauce. But the staff are extremely nice and gave me a 50 % discount to apologise for mixing up the order. In general it was a great stay and I would complain of nothing.
Date: Date of stay: September 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: The Best to date
Review Content: Having heard so much about this hotel I was pleased to find the facts were true.  The staff are excellent, the room was clean tidy well appointed and the service areas all well equipped and laid out.  A short stop for me overnight but the staff were there for all my needs.  Will be back next time for sure and as I now have found what I believe to be the best in Windhoek will  not go elsewhere.Minor reception computer glitches/slow caused some issues but that as it may is minor in the scale of things.  Thanks for this & future stays.
Date: Date of stay: August 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Best in Windhoek
Review Content: I stayed for one night in windhoek and can say that i would stay there again. The best hotel in Windhoek and miles ahead than the rest.The property is new and the rooms are spacious. The fittings and furnishings are world-class and so are the toiletries. And the views from the room and the hotel roof-top are lovely. However, the check-in was a bit of a disappointment and felt that it could improve a lot and hence the 4 star rating.
Date: Date of stay: June 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great Hilton Service and Fab Rooms
Review Content: Rooms were amazing and the roof bar was great.  Breakfast was huge.  A few very minor rough edges on the dining room service but the front desk and car parking people were perfect.Room was spotless and designed well.  Free wifi would have made it 5 stars.
Date: Date of stay: January 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Superb
Review Content: The Hilton hotel Windhoek opened in April or May 2011, so everything is shiny and new, including the very friendly and professional staff.Nice rooms, best location in Windhoek, close to shops and restaurants, rooftop pool, good breakfast. AND cheap. Paid around $135 per night in Sep 2011, which is a steal for this kind of hotel. I suppose it's only this cheap because it has not much repeat business yet, which will surely change....
Date: Date of stay: September 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Service needs attention
Review Content: The facilities at the hotel were excellent and the decor inn the foyer was very appropriate to Namibia. The room I stayed in had an extremely comfortable bed and was beautifully decorated. I would return in the hope the the niggles I mention below will have been addrressed,The temerature of the water during my shower fluctauated continuously without my adjusting the tap, varying from uncomfortably hot water to cold water in an instant. What also needs attention is the level of service provided. despite the staff I met being eager to please there were some problems. I alerted the IT department thatt the internet in my room was not working. Very soon after an maintenance person arrived but could not fix the problem, stating that a technical person from T would need to attend to the problem, only to be told then that this could not happen as the IT person was asleep - this at 20:30!. The other incident was when I went down for breakfast at 07:20. I arrived to closed doors, with the explanation that the restaurant manager had not arrived yet to open the doors despite the opening hour being 07:00. A staff member did kindly offer to take my order and bring my breakfast up to my room, which they did within 12 minutes - but unfortunately did not deliver what I had ordered.
Date: Date of stay: June 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hilton Windhoek - tired and tatty
Review Content: The Hilton Windhoek was once an good hotel but is now tired and tatty. Not five star standard anymore. Paying ¬£350 ($400) a night. No porter on arrival to take bags to room.  The rooms are clean but tired. Breakfast included in room rate but they want to charge additional for having a capuccino with breakfast. Who charges extra for coffee with breakfast? This is unheard of - especially at ¬£350 a night. Way over-priced. Not recommended.
Date: Date of stay: March 2023This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: COVID impacts were tangible
Review Content: Great reception staff who were very friendly and helpful.Full and proper sanitation observed throughout hotel. Unfortunately the restaurant was not able to serve some items on the menu on account of disrupted supply due to COVID
Date: Date of stay: November 2020This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Shocking Stay
Review Content: Stay away!! Shocking Rooms, showerdoors cant close properly, leaking onto the bathroom floor.Stay Away from the skybar, personal are not trained to handle the faciity as a restaurant.. shocking service.
Date: Date of stay: December 2021This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great 2 night stay!
Review Content: First off, let me start by saying we were only supposed to stay here 1 night but due to weather conditions our flight to another lodge was cancelled which resulted in us coming right back after checking out a few hours before. The team immediately got us a great rate for the second night and asked if we wanted our same room back (which had been upgraded from what we booked) so we said yes that would be fantastic. The team helped our plans that had gone awry and turned it into a fabulous extra night stay. Every member of the staff is so friendly and goes above and beyond in any way they can. Stay here!
Date: Date of stay: June 2021This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Honest Review
Review Content: The hotel is in a central/good location about 45 minutes from the airport, and is very clean, nice decor and ammenties, however the food services both in room dining restaurant from personnel are very poor.  Long wait for simple food, and not follow up.  Desk & Concierge are lovely and helpful in navtigating.
Date: Date of stay: November 2022This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Overall good but no FREE airport transfer
Review Content: My only disappointment with my experience was the airport transfer. The airport is VERY far from the city center. I called prior to booking to ask if they had FREE airport transfer and they said yes. I booked and then soon found out that wasn't the case. I ended up spending an extra $70 (USD) getting to and from the airport. The hotel itself was fine. It was clean, I felt safe, the wifi was good and the bed was comfy. The food was OK for hotel food.
Date: Date of stay: September 2021This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Comfortable stay
Review Content: A week stay for business. Very comfortable room, nice gym, good breakfast. Location was good for my office, but I'm not sure where the centre of town is? Very spread out. Frustratingly slow lifts, and I wish there was the option of taking stairs for just a few floors. That seems to be the way with security nowadays
Date: Date of stay: February 2023This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great place to stay after a safari
Review Content: We stayed here for one night after traveling around the country. Comfortable hotel around the corner from the outdoor craft market. About a block away from the craft center. Room was well appointed.  Shower had nice water pressure. Good breakfast buffet. We organized airport transfer through the hotel. We would stay here again.
Date: Date of stay: August 2023This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Convenient hotel. Maybe a little corporate
Review Content: Very good corporate hotel. Although it has a pool, we only stayed one night so did not have time to take advantage of it. Lovely views of the city from rooftop pool and bar.  A little confusion on check in dealt with fairly quickly. I would stay again.
Date: Date of stay: October 2022This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Top Hotel
Review Content: Ich w√ºrde dieses Hotel jederzeit wieder buchen. Das Zimmer war gro√ü, sauber und modern. Ich erhielt ohne Fragen ein Upgrade. Das Essen bei der gebuchten Halbpension war sehr gut. Insbesondere positiv zu erw√§hnen ist die Bar und der Pool auf der Dachterrasse mit einem tollen Blick auf den Sonnenuntergang.
Date: Date of stay: March 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hotel is nice but beware of the noise
Review Content: We cannot fault our stay at the Hilton WDH, when it comes to location, friendliness of staff, food and beverages as well as the quality of bedding.However, as we booked a suite, we were allocated room 700, overlooking the construction of the extension of the hotel.And believe it or not, work starts at 07:00 AM on a Sunday morning !Although, as said before, staff has always been very friendly and helpful. However, this was not the case for our breakfast visit to the lounge with an unmotivated and rude staff member (as well as very limited choice).
Date: Date of stay: August 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great roof top bar!
Review Content: Really enjoyed the sunset while having a beer. Not much else to do in Windhoek proper, so this bar was a nice find. Really well priced,  with a nice pizza. Good looking clientele. Will definitely go back if ever there again in Windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: March 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: DISAPPOINTED GUEST
Review Content: 2 weeks ago I stayed at the Hilton in Windhoek for 3 nights. Given that the Hilton claims to be 5 star I was rather disappointed with a number of issues. Whilst the staff were very friendly that unfortunately does not make up for the following:1.	Arrived around 12H20 on the Monday. I was pre booked on the system but no non smoking rooms  available at that stage so I said I would wait in the foyer until my room was available. I was sitting in full sight of the reception. Eventually at 14Hoo I went back and was then told my room was ready. Why not call me as soon as it was ‚Äì not leave me to wait?2.	Whilst waiting I decided I would like a sandwich. Ordered a pastrami on rye ‚Äì fairly standard.. After a few minutes sorry not available. Asked what is available ‚Äì nothing. This is a 5 star hotel with no sandwiches available?3.	That evening ate in the Restaurant. At least 4 courses on the al le carte not available ‚Äì this is a 5 star hotel in a city that is certainly not a backwater of the world. Why retain the dishes if you cannot offer them4.	Ordered a 200gm sirloin medium rare. Even the Dros and Spur (fast food outlets) can get that right. Overdone. Should have sent it back but I was tired. They offered free dessert as compensation which my companions enjoyed. 5.	Next night still dishes not available so had buffet. For a 5 star not up to scratch. In fact eaten better in a 2/3 star6.	Wednesday night German buffet. Quite honestly the chef needs to visit Germany and Austria to really understand the delicacies of Germanic food and how it should be properly served.  Perhaps folk from outside Europe who have never visited Germany and Austria may think it was fine. I did not. 7.	I use the gym/fitness station. The one morning at 6H30 no towels no paper cups and the place was a mess. Many executives like to exercise before work. That was not inviting.8.	Last night of my stay only 1 milk sachet on the self service refreshments in the room. Therefore either tea before bed or coffee in the morning. Not both. I know there is a limited range of competition in Windhoek but this Hotel really needs to look to its laurelsPieter Williams
Date: Date of stay: September 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good location
Review Content: Stayed here for 1 night at the end of a Namibian safari and the hotel is in an excellent location.Only a few minutes walk to the craft market, the airport is not too far away and there are various shops on the doorstep as well.The roof bar is very good for having a drink to watch the sun go down also.The room was clean and comfortable and consistent with Hilton's international standards.
Date: Date of stay: September 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Shabby looking furniture and broken appliances
Review Content: + nice big room, comfortable bed+ great view from sky bar - our iron was broken. I asked for a working one and was promised one right away but never got it - one sliding door missing, the other one broken- not functioning light switch- hotel staff opening room door without knocking (it was apparently to give us a ‚Äògood night‚Äò chocolate which we never got) - hotel staff knocking on door at 7.50 am without reason. (‚ÄòOh, we come back later‚Äô)All in all I wouldn‚Äôt recommend the hotel. Too many negative points for a 4* establishment.
Date: Date of stay: July 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Tolles Hotel, immer gern wieder
Review Content: Tolle einladende und gem√ºtliche Zimmer, bequeme riesige Betten, nette Skybar auf dem Dach mit traumhaftem Blick √ºber die Stadt, am Tage und man Abend ein Muss, ran ist traumhaft! Zum Fr√ºhst√ºck alles, was man sich w√ºnscht!
Date: Date of stay: January 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Sch√∂nes Stadthotel
Review Content: Wir haben zu Beginn und zum Abschluss unserer Namibiareise jeweils eine Nacht hier gebucht. Zimmer sind sch√∂n und sauber, das Personal war sehr freundlich und das Fr√ºhst√ºck √ºberaus √ºppig und lecker. Von dort aus kann man entspannt zur Erkundung des Landes aufbrechen und am Ende der Reise noch einmal seine Eindr√ºcke Revue passieren lassen und sich von einer tollen, aber auch anstrengenden Rundreise erholen.Wir haben uns wohl gef√ºhlt!
Date: Date of stay: June 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good hotel, but lack of service
Review Content: We stayed at Hilton for several nights. Rooms were clean, breakfast was good and the gym and pool were good as well, but every single day we were missing towels in our room, got completely different service level than our friends in the next room (we had one reservation done together) and never got apologized for the bad service we got. We were 6 girls traveling and had booked 2 rooms of 3 people. The others got big beds and we needed to share a 120 cm wide bed, which obviously didn't give us good sleep. We never had towels for 3 even though every night we had paid a lot of extra for the 3rd person, called the reception several times and went to take there face to face, while the other room of 3 had bathrobes, slippers, chocolates etc. in their room all the time for everyone. Therefore I felt that in our case Hilton was totally overpriced and didn't meet the expectations. We paid the very same price for the room and got tremendously worse service than our friends. And even though we pointed this out many times for Hilton staff, they did nothing, which was the worse thing to happen.
Date: Date of stay: October 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Worst Hilton Ever
Review Content: This is seriously the worst Hilton I have ever stayed in.  From the nonchalant, non caring staff, to the towels with big holes in them, to Internet that doesn't work with Apple devices, to the lack of any amenities in the room (iron, minibar etc).  Just a woeful experience. How you can charge NAD$1880 per night, call yourself a Hilton and treat your guests like this is beyond me. Do yourself a favor and stay at a 3 star hotel for half the price and I will guarantee you will have a better stay.
Date: Date of stay: March 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: good place shabby guests and sub standard management
Review Content: Overall impressed by the Hilton though one incident had me leaving with a bad taste and I wont be returning to stay here again. The good bits first the breakfast was very good great choice of traditional and healthy breakfast items. Rooms were good and clean but that what I would expect. I dont appreciate having to pay for a WiFi connection in this type of hotel from the room when the public areas are free. Cheapskates. Myself and a colleague had a particular unpleasant incident in the bar area. Four local guys who had obviously been on the sauce all day were very verbal and keen to spout all sorts of racial abuse in our general direction. We asked to see the manager after the bar staff refused to intervene. The manager wasn't much better and showed no backbone in dealing with the matter. The group eventually left only to return 20 mins later.          Not the sort of thing you expect in a 4 star hotel bar. Not good enough Hilton
Date: Date of stay: June 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Badezimmer
Review Content: Das Zimmer ist vollst√§ndig eingerichtet, sogar mit einem Deutsch sprechenden Fernsehsender. Das Badezimmer sollte aber als geschlossener Raum getrennt gegen√ºber dem Schlaftrakt sein. Der Schlafende kann durch das Licht und Ger√§usche vom Badezimmer gest√∂rt werden.
Date: Date of stay: November 2015This review is the subjective opinion of an individual contributor and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: This is non a Hilton and it's not a Five stars hotel
Review Content: Poor service both management and staff. 45 min for a club sandwich?! 45 min to discover that what you ordered is not available anymore.?!Broken shower...water all over. Mini bar with rests of previous guest. Poor cleaning specially in bathroom. An this did not happen only to us but also two our friends travelling with us. It was not high season so the hotel was not fully booked. So we cannot consider this as a one off accident. Simply this hotel does not meet the standards of it's brand  and of the 5stars rating. When you don't know a city and you cannot rely on advices...the only thing you can rely on are international standards...well this was not the case.
Date: Date of stay: February 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice place for a night
Review Content: We stayed at Hilton Windhoek on our trip to Namibia. The hotel is good, it is a new hotel. The rooms are just like rooms in Europe hotels from Hilton. A very good bed and bathroom. We also had diner at the hotel and that was also very good. Ask for the butternut risotto.The breakfast is good with a wide choice off things. The only thing that is not like Hilton are the elevators, they are very slow. If you use the elevator that is used for the baggage it is oke.
Date: Date of stay: May 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: I Enjoyed My 1st Hilton Experiance .......But
Review Content: This is a amendment to my review posted in early September - I was lucky to sample the Hilton experience 3 times over a 3 week period , I was working offshore and when flying into Windhoek I was lucky to stay in the Hilton overnight before continuing my journey to Joburg / London the next day .The Hilton in Windhoek has a unique turret type design , checking in reception was quick and the staff were very professional .The lobby reception decor was very pleasing on the eye and a short elevator journey to my room I was " gob smacked " with everything about the room , king sized bed - well designed on suite bathroom , very clean and well presented .After checking out the hotel on the Internet I was looking forward to going up to then 9th floor to check out the roof top bar , pool and chill out area and I was not disappointed .The views of Windhoek and beyond we're brilliant and a cheeky brandy and ginger (my 1st drink for 5 weeks) was just the ticket to soak in the views. There is a 24 hour Gym to keep you fit and healthy but I'm sorry to say a few more drinks was my priority .When I thought all my boxes had been ticked night time changed the Sky bar vibe from a day time sunny chill out zone to a buzzing night time up beat experience and the nightime views of the city did not disappoint .A few more drinks later I returned to my room to watch a bit of TV and to have a meal and then get a good nights kip before a early start in the morning .Below there are 2 different meal reviews one for a meal I had delivered to my room and the the 2nd was a meal I had in the Exipa.For my 1st meal I  decided to order some room service , baby chicken with sweet potato fries & salad  the room menu sold me my meal choice and I couldn't wait to tuck into some 5 star Hilton Style cooking and  the food arrived and it was "cooking eye candy" on a plate .The chicken was cooked to perfection end the sweet potato fries were naughty but part of my 5 a day health option so I didn't feel guilty eating them all , a early visit to the gym this morning made it all worth while .The night before I order breakfast to my room , cereal , toast and british tea what a way to start my day .My 2nd meal review which was on my last visit to the Hilton " 27 Sept "After settling in to my room and having a shower to freshen up I decided to have a meal in the Hotel Exipa resteraunt with a co-worker who was also staying a few days before travelling home .I love a good steak so I ordered the " Rib eye " steak , the resteraunt waitress sold me the steak and I was drooling with antisipation waiting for my meal .When it arrived the steak was a little small but with the sweet potatoe fries and salad my plate was full , I ordered my steak to be cooked medium to well done .But after cutting my first steak mouthful I realised the meat choice was poor quality , tasteless , and chewy .Infact I couldn't swallow it , I then tried another slice and it was just as bad .The waitress came to our table and asked how are meals were my friend said his burger was excellent but I had to be honest and say I couldn't eat my steak .I know it's not the waitresses fault but I said I couldn't believe that a restaurant associated with the HIlton brand could serve up a poor steak .My work colleagues on the rig who have stayed at the Hilton did warn me about the poor steaks but I didn't believe then until I tried it for myself .I wasnt charged for my meal but I was left disappointed that no one else has complained about their steaks .I didn't go to bed hungry we took the elevator up to the 9th floor and I had a drink and bar snack overlooking the stunning night views of Windhoek .The next day I contacted the hotel manager to give him my feedback of my steak experiance and he did say he was going to discuss with the catering manager why the Hilton was buying poor cuts of meat and serving them to customers I also discussed my other issue with him and that was why isn't WiFi free in the hotel , and  the cost was $20 plus per day per appliance so if you had a laptop , a iPad and a iPhone and you wanted hotel Internet .....do the maths .Again he said it was something the hotel was looking into , so the hotel must be coining it in with the Internet .The clientele you have from all corners of the world need free Internet , Mr Hilton must spend millions keeping his hotels at their best , having free Internet will go a long way to looking after all your customers needs .But I don't want to finish on a negative I loved my Hilton experience , the hotel has it all , the rooms and facilities are excellent unfortunately because of my steak and the Internet issues I can't give you 5 stars .But if the manager acts on the customers feedback the Hilton Windhoek will be ready to fly the Hilton flag for Namibia .
Date: Date of stay: September 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: beautiful hotel, but the service overall was pathetic!
Review Content: Still waiting for room service! they just never bothered with it! Bar lady on rooftop pool area was really not in the mood to work, her concentration was so pathetic that when i paid for my drinks, she asked me again for the money upon exiting in front of all the other guests!!!!!
Date: Date of stay: December 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Goed hotel maar koud en bruin water
Review Content: Het probleem in het Hilton was, dat we 3 dagen lang koud en wat bruin gekleurd water hadden. Geen plezier om hiermee te douchen. De reactie van de receptie was, dat er aan werd gewerkt, verder niets. Van een hotel met de naam Hilton kun je toch beter verwachten. We zijn op 12 andere plaatsen in Namibi√´ geweest en overal was de waterkwaliteit en watertemperatuur in orde Niet dus in het Hilton. Voor het overige was het hotel prima!
Date: Date of stay: February 2020This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Excellent rooms and service
Review Content: The Hilton Windhoek is centrally located with spacious and clean rooms. The staff go the extra mile to make your stay comfortable and pleasant. Breakfast in the Ekipa restaurant is delicious and the rooftop lounge has spectacular views of Windhoek. Every staff member is professional and helpful. A great place to stay in Windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: September 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Right stop before departure
Review Content: It is a good spot for the night before the flight, it is only 40 minutes max from Windhoek airport and really close to the centre.The rooms are wide and clean and they offer a good sleep. The service is a little bit confusional (no one knew where our car was parked and the bags took a while before being delivered to the room).The rooftop has a nice view on the city. The food is good.
Date: Date of stay: April 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Paradise by the traffic light...
Review Content: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel on the main road of Windhoek and went a little bit overboard with the type of room: the garden room on the executive 9th floor. It is lovely. You have your own huge balcony measuring approximately 10x10 meters half of which is a garden! The room comes with free breakfast and buffet dinner in a small executive lounge. So treat yourself and go for it. AND if you need a male haircut just cross the street where you find TATEKULU barbershop. Really excellent!!! You get far more than you can imagine. The result is stunning. So go anyway just for the experience!!!
Date: Date of stay: February 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice hotel, but i was expecting more.
Review Content: We decided to do a quick 2 day tour of Namibia, the hotel of choice in Windhoek was the Hilton. By far the biggest establishment in the town. I had a specific requirement and Irma Kubas (PA to the GM) was amazing in getting me sorted. The rooms were decent, modern and clean. The menu offerings are good enough to satisfy most needs. The jewel of the establishment has to be the Sky Bar, situated on the 9th floor it gives access to views of the city, a lap pool and of course the bar. The internet connectivity was a big let down, i was told that there was only 10mb available to hotel guests, and this made it almost impossible to do any meaningful work that required an internet connection. I guess i dont really need to say this, but please lock away your valuables, i was silly enough to leave money lying around and needless to say after the cleaning staff had been by a portion of it had vanished.
Date: Date of stay: December 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Die schlechteste Hilton Erfahrung die wir bisher gemacht haben
Review Content: Das war bisher unsere schlechteste Hilton Erfahrung die wir gemacht haben.Ein vorzeitiges CheckIn ohne Aufpreis war m√∂glich (ca. 1Std. vor regul√§rem Check In) und das war auch das einzige positive was es zu berichten gibt.Das Peronal am Frontdesk hat ihren Job gemacht aber mehr auch nicht.Das Zimmer war nur oberfl√§chlich gereinigt, es hat etwas unangenehm gerochen, das Fenster war von innen und au√üen total dreckig und die Abdeckung der Duscharmatur hat gefehlt.Auf der obersten Etage liegt die Sky Bar, die auch entt√§uschend war (mehr dazu in separater Bewertung).Das Fr√ºhst√ºck war gut aber auch nichts besonderes.
Date: Date of stay: November 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great Stay
Review Content: This is a gem of a hotel in Windhoek. Situated centrally in the city, it is walking distance to the shops, museum and main areas.We made full use of the executive lounge as well as the sky bar and the rooftop pool. The food at breakfast was also superb!
Date: Date of stay: July 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Eerste overnachting tijdens groepsreis
Review Content: Het hotel is mooi, mlaar de service aan de receptie laat te wensen over.  Bij aankomst waren een aantal kamers klaar, maar  3 kamers nog niet. Dat is aanvaardbaar aangezien we daar in de vroege namiddag aankwamen. Maar dat het  3 uur duurt om de laatste 3 kamers klaar te maken is te veel. Met 6 personen hebben we  3 uur gewacht. De enige plaats was de bar, de mensen die er de service deden waren behulpzaam, maar ook daar verliep alles moeilijk en niet vlot.Alles duurde zeer lang.  Ik denk dat er veel mankeert aan de leiding van het hotel.
Date: Date of stay: December 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Comfort and style
Review Content: The Hilton Hotel at Windhoek has only one fault as far as I am concerned - it's damn near impossible to find the hairdryer, because it's in a drawer under the desk, a drawer that doesn't even look like a drawer. Apart from that everything is fine, and service is very good. When I asked housekeeping for just a sheet instead of the duvet, it appeared within minutes.
Date: Date of stay: September 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A decent place to stay!
Review Content: After long flights and feeling exhausted this was an oasis in the desert! (well, in Windhoek anyway). Easy to find off the main road in from the airport, with easy check in, valet parking (at a small cost) in the basement and decent breakfast. The sky bar is worth a visit for a sundowner and does decent food. Nothing negative to say after a one night stay - the key for us was that this was so easy to find.....

As for the food, very disgusting freezed sushi with even not 1 gram of vile salmon on the top. As all on the in room dining is deep-freezed... So disappointing and definitely not at the level to be an "hilton": no cotton in the bathroom, toilet in the very next to the bed with not discreet windows, executive lounge in the up floor very very poor (does NOT worth at all however the staff of this lounge was careful), and the airport transfer was pure AMATEURISM

Name: Exceptional hotel in central location
Review Content: This is a beautiful contemporary style hotel.  The rooftop long, skinny lap pool is beautiful and connects to the Skybar.  From the Skybar can be seen the most amazing sunsets I have ever seen.  People not staying at the hotel come here just for the sunset views.  The breakfast buffet is quite nice with the normal offerings of an upscale hotel.  The staff is very attentive and anxious to help.  The executive lounge provides an exclusive setting with its has glass walls.
Date: Date of stay: February 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Esperamos quase 2h at√© que a situa√ß√£o fosse resolvida e n√£o houve sequer a preocupa√ß√£o de nos oferecerem qualquer cortesia, o que demonstra uma grande falta depreocupa√ß√£o com o cliente.N√£o t√™m casas de banho comuns equipadas com muda-fraldas e, uma vez que n√£o tinhamos o quarto dispon√≠vel, tive que  mudar a fralda √† beb√© sobre as pernas, no WC das senhoras.A limpeza dos quartos tamb√©m deixa bastante a desejar.

Name: Leider nicht was wir erwartet hatten...

Von fehlenden Hausschuhen √ºber fehlende Badem√§ntel (Standard bei 5 Sternen) bis hin zu lauter Musik bis in den sp√§ten Abend war alles vorhanden. Der Gipfel war aber das Fr√ºhst√ºck. Das Angebot ist eigentlich sehr gut, aber leider waren sowohl Kaffee, als auch Tee v√∂llig ungenie√übar (muffig, chlorig). Der Manager hatte zur Ausrede, dass es Probleme mit der Wasserversorgung gab. Komischerweise war der Kaffee im Slowtown oder bei Cramer's gleich neben an tadellos. Hier h√§tte ich erwartet, dass automatisch auf Flaschen-Wasser "umgeswitcht" wird, wurde aber nicht. Ansonsten war das Restaurant einwnadfrei und das Personal sehr freundlich.
