Name: Lived upto expectations
Review Content: Another excellent stay at this hotel. Breathtaking views from the sky bar and a warm pool, even in winter. Room was clean and everything working. Staff friendly and helpful. Only small complaint (from three visits in nine months)was trying to check in when no one knew when my room would be available but I was in by about 4pm. Will be going back next time I am in town.
Date: Date of stay: June 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Friendly delightful staff. Very obliging and everything you'd expect from the Hilton
Review Content: Was really looked after very well here. Spent some time in the executive areas which are a must see. Spa was fully booked for the days I was there but otherwise everything superb. Food, service, amenities.
Date: Date of stay: March 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Roof top swimming pool leak through the roof to the 5th floor!
Review Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times. It has always been good and still is many ways. However I will not stay again until they have fixed what I believe to be a major risk to safety of guests. The roof top swimming pool is leaking and obviously has been for some time, so much so that it has caused damage to the marble flooring on the 5th floor, 4 floors below. I am not a structural engineer, but would guess it is only a matter of time until the ceiling on the 9th floor collapses causing a potential risk to life below.I reported this to reception who claimed they were unaware, which I do not believe. They didn't to the best of my knowledge even report it.
Date: Date of stay: January 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice end to Holiday
Review Content: This was last stop on 3 week trip to Namibia.Lovely hotel with very modern decor.Nice roof top bar to view the sunset before a nice meal in the restaurant.Only criticism, which I am sure a lot of people will point out, is that there is a lot of construction work going on around the Hotel.   We arrived on a Sunday so all was quiet as no work being done on Sunday but come Monday morning and it was very noisy.This is obviously something the Hotel has no control of and is no way intended as a criticism of the Hotel.There is parking under the Hotel and free wifi is available in lobby area and on the roof.    It has to be paid for to be used in room.
Date: Date of stay: September 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Sky Bar: Only the view is five star
Review Content: This is not a review of the hotel, since I haven't stayed there. It is a review only of the sky bar on top of the building. The best view you can get of Windhoek, the place to be for a sunset drink (the sundowner, never to be missed anywhere, and definitely not in Africa). So, location wise, nothing can beat the bar. Service wise, I doubt that any shebeen in Katutura could be worse (no offense, guys...). Spent a number of sunsets up there, and the service experience was frightful every single time. First of all, you wait for a long, long time, despite your best efforts, before anyone of the staff believes you might be worth their attention. Second, once you managed to catch their attention, you will find that not all is as it seems. Order a bottle of wine from the menu not everyone orders, and all you hear is "we don't have this". Insist, and you might convince people that looking into the fridge might help. And when you order a second bottle of the same wine, chances are you will be told that it might take a while before that bottle has been brought up from the restaurant. Last time I was there, getting the bottle took the better part of an hour. Not to forget that I was once told there was no Coke. Or that the parking boom didn't work, even though everything had been paid at reception. And on and on the lousy service stories go. So, all in all: Location - excellent. Service - unspeakable, given that the place's pretension is to be five star. Do go there for the view. And brace for a one of a kind five star service experience.
Date: Date of stay: July 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Wonderful Service
Review Content: When you're greeted warmly upon entry and each time you show your face, how bad can it be? Service is excellent. The rooms are well appointed. Security is excellent because it's there but very unobtrusive. Location is good. The rooms are comfortable, well maintained, and very comfortable. I recommend you check the electrical connections for the hotel and Namibia and plan accordingly. Overall a very acceptable property above the standard Hilton excellence.
Date: Date of stay: April 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Had issues but ended up happy
Review Content: It first started when we arrived at the airport. I had arranged for pick up with the hotel last year already after accommodation booking was confirmed. To our surprise there was no one waiting for us. We had to ask information desk at the airport to phone the hotel to find out what was going on. We spend almost two hours at the hotel before we were collected. On arrival the room became an issue. The room i had booked was king deluxe room and special request was smoking room. We were informed that the room we had booked is non-smoking as it was on a non-smoking floor. We were offered a standard room instead which we refused. We were very frustrated and disappointed as we were expecting the best from Hilton hotel. We were eventually offered a room with a garden balcony. Still had issues because the floor was licking. We ended up on seventh floor which was great. We also had access to the executive floor. We only had supper and breakfast , then we decided it was better for us to buy food elsewhere. In my opinion the food is not wow in the executive launch. The standard was not up to my expectations, The only thing i enjoyed was the drinks. The room was great , spacious and to my expectations.I was not happy with the cleaning of the rooms as there was a day where cleaning was not offered at all. What i can say is after a few complaints we were eventually happy but my concern is that must one complain before they get what they want or what they have asked for. I have been to Hilton Shanghai , Hilton Durban but it was the first time i felt disappointed on my arrival at the hotel. Wifi is only in public areas so i had to pay to use it in the room.
Date: Date of stay: February 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: 5 Sterne Hotel mit 1 Stern Service
Review Content: Einfach schlecht. Jedes mal als ich an der Rezeption war, waren andere G√§ste da, die sich beschwert hatten. Ich war offensichtlich nicht der einzige, der mehrfache Probleme hatte in diesem Hotel.   Das gebuchte Zimmer war nicht verf√ºgbar und sie haben uns eine Suite gegeben und wollten ein Zusatzbett in das Zimmer bringen. Nach gef√ºllte 1000 mal hin und her kam das Zusatzbett erst gegen Mitternacht.   Viele Sachen in diesem Hotel funktionieren einfach nicht:   Der Aufzug ist einfach so von alleine hoch und runter gefahren und wollte uns anscheinend nicht auslassen. Wir haben die erste Gelegenheit genutzt und sind ausgestiegen und runtergelaufen.   Das Wasser vom Dachterrassenpool tropft runter in die Halle.   Es gab exponierte Stromleitungen im Schrank zu sehen.  Das Geruch von der Klimaanlage war unertr√§glich.   Es gab viele Flecken auf dem Teppich im Zimmer. Die M√∂bel waren alt und weisten Verbrauchsspuren auf.  Das Wasser f√ºr die Dusche war entweder hei√ü oder sehr hei√ü.   Beim runterlaufen im Treppenhaus war der Fluchtweg nicht erkennbar. Die T√ºr im Erdgeschoss war abgeschlossen. Ich frage mich wie man in einer Notsituation das Geb√§ude verlassen soll.
Date: Date of stay: December 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Perfekte Lage und Zimmer mit Wohlf√ºhlfaktor
Review Content: Im Umkreis von 5 Gehminuten finden sich die bekanntesten Sehensw√ºrdigkeiten von Windhoek, so dass das Hotel insbesondere f√ºr einen Kurzaufenthalt bestens geeignet ist (wir sind gegen 16:30 Uhr eingetroffen, am n√§chsten Morgen abgereist und konnten uns dennoch fast alles anschauen).Das Hotel verf√ºgt √ºber eine sehr sch√∂nen, auf dem Dach gelegenen kleinen Swimmingpool. Leider vergeht einem die Lust auf Nutzung (es sei denn, man ist Exhibitionist), da die dahinter stehenden Liegen nicht von Poolnutzern sondern Besuchern der Dachbar genutzt werden, die full dressed ihre Cocktails schl√ºrfen.Die Zimmer sind der Kategorie entsprechend eingerichtet. Auffallend ist die herausragende Gestaltung des Sanit√§rbereichs.Das Fr√ºhst√ºck l√§sst nur wenige W√ºnsche offen. Allerdings hatte ich den Eindruck, dass zum Ende der Fr√ºhst√ºckszeit nicht mehr der gesamte Service angeboten wird.Wi-Fi in der Lobby kostenlos (funktioniert auch gut), im Zimmer kostenpflichtig (Tagespauschale OK, Stundenpauschale recht teuer).Aktuell sollte beachtet werden, dass um das Hotel herum intensiv gebaut wird, was sich auf das gesamte Ambiente etwas negativ auswirkt (und die PKW-Anreise erschwert; wir mussten mit unerem nicht gro√üstadttauglichen Wagen zwei Runden um mehrere Blocks drehen).Gesamturteil 4,5 von 5,0 (Abstriche f√ºr Pool und Fr√ºhst√ºck).

Name: They Just Don't Get It
Review Content: The staff at this hotel just doesn't understand the concept of urgency with regards to customer complaints.  We had multiple problems during our stay-ranging from the internet not working properly to housekeeping forgetting to leave bathroom amenities after they cleaned our room and in each instance we had to call repeated before we got a response or resolution.  Under the circumstances I can't recommend this hotel.
Date: Date of stay: July 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good Hotel for a short stay before your start exploring
Review Content: We stayed at the Hilton in central Windhoek 1 night before and 1 night after we explored Namibia and we believe that was exactly the right thing to do. There are a few nice spots in Windhoek but from our point of view there would not have much of a point to stay longer.The 2 different rooms we had were nice and tidy. They are just what you would expect from a Hilton. People at the reception were welcoming and helpful, but much too slow when we wanted to check out in the middle of the night when they also forgot to prepare the breakfast box that they offered us the day before. Anyway,this was nothing of major importance. We enjoyed the short time we spent at the Hilton. The rooftop bar is worth a visit even for people not staying at the hotel.We would recommend the hilton to anyone! It was nice and met our expectations.
Date: Date of stay: March 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Redeemed
Review Content: We went back after our last unpleasant stay and gave the unit a chance of redemption. The overall performance improved dramatically from the last experience with the porter staff welcoming us in the basement parking lot to transport our luggage to reception and beyond.  I was impressed.  we were given a room on the east side of the building which was very comfortable, spacious and well illuminated in day time.  Problem though was that part of the light streamed through a large "milky" glass window with no blind to cover the light at night which disturbed my sleep endlessly. We lodged a complaint and the maintenance team came to investigate and never brought a solution for our entire stay.  I will probably go back but insist on a room in a different position.
Date: Date of stay: March 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hilton Hotel Windhoek

Rooms are great.We had an issue with ordering some light meals in the bar - in that one order never turned up!Customer service in reception sorted it out and it didn't spoil our stay.Hotel is very central, and everyone smiles - even when they are messing things up!But that's Africa.

Name: Snackbar im 9. Stock - ungen√ºgender Service

Es war zu dem Zeitpunkt absolut kein Andrang, neben uns nur ein weiterer Gast.Auf eine Beschwerde hin, dass das Fleisch kalt sei, hatte man uns angeboten, es zu erw√§rmen. Weitere 10 Minuten sp√§ter war das Fleisch lauwarm.Das n√§chste Mal wird es bei Getr√§nken bleiben. Eigentlich schade ...

Name: Good place to stay for business or leisure
Review Content: 4 of us stayed here at the start of our weekend for 1 night only , from check in to check out, we were impressed with the service, the staff and the rooms. The rooms are large and really modern, everything is new and works brilliantly, the bathroom is large i loved it. This hotel has been designed for long or short stays, for businessmen or people travelling on Holiday. It has 2 restuarants one incorporates the bar on the roof top, with lovely nighttime views of Windhoek under lights. Seems like a place for locals to visit too, i had a lovely vibe. It's close to restuarants, and shops, and offers parking as well.Overrall we had a fantastic stay and I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again should I return to Windhoek.

Und der Salat Avocado / Prawns bestand aus 5 ungew√ºrzten Bl√§ttern Koofsalat, 20 Gramm Minishrimps und einem Matsch, der entfernt nach Avocado geschmeckt hat. Nach Reklamation war zumindest der Hauptgang flott da und hat auch geschmeckt, wenngleich niemand am Tisch davon satt wurde. Weinauswahl war zwar auf der Karte, man musste aber nehmen, was da war. Name: Good but not 5/5
Review Content: We stayed here twice in the last two weeks. We booked a deluxe room on both stays and as a Hilton Gold member it was fair t9 expect an upgrade b7t none were available . We were however given access to the Executive lounge which was great. The first stay, the staff member in the executive lounge was lovely, second stay she was surly and shut all the drinks away at 8pm which we did not expect as the lounge closes at 10pm. Stay 1:was better overall with lovely desk staff too.Stay 2 - another room next to the lift which my account states room away from elevator. Chips in cups in room and on soap holder, stained carpets, fused plug points - room 201 FYI. Only one robe and pair of slippers and only one bottle of water strangely. However, it is  close to the Museum and African craft market. Parking costs ¬£4 per day - NAD 60 . The car park is small and the angles are very tight. Rooftop bar is lovely for a sundowner cocktail.  Overall, small but important improvements ,ents could be made. Fridge in room which was handy.

I was there for one week and used the executive lounge most nights.  the light dinner and drinks was just what I needed after a long day. all I had to do was go to the 9th floor with few other people and just relax.

Name: Horrible Check-inn experiance. Staff very rude and impatient. Definately not up to the Hilton standards
Review Content: Had the worst check-inn experiance at the hotel. Receptionist  was very rude and impatient with us. We asked to speak to the Duty manager so we could explain what we were promised prior to booking. Receptionist told us that the duty manager refused to see us and her decision was final. The duty manager only came a few minutes to assist a client who came later than us. Later on He attended to us of which initially he was even impolite. After check-inn noone showed us which way to go. Both receptionist and manager were just looking at us. We ended up pushing our own trolley, thats when they asked the security to help us. This made our stay unbearable. It was supposed to be  a fantastic birthday get away but ended up being the worst experiance of my life. Definately not up to the Hilton standards.

Name: Nice but struggling with the details
Review Content: This very nice business hotel in CBD Windhoek still lacks with some of the service elements expected from a Hilton property. We had to complain a number of times before the duty manager provided an alternative solution. I had the same problem many years ago and it has still not been addressed. I would expect this to work in the capital in a Hilton property. The rooms are spacious and nicely furnished and the roof terrace is the real beauty about this hotel.

Name: Phenomenal staff, very eager to please
Review Content: After a lengthy second voyage through Namibia with a colleague stayed here upon returning to Windhoek. It was immediately clear the staff are exceptional, and having stayed at Hiltons on multiple continents I can confidently tell you they are absolutely among the company's very best!I did really love the rooftop lounge and the bar/pool area. It is a great place to unwind. Also the executive lounge is well-appointed with good amenities. If you are traveling for business I would however recommend getting multiple rooms (rather than sharing a room with two beds) due to the hotel design; these rooms have an open format that lacks privacy. The upper floors have good views of the city and mountains. We had one minor glitch, and the concierge was very gracious to immediately make things wonderful. The property's location is ideal -- you can easily and quickly walk from the hotel all around the central business district by day. Best to drive at night, and the underground car park is very safe and secure.

Name: Central location and helpful front desk!
Review Content: Great stay at the Hilton Windhoek! It was a weekend so the streets were quiet, but enjoyed the central location.  Very friendly front desk who showed me how to walk to the church and to the Nambian Craft Centre.  The included breakfast buffet was delicious and the chef herself stopped by every table to say hello and check on us.  The overall architecture of the hotel is stunning from the two-level lobby to the enclosed atrium where the rooms are located to the rooftop pool and bar where you can watch the sunset over all the tall buildings nearby. When leaving for the airport, they have an airport shuttle service that was very helpful and convenient for about 358 Namibian dollars.  The airport is about 30-minutes away.  This is one of the best hotels in Windhoek.  I picked it last minute and was pleasantly surprised by my wonderful stay.
Date: Date of stay: April 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice hotel but food can be much much better
Review Content: Staying here for the third time, meaning I am quite pleased overall. The main issue is the food. The breakfast is OK, but would expect better bread and cereals in the morning. I ordered a club sandwich twice in the lobby for a quick lunch and two times it was just OK. I had lunch once in the main restaurant (28 March 2018) and ordered the tataki tuna. Far too much wasabi and half an hour later I had a high fever and rashes all over me, most likely food poisoning. This is unacceptable in a hotel linked to the Hilton chain. So yes, stay here but eat somewhere else ...

Struttura di ottimo livello, camere confortevoli e spaziose, dotato di palestra e piscina esterna, parcheggio, personale gentilissimo e disponibile. Dotato di due ristoranti interni, uno con men√π internazionale e l'altro un sushi bar di discreta qualit√†. Buona l'offerta per la colazione. Incantevole la vista sulla citt√† che si pu√≤ godere dallo sky bar all'ultimo piano.

Name: Very recommendable place to stay in Windhoek
Review Content: We are a family of 4 and stayed for one day and night.  We arrived straight from the airport after having picked up our rental car elsewhere in Windhoek. Easy getting around and finding hotel. Parking no problem. Rooms were clean, beds very comfortable and no noise during night. Lovely shampoo, body lotions etc. Pool area upstairs very swanky and we truly enjoyed our time up there with the great bar food and wonderful small pool with a gorgous view overlooking the city. Only tiny complaint: we aited more than an hour for our late lunchtie burgers- apparently the staff somewhere forgot about our order. However- we were offered free drinks while they worked on sorting it out and all staff everywhere in the hotel were nice and friendly upon approach.  Great working wifi. We would definitely stay another time.

Same for some of the fish dishes on the menu that happened to be ‚Äòjust out of stock‚Äô during the four days we spent there...And the Sky bar clothes at 22:00...Had a long discussion with the receptionist who charged our bills with meals that we had already paid for (we had a half board - breakfast and dinner option). All was sorted out but I would have happily skipped the controversy.Also, this is the first hotel ever where I could not check out the evening before departure because the software ‚Äòmust click into midnight in order to count the last night of our stay‚Äô. Weird!So we did it at 03:00a.m just before departure.All in all a good experience but certainly this hotel can do better!

Name: Disappointed
Review Content: After arriving at 4 in the afternoon following a long journey from Etosha (Namibia), the room was still not ready for check-in. We were told by the Front Desk that there is no standard check-in or check-out time. It took 30-40 mins for them to get the room ready during which as saving grace, we were offered complimentary wifi and coffee. However, the staff did not seem apologetic for the delay. When we had to go to the room, we were told we could take our luggage up ourselves. In general, we found the Front Desk unfriendly. Maybe there are cultural differences that we as tourists need to be mindful of, but in the service industry, I think the onus is on the service provider to be sensitive and kind. We were certainly expecting better from Hilton which is a well known hotel chain.
