Name: Hilton Windhoek
Review Content: One of the best Hilton Hotel.  Very well situated in town. Very spacious and comfortable rooms.  Bar on top floor is a "must visit" at end of afternoon.  I felt welcome and appreciated. Service is definitely good.
Date: Date of stay: October 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Not what I was expecting
Review Content: I was expecting the usual old chain hotel experience and was stunned by the beautiful, modern d√©cor.  The roof top bar did not disappoint nor did our accommodations.  We did have a problem with the room in that the shower drain must have been clogged because the room quickly flooded.  The staff was very friendly and cleaned up the room fairly quickly.  We were very tired and decided to eat early.  The only venue available to us was the bar.  The bar food was not bad but it was not very good either.  Perhaps the restaurants are better.  I would highly recommend this hotel if you have an early morning flight out.  The shuttle was spacious and the driver was extremely helpful.
Date: Date of stay: July 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great place for Windhoek
Review Content: After weeks of Safaris in tents, lodges and guest houses the Hilton was a nice end of our holidays. The hotel is good located directly at the Independence Avenue. During the day it's easily possible to walk around the several shops. The view from the window is great. It is probably the highest building around. Checking was good and fast, the staff was friendly. The room is nice and bright and has the equipment you expect from a 4-Star hotel. Certain things like bathrobe, slippers, shaving kit etc. were missing but everything else was good.  The kingsize bed was excellent and in good condition. We can recommend the dinner. The lady at the entrance was very friendly and the food was excellent. The value for what you get is extremly good! Also the breakfast buffet and the service was great.The Skybar invites for a drink over Windhoek and it is as well a place for relaxing at the (heated!) pool. The fitness center is small. However since I only use the treadmill it was ok for me. The only negative point was that they forgot to bring the baggage to the room even after a call to the reception. I finally had to go down to pick it up by myself.
Date: Date of stay: August 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: The Manager in the bar on the mezzanine floor across from the restaurant, think it was called Kalabar..
Review Content: I enjoyed the Kalabar, the staff behind the bar was very helpful, and made great drinks, my only issue was the manager, I think his name was Joshua if I read his tag correct, colored fella with curly hair.  His staff was wonderful, and I really enjoyed myself until he came around scolding them and barking off questions and request with a very bad attitude as if he was perfect.  I'm a manager and a supervisor, but I'll never treat my staff the way he did in front of a paying customer, this occurred on both nights that I took in drinks at the bar during my stay. His staff was extremely professional, but he lacked professionalism. I've never seen a staff as polite as his staff, and treated the way he treated them.  Otherwise the Hilton is a great place to stay, and I stay there frequently on my business travel to Windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: August 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good location and service
Review Content: It has an excellent location in town which for business is a plus. Its a new and modern hotel with very Nice rooms, pool at The top inklusive an outlook bar. All The service i recieved was friendly and helpfull. Had dinner at resturant which was fine and worth The money. For sure i will stay there next time
Date: Date of stay: July 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Excellent
Review Content: Very modern and neat hotel reception extremely friendly and helpful as well as reservations Agusta thanks.  The as per my review improvement can be done with the waiters working in the Epika restaurant and with the wine selection
Date: Date of stay: June 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good but not great
Review Content: My friends and I stayed here a few days ago.  We are all Gold level Hilton members and should get free Internet, Executive lounge access and upgraded rooms with our stay.  Apparently no one knew this as we had to ask for everything. Plus when we did ask for the Internet password they gave us an hour at a time so when I got kicked off at 10pm, I had to call and someone had to run up a piece of paper to my room.  That was annoying.  The hotel was nice, pool area was modern and centrally located.
Date: Date of stay: May 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Central, Modern & Comfortable
Review Content: The Hilton Windhoek is excelently located with large comfortable bedrooms, fantastic sky bar and pool and great buffet breakfast.  Ideal for business and leisure.  The room corridor area is reminicent of
Date: Date of stay: May 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Almost perfect but....
Review Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights after flying in from Johannesburg. We took a taxi from the Airport and paid ZAR 280 for 2 persons for the ride to the hotel.The hotel is of Hilton‚Äôs international standard, strategically located near the Independence Avenue, the centre of the city‚Äôs activities. There could not be a better location than this. We stayed on the 5th floor and our room was perfect, as can be seen from the photos we have posted here. We agree with all the previous reviews about the high standards of the room and the great views from the rooftop, so, we will not repeat them again. Our only complaint is against one of the staff, and unfortunately, we have to air our concerns here as there is no other forum for us to do, to ensure that this issue comes to the attention of the person in charge and not deleted and sent to ‚Äòtrash‚Äô should we address it as a general email to the hotel.On our final day at the hotel, we have asked the front desk staff by the name of Anna Massauwe, to assist us in booking a table at and a taxi to the famous Joe‚Äôs Beer House Restaurant. She assured us all will be arranged and we should just come down to the lobby at our appointed time in the evening and the taxi will be there for us. When we came down in the evening, we found out that she had booked for us a taxi to go to a restaurant called O Portuga instead!! We told her off for doing so and due to her doing, when we finally arrived at Joe‚Äôs without a booking, we had to wait for about an hour for a table and another 30 minutes for our food!! We are not sure whether this Ms Massauwe gets a commission for referring guests to O Portuga but for a hotel of Hilton‚Äôs standard, we did not expect this kind of behaviour from their staff! This was not a mere oversight and there was no language problem in our communication with her. We communicated with her in English, which she was fluent in, and ‚ÄúJoe‚Äôs Beer House‚Äù sounds VERY different from ‚ÄúO Portuga‚Äù. There could not be any mistake in that.We were not able to channel our complaint to the hotel‚Äôs management at that time as it was very late by the time we finally returned to the hotel and we had to check out early the following day. We hope the hotel will look into this serious misconduct of one of their staff so that incidents like this do not happen to other guests in the future. Other than this unfortunate incident, we enjoyed our stay at the hotel and will have no qualms in recommending it to other travellers.
Date: Date of stay: March 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great hotel for business traveller
Review Content: I normally stay at this hotel as I travel to Windhoek twice a month. It has all the amenities for the business traveller. business centre, gym, conference rooms , wi-fi. The food is always good. The staff are friendly and helpful. Room are comfortable , with a queen size bed. The rooms have bar fridges, which you need to check upon check in to make sure no one has helped themselves prior to you occupying the room. Overall a great hotel that always lives up to expectations.
Date: Date of stay: February 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: It's OK,but..........
Review Content: I stayed one night. This hotel is central of the city,so it's easy to walk around downtown,cafe,bar, restaurant,shops......information center also.But, there is not special something.It's OK for stay 1night.If you will stay over 2nights, I think there is more enjoyable hotel .
Date: Date of stay: January 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: First Class Hotel in Namibia
Review Content: The Hilton Namibia is really excellent: very new, very friendly and helpful staff, excellent quality of service and food. Situated in the City Center only a short walk to the shops and restaurants. The access to the hotel is a little bit comlecated because it is not where you look for the entrance. From the Independence Street you can easily wlak through the Garage to reach the lobby. In total to recommand to others.
Date: Date of stay: February 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Comfortable, modern hotel in central Windhoek
Review Content: After a couple of weeks on the road in Namibia, we enjoyed this hotel a lot. Modern furnishings, comfortabe beds, good facilities and friendly and efficient staff all contributed to an enjoyable (if brief) stay. The hotel is right in the centre of town and within easy reach of restaurants, shops etc. They have a minibus to take guests to the airport but this was busy so they arranged a taxi for us.The only thing I didn't enjoy were the incredibly greedy guests in the executive lounge (some not many) who were intent in getting as much 'free' food and drink down their necks as quickly as possible.
Date: Date of stay: October 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hilton Windhoek
Review Content: Stayed five nights mid-August, on a business trip to Windhoek. Was recommended by local contacts. New and modern building right in the heart of the city - within walking distance of all business appointments made. Friendly and pleasant staff at reception desk upon arrival. Was given complimentary Wifi for the duration of the stay - would otherwise be relatively expensive. Nice room with all the amenities one can expect. Great breakfast spread and again friendly staff. Haven't used the restaurant for lunch or dinner, but had the occasional beer and/or a snack in the late afternoon in the rooftop bar - very nice views from there.There was no information in the room about hotel services and facilities, as one would expect.If I had to return to Windhoek, I would choose this hotel again.
Date: Date of stay: August 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Beautiful, but where's the service.
Review Content: It's a beautiful hotel and an excellent location, but  both times there were problems getting my bill straight at checkout. We're talking 20-30 minutes and multiple reiterations before it was right.  I paid the hotel for the shuttle to the airport and then the driver wanted to be paid at the airport. Everything is extra cost - breakfast, internet, you name it. One trash can in the room and I didn't know they made trash cans that small.
Date: Date of stay: July 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Windhoek Hilton
Review Content: This Hilton is one of the best I've ever stayed in around the world. The rooms were spacious, clean and well appointed. We used the Executive Lounge for afternoon glass of wine and for breakfast. The service and offerings were suburb! The hotel is located directly within the city center and within easy walking distance of the craft center and other tourist sites. We used the hotel on our return from Etosha and couldn't have been more pleased.
Date: Date of stay: May 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Still a lot to learn
Review Content: This hotel is still very new and looks great, the decor and design is the best in Windhoek but there are issues that come from being so new. The staff are nice and friendly but are not trained to the high standard you would expect from a Hilton hotel, here are a few examples:Hilton Honours - I'm a gold HH member and received no benefits nor an upgrade, the staff seemed pretty much unaware of its existence.Lots of things not working, water temperature in the shower goes really hot to cold and doesn't settle, Internet is intermittent and various services unavailable in the business center.Please do not be put off by my above comments as this hotel does have some good offerings such as the rooftop bar and pool although a serious lack of ashtrays. The executive lounge is nice for quiet drinks and the breakfast has a good selection. The main restaurant is really nice and has a great food but I found it was repeated too much, service in the restaurant was fast and efficient. For a bit of entertainment the Kalahari Sands hotel nearby has a casino, the streets seem safe enough to walk at night too.All in all this is a good hotel which over time will grow better with its staff.
Date: Date of stay: January 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Perfect rooms - imperfect service
Review Content: Brand new place with perfectly styled and arranged rooms. Great beds and bathtub.Service needs real improvements, three out of five felt sick after dinner in the hotel restaurant. Music from roof top bar is extremely loud until early morning. They need to figure out whether to be a hotel or nightclub.No WiFi available in rooms and price in public space (7,5 EUR per hour) is unacceptable.Else a perfect stay for sophisticated travellers.
Date: Date of stay: October 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Chic style in Namibia?
Review Content: If you are looking for an Africa experience, skip it. But it you want a true 4 star westernized-urban business-like hotel in downtown Windhoek then go for it. Did this whole place just drop into Namibia? Very lovely modern setting, room decoration is strange with bathtub open to the whole room. Roof top deck is fantastic, but small.  BEWARE of flaky wifi service that only works in some seats in the lobby, does not work in the rooms or roof top deck. Internet in the room is plug in...no plug on an iPad or smart phone so worthless for me. And they charge for internet access - annoying.
Date: Date of stay: July 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Very average stay - we expected more from a Hilton
Review Content: We stayed at the Hilton Windhoek for one night at the end of our stay at the end of March 2022. We decided to stay here as we had given the car back and we wanted somewhere with amenities, including a restaurant (since we had heard it's not especially safe to walk around after dark), in the hotel. PROSThe room was spacious and had a pleasant view. There were also no bugs that we had experienced elsewhere on our trip! There was also good internet and a TV.There was a restaurant in the hotel, a rooftop pool and rooftop bar. Good location.The hotel helped us to chase our transfer to the airport the next day and the front entrance concierge were very helpful. CONSThere was no sauna/spa available still, we assume due to covid.The room service was terrible.. the first time we ordered, took over an hour to arrive and very average food. The second time we ordered, it took over an hour for half the order to arrive. We then had to chase the other half. After 20 minutes, nothing more arrived. We then had to call again and they finally got it right but it took another 15 minutes to come. The food, again, was very average.The food at the restaurant for dinner was below average but the wine was good (despite the first one we ordered having run out). The service was also below average. The same goes for breakfast for next day on quality and service fronts.The rooftop bar was a good cider but they got the order wrong in terms of giving us glasses with ice.In summary, the hotel was below average for what was paid and we expected at least an average service with a Hilton.
Date: Date of stay: March 2022This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Windhoek Hilton
Review Content: Lack of a general manager has led to a massive drop in quality of service and care. Food is dreadful, except the pizza, breakfast pathetic. Staff uncaring and rude. Just not worth the price. Coffee in the restartuant 4xthe price of Zenzi shop which is much better quality over the road in the mall. Guests expected to pay to park a car even if you have high frequency status. Loyalty not recognised nor cared about. Security intrusive and rude clearly do not care
Date: Date of stay: February 2022This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good location, nice service
Review Content: Very nice hotel with helpful staff. We had a standard room, which was comfortable in size, but had one major minus: no wall between the room and the bathroom! As a Finn I‚Äôm totally OK with nudity in the sauna and going skinny dipping in a lake, but I definitely want my privacy in the bath! No to recommend. Otherwise accommodations were good and the bed comfortable. The hotel has a rooftop bar, swimming pool, gym and spa. The skybar is great for sunset drinks.We only had breakfast at the hotel, but there is both a restaurant and a wine bar. Breakfast was tasty and very comprehensive.The hotel is located very near major sites like the Independence Memorial and the Parliament.
Date: Date of stay: January 2020This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Poor Standards
Review Content: This is my second stay at the Hilton in the last 2 months and I must admit the service   is getting worse. The water heating was not working and I had to take cold showers. Despite my compliant no one was interested to fix it. The shower is also blocked and keeps flooding the bathroom floor.Every request is hard work and they need to take a note for someone else to do. Simplest thing like sending me the invoices by email was a struggle. I needed change for 100 dollar note and guess what .. they don‚Äôt have change and no one bothered to help. Last night in the roof bar, I noticed the staff washing the glasses by hands only. I am a Hilton member and this is the worst  Hilton I ever stayed in.I was polite to raise all my concerns to the manager and I hope someone will take actions very soon.
Date: Date of stay: January 2020This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Brilliant from A - Z
Review Content: I had a fantastic experience at this hotel, starting with a very friendly driver who picked me up from the airport and whose name I have sadly forgotten. Friendly and efficient check-in, nice room, very clean and tidy. Great breakfast. Beautiful roof-top pool (sadly not heated during my visit). Sauna and Spa closed for refurbishment. Very approachable GM whom I met when he inspected the gym and surrounding areas. I look forward to staying here again.
Date: Date of stay: June 2022This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great hotel
Review Content: Very friendly and professional staff with excellent facilities including the Sky Bar. Very clean and has great vibes in a central walkable location. The breakfast selection is above average but could improve. The rest of the food is good in the restaurants in good although one was closed during my Feb 2023 visit.
Date: Date of stay: February 2023This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Experience to treasure
Review Content: My stay at Hilton Windhoek was an experience not to forget. Ever improving service both in room and executive lounge. My diamond Hilton status has always been honored with complimentary upgrades.3 nights felt very short!!!
Date: Date of stay: February 2020This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great hotel for stopover.
Review Content: Perfect place for a couple of night stopover. Rooms were big, place was perfectly clean, staff were very friendly (without exception). Sky bar was great. Executive Club was pretty small with limited choices at breakfast. Saw a few arrive then leave for the main buffet restaurant.  Good, safe location. Not much to do in Windhoek so will probably not be back but would stay here again if we did.
Date: Date of stay: February 2023This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Don‚Äôt bother
Review Content: Don‚Äôt bother. There‚Äôs a reason why none of the guidebooks say stay in Windhoek for any length of time! We had to have an extra night here on our way home from a holiday in Namibia. We‚Äôve stayed in lots of Hilton‚Äôs and lots of great hotels. Sadly this is not one of them. Great, friendly staff. Truly appalling awful breakfast. Avoid
Date: Date of stay: August 2022This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: I am so disappointed by Hilton. what a shame!
Review Content: I booked a room at Hilton well in advance (1 year before) and I just made a mistake with my computer to book it (april 29th instead of 28th 2017). I tried to change it immediately, 2 minutes after. Impossible. I tried to call them 4 times + 2 emails without any answer. After a last e-mail, Hilton answered me that nothing is possible without proposing a solution. I am very very disappointed by this so poor service and understanding. Even with low cost companies like easyjet, it is possible to modifiy within 24 hours. That why I don't recommand at all to book Hilton, it is not a luxury hotel, providing services and comfort. I will choose another and better hotel than Hilton for my stay in Windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: January 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great Stay
Review Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights while in Windhoek for work. The hotel is very nice, if a bit pricey.The pros: the location is great, right in the center of Widhoek and about a 25-30 minute drive from the airport. The WiFi was slow occasionally, but mostly worked well. There is a gorgeous rooftop pool and bar, which offers great views and is a good place to hang out after a long day. The breakfast in the restaurant is pretty good, nothing out of the ordinary but still a great way to start the day. The gym is small, but it has enough equipment to get a decent workout in.The rooms themselves are nice, clean and spacious. The same is true for the bathrooms. The bed is very comfortable.The only cons I experienced in my time there were that there are only 3 elevators, so you can wait a few minutes until one is available (particularly if one is out, as was the case for part of my stay). There was a line when I was checking in, so that took a little while, but the service from staff was otherwise great. The restaurant was good for breakfast, but only okay otherwise. There are a lot of other fantastic restaurants nearby, so I might suggest exploring those during your time in Windhoek. The hotel was a bit pricey, but to be expected for a hotel this nice.The cons are all minor, however, and I definitely would stay here again during my next trip to Windhoek. I would also recommend this hotel to anyone going!
Date: Date of stay: September 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: No room at the inn
Review Content: We booked and paid 2 weeks ago and on arrival are booted out for a group. Happens fairly often according to receptionist. Completely unacceptable. We are in a foreign country without a hotel room. Their solution is a room in A hotel 20km out if town. Flabbergasted that a Hilton can do this.
Date: Date of stay: February 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Probably the best option in Windhoek
Review Content: Really nice modern hotel, though I've spent lots of time in Africa and my expectations are moderated therefore -those who have only spent time in SE Asia, US and Europe may be less impressed!  It's a nicely designed and striking building right in the heart of this small and pleasant city.  You can walk to shops, cafes etc which seems perfectly safe in the daytime at least.  The hotel must be only a couple of years old, though showing some signs of wear (pool tiles, crack on side of bath, stained room carpet) already so they need to keep up to speed on maintenance to stop the slide.  Staff are nice and professional.  Room was big, modern and very comfortable.  Breakfast was one of the best I've had anywhere.  Extras were not expensive, eg a coffee and huge slice of cake on the outside terrace for about ¬£4.50.  My Hilton gold card gave me 'free' internet and access to the lounge for usual drinks and snacks -without this it would have been less good value.  I visited a few other WIndhoek hotels, this seemed the best by some margin.
Date: Date of stay: November 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice hotel in the city
Review Content: I was supposed to have 2 nights, but my flight was cancelled,. so I only got one. This is a very nice hotel within walking distance to about anything you would want to see in Windhoek. They also have an airport shuttle, which I used.
Date: Date of stay: October 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Worst customer care experience
Review Content: I advance booked for transport to and from the airport. They say check-in is 3 pm but I was made to wait for 2 hours as rooms were not ready. When we were given our keys at 530pm we were told to to our rooms as our bags will immediately follow. The porter wrote our room numbers on his hands and forgot to bring them. I had to call front desk after an hour and our bags finally came and the porter never even apologised. Seing that the hotel seems to be sleeping on the job, I made sure I had to verify the night before that I will be picked up at 6am on my checkout as booked. To my surprise I was only booked for pick-up and they had ommited to capture that I need to be dropped off! They then amended and said it's now fine your shuttle will be waiting for you at 6. Surprise the following morning,  no shuttle for my family of 4, no shuttle for another family of 3 and no shuttle for an individual lady, all leaving at 6am. After about 15 minutes delay all guests were agitated and asking the front desk guy who kept saying it will be sorted, we were now literally shouting at him and he just stood there helpless after phoning Hertz. The shuttle came at around 620 and we all fought to get in it was messy. The Hertz driver (Innocent) was at least helpful and called for another shuttle, trying to save the situation created by the hotel. We were rushed to the airport in dead silence as everyone was angry. As we were late, we had to rush through departure formalities breathlessly and in the commotion I lost my travel neck pillow! This was my worst experience at any hotel and Hilton Windhoek needs to improve their customer care and logistical arrangements so as not to tarnish the Hilton brand.
Date: Date of stay: December 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great Stay
Review Content: I stayed for around 2 months. Well equipped hotel with friendly staff. Enjoyed the executive lounge access. Roof top bar, swimming pool and gym. 2 in-house restaurants and casino in the basement. Over all, good experience.
Date: Date of stay: August 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: My last stay at hilton windhoek
Review Content: I am extremely pleased, for having once again experienced the marvels of hilton windhoek, it was nothing but an awesome experience.  What else can we expect from the hilton brand if not greatness? I highly recommend it.
Date: Date of stay: November 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Lugar c√©ntrico confortable
Review Content: Limpio, acogedor personal muy amable. Dificultad que no hablan el espa√±ol o el franc√©s. Las instrucciones solo son en ingles y alem√°n.  El servicio de taxis, es de  facial acceso. El internet es bueno y de facial acceso
Date: Date of stay: February 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Wonderful family experience at the Hilton - Windhoek
Review Content: My family had a wonderful holiday experience at the Hilton Windhoek. We spent a few days there while we moved between Erindi and Swakopmund. The accommodation was excellent and the staff very accommodating and professional.  Special mention must be made of Vivian in the Executive lounge, he was a wonderful host and provided excellent service. The Hilton in Windhoek is definitively the best accommodation experience in the Windhoek
Date: Date of stay: July 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Best in Town... but...
Review Content: This hotel is well located in the center of town.  It does not have too much competition from other international hotel chains, so its standards do not need to be so high.  It is already the best available in town, but don't expect the usual Hilton 5 star standards!
Date: Date of stay: October 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: "Faulty Towers" in Namibia
Review Content: Booked two King Hilton Deluxe Rooms and paid in advance. Received an e-mail confirmation regarding both booking stipulating check-in time is at 14:00. We arrived at 17:40 and was informed that the rooms were not ready? Were offered two standard rooms ( a downgrade) by Victor but with lounge access if we would like to check in as it could be a while before the deluxe rooms would be ready. Accepted the option to check in immediately as it was then nearly 18:00.No welcome letter or water or any recognition for a loyal Hilton Honours member in the room. Room was in a poor condition. Seem that someone was on the bed after the room was made up. The telephone did not work, the fridge door did not have a handle and the desktop light was broken. Informed the front desk and maintenance suggested a room change after their inspection. Eventually received a King Hilton Deluxe room that I booked at 21:00. At 21:20 someone else attempted to get access to the room. This person was also booked in the same room.Executive lounge very small and not on the same level as the lounges as other Hilton Hotels. Very limited food and drinks offering. The attendant also does not replenish wines when it is finish. A group of young tourist quickly finished the only two bottles of red wine that were put out and it was never replenished.  When my room was  changed at 21:00 people were still checking in and were told about their lounge access and directed towards the lounge, but everything in the lounge gets packed away at 20:00. What a joke. It seems that the one hand does not know what the other hand is doing! Can just imagine what breakfast will be like tomorrow morning. Will definitely not stay here again. Overprized, unorganised and just plain pathetic service! This hotel is a blemish on the Hilton name.
Date: Date of stay: February 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hotel moderne et confortable
Review Content: Cet h√¥tel situ√© au centre ville de Windhoek est une halte confortable dans un d√©cor √† la fois contemporain et cosy . Nous y avons pass√© une nuit √† notre arriv√©e en Namibie, le 23 avril .Le hall d'accueil, vaste et lumineux, invite √† la d√©tente avec ses canap√©s et fauteuils dans des tons neutres et raffin√©s .La chambre ex√©cutive, dans des tons de beige et de jaune mordor√©, √©tait de bonne dimension . Elle √©tait √† la fois moderne et cosy avec sa m√©ridienne et son lit king tr√®s confortable . Dans les rangements g√©n√©reux de l'entr√©e on trouve le coffret de s√©curit√© ainsi qu'une table √† repasser et un fer .La grande salle  de bain, toute de bois, verre, carrelage et jeux de mosa√Øques, se pr√©sente comme une sorte de couloir, avec d'un c√¥t√©, une grande baignoire et une douche s√©par√©es , tandis que de l'autre tr√¥ne le lavabo surmont√© d'un grand miroir . Au fond, se trouve une toilette ind√©pendante . Cette salle de bain, moderne et agr√©able, est √©quip√©e d'un miroir grossissant . Inutile d'y chercher le s√®che cheveux puisqu'il est rang√© dans l'un des tiroirs du bureau de la chambre . Cette derni√®re est √©quip√©e d'un √©cran plat et de wifi ( payante) .Le "Skybar" situ√© sur le toit, autour de la piscine, est agr√©able mais comme il faisait froid on a pr√©f√©r√© boire un verre au "Kalabar" situ√© sur la mezzanine et o√π les profonds fauteuils de cuir sont confortables .On a mang√© au restaurant l'Ekipa o√π un buffet, copieux et vari√© nous a donn√© le choix entre diff√©rentes salades et crudit√©s, des grillades de poissons ou de viande ( l'agneau √©tait excellent ) et de bons desserts comme, par exemple, des morceaux de banane enrob√©s de chocolat craquant .Le petit d√©jeuner, servi lui aussi √† l'√âkipa, se pr√©sente sous forme d'un buffet avec fruits frais ( ananas, raisins, fruits de la passion ) , ≈ìufs ( durs ou omelettes), charcuteries (saucisses, jambon, bacon etc.), pains, c√©r√©ales et yaourts . On peut aussi go√ªter √† la semoule collante de ma√Øs ( pap) qui est l'un des plats de base de la cuisine namibienne .Nous n'avons eu aucun probl√®me de service, ni au bar, ni au restaurant, ni √† la r√©ception . En r√©sum√© une excellente adresse pour une √©tape dans la capitale .

Name: Nichts zu Bem√§ngeln
Review Content: Perfekte Lage und eine herrliche Aussicht. Der Pool ist zwar eher √ºberschaubar - aber es ist trotzdem witzig vom Dach √ºber die Stadt zu sehen. Poolbar beim Sonnenuntergang ist sehr zu empfehlen. Zimmer war ger√§umig und makellos eingerichtet, das Bad sehr geschmackvoll.Fr√ºhst√ºckbuffet und auch Abendessen einfach gut.Sehr gutes Service.

Name: Designer Hotel
Review Content: Das Hotel ist erst vor einigen Monaten er√∂ffnet worden. Es liegt sehr g√ºnstig. Man kann die Stadt zu Fu√ü erreichen. Im obersten Stock gibt es einen kleinen Pool mit Bar und einer wunderbaren Aussicht auf die Stadt. Es gibt eine Tiefgarage, sodass man den Mietwagen unbesorgt dort abstellen kann (gegen Geb√ºhr). Gew√∂hnungsbed√ºrftig sind die modernen Zimmer. Es gibt keine T√ºre zum Bad, dadurch wird der Mitreisende gest√∂rt, wenn einer fr√ºher aufstehen und sich duschen m√∂chte. Lediglich das WC ist mit einer Milchglasscheibe abgetrennt. Angenehm war, dass man sich im Zimmer Kaffee und Tee selbst zubereiten kann. Da wir die Mahlzeiten bei Freunden eingenommen haben, kann √ºber das Restaurant nicht berichtet werden.

Name: Super Hotel - Mega rooftop Pool und Bar
Review Content: Wir waren am Ende unserer Namibia Reise eine Nacht in Hilton, und h√§tten wir vorher gewusst was uns erwartet, w√§ren es definitiv 1-2 N√§chte mehr gewesen! Ein sch√∂nes Hotel, super freundliches Personal, wir konnten ohne Probleme bereits um 12 Uhr mittags auf s Zimmer, wlan super schnell, toller Pool, 60 Minuten ganz k√∂rpermassGe f√ºr umgerechnet 40 Euro, eine der besten Massagen die ich je hatte! Tolle Lounge Musik und Laufband im Fitness! Was will man mehr? :)) Ach ja eine sundowner auf der Dach Terrasse ! ü§óüëèüèª5 Sterne ! Danke.

Review Content: Easy to find from airport.Room spacious, clean, modern bathroomBreakfast ample choice & quality.Friendly, efficient receptionistSmall pool on roof terraceLounge ok, evening canap√©s & drinks provided

Review Content: Premi√®re et derni√®re nuit dans notre trip en Namibie .Parfait pour se reposer , le restaurant et le petit d√©jeuner sont de tr√®s bonnes qualit√©s .J‚Äôy retournerai avec plaisir .Sans oubli√© la gentillesse du personnels

Name: Nice 2,5 stars hotel
Review Content: As usual Hilton - Hilton is Windhoek is centrally locates clean and new 2,5 stars dormitory. Rooms are spacious without all useless facilities such as hot water, fast internet, minibar or sound isolation. If you need some help from the staff (for example tablet of paracetamol or adaptor for charging you phone) - staff will send you very very far away but with sweet Namibian smile 24 hours per day ... if you really want to have nice time in Windhoek - stay far from Hilton ... as far as you can
Date: Date of stay: December 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Theft in Windhoek Hilton
Review Content: I had a very unfortunate experience in Hilton Windhoek:  I left my travel wallet including my passport and travel money in the hotel safe (Room number 317 to be exact) and departed for Erongo Wilderness Lodge.  Upon arrival in the Lodge, I found out about the mishap and immediately contacted my travel agent.  I was informed that the wallet was found and it was returned to me on the way to the next destination.  Unfortunately 200 USD was missing from my wallet although there was cash remaining.  I immediately informed the travel agent who confirmed that they had received the amount I had found when the wallet was returned.  The travel agent later informed me that she had watched the security footage at the time the wallet was handed over to the hotel management and everything looked in order.  Naturally there was no footage from the time the wallet was collected from the safe.  Therefore, whatever happened in the interim remains unknown.  Although hotel management acknowledged the situation they claimed they could do nothing.  I try to understand this from their perspective (whose word against who).  On the other hand, as a guest who has spent a significant amount of money on this travel, I would not be in a position to lie about 200 USD and the hotel management should be able to empathize with this fact.I am writing this review, as this incident may happen to other guests and hurt people on a larger scale.  I think it is super important to take these feedback from your guests to dive deeper into the problem and avoid any future issues.  Regarding other amenities in the hotel, all was in order and I do not have anything else to complain about.  Especially the breakfast staff was very hospitable and kind.  The breakfast and specifically fresh juices were amazing.
Date: Date of stay: August 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Overbooked, they do not take  rally care or try to give compensation
Review Content: At arrival (13.06.) we were told that the hotel was overbooked (from other people out of Windhoek we heard it happens very frequently). The people at the reception were entirely useless...they just stated they booked an alternative in the country club. When I insisted to see somebody from the management, they sent the IT manager who apologized but did not come up with an adequate proposal for compensation.He told me they would come back to me with a proposal for a compensation and would take a certain part of the charge of the other hotel.Nothing happened: no message, no apologies.Stay away from this hotel. Their policy is overbooking and the competition in Windhoek allows them to do so...
Date: Date of stay: June 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hilton Windhoek
Review Content: Wundersch√∂nes Hotel in super Lage ! Der Ausblick von der Terrasse ist bei Sonnenuntergang einmalig. Das personal war sehr Behilfsam, sogar ein early check-in morgens um 9 Uhr war absolut kein Problem. Das Hilton Hotel liegt mitten in der Stadt in einem neunst√∂ckigen Geb√§ude. Es bietet eine ideale Lage, um Beh√∂rden, Finanzinstitute und kulturelle Sehensw√ºrdigkeiten schnell zu erreichen. Das Hotel bietet f√ºr nur 350 Namibian Dollar einen Airport Transfer zum Flughafen an was genauso viel kostet wie ein Taxi, aber daf√ºr f√§hrt man in einen neuen komfortablen Hertz Limousine und wird man nicht vom Taxifahrer abgezockt.
Date: Date of stay: December 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Trotz gravierender Servicem√§ngel besseres Hotel im Herzen von Windhoek
Review Content: Das Hilton war unsere letzte Unterkunft nach einer 3 w√∂chigen Rundreise durch Namibia vor dem R√ºckflug. Aufgrund des Namens und der 5 Sterne Klassifizierung und des damit verbundenen Preises waren unsere Erwartungen entsprechend hoch. Sie konnten aber nur teilweise erf√ºllt werden. Der Check in verlief schleppend und war von leichter Arroganz gepr√§gt. Gut war aber, dass man das ansonsten teure kostenpflichtige WLAN im Zimmer dadurch "geschenkt" bekam in dem man Mitglied des Hilton Programms wurde. Man machte uns klar, dass wir ja nur (!) ein Standardzimmer gebucht h√§tten und dass man f√ºr das Kind noch ein Zustellbett in das Zimmer stellen m√ºsse ( Hinweis: das war in der Buchung mit 2 E und 1 K bereits angegeben). Obwohl das Housekeeping gleich informiert wurde, war auch 5 h nach dem Einchecken immer noch keines gestellt. Unser Hinweis an die Schokolade verteilende Mitarbeiterin wurde insoweit Rechnung getragen, dass wir nach dem Abendessen vor(!!!!) unserem Zimmer das (  nicht bezogene ) Zustellbett vorfanden. Es ist unseres Erachtens ein Unding, dass man in einem 5 Sterne Hotel der Hilton Kette ein Zustellbett selbst reinrollen, M√∂bel verr√ºcken und das Bett selbst beziehen muss. Das ansprechende Zimmer selbst war im 8. Stock belegen und bot eine sch√∂ne Sicht √ºber Windhoek. An der Sauberkeit gab es nichts auszusetzen. Was aber auffiel war, dass trotz der 3-er Belegung nur ein Bademantel im Schrank hing. Eine Etage h√∂her auf dem Dach war das Highlight des Hotels, der nette gut temperierte Infinitypool mit der Skybar. Kleines Manko hier: nirgendwo war ein Hinweis wie man an die Poolhandt√ºcher kommt. Die Bar war mit einer Servicekraft auch unterbesetzt. Das dort angebotene Essen (Burger, Pizza, Sandwich und √§hnliches) war preislich und geschmacklich in Ordnung. Der von dort gebotene Blick √ºber Windhoek war etwas getr√ºbt durch  die Gro√übaustelle direkt vor dem Hotel, was man dem Hilton aber nat√ºrlich nicht anlasten kann.Das Themenabendessen im Restaurant des Hotels - war ein Buffett - (Tintenfisch, W√ºrstchen und Steaks wurden a la minute zubereitet), welches in (!) der K√ºche aufgebaut war. Es war nicht √ºberragend, aber ordentlich, der Service war vergleichbar. Preislich war es noch in Ordnung.Das Fr√ºhst√ºck war umfangreich und schmackhaft, es fehlte aber der letzte Kick, was aus einem guten Fr√ºhst√ºck ein sehr gutes macht. Positiv zu nennen sind die frisch gepressten S√§fte auf Wunsch. Der Check out verlief unproblematisch, Bordkarten wurden anstandslos und kostenfrei gedruckt. Die Hotelgarage war zwar kostenpflichtig, aber preiswert. Aber auch am Abreisetag mussten wir auf die Gep√§ckabholung 15 min warten. Fazit: der sch√∂ne Pool und das akzeptable Zimmer machen Servicem√§ngel nur teilweise wett. Von einem Hotel der Hiltongruppe sollte man mehr erwarten d√ºrfen. Zu empfehlen sind Zimmer in den h√∂hergelegenen Etagen.
Date: Date of stay: August 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: EXPERIENCE WITH HILTON
Review Content: highly disappointed with Hilton Windhoek, despite my effort to ensure that our shuttle was booked and availed on time, we still had problems on the day of arrival and departure. The hotel was not clean to my satisfaction, i spent the whole week in Hilton and my bedding was never changed, the water spills were left to dry and never wiped, i left the room when they were still there, which was evidence that the cleaners are not thorough with their job.
Date: Date of stay: July 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Well situated and comfortable
Review Content: The Hilton in Windhoek is very well situated in the city with easy access to Parliament gardens and the Christuskirche. The hotel staff is extremely friendly and attentive. The SkyBar on the 9th floor has amazing views over the city and to the mountains beyond. Very nice for sunsets. The executive lounge is also nice and Vivien and Willard were great hosts. They will easily help with reservations at restaurants and the concierge downstairs also can arrange transport to restaurants. Just be sure to agree pricing ahead of time.
Date: Date of stay: May 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Auf der Dachterrasse vom Schreck erholt
Review Content: Das Hotel liegt im Stadtzentrum und vieles l√§sst sich gut zu Fu√ü erreichen. Wir hatten das Pech, dass wir 150 Meter vorm Hotel f√ºr zwei R√§uber interessant wurden (das geh√∂rt auch zur Innenstadt), da sa√üen wir noch im Auto. Deshalb unser Rat:immer Zentralverriegelung! Wir hatten sie n√§mlich nicht benutzt und schwupps war die Tasche vom R√ºcksitz weg. Allerdings war ich auch - schwupps - vom Beifahrersitz abgeschnallt, stand gleich hinter dem R√§uber und habe sehr mit ihm geschimpft . Daraufhin lie√ü er die Tasche fallen. So etwas kann man in Namibia wagen, niemals in S√ºdafrika (da dort die √úberf√§lle viel gewaltt√§tiger sind, und man schnell ein Messer am Hals haben kann). Insofern gab es ein glimpfliches Ende, der R√§uber war erschrocken, ich irgendwie auch. Wir fuhren ins Hotel (sehr sch√∂ne, saubere Zimmer) und dann auf die gro√üz√ºgige Dachterrasse. Dort k√ºhlte ich mich im Pool ab, nahm auf den Schreck einen Sundowner und war sofort mit der guten Aussicht und dem tolle Ambiente vers√∂hnt. Nein, der kleine Bandit hat uns die Laune nicht verdorben. Aber die Standpauke, die hat er verdient :)
Date: Date of stay: January 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hilton Windhoek
Review Content: Great location, very safe area and clean. The staff are very helpful. the hotel has great facilities for guests to use. nice views overlooking Windhoek. Great if you want to take walks in a clean and safe environment with great land features
Date: Date of stay: November 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Not a Five star.
Review Content: Well this is definitely not a Five star hotel and as such is overpriced. The hotel fist impression good and modern but when you look closer one can see it is already pretty worn down for the years it is in service. Tidiness of our room was on average level. Staff was friendly and helpful but not of 5 star standard. Construction work all around the hotel these days so a bit noisy.
Date: Date of stay: September 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hilton Windhoek, Namibia stay
Review Content: This is a great hotel in a very convenient location. Easy to find if driving in from the airport. Staff very accommodating. Its hard to think of a bad word to say in fact I cannot think of one. I will stay there on my next trip to Namibia. The roof pool and bar are a great asset.
Date: Date of stay: June 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: I like it
Review Content: Overall probably best place in Windhoek - but service can be patchy.First room we had was East facing which was above the Hotel Casino - a muffled thumping sound of music until 5.30am can be heard in the room. We changed to another room because this room also had a glass panel cracked. Restaurants and bar service is patchy - some good some bad. Have found this throughout Namibia, however a little in-house training by Hilton would improve. At the sky bar for example, I ask for 2 drinks and a dessert. After a long time i enquire what's happening & the girl had forgot. Then proceeded to also forget the dessert. In the Executive Lounge they ran out of Gin early in evening and would not get replacements - surly girl on duty at time. But every time something was not right and you got a manager involved these issues were resolved quickly - so for that reason I can be forgiving. I still liked the great location and the pool area. It's good value I think and food and drink prices are good. I would go back.
Date: Date of stay: March 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Roof top swimming pool leaking. Potential danger to guests and staff
Review Content: Whilst the hotel is nice I would not stay again due to the danger of the ceiling collapsing on the 9th floor due to the roof top swimming pool leaking. So much so that it has damaged the marble flooring on the 5th Floor. My worry is that it will eventually collapse. I believe that this is a potential danger to life.
Date: Date of stay: January 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: What a mess - standards have slipped terribly!
Review Content: I have always supported this hotel as the service was always friendly and efficient.  This time around was a absolute mess and it was as if all the staff have been replaced with people who are not properly trained.  The check in took about 50 minutes and then they managed to get the room allocations all wrong as well.  The check out was just such a mess as a result of the incorrect name allocations to rooms.  The bed in the room didn't have pillowcases on half of the pillows.  The bar fridge didn't contain water but had fruit juice and alcohol.
Date: Date of stay: September 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great Location, Good Facilities, Poor Service
Review Content: Stayed here in July 2015 with family.The overwhelming vibe entering the building is of a new property...which is a good thing, as things may not have had time to wear/tear/breakdown. I really liked the facilities as I came in.The front desk staff were efficient and got us checked in quickly...as was the bellman who brought up our bags. The room itself was quite standard, but again decent build quality and good modern decor. The room did face a construction site, which I was not informed about while checking in...poor service. The hotel did appear to be running at less than full capacity so we would have appreciate an option of the other side.The best part about the hotel is the location. I think anyone with business in Windhoek would find it extremely convenient. It's barely a kilometer to any big office space or the Parliament Building for that matter. Among the facilities the Pool and Skybar are really good options to relax at. The pool was especially welcome as it was heated up, which our kid loved in the cold weather. The main restaurant Ekipa and the Skybar are well set up but I found that the staff were unable to help with any request that didn't involve ordering directly off the menu. Now this isn't a deal breaker but sometimes one is looking for something extra. This was decidedly missing.The concierge was also unhelpful with a couple of basic requests...some things  that any 2-star hotel operator (not even a concierge) should have a handle on....I won't bore with details. Overall it points to a lack of training beyond the minimum or basic level. I really expect more from a global brand like Hilton. We got much better service at the small boutique hotel Olive Exclusive across town...and they barely get as much exposure to so many visitors given their size.I think this hotel makes sense if you are looking for a "known" quantity while out on a short business trip and don't anticipate having any sort of "off the menu" requests. Else watch out...cause they will not be able to help.
Date: Date of stay: July 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Average Hilton value, pricy
Review Content: Stayed one night on business. The rooftop pool and bar made it all worth it. Sunset and the slow emergence of an incredibly starred sky - entirely cloudless this time of the year - what an experience. The pool is the width of a single lane in a regular pool but this does not lower its appeal, and exercise swimming is possible, which is not the case in other 'rooftop pools' in town. Great views of the city. Otherwise average Hilton experience, nothing impressive but expensive compared to other local accomodation.
Date: Date of stay: May 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Confortable, but not the service expected from a Hilton
Review Content: We got to the hotel at 9 pm on a Sunday. They received us very well, but when we got to the room, the mini bar had nothing on it. After traveling a lot, I was very thirsty, so asked to bring bottled water to the room while we went to the rooftop to drink some cocktails. First surprise: the bar was closing, and the girl wouldn't take any orders. When we went back to the room, our water hadn't arrived. I had to call 3 times in order to have something to drink. Breakfast was good, with lots of choices. Then, for lunch we went to the other restaurant-bar and ordered some sandwiches... almost an hour until they got to our table. Conclusion: nice hotel, confortable, but awful service. Bring a lot of patience and extra time, if not, you're gonna have a bad time here.
Date: Date of stay: January 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Slow service at the pool bar
Review Content: Hotel itself is nice enough, standard Hilton property. Ordered some food at the pool bar that took an hour to arrive and then was cold. The cocktails are decent, but again incredibly slow service. Nice views across Windhoek from the bar/pool.
Date: Date of stay: December 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A bit disappointing
Review Content: I stayed for three nights on a business trip.  At first glance the hotel is very impressive, however from the moment we stepped into the building it went downhill.  I was booked into a room with bath and shower however I was allocated a wheelchair friendly room with only a shower.  When I realised the mistake I immediately went to reception where I was told it was my fault as I should have checked when I was checked in (!).  I was then told they are fully booked and that was that.  There was no porters to assist myself and my colleague with our luggage - we had to carry all our bags by ourselves. One plus point is the rooms - they are very comfortable. The restaurant choices are very limited, especially if you are staying for more than 1 night.  At breakfast there was no option for continental, thus we had to pay for a full English breakfast although we only had cold meat. The hotel does not live up to the reputation of what one would expect of a Hilton.
Date: Date of stay: September 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: 10 out of 10
Review Content: Expectations were met from all angles - room, entertainment, service and food quality all top notch. We checked in rather late on a Wednesday evening and the check in took literally 3 minutes where after we got to our rooms and were still able to have a meal in the bar area whilst watching one of the world cup games. Breakfast was outstanding with a massive quality selection to choose from. Sky Bar at sunset was again a special experience so all in all a great stay.
Date: Date of stay: June 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Normal...
Review Content: Stayed here the 2nd time, booked in advance , yet prices are too steep for Windhoek , however it is the hilton so let's move ahead cuz of the brand. Smoking rooms available for now, bear in mind smoking in public places in the city of Windhoek is a big no no.. U can't even smoke in the open air and the Hilton Windhoek has it's share of confusion, smokers can only use the sky bar or the ground floor terrace , no smoking on the mezzanine bar which also has its own open air terrace, although we saw 3 people lighting up they were only told once they completed their cigars.. Hence we were confused. Breakfast as usual is a big spread, bear in mind this hotel is known for assigning rooms which are already being used , no clue why, it's the 2nd time it happened to us plus someone else @ breakfast had a similar story...so pardon the intrusion..
Date: Date of stay: May 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Disappointing business trip
Review Content: Check in was great.  Aubry was warm, professional and exceeded my expectation when providing assistance with check-in, internet access, etc.  I enjoyed the Roof Top bar and the lounge/bar on first floor. (Service is poor in both areas.  Thankfully, I was relaxed and did not have high expectation). My dinner at first floor lounge/bar was yummy.  Disappointments.  - Noise in room. A guest in an adjacent room made a phone call in the foyer. I heard every word - the walls and doors are not thin. - Room service. I contacted House Keeping, Room Service and the Reception Desk for a bottle opener. I wanted to enjoy a drink from the mini bar but needed an opener. 30 minutes and several phone calls before I received bottle opener and then he wanted a tip. - I asked the Concierge to assist with a dinner reservation. They forgot. No reservation was made. - At check-out, my bill for the business meeting was ambiguous (staff struggled to discern bill) and included several errors.  They argued amongst themselves and argued with me.  It was a poor end to the trip.
Date: Date of stay: December 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Very international flair
Review Content: We stayed at the Hilton on our first day, after having just travelled all the way from London. The hotel was easy to find and is straight on the way from the airport. Check in was very efficient. The room was very spacious with a nice big bathroom space. It also had a fantastic view over the city centre and the big church. We then made our way upstairs to the roof top bar which was a really nice place to relax after a long flight. We later on used the bar on the first floor which had very attentive staff. In the morning I panicked a bit as I genuinely thought I had lost my wallet and thought I had maybe dropped it in the bar. Staff at reception were extremely helpful trying to find it and soon I had about 4 people looking for it everywhere, only to then realise that it had fallen behind the desk in our room. Breakfast was also a very pleasant affair which had everything you need. I am especially a fan of made to order omelettes and I wasn't disappointed. The only con I could think of was, that being a Hilton, this hotel could have easily been anywhere in the world and was lacking a bit of local charm.
Date: Date of stay: June 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Terrible
Review Content: Stinkende ( nach Chemikalien) und schmutzige Zimmer, auch nach 4 Tagen waren die Kruemel auf dem Boden noch nicht weggestaubsaugt, die Raender auf dem Nachttisch mussten wir selber beseitigen. "Cleaning Supervisior" sehr unfreundlich und wenig hilfreich. Ist den Namen "Hilton" nicht wert.
Date: Date of stay: May 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Sensational
Review Content: The only place to stay in delightful Windhoek. Across all aspects of the stay, this is an exquisite hotel, and worth splurging on at the beginning or end of your trip to Namibia (the prices are still very competitive). The design of the building, the size and quality of the rooms, the dining experience and not least the hospitality and professionalism of the staff all add up to make this hotel a compulsory one on your Namibian itinerary. The Sky Bar is a real hit! If you're desperate to escape the nanny states of Australia, Europe and North America, come and relax here - you can have a cocktail and cigarette in peace!
Date: Date of stay: January 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good but has significant flaws
Review Content: Room in tower very pleasant. Large, quiet and nicely designed. However.....on getting to room bedside light was wrecked, phone did not work (both not plugged in and not correctly programmed) and bath water a very interesting brown colour (also stained carpet - not acceptable in hotel with these pretensions). To their credit the staff cleared these problems (with exception of stains) very quickly.9th Floor bar very pleasant and breakfast above average.After 2 days of 4 day stay I was sent a letter by management stating that my credit had run out and that I should make an immediate payment - despite having given my credit card details and the booking having been made for 4 days through travel company. I had an exchange of views with the front desk staff, who said I would receive a comment from the manager (he/she was not available for a direct discussion). Still not got it!The staff were very friendly and welcoming - but I got the feeling that the management of this hotel should be far more proactive and be more hands-on themselves. Maybe they could do with some training.A further pet-hate - paying large sums for the slowest internet in the world.
Date: Date of stay: October 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Decent stay
Review Content: Positives:- Loved the city views here. - Special mention to Giovanni at the lounge for his professionalism and efficiency, and Johannes at the front desk for friendly and helpful service. - Location is super convenient, close to shops, nightlife etc. - Executive lounge was fantastic for getting work doneImprovements needed:- The menu was very limited for vegetarians, just a couple of options, so after one pizza I had to be ordering in my food for delivery. - I‚Äôd initially booked an executive garden room but as it was unavailable when I arrived, they upgraded me to the diplomatic suite, which was not appealing‚Äî poor lighting and gloomy colors. I changed to the executive room and that was nice, would suggest though that you improve your booking system and redo the diplo suite.- Better service at sky bar during busy periods is needed.Overall, a solid city hotel, I‚Äôd recommend it but maybe advise you to make your dining plans elsewhere‚Ä¶

Name: Super entt√§uscht

Die Terrasse war belagert von jungen Einheimischen samt fragw√ºrdigen Damen, dass fast kein Platz mehr f√ºr G√§ste war. Der Service war √ºberirdisch schlecht - ich wei√ü nicht, wer hinter der Theke stand, aber es war sicher kein ausgebildetes Personal. Es dauerte 30 Minuten (bei 4 G√§sten) allein die Bestellung aufzugeben, Bier war dann schon wieder abgestanden, Cocktail wurde nicht geschafft trotz nachlesen in der Karte, Essen dauerte 1 1/2 Stunden.........ich habe super viel Verst√§ndnis f√ºr coronabedingte Engp√§sse - aber wir zahlen viel Geld f√ºr diese Unterkunft und das war unvorstellbar schlecht. Rezeption kaum besetzt, Restaurant war mit 5 Personen zum Dinner komplett √ºberfordert, Wein zu bekommen sehr schwierig, entweder nicht da oder kochend heiss, Essen h√§tte ein 12j√§hriger besser gekocht. Wir waren in jedem Restaurant tief im Busch in Namibia besser versorgt. Die Nudelsosse war mit Ketchup pfui Teufel. Also da muss das Hilton jetzt unverz√ºglich was √§ndern, sonst k√∂nnen die nach Corona schlie√üen, weil sie sich alle G√§ste vergrault haben.

Review Content: Giovanni (staff member), completely made the entire stay experience worth the stay.  Food selection away from the hotel is plentiful and easily within walking distance.  Food at the hotel is good but do venture away at times.

Name: Premium hotel in Windhoek
Review Content: After a very long flight from the states, we always look for a reliable option to recoup and catch up on our sleep to get on the new time zone.  This hotel serves its purpose for us without being the most luxurious Hilton we've seen before.  The common areas are very premium looking but the rooms are average.  They are clean and definitely comfortable but they have a funny open bathroom format that has the shower only a few feet from the bed.  The morning breakfast buffet is plentiful and our a la carte dinner was fine too.  There is a lovely rooftop pool and bar area that is a nice way to end the day.  Workout run is on the top floor with a panoramic view of the city.  There is a mall walking distance from the hotel so if you need anything before going 'into the bush' on safari, you can easily find it.  There's not much to check out relative to sightseeing - it really is simply a springboard for seeing the country or doing business in this city.
Date: Date of stay: August 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Centrale, comodo, accogliente!
Review Content: La scelta dell'hotel Hilton di Windhoeck  l'ho fatta dopo il suggerimento di una amica. Ho guardato la location e le foto dell'hotel e mi sono convinto che questa sarebbe stata una buona scelta per me e per i miei amici (eravamo 3 coppie, a me √© stato delegato il compito di provvedere a tutto). √à stata un'ottima scelta, facile da raggiungere provenendo dall'aeroporto, La struttura ha un comodo garage sotterraneo dove parcheggiare la macchina. Servizi molto efficienti, camere molto gradevoli ed ampie e un comodo letto. La colazione √© molto buona e offre qualcosa che non mi era mai capitato finora, ottimi smooties che vengono preparati al momento (io viaggio spesso per lavoro).  Decisamente una buona scelta!
Date: Date of stay: June 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Excellent hotel with room for improvement
Review Content: This review would have been 5* if not for the bad start to my stay. I had booked to be collected at the airport and confirmed this again a few days before my arrival. I received email confirmation that I would be collected, however nobody turned up to collect me. This is not acceptable, especially for a hotel of this standard. There is nothing worse for a traveller arriving in a new country to have no one to meet them. It transpired a car had been booked to collect me from the airport on the day I left. Not good enough and the procedure needs reviewing.Shortly after arriving a member of staff brought to my room a welcome card and a bowl of nuts, dried fruit and billtong. This was a lovely touch, unfortunately the welcome card was addressed to another guest. A minor detail of course, but minor details are important to guests.Apart from the bad start the rest of my stay was excellent. I stayed in a tower room, which was very large, spotlessly clean and beautifully appointed. Room service was very prompt. Breakfast is of a very high standard with a huge variety of choice, but should be included in the room rate. All the staff I spoke to were friendly, welcoming and helpful. A real asset to the hotel. The top floor roof terrace is super with a small pool and lovely bar area. The hotels location is very convenient. Just a short walk to the famous church and the independence memorial and museum. A little further up hill, but quite walkable is the botanical gardens which are well worth a visit.This is a quality hotel with great staff and I will definitely stay here again when I am in Windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: May 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
