Name: Not really worth the money
Review Content: I feel like I expected more from a Hilton Hotel. The first negative was we waited 1.5hours before we could go to our rooms. While I understand we arrived at 1:30pm and check in time is only at 2:00pm, we still waited a whole hour after we should have been able to check in before we got to go to our rooms. The second negative was that there was no free WiFi to guests in their rooms. You have to pay for it. Their third negative was that we were told the the spa closed at 6pm when we tried to make a booking, yet it is advertised in the book in the hotel room and the door outside the spa that they close at 10pm.Sky bar is pretty and has an amazing view, but it gets full very fast. So if you want a table, go a bit earlier. Their breakfast I will say was amazing! They had such a wide spread and the chefs/kitchen staff are very helpful and accommodating towards anyone with food allergies or certain food requirements. The rooms are nice and clean and had everything I needed. The double bed bathroom situation is weird as you can see the other person if they in the shower or bathing (I shared with my siblings). It‚Äôs nice, but just a bit awkward if you‚Äôre not a couple.

Name: One night stay in Windhoek
Review Content: After a long road trip through North East Namibia is was fantastic to pull in to the Hilton for our last night. The facilities were excellent and a drink at the roof top bar and a swim was the perfect end to our family holiday. We really appreciated the standard check out time being 12 noon as most other places are at 10 a.m , this was fantastic for a bit more pool time before heading to the airport. The breakfast was outstanding

Name: Good Location and comfortable stay
Review Content: The Hilton has an ideal location in the CBD for a business trip. The rooms are in good condition, the food is decent and the gym is user-friendly (and open 24 hours which is a plus). The internet connection was quite intermittent which is problematic if you have work to finish at the hotel. Overall its a good experience for a frequent traveller
Date: Date of stay: June 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Reliable Full Amenities Hotel in Downtown Windhoek
Review Content: It was nice to have my own queen bed for a night on a trip I'd been sharing with a friend. The room was spacious. There was a GORGEOUS tub, but unless we kicked the other out there was no door to allow privacy. My problem with the hotel was that when we checked in, the front desk woman asked if she could upgrade us, which would mean access to the lounge for drinks and breakfast. Of course we said yes. The next morning when we went to get our breakfast, though, the woman at the lounge told us we weren't upgraded. If we had known that, we would have accounted for it in our timeline and planned around having to get breakfast somewhere else. Ultimately, it took me insisting that she call the woman from the night before to confirm to finally let us in, but it meant we stood there looking like jerks for half an hour wasting time. She clearly cared more about the process than common sense and customer service. Also, the cabs FROM this hotel cost more than if you book them separately. I recommend getting your taxi driver's card from your trip from the airport and arranging transport with him. There is a lovely roofdeck with pool, but it was too cold to use it.
Date: Date of stay: May 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Yet another great stay
Review Content: I always stay (when it is not fully booked) in this hotel when in Windhoek. Excellent and attentive staff and in a very central situation both for business and leisure facilities.  Menu can be repetitive but plenty of restaurants nearby to add to variety
Date: Date of stay: June 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Pleasent stay after a wonderful visit to Namibia

The breakfast was perfect with the best cappuccino in Namibia!

Name: Bad customer service at Plaza Casino
Review Content: The staff at the Plaza Casino, namely the bar staff and waiters, are incompetent, lazy and inhospitable. Not only have I experienced, but I witnessed how they do not rotate much around the casino floor, they would get orders from the tables and slots customers and the latter would end up walking to the bar counters themselves just to find their meals placed there unattended after what seems to be more than an hour of waiting. One rarely sees them cleaning up the empty glasses and used plates from the floor. They have attitude towards the customers and do not know how to address them properly. This kind of service is harming the reputation of Hilton Hotel and Plaza Casino, I suggest they start hiring more experienced and competent bar staff.

Name: THIEVES at large .. Poorest service considering the brand
Review Content: I had a very bad experience during my stay at this property. I stayed in this hotel for almost 4 months.Some staffs are nice i must say. But max of them including the upper layer of staffs are just thieves.I never had such issue even in the tiniest hotels in dangerous most places around the world.During my stay there i gave some of my clothes for laundry one day, including a sweat shirt(My fav one) that was gifted by my late grandfather.  They lost it  and said i have never given them any. I was furious about it as that was the last piece of materialistic attachment i had with my Grand father. Upon showing the laundry slip finally they agreed that they have  lost it and they said they will look into the matter. after continuous follow up by me they finally reimbursed the amount 7or 800NAD.I thought ok .. done is done.. I have been reimbursed so no point shouting about it..But to my utter dissatisfaction just before my last day i found that 500USD has been stone from my room safe. Safe is not at all safe in this hotel. But i thank to who so ever stole that money , because they were just settling scores. Thank god they didn't stole my passport....
Date: Date of stay: February 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

The roof top bar with the swimming pool is a great place for a sundowner.

Name: Buon permottamento
Review Content: Personale molto accogliente, camere carine e spaziose ma nella nostra c'era puzza di fumo. Ambienti comuni belli ma poco curati / trasandati ( corridoi sporchi) i punti di favore: colazione buona e variegata e bel roof top con piscina e bar
Date: Date of stay: August 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: There is just a little too much that goes wrong here
Review Content: The Hilton has pros and cons. Let's start with the pros. The pool on the roof is nice. Peaceful, heated, great views. Breakfast is another. Has everything you want.Then there are the cons, of which there are a few.1. We had a booking through hotels.com. 5 People, 2 rooms. A couple of days before arriving I sent an email asking if they had a pickup service from the airport. I recieved no answer and thus assumed we would not be picked up. We were picked up all the same, but they thought they were pickin up one person, not five. That's a little odd? It got a little crowded in the car.2. Check in is excruciatingly slow. It litterally took ages. We're travelling with three kidsand wanted rooms next to each other. Check in is at 1400 hrs. They gave us 1 room, assuring us that the other would be available very soon. That took about 3 hours, way beyond check in time. We got annoyed, asked several times, and in the end it turned out the room had been ready the whole time, but housekeeping and reception had been unable to communicate that to anyone, despite our constant asking.3. Laundry. We had a bit of laundry. It all came back very quickly, but 5 tees and a pair of socks were lost. We're from Norway, were such tees can easily be 800 rand a piece. We also had designer tees a lot more expensive than that, but they were not lost. We've had endless discussions with staff about this, still nothing has been reimbursed, this is about a month ago now. In all fairness a manager cut through and decided we did not have to pay the about 800 rand for the washing. 4. Hotel needs to work on some routines. Our room neighbour had ordered room service. He then placed leftovers outside his room, probably expecting them to be removed. From what I could oberve that took at least 6 hours. The only Hilton I've stayed at before was in Tokyo. They would have removed this within 6 seconds I would guess.5. Wifi is not free, but at check in we were told they'd enroll us in some sort of program that would give us free wifi. When checking out they still wanted us to pay. Same manager cut through again, that's nice.All in all we're not too happy. We've been to Southern Africa several times, to Namibia too, but this reminded me more of East Africa than Southern Africa. It's a comfortable hotel, rooms are ok, the one manager was helpfull (though our clothes are still lost), but I don't think we will be returning to the Hilton.
Date: Date of stay: July 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Pleasant experience
Review Content: This was my 1st stay and my expectations were high. I battled to find the entrance to the parking garage when I arrived late at night. Checking in went smoothly except they couldn't find my Hilton Honours number on their system. Room was spacious and comfortable. The bathroom was large and had a bath and a shower. Breakfasts were excellent and I enjoyed the pizza that I ordered for dinner from room service. I was irritated by the fact that on two occasions my electronic access card would not work in the lift and I had to get it reset. Check out was very slow because they did not split my bill into accommodation and breakfast (paid by travel agent) and additional charges. An unplanned expense was 2 nights parking at 60 dollars per night. Overall a good experience but not better than the other BnBs and other hotels in Windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: July 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Confortevole
Review Content: Hotel situato nel centro del paese! Peccato che durante il nostro soggiorno tutta la zona era in ristrutturazione. Stanze pulite e molto curate, il pezzo forte rimane lo Sky bar situato sulla terrazza che domina Windhoek e i suoi tramonti bellissimi.Cucina ottima e ogni sera c'√® una serata a tema. Davvero molto bello. Ottimo come arrivo in Namibia
Date: Date of stay: July 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Do not use the spa
Review Content: Hotel is nice, great location, but make sure you have your booking confirmation with you. I had to resend mine to the reception twice before the issues I had was fixed. Hotel is very clean and rooms are comfortable. I can't argue with that. DO NOT USE THE SPA. Go somewhere else.  The breakfast is amazing. High five to all the chefs and the staff who work hard to prepare it. There is a lot of construction around the hotel so expect to have some level of noise. The fitness  center is ok. if you have a good fitness imagination you can get a good workout in. Sky bar is cool - definitely worth going.
Date: Date of stay: July 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: CLASSY
Review Content: Best place to stay if you need peace and tranquility, well design room that give that smile as you walk in, it one of those place you wish u can carry home with you.  Well located with Windhoek town, no need to worry about traffic. the service is of high standards.
Date: Date of stay: June 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Very good
Review Content: Stayed here one night after arriving in Windhoek. We had three rooms and all of us very much enjoyed the hotel. The rooms were spacious and very well appointed. A roof top pool and bar were very good. The service was especially good. All of the staff were warm, friendly and gracious. We used the bar and restaurant three times and all were very good. Highly recommended for a stay in Windhoek.

Review Content: Fantastic hotel, great and friendly staff, comfortable and easy to access facilities. very professional conference organisers and well laid out venue. the wifi needs to be easier and stronger connection as i was unable to download emails, but overall a fantastic stay!

Name: A nice change from budget tour hotel.
Review Content: This hotel proved a comforting change from long road travel tour of Zimbabwe, Botswana and Namibia. The roof top top swimming pool was sheer luxury with a view of the city. The service was excellent too.
Date: Date of stay: April 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: THIS HOTEL NEEDS LOVE IN MORE WAYS THAN ONE!!
Review Content: Although this hotel is beautiful hotel in terms of its design, it needs great improvement in the following ways:  (1) the Internet needs major improvements. (2) the carpets in the rooms need to be replaced as they appear dirty and not properly cared for; (3) the curtains in the Executive Lounge need replacing, as they are dry rot and falling apart; and (4) the staff needs to be properly trained.I have been at the hotel on a business trip and have been working on my laptop from the hotel.  The Internet has only been working 60% of the time, as it keeps dropping.  Additional, there are pockets of time where it just does not work.  It is completely frustrating, and has lead to my decision not to stay here for my next trip to  Namibia.  I am here once a month for Board meetings.  The room design is one of the best I have experienced amongst the many hotels I have stayed in.  However, the rooms need a bit of love, and particularly, the carpets look very dirty, and I highly recommend replacement!!The disposition of the staff is always friendly and accommodating in typical Namibian style.  However, they clearly need additional training.  I was given a face cloth that was new, and it still had the tag on the face cloth when I picked it up to wash my face.  When we arrived there was a power outage and the front desk team couldn't check us in the room because the system was down.  The staff said that they couldn't find the Master Key, and thus couldn't allow us into the rooms which they had assigned for us.  So, they took us up to the Executive Lounge and asked us to wait until they could check us in.  No problem!!  However, after waiting 2 hours in the Lounge, I overheard the Lounge attendant tell a guest that had just arrived that the hotel was having power issues, however, he could use the Master Key to open his room for him.   At that moment, I was very confused, as it was obvious that someone had a Master Key which could be used to open the rooms.  Yet, we sat and waited for 2 hours before we were given access into our room.  Please send my compliments to "Gabriel" in the Executive Lounge, as he goes out the way to make the guest feel comfortable and satisfied!!
Date: Date of stay: April 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Central location, motivated staff and excellent food
Review Content: Centrally located in "downtown" Windhoek, it is an ideal location for any reason being in the city. Windhoek for those who are visiting for the first time, is a small city of approximately 400,000 inhabitants. It has influences of Africa combined with the country's german roots with an additional mix of Afrikaans influence (South African "Dutch") and a small white English language representation.The Hilton is not on a large plot of land but rather a 10-storey building overlooking the "skyline". The bar next to the small roof-top pool is great for chilling out. Rooms are excellent, modern with a touch of Africa....  The bar is also great on the 1st. floor and the restaurant is truly a hidden gem with a  wide range of quality to wet any appetite....Check out the way the head chef keeps the staff on the move... very impressive! If you don't see your favourite, ask... they will bend over backwards to help.Parking is a real driving challenge with lots of twists and turns downstairs.... there is also apparently a casino... sorry, don't gamble! The downside was the speed at which the lifts operated... You really need all three lifts to be operating and apparently one has not been working for over one month.... The icing on the cake is the excellent frequent guest facilities located on the top floor offering between 6 and 8pm (including alcoholic) drinks and finger food of excellent quality. All in all, a hotel that can proudly put the name Hilton on its facade!
Date: Date of stay: February 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: STAY AT THE HILTON - WINDHOEK, NAMIBIA
Review Content: Very clean and comfortable environment to stay in. Rooms and service were excellent. Staff friendly but professional. Some niggles with Internet and parking but overall well worth the visit.  Forcing me to use a minimum of 200 characters for this review is very irritating. I like to leave succinct (to the point) messages. I do not have the time or inclination to count the number of characters used in my assessment of this institution.
Date: Date of stay: February 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Not reaching the Hilton standard as many problems in the hotels
Review Content: The Hilton Windhoek was perfectly located, it was easily found. Hotel staff were polite, hotel room was tidy, breakfast was nice. We stayed there at the first night and the last night of my Christmas trip. Everything seemed to be fine at the first night, however after we checked out we found out that the hotel deducted more money from my credit card, after several rounds of checking and email communication, the hotel returned the money to me.At the last night of my trip, we stayed in Hilton again, that night was terrible! The pillow sheet was missing, the bath gel was missing, the hotline could not be reached by using the phone in room, there were lots of buzz noise during night, making me keep awake and awake during MIDNIGHT and finally I went to the reception in person to complain! It was a nightmare because it should not be the standard of the Hilton Hotel! Finally the hotel reduced the accomodation fee as compensation.
Date: Date of stay: December 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Das Fr√ºhst√ºcksbuffet ist sehr grossz√ºgig (frische Eier nach Wunsch, Fr√ºchte, Saft, Brot in allen Variationen, etc).Das Zimmer war gross aber leider  zwischen 2 Fahrst√ºhlen eingeklemmt und vor den Fenstern hatten wir das grosse Gitter √ºber dem Haupteingang. Name: Does not live up to Hilton standards
Review Content: We booked this hotel for our last night in Namibia, as we were unable to stay at the lovely Airbnb we had had on  arrival. What a disappointment! The room was what we had expected, a good level of comfort, modern bathroom with good shower and a comfortable bed. However the pool which had appeared so inviting in the promotional pictures was small, and for a hotel of this size only eight loungers seems a little mean. Consequently on this Sunday afternoon there was not even anywhere to sit let alone lay. This situation was further compounded by a large number of people who were obviously not guests of the hotel. In general the atmosphere was not pleasant and the level of service was very poor with plates of congealed food lying around as well as dirty glasses. At the sky bar later in the evening the poor level of service was again evident when we had difficulty getting served and also paying our bill. They seemed to work on the principle of he who shouts loudest,Service in the restaurant was better, but the buffet meal was not impressive particularly in comparison to others we had in much cheaper hotels. The following morning the breakfast packs we were supposed to have were not forthcoming and we were informed that we should be paying for the parking although they did agree to waive this charge as we had not been informed of it on arrival. Altogether not a good experience and we would not recommend this Hilton. There are better places to stay in Windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: November 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Just the Front Desk
Review Content: Everything as usual excellent. Room was as ever well furnished and kept in great order by the housekeeping staff. Food was well above average and service was to a high standard. Only two points keep me awarding 5*. The first is the excessive cost for the provision of internet in the room. As I was there on business I needed 7 day/week coverage which was $100 - This is by far te most I have been charged, in fact most hotels provide the service free. The other, less important one was the failure of staff at the front desk to deal with my early check in and then, having booked an extra night, phoned at 11pm on the night prior to my departure to ask why I hadn't checked out. Pity, otherwise a great hotel

Name: Windhoek Relaxing
Review Content: Traditional hotel, but excellent staff and service;  Make the breakfast buffet a must - what other place has a wonderful juice bar included with breakfast.  From hotel, its 2 blocks to downtown shopping - just beware that the city shuts down at 5 pm, except for a few restuarants.   Check out the sky bar - great city views; only negative is no beer on tap.
Date: Date of stay: April 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Very good business hotel
Review Content: The Hilton Windhoek has very comfortable and large rooms with good bedding which is important for me, but I was a little surprised by the open toilet and shower area which would be good for couples. The hotel has good facilities - swimming pool and a roof-top bar offering good views over the city. The spread at breakfast was good and I had the chance to visit the Executive Lounge which was stocked with food and drinks depending on the time of the day. The staff were prompt to handle requests and tried to engage in conversations with guests and I always felt welcomed during my stay. I thought a few areas that the hotel can improve on would be having more gym equipment - though I acknowledge that this might be difficult due to the small space. Wifi access should also be made available free of charge in the rooms rather an within the public area. This is already a luxury/business hotel so guests shouldn't be penalised if they need to get online to do work.
Date: Date of stay: March 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great, Modern Hilton
Review Content: Real good experience at this hotel.  Common space is nice, including restaurants, bars, and the pool.  Rooms are modern and clean.  Lounge was also particularly nice and the food spread in there was definitely above average.  Hotel is also quite central.  For comparison purposes, I found this Hilton to be very much like the Hilton in Auckland.Some staff appeared a bit unknowledgeable at times - about the town and the hotel - but overall service levels were pretty good.

Name: Nice place
Review Content: Very good place where to stay in a town with a medium low hotel offer.It's an international Bussines hotel with related services ( nice bars,  good breakfast ) and room fittings ( big and confortable bed, spacious  bathroom , very clean and silent room ) nothing more but nothing less ( a part from wifi which is not free! ) Concierge and desk people are helpfull and polite.Summary : Four stars and half

Name: Mopane worms
Review Content: Free Wifi is available outside your room and in common areas so if you stand real close to your door, you can connect.Pool area was very crowded; not many people in the water; the pool is just a small strip of a pool. No pool attendant so I had to ask several people to find out where to get a pool towel; they are in the exercise room.Room was very nice; great beds; nice and quiet.  Great aircon. Great bathroom and shower.Nice breakfast buffet.  They even have Nutella.Parking is in the basement and it is a little tricky to find the entrance.Dinner buffet on Friday night was local cusine so I had my fill of Mopane worms.  The rest of my family ordered off the ala carte menu and they were happy.Service and staff was excellent!
Date: Date of stay: January 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good place to stay in Windhoek
Review Content: OK, one thing every visitor should know is that Windhoek isn't the place to spend your Namibian vacation.  Oh, it's perfectly fine, and more than safe enough, but you should "get in and get out" ASAP.  We had a later afternoon arrival at the airport and an early morning flight out, so we spent two nights.  That was plenty.  Also, if you're in town on a Sunday, it's a complete ghost town (the nearby NICE restaurant, not really within walking distance, is one of the few places to eat on Sundays and I would recommend it).As a HHonors gold member, we got room upgrades (one better than the other), and free access to the executive lounge and breakfast.  Both the lounge and breakfast are above-average; honestly, the breakfast buffet is truly 5-stars, and probably the best feature of the hotel.  The executive lounge had free alcohol in the evening and put out enough dishes that you could make a meal out of it if you wanted to.The lounge is located on the pool level, where there is also an attractive Sky Bar.  The problem is that in boring Windhoek, the Sky Bar seems to be the place to go.  So it's popular with the locals.  This is bad for guests because there's too much "scene" there, and it makes the pool area and bar crowded and less desirable.Bottomline, as an HHonors Gold member, I wouldn't think of staying anywhere else in Windhoek.   That said, I wouldn't plan on staying any longer than I need to, either!
Date: Date of stay: December 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Views from the Skybar on the ninth floor are great! But the DJ on Friday night inappropriate for setting/cocktail bar - too loud! Also the passage light shows under door and disturbed us.

Name: nice hotel, poor staff attitude
Review Content: We stayed at the hotel the night of October 30, 2014, arriving in the evening with a group of travelers. In spite of the long advance notice of arrival, few of the registrations and keys had been done, resulting in a significant wait for a tired group. My wife and I went up to the lovely rooftop patio bar and I ordered a glass of brandy. This took nearly 30 minutes to be served, during which time the waitresses and bartenders were generally standing around doing nothing. The elevators in this hotel are not obvious to use, requiring some fancy button pushing. No signs, no advance warning from the front desk. Nearby staff were not interested in helping when asked. So physically this is a beautiful hotel and could be a nice spot to stay but for the poor staff attitude. If it were only one or two staff members we could shrug it off, but they were all that way - just disinterested and bored. This in turn suggests some sort of ongoing management problem. The one bright spot was the greeter at the morning breakfast buffet - he was wonderful and the food was excellent. However, next time in Windhoek we will stay elsewhere.
Date: Date of stay: October 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Date: Date of stay: May 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice Stay in Windhoek
Review Content: The hotel was very nice and modern. There is good food in each of the restaurants on the property and the Sky Bar Lounge / Pool on the roof is an added bonus. Only downside was the "thin" walls, which you could hear each door in the hotel closing through. I would stay again though, good value for the money!
Date: Date of stay: May 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great stay!
Review Content: The hotel is centrally located right in downtown Windhoek. The staff is very friendly and the swimming pool and bar area on top of the hotel is spectacular. They are working on some leaks in the pool, but we were not inconvenienced by it at all. There are many tourist attractions in walking distance from the hotel.
Date: Date of stay: March 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: As I might expect from a Hilton hotel
Review Content: Well appointed room.  Modern decor.  Comfortable.The lobby is lovely, the restaurants are nice and offer good value.  The only criticism I might make is about their meat suppliers,  The steaks were not always very tender.All in all, a nice place to stay.
Date: Date of stay: January 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great hotel but the customer service is lacking
Review Content: I was initially allocated a smoking room on arrival and when I asked for a non-smoking room, I was told that there is nothing they can do for me. The manager has the same unhelpful manner. No offer to check if there are any cancellations were made. One of my colleagues offered to swap his non-smoking room with me as I had a cold. The experience was a big disappointment for me. The room was very spacious and beautiful. Negatives : no bottled water except in the bar fridge (charged) and R185 for 24h wifi. I will stay there again for the location but this time I will take my own bottled water and double check before I depart that I have been allocated a non-smoking room.
Date: Date of stay: February 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Really great staff... Great rooms... But....
Review Content: Stayed here for a week in Jan. 2014.  The staff are super friendly, the rooms were gorgeous though during the day you can here loud music from some store blasting all day long and unfortunately it's the same darn song...We have executive rooms with lounge access.  Lounge was standard, it did the trick.  Concierge was great with arranging taxis to restaurants.  The rooftop pool is absolutely gorgeous!  But... it's leaking thru the roof of the hotel... you can see it dripping.... which is a big shame cause I believe the building is not very old.    That's going to be some major renovation in the upcoming months cause it's only going to get worse.  But overall very happy with this hotel and I would recommend it.
Date: Date of stay: January 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hilton Namibia
Review Content: Nice hotel, clean but mundane. i had expected the Hilton standard but  fall short a little. i expected to have  WiFi to be up and running but was disappointed. it was latter fixed toward to end of my stay but alas you still have to pay for internet  separate from your room charges, that was obviously over priced.  the staff will obviously benefit from customer service training .
Date: Date of stay: October 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: zentrale Lage, sauber
Review Content: gut gelegen, Stadtzentrum zu Fuss leicht erreichbar, grosse Zimmer, sauber, tolles Badezimmer, Fr√ºhst√ºck toll, Abendessen m√§ssig. Leider hatten wir das Zimmer offensichtlich √ºber der K√ºche, abends Geruch von Grillfisch, morgens "Ham and egg", die zweite Nacht auf der Gegenseite war die Musik der Bar bis in die Morgenstunden h√∂rbar. Das Personal an der Rezeption ist zum Teil sehr bem√ºht und ausgesprochen nett, teilweise aber leider auch Angestellte, die entweder √ºberfordert  oder wenig motiviert sind. Insgesamt ein "Business Hotel", wenig afrikanischer Flair, eher k√ºhl, insgesamt  aber gut.Tolle Aussicht bei der Dachterrasse, Pool ...
Date: Date of stay: November 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Excellent hotel
Review Content: Super hotel, goee locatie al moet men ervoor zorgen dat de service en diensten ten alle tijde uitmunted is. Staking of niet. Hiltion= premium brand= premium pricing= premium services and accomodation this was not the case and NO alternatives we're offered.
Date: Date of stay: December 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Tiefe Provinz
Review Content: Super Auftritt in der Empfangshalle. Super Auftritt von aussen. Super Auftritt der Empfangs-Boys, etc.Aber das ist auch schon alles! Das Personal am Empfang, das heisst diejenigen mit der Kontrolle am Computer, sind sehr schnell √ºberfordert. Umst√§ndlicher geht's fast nicht. Langsam und ohne √úbersicht. Warteschlangen wie in einer Gross-Stadt. Haha. Einer von 4 Countern besetzt. Der Rest ist wohl hinten besch√§ftigt.Eine vergessene N√©cessaire-Tasche im Zimmer wurde nicht mehr gefunden. Das obwohl wir den Namen der Dame, welche f√ºr unser Zimmer verantwortlich war gewusst und telefonisch nach zwei Stunden nach den Aushecken mitgeteilt haben.OhOh‚Ä¶.. Meiner Meinung nach ist das Hilton in Windhoek also nicht so vertrauensw√ºrdig. Zwei Wochen sp√§ter (und das haben die an der Rezeption ja gewusst), sind wir wieder im Hilton abgestiegen. NIEMAND WUSSTE ETWAS VON UNSERER N√©CESSAIRE-TASCHE‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.. Wir wurden mehr oder weniger so "durchgewunken/abgefertigt". Ich war einfach zu m√ºde, mich mit solch idiotischen Dingen noch abzugeben. Aber in solch einem Haus ist das gezeigte Verhalten unter allem Niveau.Die Zimmer sind sch√∂n. gewohntes Niveau von Hilton.
Date: Date of stay: September 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Prezzo abbordabile, standard un po' sotto le aspettative
Review Content: ho passato una notte all'hotel che si trova in una posizione molto centrale della citt√†. La costruzione √® un po' datata, il progetto discutibile, soprattutto la stanza che ha il bagno senza porta (solo doccia e WC hanno la porta) e il WC (e la doccia) senza luce dedicata.  Ottime le prese di corrente internazionali. Ottima la pulizia e gli accessori incluso un potente asciugacapelli. Stanza abbastanza spaziosa e luminosa, ben oscurabile. Climatizzazione centralizzata. Armadi capienti e illuminati. Manca il sistema di chiusura centralizzata della corrente.Personale al banco un po' lento ma molto gentile. Servizio e cortesia eccellenti.Abbiamo anche cenato nel ristorante dell'hotel. La variet√† del men√π e l'organizzazione del ristorante sono migliorabili (la capo cameriera ha esitato a darci il tavolo richiesto perch√© ancora da "rifare"). La qualit√† inferiore allo standard atteso per un hotel di questo tipo. Forse perch√© era domenica sera? La prima colazione invece √® stata eccellente per variet√† e qualit√†. Migliorabile la qualit√† dei cornetti...Roof garden and pool molto romantica per un tramonto su Windhoek e dintorni indimenticabile.
Date: Date of stay: September 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good value, well located
Review Content: We enjoyed 3 nights in this luxurious hotel. Room was excellent, roomy with comfortable beds, nice towels and good quality toiletries. The shower door and shaving mirror were broken on our arrival but both were quickly repaired, or we were given the option of moving rooms (but were too tired!) Breakfast was a comprehensive buffet, from 0700 hrs weekends and 0630 hrs Mon-Fri- probably should be from 0600 hrs every day for those with early flights/activities to catch . Room service was variable and at times slow. The only draw back was having to pay for internet access, during our 17 days in Namibia this was the only place we were asked to pay to use the internet. We had 1 meal at the restaurant buffet, food was nice but nothing exceptional. Happy hour Mon-Fri in the bar on level 1 was good value, and you must enjoy drinks by the pool in the Skybar at sunset, lovely views over the city.
Date: Date of stay: September 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Sosta dopo il lungo trasferimento
Review Content: Ottimo hotel situato nel centro della citt√†. Parcheggio a disposizione al costo giornaliero di ‚Ç¨ 5,00. Abbiamo preso due camere standard comunicanti. Ottimi e molto grandi i letti pulizia buona pensando che siamo pur sempre in Africa!!!Ottima per scelta e qualit√† la colazione.Consigliatissimo come sosta dopo il lungo viaggio e prima della partenze per il tour della Namibia.
Date: Date of stay: August 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Stay at the Hilton Windhoek
Review Content: Loved the Hotel in the center of Windhoek, and the pool was very much appreciated by the family after 10 days driving in the South. Nevertheless got riped-off at the restaurant and it left us a bitter taste after a Fantastic break in Namibia.
Date: Date of stay: August 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hilton Windhoek
Review Content: Value for money, clean rooms. Its situated in town. They have internet which you pay for but some social sites are blocked. They have a shuttle to and from the airport. They also have a restaurant which serves local and international menus and buffet.
Date: Date of stay: July 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Gold
Review Content: Every trip to Windhoek Namibia is like retrurning to Home.  It is special every time. The staff remembers my name, Mark at the Executive Lounge has the room special clean and prepared and Ronald always support when I need a room and fight our global travel reservations people.
Date: Date of stay: June 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: very good experience by all means
Review Content: It is the 3rd time I am in Namibia and every time I have been quite satisfied with the hotel that I stayed in. Until I "discovered" Hilton this time. It is by all means the best hotel in town for business.The service - staff wise - is not in the level sb expects, esp when it is a business trip, however, the rest makes up for it. The room was great, I got an upgraded room, the breakfast was excellent. The food was so good in general, that every night we preferred to dine in the hotel,and nowhere else. Definitely a come back.
Date: Date of stay: May 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Lovely rooms & rooftop bar but Wifi crazy expensive
Review Content: This is my second trip to Windhoek and we choose this hotel after a great experience last time. The rooms are spacious and lovely (great deep bath and double headed shower). The rooftop bar  and pool is perfect for watching the sun set over the city but it was not quite as nice as remembered. We stayed a week and housekeeping was a little inconsistent. This time there were no robes or slippers but the big problem was getting out of the shower after the room had been made up only to find that although the wet towels had been removed no new towels were provided!  A hand towel doesn't cut it! Turn down service was there for some nights but not others and on one occasion a staff member just let themselves into the room without even knocking. Wifi is ridiculously expensive and the lack of free wifi even in the lobby is disappointing. Particularly frustrating is that you have to pay for each device separately. To get a weekly access for my mac and my iPhone  (not even counting the iPad) would be more than $200 USD. Even for the business market this is pretty galling and it might contribute to me choosing to try the castle next time instead. All the same a very nice reliable hotel with great bar and lovely breakfast buffet.
Date: Date of stay: May 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Beautiful Property in great location
Review Content: We stayed here several days on three different occasions as we traveled around Namibia in January.  The rooms are great, the food is exceptional, the service was excellent and they have a lovely rooftop pool and bar with wonderful views of the city.  The beds are wonderful too!  Although there is a definite German influence in Windhoek (actually the entire country), we liked the Hilton as there was a very culturally diverse clientele staying in the hotel.It is in the heart of the city, close to shopping and a weekend open-air craft market.  I wouldn't say that Windhoek is a hopping city, but it is the capitol and largest city in Namibia and it is centrally located in the country. We heard there were some interesting evening shows, but we pretty much stayed close to the hotel.  We felt very safe around the hotel.
Date: Date of stay: January 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Lovely hotel, great views from the rooftop bar!
Review Content: The executive room I had was magnificent in all respects.  Took a while to find the switch for the funny blue light near the loo, but after that, peace and sleep were mine!  The rooftop swimming pool was lovely, especially when the thunderstorms started all around, what a view!The only drawback of the hotel is the high cost of the WiFi, bu that is a general complaint I have about many good hotels all over the world.  I really feel we need free WiFi on all devices!
Date: Date of stay: February 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good hotel in a good location.
Review Content: The Hilton Hotel in Windhoek is probably the best in the area and is conveniently located in the city centre close to shopping malls and restaurants. The location is also very good if driving for the first time in Namibia as you will drive past it once coming into town.  The staff is very attentive and polite. The rooms are very clean (it is still fairly new, so lets hope this standard is upheld) and not too bad space wise. I never ate dinner in the restaurant on my previous visit, but walked down the road to a franchise steakhouse instead so cannot comment on the restaurant, although I have had meals here in the past on business meetings and the food was of a good to high standard if somewhat pricey (standard prices for hotel restaurants). While the TV option provided a good selection there were not too many sports channels, this may not be an issue for most travellers, but as I am on business a lot of the time I try to keep up with the Champions League, cricket other live sporting events etc. so a good selection of channels is always appreciated by myself. The only two issue‚Äôs I would have with the Hilton is, firstly, the charging of WiFi, the other ‚Äúluxury‚Äù hotel in the area (of a decent standard) the Country Club, does not charge for this at all, this is quite important when travelling on business. The rooms are also not as spacious as the Country Club, but are of a higher standard. Again, as I am on business most of the time the larger space and free WiFi makes the world of difference. I do understand that most hotels charge for WiFi these days, but, most of the other hotels in Windhoek don‚Äôt. All in all a very good hotel and I would definitely recommend it, but would take into account the very minor issues noted above. Finally, the major disappointment with this hotel is the charging of parking! I was actually shocked to be presented with a bill for overnight parking even though I was a guest at the hotel. I can understand this practice in major, congested cities, but this is not the case in Windhoek. This must be rectified by management of the Hilton as it does make you feel like they are trying to squeeze more money out of you!
Date: Date of stay: March 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Speed of Service could be greatly improved
Review Content: Great modern hotel and facilities but the service is way to slow. It needs immediate attention and takes away from a great looking place with good facilities. More memorable than the looks are the slowness of service, food takes an hour to be delivered regardless if you are ordering one plate or food six.
Date: Date of stay: February 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Date: Date of stay: October 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Beautiful Hotel, bad bad service!
Review Content: You cannot complain about the facilities at this hotel.  Everything is still new and looks good.  What absolutely brings this hotel down is the service standards.  The rooftop pool bar, again beautiful with an amazing view of the city, was a complete disappointment when it came to try to get a drink or something to eat.  After 20 minutes of looking for staff, we went down to the restaurants on the mezzanine level.  While there was 1 waiter, the service was super slow.  What we ordered was substituted with different ingredients without consulting us, wraps not toasted, burgers completely overdone and when we pointed this out there was complete indifference from the waiter.  We made a point of seeking out the chef and manager to complain about not only the service but the quality of the food.  The manager ended up giving us our full lunch and drinks on the house because of the unacceptable experience.  I will stay here again but make sure I have my meals elsewhere!
Date: Date of stay: September 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good but let themselves down
Review Content: A good hotel but let themselves down with silly mistakes! On first stay we enjoyed a nice meal in the main restaurant (buffet but had a la carte) Overall first stay was 4.5/5*However, the second time let yourselves down as we purchase some internet and on one took the code given to transfer to a different device but ended being charged for 4 internets, when was only 3 used! IT chap was extremely rude and ignorant, when talking to us it was like he was saying 'what do you lot know about IT' Eventually had to pay for it as rude front desk girl wouldn't budge! eventually just before we left 1 hour later she refunded 1 internet charge! On the positives, the indian buffet is sublime and the chocolate cake they served (not sure how indian that is) was outstanding!
Date: Date of stay: July 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Surprisingly excellent
Review Content: Brand new hotel; inviting, comfy, soft, clean beds; ultra modern decor; phenomenal buffet breakfast; very friendly staff; helpful cheeky concierge; value for money.
Date: Date of stay: December 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Date evening
Review Content: My husband and I went on a date night and overnite at Hilton Hotel in Windhoek.Not sure about the date. think it was August last year.He planned something nice which he mentioned to me. Our agreement was that I will book in first and he will join me later. Upon arrival the room was not as he asked and I had to arrange with front desk and housekeeping to get the room as he wanted it. Romantic....Needless to say I had to book a massage to get me to relax. The rest of the date was great. I would recommend their spa and wellness facility anytime. Will I go again...maybe
Date: Date of stay: August 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Lovely hotel, great facilities, service could be better but by no means bad!
Review Content: Very swish hotel in a great location.  I only stayed in a standard room but it had excellent facilities, very spacious, modern, clean and the bed was super comfortable.  Another bonus in the room was the good lighting - when travelling for work and working in your room it is so noticable how badly lit most hotel rooms are but this was excellent and very comfortable to work in.  Only downside was no wireless internet access from your room (although there is cabled access).  The food, bar and restaurant facilities were excellent and the view from the roof top bar across Windhoek at night is lovely.  The service from the reception desk is a little hit and miss, there are some excellent staff members who are very attentive and quick to help but there are also some not quite up to scratch (or perhaps just inexperienced given it is a new hotel).  Overall though a great place to stay, and should defintely be a hotel of choice for both business travellers and holiday makers spending time in windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: July 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Not that impressive
Review Content: On holiday with my family and stayed overnight in the Hilton Windhoek. I do travel a lot and is used to the best hotels in the world, this one was pretty disappointing.The Hilton is luxurious (as you would expect) with a friendly staff and good clean accommodation. This is were is ends. The heated pool was was cold (heat pump broke). We were allocated a room with an inter-leading door for the children. The children's room was not ready at the time of check-in so we initially unpacked our luggage in the 1 room. After numerous phone calls to reception (without response), eventually we were told we had to move to a different room all together. This is after we unpacked! I was not happy. We ordered Mojitos but they did not have mint leaves!We had dinner in the hotel restaurant and waited for our food for more than an hour and they got the whole order wrong!! The next morning we had breakfast in the same restaurant. On arrival the buffet area was empty with no sausages, eggs, bacon etc etc etc. I made a fuss and after 15 min this was stocked up again. I ordered a omelet, this never arrived. The whole experience was pretty disappointing and not what you expect from a Hilton hotel. I'm not convinced I will go there again.
Date: Date of stay: June 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good entry point to your Namibia adventure
Review Content: Centrally located and offering all the amenities you could need in Windhoek. This hotel has Ana amazing roof top bar for sundowners. The gym could do with a little updating and the advertised Wine Bar was not open but the concierge at the front desk offered cheap and convenient transport options for destinations in and around the city.
Date: Date of stay: April 2022This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Best Modern Hotel in Windhoek
Review Content: This is the best hotel in Windhoek! We came in from Botswana via truck and called beforehand because we knew we would arrive past the COVID imposed curfew. The hotel explained they would be ready to receive us at anytime. After two roadblocks, one telling us we would have to sleep overnight on the road until 4am, we arrived at the Hilton around 1130 pm. We stayed in the executive king  room with lounge access. Although the lounge was not open at the top floor, there was a  lounge area in the restaurant. The room was very nice with a modern feel. Great water pressure from the shower and the large bath was great for my 2 young girls. The hotel is 10 years old, so relatively new. The foot at the restaurant was great. The pool at the top of the hotel is very nice and has a great view over looking the city and mountains. We brought lunch up to the top and had a great time. The staff were great here and the hotel is really a five star hotel for this region. Location is great too for shopping and food, and close to museums. When we come back to Namibia, we will be sure to stay here before or after the flights!
Date: Date of stay: July 2021This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: The best Hilton in all Namibia

Shame on them. The hotel already feels rund down. It doesn't feel like a Hilton level but all OK if you only stay a couple of nights.

Secure underground parking is useful if with a hire car.

Name: A Welcome Addition to the Windhoek Hotel Scene
Review Content: This was my fifth time in Windhoek and my first stay at the Hilton. It is nice hotel, with a beautiful architecture, open feel, and very sleek decor. The room was large and tastefully furnished, and the bathroom was one of the nicest I have enjoyed on my recent travels. After a long transaltlantic travel, I slept really well in the comfortable king-size bed. The rooftop pool area was very relaxing, although a bit crowded, with some loud patrons that nobody seemed willing to control somehow. But a good book and the stunning view of Windhoek let me forget the distraction.So all was well during my stay? Well, there is room for improvement. For one, I got exactly the opposite of what my Hilton Honors profile indicated as my room preferences (I usually ask for a high floor, non-smoking room, away from the elevator--and I got a lower floor smokers' room right near the elevator). The worst part was the smokers' smell in the room, which was made worse by the fact that windows could not be opened and the AC temperature could not be adjusted (the temperature setting buttons did not react). I could have probably asked for a change of rooms, but did not want to go through the hassle. I also noticed some other minor maintenance issues, including scratched walls and furniture. And I heard from other guests that the breakfast was not worth the charge; I opted to have breakfast at a small cafe in the Voigt shopping center five minutes away. But in sum, I am glad that the Kalahari Sands Hotel--the other main business hotel in town--got competition from the Hilton, and I would consider the Hilton several notches better. And based on the manager's response to other reviews, I trust that the Hilton will further improve its service delivery and ensure proper upkeep of the facility.
Date: Date of stay: November 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Enjoyable Staff at Hilton Windhoek
Review Content: Stayed two nights at the end of our safari before returning home.  The hotel is centrally located and it is a very short walk to a good selection of tourist shops and cafes and also the local craft market is close by.  The hotel has a great roof top pool and bar overlooking the city.  Our room was large and comfortable, as was the bed.  Breakfast served at the hotel is excellent and extensive, the pastries were to die for.  We dined in the main dining room two evenings and our meals were fantastic, it had a very good menu, which included game. Full credit to the kitchen staff here. Our wonderful waitress Anna ensured we had the best of service - what an asset she is to the hotel.  We really enjoyed chatting with her.  Lambi also ensured we had excellent service.Would definitely return to the Windhoek Hilton and can recommend staying here.
Date: Date of stay: October 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Excellent Serivce
Review Content: Located very centrally so easy to walk about from this hotel. Loved the serivce here. They are very professional and very, very friendly.  Really make you feel welcome. Check in was quick.  Breakfast is huge with good quality.  Loved the rooftop pool.  I would stay here again

Name: Hotel very clean located in a safe and centre town
Review Content: The hotel is located in city centre.. Very safe area clean and tide.. Casino and bar and restaurant are close by..you can find bank exchange  bars and agencies all around.. Parking free and shops all close to the hotel . Exelent

Name: One night only - honeymoon luxury
Review Content: Had a great stay at the Hilton Windhoek. I happened to mention it was my honeymoon when booking and Brandon in Customer Relations upgraded us to an executive suite with lounge access. As if this wasn't enough, we arrived back after a stroll around the city to bubbles, nibbles and a massive bouquet of flowers to congratulate us. Beyond impressed. Bed massive and comfortable, breakfast superb, skybar/pool very inviting (although it was Winter so we did not use them) and location great. Would not hesitate to stay again. Only gripe - shower despite being on 'full hot' was pretty lukewarm. I could have called reception, but for just an overnight stay, I was happy to let it go. Thanks so much Brandon!
Date: Date of stay: July 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Lost items
Review Content: We were at the Hilton from October 24, 2017 to October 27, 2017. While the room was great and the food was great, I felt the some of the staff was disappointing. When we were getting ready to pack to leave, I noticed that an ATH-ANC7b notice cancelling headphones(audio-technica) were missing. I told the front desk and they would contact security. I never heard from security. Later I found that I was missing $250.00 from my backpack. I never contacted the front desk because I never heard back about my missing  headphones. If you travel to this hotel, I would make sure that all money, valuables, etc be locked up in the safe.
Date: Date of stay: October 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Second time was not the charm
Review Content: Once arriving at the hotel, we were given our key and went up to the room. The porter opened the closet and there was someone else's luggage in it along with hangers that were empty.  The hotel room did not look as if anyone had been in, other than the luggage. So, we called the desk and they told us to bring all of our belongs down and they would move us. We haul all of it down and they said they were leaving us in that room and that the porter had left luggage there accidentally.  Keep in mind, there were empty hangers from someone's dry cleaning.  On the same day, our friends were with us also and we were checking in at 8pm at night and they were told their room was not ready.  So, we were not happy, after having made the arrangements months prior.  They apologized and my friends did get upgraded and settled.We had other issues with keys and didn't like the fact that we could not visit other friends on two other floors without the major annoyance of having extra keys to those floors.  Also, the hotel has a bad leak from the pool and drips and is causing floor problems on level 5 and issues with the carpeting that was not very pleasing.  It seems to need some upgrading.
Date: Date of stay: September 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Well... Not really WOW!
Review Content: Spend 3 nights at Hilton Windhoek in September 2014 with a friend. We booked a room with separate beds. Upon early arrival we were told that rooms are not available yet, since the check-in policy is 2pm, but we were promised to have a room ready within 1 hour. Ok - we waited. 1 hour later we checked back with the reception, where we have been told that they are waiting for bed sheets. Another 1 hour later the bed sheets were there - but it was a double-bedded room. Not with twin beds. The procedure startet all over again. and again - they waited for bed sheets. I started seriously questioning from where those sheets are delivered... From mars? Venus? Saturn? Another 2 hours later - no bed sheets yet. But they could offer us a room which is ready - with a double bed. Why would I repeat a 3rd time that we have asked for twin-beds???? Finally - at 12 noon we got a room. Which was the biggest disappointment EVER! Open bathroom culture. I fully understand that this might be up to african standards, but sure not to european or cosmopolitan standards. If you don¬¥t travel with your husband, wife, family or so - who would like to do a peep-show and undress naked before every shower in front of others? Who would like to do his/her "big business" (you know what I mean) and let this favorite personal smell move out to share? Oh, what disgusting... If you travel alone, this might somewhat be acceptable. With fellows - NO WAY! In some situations I love my privacy!Positive aspects: breakfast - all someone¬¥s heart desires. Wonderful rooftop-bar with a view over Windhoek.All in all: don¬¥t do promises which you can¬¥t keep. If your check-in policy is 2pm - accepted. But don¬¥t pull someones leg by keeping them on hold. And - put walls between your bathroom and room. This is a NO GO!!!! Would I visit Hilton Windhoek again? Alone: maybe, with fellows in same room: no way.
Date: Date of stay: September 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Terrible service from staff.
Review Content: We stayed for 2 nights at this hotel, although the room was of a very high standard everything else was awful. -Check In- Very slow, staff did not come across as friendly, no eye contact.-Bar service - The worst ever, we stood for 15 mins at the bar waiting to be served. Finally we had our order taken but it took another 10 mins to poor a glass of wine (only 1 to choose from as they'd run out of stock) !!-Breakfast- Arrived in dinning room, was not shown to a table despite a member of staff  asking for our room number, they seemed completely distracted by other staff/friends. Was not offered any tea or coffee had to ask a member of staff who's job it would appear to be to serve tea and coffee but was more interested in their mobile phone. . Terrible!-Although I can not prove this there would appear to be some obvious prostitution going on the bar  in the evenings, perhaps this is the norm but I've certainly never been exposed to it quite so obviously  as it was there.Such a shame as the hotel is lovely and could do so much better.
Date: Date of stay: January 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Disappearing glasses and other housekeeping woes
Review Content: This was my 2nd stay at the Windhoek Hilton and, like other travelers, I continued to be charmed by the rooftop SkyBar views and general centralized location. However, the housekeeping left much to be desired - after 3 days of asking to have my bed linens changed, I finally had to take the linens off the bed and pillows and place them in a pile on the floor to have fresh ones put on the bed. Also due to the fairly costly glasses of wine at the bar, my colleagues and I nipped across the street to purchase wine at the local Checkers. Using the collective glasses from our rooms to drink our tasty Pinotage, we found ourselves without replacement water glasses (even though we brought the dirty glasses back to the room) for the remainder of the stay...punishment for undermining corporate profits, perhaps? Will I stay there again? - most likely, yes. Would I recommend to you? Yes, but with caution - expensive Internet, food and drink on site. Cheap food and drink nearby to overcome part of the problem; with the additional suggestion that you purchase a wireless network card with minutes from outside provider. The sunsets are spectacular.
Date: Date of stay: May 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Friendly staff memebers. 1) My clients orded Windhoel beer, just to be informed that they had none. 2) I wanted a Bells whiskey, just to be infirmed that they had no Bells, but they have Jameson. 3) I order a Jameson just to be informed that they had no whiskey! 4)I also order a pizza, chicken and mushroom in my room. Just to be informed that there were no mushrooms for my pizza. 5) By the way,there was no menu in the room. I had to request one from room service. 6) The water pressure is very poor for a shower.I have stayed at various Hilton hotels all over the world,but I have never had such a bad experiance.

Name: Perfect location
Review Content: We stayed at the Hilton Windhoek for 3 nights in mid-April.  We used HH points for an Executive room with Executive Lounge access.  The room was clean and quiet and nicely laid out.  The bed was comfortable and we had no issues with the WiFi.  Staff were pleasant and friendly.  The food in the Executive Lounge was outstanding, both in the morning and the evening.  We had lunch one day in the restaurant and it was very good.  The location is great for getting everywhere in the City Center.  We walked 9 miles on the first full day we were there, which being a Sunday meant very little was open!
Date: Date of stay: April 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Bitte etwas mehr Sauberkeit.
Review Content: Nach ca. einer halben Stunde Fahrt vom Flughafen erreicht man das Hilton. Der Check-in lief z√ºgig und wir konnten in unser Zimmer. Dies hat mir nicht besonders gefallen. Wenn man hineinkommt, sieht man direkt ins Bad, alles ist offen. Einfach nicht mein Ding diese offenen B√§der. Ansonsten ist das Zimmer renovierungsbed√ºrftig. Es wirkt nur alt. Besonders gest√∂rt haben mich jedoch die vielen Haare des Reinigungspersonals. Minibar ist leer, Getr√§nke k√∂nnen bestellt werden. Highlight des Hotels ist auf jeden Fall die Dachterrasse. Es gibt eine nette Bar, einen Pool und alles ist neu. Es war ein sehr angenehmer Nachmittag hier.Das Fr√ºhst√ºck hatte alles was das Herz begehrt und auch abends im Restaurant hat das Hilton eine sehr gute Karte.
Date: Date of stay: November 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Room was Dirty
Review Content: I checked into this hotel after a couple days of camping in the Namibian desert.  I was really looking forward to checking in, and getting cleaned up from the grime of camping.  The check-in process was inordinately slow, not because there was a line, but because the front desk was very slow and seemed to have a great deal of difficult in finding my reservation,  Although, I had been in the same hotel just 6 nights previously, they were also unable to find my Hilton Honors number.  When I finally got to the room it was dirty - not blatantly so, but there were food stains on the night stands, and other general lack of cleanliness that made me wonder what other dirt there was that wasn't quite as visible.  I did use one of the very few towels provided to wipe food stains off furniture.  Note that the first night I stayed at this hotel it had a hot water malfunction, and when I arrived in the evening apparently the water had not yet heated, so I had to take a cold shower - an unpleasant experience in the middle of Africa's winter.  The breakfast at the hotel was quite good.
Date: Date of stay: August 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Das Essen im Restaurant ist gut und das Fr√ºhst√ºcksbuffet √§usserst reichhaltig. Einziger Sch√∂nheitsfehler ist das eher unpraktische Mobiliar im Zimmer.
