Name: Rather dull experience in a rather dull city
Review Content: I must admit upfront that we stayed here for 2 nights over the Easter Weekend in April 2017, which may account for a part of the crushingly mediocre flavour both of Windhoek and the Hilton on the whole.The total cost was around R5000 all in for B&B.I found this to be is a reasonably good, average, luxury hotel.  The rooms are adequate and comfortable (2x 3/4 beds), although why it is necessary to endure the  ugly brown and green colours, and extremely complex but ineffective lighting designs in the rooms, is anyone's guess.  Our view from room 221 was of a building site and a huge stagnant body of water at its side.   No turn-down service.The bathroom is basically part of the room and is not sealed off in the old-fashioned way.  The shower was good but the tiled floor very slippery; good Hilton-brand cosmetics.Check in was a bit confused - we had booked through booking.com and the terms appeared to be unknown to the reception desk.What really stood out were the breakfasts - an excellent buffet of everything you could want, including freshly squeezed juices, diverse pastries and even smoked salmon.On the other extreme, the pool area and gym on the roof are much too small, hot and overcrowded.  The constant music was terrible (just like a European beach-party); cleaning/clear-away services poor; the general crush of humanity unpleasant.  We fled.Plentiful parking but lack of explanation as to how it works.No consistent Wi-Fi to speak of - it is supposed to be free in the lobby but charged for in the rooms.Windhoek generally a dull city and a waste of time for anything more than a stop-over.Would not rush to stay here again: perhaps try to find something more traditional or charming in another part of the city; charm generally in short supply, I suspect.
Date: Date of stay: April 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Newish hotel friendly staff but can't meet the expectations of seasoned business travellers.
Review Content: Hilton Windhoek is recent but wears already the scars of usage. Badrooms not working properly. Staff attitude towards speediness of request. Wifi is unacceptable slow. The hotel set up is up to standard but service is not.
Date: Date of stay: January 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great rooftop bar
Review Content: Recent comfortable and modern hotel, offering all the amenities you'd expect from a Hilton. Very friendly and helpfull staff. The rooftop pool and bar has great views over Windhoek - making this an excellent place for a sundowner!
Date: Date of stay: November 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Relaxed and comfortable stay after overland trip from Victoria Falls
Review Content: I have stayed at Hilton hotels for business in Australia which have all been excellent.  The reviews on TripAdvisor for Hilton Windhoek have been a bit mixed but the two nights we stayed for leisure in September 20i6 were excellent. Reception and check-in were friendly and hassle-free, the room was quiet, clean, good size and the bed was very comfortable.  Staff helpful and frinedly.  Breakfast was fresh with excellent range of fruit and cooked items.  We ate at the Kalabar and food and drink was tasty and reasonably priced. Would definitely stay again.
Date: Date of stay: September 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Business trip to Windhoek, Namibia
Review Content: I have not been to Namibia for about 2 years now and for this visit I stayed at the Hilton Windhoek.It is truly a lovely business hotel. Classy, comfortable, functional, and clean. The staff are very courteous and professional, the amenities are in excellent condition, the service is good, the food is good, and it is within walking distance of most government offices.The view of the city from the gym or swimming pool is enough to make you want to go to the gym.The only thing I was unhappy with was the wifi. It was slow and frustrating and I do not know if it is regular thing or just for this week. Even at that, I will still recommend the hotel to any business traveler.
Date: Date of stay: June 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: –õ—É—á—à–∏–π –æ—Ç–µ–ª—å –≤ –ù–∞–º–∏–±–∏–∏
Date: Date of stay: October 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A little dissapointing
Review Content: We have stayed here before, so we booked again for a return holiday to Namibia.  Staff are really friendly, but the hotel has deteriorated since we were there last.  We stayed on the second floor and were 12 people travelling together.  The hotel was not very full.  Our room had missing floor tiles and the glass 'wall' that separates the entrance from the bathroom is no longer there, so you can see the door from the shower and the bath.  All the rooms we were booked into were like that.  The glass panels were simply not replaced.  Massive construction is going to take place right next to the Hilton soon, just so you know if you're planning on staying there.  We could not eat A la Carte in the restaurant, because we were more than 12 people.  Yes, 'What!?" Is exactly what we thought too.  We were told when we booked in that we don't need to make a reservation for the restaurant, because the hotel is not that full.  We arrived at dinner with an option of buffet or a la carte, but only if we're 5 people or less.  Huh? So I asked the manager on duty at the restaurant if we could eat a la carte if we left and came back in 5 at a time.  She said: "That is a very good question".  Needless to say, we left it at that.........On the plus side.  Great location!
Date: Date of stay: December 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Solid Performer
Review Content: Hilton Windhoek Offers all the services you want with hassle free service. Enjoyed my stay. Good breakfast offering (wide variety) . Sky bar and pool is beautiful, with amazing sunsets in the evening. Nice sizable quiet rooms that are clean with a modern finish. One of the best option Hotels in Windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: September 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Classic Hilton Hotel
Review Content: I stayed at this Hilton for a couple of weeks on business.  It is conveniently located downtown and has a good restaurant, two bars, exercise room, spa, and an odd rooftop, one lane lap pool.  The staff are attentive and friendly.  The internet is not fast, but that may be the same in all Namibian hotels.  I heard from friends that internet in most Windhoek hotels is not speedy.  I have a general complaint about the Hilton brand of hotels making internet access a separate profit center.  Just like water and electricity, no hotel should think of offering a room without internet already included!  The Housekeeping staff were good about providing an ironing board and iron, and kept my room clean.The restaurant staff were friendly quickly recognized long term guests.
Date: Date of stay: June 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: abysmal management
Review Content: so disappointing.Looks very pretty and fair size room but no noise insulation to speak of.  Noise from road is significant all night doors closing and people talking in the atrium can be heard clearly. Conference facilities ok if they don't change projectors. ..then no idea how to sort it out so nearly 3 hours lost from the day.No ability to manage building work in the hotel so it does not interfere with conference. GM does not acknowledge or apologise.  Original electrical extension cable was dangerous with bare copper exposed.Small minded extra charges ¬£10 for internet in room ¬£1.20 for water to clean teeth.  Unable to arrange taxi on time or to get bill sent to company.My student were very disappointed and know better managed hotels at better prices locally.The chef was a star in this mess. So happy to make genuine efforts to address any concerns.the pool seems to be less than 6ft wide and does not deserve the title
Date: Date of stay: May 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A return visit, one year later, and still enjoying what I found
Review Content: I stayed here on no fewer than 3 separate occasions during a near month-long odyssey around Namibia to visit a few conservation projects and catch up with old friends. I traveled in Dec. 2014, and stayed over on New Year's Eve.I stayed here once before, a year earlier, on my first visit, and was mightily impressed.One always has some trepidation and anxiety returning to a place where one had a good experience before, but I needn't have worried: The Hilton Windhoek was the same friendly place I remembered from Dec., 2013.Things I liked: Small, clean, comfortable, friendly & attentive staff, and some really clever use of glass, angles, architecture, etc. Electronic key cards that operate on a swipe & scan system, not the dated shove-it-in-shove-it-out-and-hope-that-it-works key cards that so many other hotels, including most Hiltons, use.I stayed in a basic economy room, and I love the fittings ‚Äî comfortable bed, the option of a bath or shower, comfortable work desk and plenty of plug-ins, including both European and the African plug-ins (the standard Africa-wide triple plug, not the neurotic, impossble-to-find 3-prong plug-in that, for whatever reason, Namibia seems to use).Reliable wifi ‚Äî though (a pet peeve of mine) it does come with a fee. That's not the hotel; that's Hilton policy.A plus: A good TV package that gives you ready access to English Premier League soccer, which for me was a real added bonus I hadn't quite expected. Hilton should really pay more attention to this property: I've stayed in (much) more expensive Hilton Airport properties in Amsterdam and Frankfurt, and the TV packages there are truly pathetic. Never mind trying to find a soccer game; it's as if soccer does;t exist. Because, as Hilton in Germany knows well, nobody in Germany cares about soccer, nobody there plays the game and nobody passing through Germany would want to watch a soccer game while staying a couple of nights between 11-hour flights.Namibia is a gorgeous country, with much to recommend it, despite the social problems inevitable to any country in sub-Saharan Africa, even relatively developed SA.Windhoek is a lovely little town, and the Hilton is right on top of the main shopping district. It may not be London or Paris but there are plenty of sidewalk cafes and decent places to eat.I'm sure a few travellers on this site have had founds things to complain about, but for my money this hotel is a little gem in the Hilton family. If you're travelling with kids, or on your own as I was, I can't think of any place that could be better. Namibia is known for its guest farms, and there are some truly courteous and comfortable places to stay throughout the country, but if you're looking for more of a business/corporate hotel with amenities, and you don't want to be gouged, I really don't think you can go wrong here. As I keep saying, I've stayed in a lot of Hiltons ‚Äî from the Beverly Hilton to the Universal Hilton, to Hiltons in Frankfurt, Amsterdam and Nairobi, and this one is a real little jewel. The staff, the management, everyone associated with this hotel deserves to be commended.
Date: Date of stay: December 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Spacious rooms and centrally located
Review Content: apparently the best five star place in town. Very friendly service and the views from the roof top terrace are really spectacular.We stayed in an executive room and therefore had lounge access, where the staff had been very helpful to solve a problem and book us into a restaurant at the same night ( although it was a public holiday). The only low, I have to say, was the size of the lounge and the breakfast there was not at all to normal Hilton standards
Date: Date of stay: December 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: First visit nice, second OK
Review Content: Stayed here for one night upon arrival in Namibia.  After a self drive 12 day tour of beautiful Namibia, we checked back in for an 8 day stay.  We booked a deluxe room and did not receive an upgrade - that's OK as the deluxe room is very nice.  But as Diamond HH there was no welcome note nor any amenities that we usually receive (bottle of wine & fruit in Sandton).  I really would recommend a deluxe room because the standard king we had on our first stay does not have much privacy.  There are sliding glass panels that serve as bathroom walls and if they are not aligned up a certain way, anyone coming to your room door and see directly into the bathroom and/or see someone sitting up in bed.  There is no separation at all between the bathroom tub/sink area and the bedroom so you'd better be traveling with your "significant other".  The executive lounge is small but they have friendly folks working there and a nice breakfast and evening snacks and drinks.  Sadly you can not take even a small bottle of water out of the lounge.  There is free wifi if you are Diamond HH but there is a parking charge.  Location in the middle of downtown is great for business or tourism.
Date: Date of stay: October 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: nice hotel with great sky bar
Review Content: we recently spent two nights  Ôºàone week apart)in Windhoek Hilton during our Namibia trip as the beginning and finishing stop. The staff were friendly, check in was a little slow, the room is quite nice and spacious, one night we got a nice room with a great outdoor patio, the 2nd night we were given a room next to the elevator which was quite noisy, plus the bed was facing the bathroom which has a night light that couldn't figure out how to cut off and it affected my sleep. The buffet was nice, nothing extravagant but nice options of indian food at the night we stayed. The sky bar has a great set up, very relaxing to spend an afternoon there having a drink and ordering some bar food. Overall it's a nice hotel and we will stay there again if we ever return to Namibia.
Date: Date of stay: June 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: ‚ÄùExcelente localiza√ß√£o, servi√ßos de qualidade‚Äù
Review Content: Hotel urbano de 5 estrelas com localiza√ß√£o privilegiada no cora√ß√£o de Windhoek. O conceito contempor√¢neo do hotel foca-se num estilo mais citadino, dado o seu contexto e localiza√ß√£o pr√≥ximo da cidade, mas n√£o menos elegante.Com um lobby amplo, a decora√ß√£o s√≥bria surge ponteada aqui e ali com motivos √©tnicos de muito bom gosto. A decora√ß√£o do quarto √© moderna com cores claras. A casa de bando e o quarto n√£o s√£o divis√µes estanques, apenas separadas por grandes pain√©is de vidro.No geral, foi uma boa estadia. Recomendo.
Date: Date of stay: October 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Our first Windhoek visit.
Review Content: This hotel is OUTSTANDING!  The management and staff have a remarkable synergy that provides a very hospitable, customer-first atmosphere.  We spent seven days there and could not have enjoyed ourselves more anywhere.  The breakfast buffet on the Mezzanine level is fabulous.  The Fitness Center on the top floor is well equipped with modern, clean, functional components.  I am currently using a physical therapy routine on my knees and hips prescribed by an orthopedic surgeon.  The Fitness Center allowed me to follow this routine precisely.  The view of Windhoek from the top floor facilities is hypnotic.  The location is within walking distance to great shopping and enjoyable historical and cultural museums.  You will enjoy your stay immensely.
Date: Date of stay: April 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Airport to Hotel Transfer Scary
Review Content: I have stayed here a couple of times on business and have always been met at the Airport by a member of the Hilton's staff, in uniform and with a nice vehicle. I arrived last Sunday, February 9th and had to ring the hotel as nobody was there upon my arrival. A young guy, casually dressed turns up with my name on a card. Outside it is clear that it is his private car that I am getting into. The seat belt didn't appear to work so I moved over into another seat. The driver started to text message on his phone......I mentioned that I thought it was illegal to use his phone, he then stopped!Throughout the journey he broke the speed limit and drove to close to vehicles in front. Despite my comments about his driving he continued. Upon arrival at the hotel I raised my concerns to the Duty Manager, Imogen.  Being met at the airport is the first experience of the Hilton Brand and if I hadn't stayed here before I wouldn't be impressed. I understood from my conversation with Imogen that I wouldn't be charged for the transfer but upon checkout found this not to be the case. Asked for the Manager but was advised that no one was on duty!Despite this I am pleased that the standard within the hotel is being maintained, as it has been open for a couple of years. The rooftop bar and pool is beautiful and the bar on the 1st floor has a lovely outside area. Service could sometimes be a little slow. Oysters are on the restaurant menu but was advised that they haven't been available for months.One thing to note is the cost of Wi-fi, surprising that it is not free to residents.
Date: Date of stay: February 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Very good hotel
Review Content: We stayed here in business in October 2013.  The Hilton brand is always dependable and this one is no exception.  It is very centrally located, has wonderful clean rooms and a superb "Sky Bar" on the roof.  It is within easy walking distance to many shopping and dining options in downtown Windhoek.  It is definitely worth a repeat visit in future.
Date: Date of stay: October 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice rooms and facilities, but average service
Review Content: The rooms and restaurants/bars at this hotel are pleasant, clean and spacious. The food and cocktails were nice. However I found some of the services lacking e.g. No parking spaces available, no local currency available for change (even after being told to return on 5 occasions), and generally slow service. The price is quite high, and I would expect a higher level of service for that kind of money.
Date: Date of stay: October 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Worst Hilton in the world
Review Content: The premises itself is nice as it is still new. No doubt it is Hilton. However, the quality of the services provided by the staffs were VERY terrible. Services were a bit slow and sometimes rude. What is more, to my surprise, when I came into room, I found that the room has not been cleaned yet. Then, called the housekeeping. after minutes later, cleaning woman came and said "where is dirty?" with anger.I do not want to recommend this Hilton, but I think there is no choice but to stay here if you get convenient stay in windhoek. In Windhoek, Hilton would be the best choice though.. Others look much older and this Hilton is not so expensive in fact.
Date: Date of stay: December 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Bedingt empfehlenswert
Review Content: Wir, eine Gruppe von 5 Personen wohnten 2 Mal in diesem Hotel. Beim ersten Besuch war fast alles ok, wenn man davon absieht, dass wir, ein Ehepaar, ein Zimmer mit 2 Betten bestellt hatten und ein Zimmer mit einem King-size-Bett bekamen. Auch der Preis stimmte nicht, wurde aber berichtigt. Beim 2. Besuch landeten wir aus Maun/Botswana kommend in Windhoek. Meine Frau rief aus Maun das Hotel an und bestellte die Abholung. In Windhoek gelandet, war niemand da. Wir riefen wieder im Hotel an. Man sagte uns, dass das Auto unterwegs sei und in 15 Minuten eintreffen w√ºrde. Nach fast einer Stunde Warten riefen wir wieder an: Der Wagen werde jede Minute eintreffen. Nachweiteren 15 Minuten war er endlich da. Die Fahrt ins Hotel dauert genau 35 Minuten!!!!! Im Hotel angekommen, machten wir unserem √Ñrger Luft, wonach sich die Dame an der Rezeption entschuldigte und versprach, die Abholung nicht in Rechnung zu stellen. Wir bekamen wieder ein Zimmer mit nur 1 Bett obwohl mit 2 Betten bestellt. Nachdem dieser Fehler behoben war, wurde uns ein neues Zimmer zugewiesen. Mitten im Zimmer befand sich im Teppichboden ein 10cm grosser Fleck. Am n√§chsten Tag baten wir um Reservierng eines Tisches in einem bestimmten Restaurant f√ºr das Abendessen. Im Restaurant angelangt, wusste man nichts von der Reservierung. Auf unsere Frage nach der R√ºckkehr ins Hotel entschuldigte man sich f√ºr die Nichtreservierung. Schwierig wurde es dann wieder mit der Rechnung. Der Preis stimmte nicht und der Transport vom Flughafen ins Hotel stand auch auf der Rechnung. Das Hotel in erstklassiger Lage mitten in der Stadt macht sonst einen sehr guten Eindruck. Die Zimmer sind ger√§umig und modern ausgestattet. Das Fr√ºhst√ºcksbuffet ist auch ok. W-Lan muss man - wie in allen Hilton - bezahlen.
Date: Date of stay: August 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Happy Travellers
Review Content: We spent one night at the Hilton in Windhoek at the start of our holiday,could not be happier.The room was fantastic,the service at reception was efficient and helpful.We had breakfast before we left,the food was terrific and there was a good variety,also the service was good,all said it was a great start to a great holiday.Thanks
Date: Date of stay: January 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: F√ºr Business- Reisende nur bedingt geeignet...
Review Content: Das Hotel wurde erst vor ca 4 Monaten er√∂ffnet und befindet sich zentral im Stadtzentrum. Man merkt, dass das Team noch nicht eingespielt ist, besonders wenn es darum geht eine Bestellung aufzunehmen. Die Zimmer sind ok, allerdings unbedingt Zimmer (100, 101, 200, 201...) meiden, da sich diese direkt hinter den Aufz√ºgen befinden und man st√§ndig den Aufzug h√∂rt. Das Gym ist f√ºr Win neues Hotel ein Witz, kaum Ger√§te, mangelnde Sauberkeit. Top ist die Roof Top bar auf dem 9. Stock inclusive kleinem Pool. Ideal f√ºr 'nen Sun Downer!F√ºr Business- Reisende: Internet kostet extra, Uebertragungsrate sehr niedrig, d.h. das Versenden von Dokumenten, etc. unmoeglich!
Date: Date of stay: July 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Standard's Slipping
Review Content: Hotel services were not up to standard this trip. Despite booking well in advance and being a corporate guest and Honors member room allocation was not ideal with low room with unsightly view. Had to return to reception on numerous occasions for door key not activating for either room or lift. Had cold water in the basin day 1 and luke warm shower. On Day 2 cold water for both. The coffee in the room was Decaff only. WIFI was constantly dropping and cannot be used seriously for business purposes. As a regular corporate traveller around Africa, the hotel is lacking a few basic amenities which competitor hotels stock e.g. Facecloth, Gown and slippers, Shaving kit, sewing kit, rusks etc.Hilton Windhoek seems to be down to the bare basics.On the positive side the restaurant and Spa were excellent and the view from the Skybar on the 9th floor is unsurpassed.
Date: Date of stay: May 2023This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Schlechtester Aufenthalt in einem Hilton Hotel
Review Content: Schon beim Check In haben wir 1 Stunde auf unser Zimmer gewartet, angeblich, weil sie es - wie wir im Voraus gebucht haben - f√ºr 3 Personen fertig machen m√ºssen. Name: My stay was good but could be better
Review Content: The ac needs improvement the rooms get hot sometimes during nights The food menu has no much options, I payed almost $2000 rands for a room I think breakfast should be included I didn‚Äôt like the fact that my flight to Nam√≠bia was cancelled and I called hotel front desk to cancel and postponed my check in they apparently did once I arrived one day latter the hotel front desk didn‚Äôt kept they word, not good

Name: Urban comfort at the end of a self-drive safari

Name: Not up to Hilton standards
Review Content: As there is not may option in Windhoek as this is a very small town, Hilton was my choice but clearly too many things wrong with hotel, staff are friendly but they wont go the extra mile for use us always a complication, had a problem in my feet could not walk a lot requested to change for a room closer o the elevator, the issue was escalated to 20 people before being allocated a closer room.Clear the hotel is old and needs updates carpets and other part, looks like part of the hotel was going to renovation but not sure.Another point for improvement would be for the kitchen, they use cheap ingredients in the food and it feel for example the eggs Benedict as my favorite I always asked but it tasted cheap margarine and vinegar so need an improvement there.Definitely too expensive and not leaving up to the standards for Hilton, better to try the other Chinese hotel just across the street

Name: Good place to stay as starting point for yr excursions
Review Content: Stayed as part of a tour group both, one night on the way to/from to dunes and seaside.Nice place, large comfy rooms, huge lobby beautiful lobby, lovely rooftop area with pool, bar and great views. Also nice outside terrace with comfy sitting areas and shades where smoking was allowed (husband does, and he enjoyed this area).Very good location. Staff friendly and plenty of them. Not a very personal hotel, but just what you expect from a Hilton.

Name: Great hotel!
Review Content: The hotel is positioned centrally with a great top floor with a bar, a pool and a fitness room. We enjoyed the executive lounge at the hotel and felt that the food provided at dinner time was of a good quality.We were upgraded to an executive room which we saw was as good as any other executive room that we had stayed in before.I thought the ladies on the front desk were extremely helpful and friendly and a credit to the hotel.Breakfast was fantastic with a really good choice of items and again very friendly and helpful staff. Thanks to all who made our stay a memorable one!

Name: Got off to a bad start but finished well
Review Content: Hi having booked a twin room we were not to happy when we arrived late at night after 36 hours travel to find we were booked into a double. Wilbur (i hope i have the correct name) was very apologetic and assured us he would sort it out the next day.  Wilbur did indeed sort it out and our stay was quite enjoyable after that. The spa and pool are great and the food is good.

Name: Goede verzorging
Review Content: Wat een leuke aankomst en wat een vriendelijk personeel, hotel ziet er goed verzorgt uit zijn wal wat puntjes van aandacht maar dat is minimaal. Ik keam erg vroeg aan maar alles werd georganiseerd om snel een kamer in gereedheid te brengen.

Name: Fairly Typical City Centre Hilton
Review Content: Intending to just spend one night in Windhoek, we chose the Hilton as it appeared to be reasonably easy to find after a night time drive from Windhoek airport. Finding the hotel is fairly easy, as it is on the main road in to Windhoek from the airport and it's an unmistakable building, however getting there was something else, until you read the plate beneath the 'No right Turn' sign which says  'Apart for Guests'. Parking is then in an underground carpark.We struggled to get any service at the roof top bar, although there were some other guests sitting at the bar with drinks, so we went downstairs and whilst the drinks service was very good, it took well over half an hour for a club sandwich and a plate of chips to be served. The room was very clean and comfortable, as was the bed. Breakfast was very good, with a fine choice of fruit, cereals, pastries and hot items.
Date: Date of stay: August 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Review Content: Wichtigist: Hilton direkt buchen und dann Hilton Honours w√§hlen, damit preisg√ºnstiger , freies WiFi etc.Nach 2 langen Fl√ºgen braucht man ein Double-Double Zimmer um erstmal einige Stunden auszuruhen.Derzeit kann keine Empfehlung √ºber Zimmerlage gegeben werden, weil noch eine Gro√ü-baustelle nebenan.Restaurant: gutes Fr√ºhst√ºck, Dinner Buffet eher Durchschnitt, es lohnt √† la Carte.

Name: Luxurious and charming
Review Content: When we first arrived to Namibia we were all ready to dive into the wilderness of the country, sleeping wherever we could, exploring traditional places and cultures... Our stop at the hilton hotel was merely for convenience purposes, so we arrived at the hotel with no expectations  whatsoever simply exhausted from the 13 hour trip we'd just been through. The welcome was wonderful, the service was polite and helpful. They had upgraded us to another room due to our hhonnors club card and I must say it was the most asthetic and comfortable room I have ever stayed in.We had dinner at the hotel (they tend to offer two options: the buffet and normal menu) and the food was good. It was refined and tasty although that was only for certain dishes.We also had to spend 1 more night there on the way back. This time things were a bit more chaotic however, it was still pretty good even though the service lacked the usual motivation.It was a pleasant experience bearing in mind that we did not expect such luxury during our trip, the atmosphere managed to suit out worn-out conditions pretty well.
Date: Date of stay: March 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good hotel in central Windhoek.
Review Content: Very good hotel in central business district of Windhoek. The room was spacious, well appointed, quiet. Comfy bed. Large bathroom (a little too integrated with the room - looks nice but perhaps not super practical when sharing a room...)Great pool area. Nice restaurant.Totally my fault - I accidentally booked the wrong date (by one day) phoned the hotel to get that cancelled even if it was not refundable - within 5 minutes of making the booking - but they refused to refund that booking. I understand it was my fault - but I was hoping for a little flexibility and a refund given I realised my mistakes within 5 minutes and I was going to stay there the next night. It is not like the hotel was fully booked and they missed out.
Date: Date of stay: March 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Aller Anfang ist schwer
Review Content: Als Start unser Reise durch Namibia sollte es das Hilton in Windhoek sein. Nach einem langem Flug wollten wir nur noch entspannen und abschalten. Es ist auch ein tolles Hotel mit einer sch√∂ner Dachterrasse von der aus man bei einem Glas Wein den Blick √ºber Windhoek geniessen kann. Die Zimmer sind gross und sauber, das Personal sehr nett und das Abendessen war auch sehr gut.Einziger Wermutstropfen war...wir hatten weit voraus √ºber Hilton Honors das Zimmer inklusive Fr√ºhst√ºck und Dinner gebucht. Und einen Tag vor unserem Abflug konnten wir uns noch das Zimmer √ºber die App aussuchen. Als wir aber im Hotel ankamen war unsere Reservierung anscheinend nicht da. Wir bekamen ein ganz anderes Zimmer. Auf Nachfrage, ob wir denn Fr√ºhst√ºck und Dinner im Preis mit drin h√§tten, wurden wir gross angeschaut.  Erst als ich die Reserierung in der Hilton Honors App vorzeigte, kam Bewegung rein. Pl√∂tzlich bekamen wir ein anderes Zimmer und es wurde gesagt, dass man bei unsere Buchung hinterlegen w√ºrde, dass das Essen inklusive ist. Es hat am n√§chsten Tag zwar alles bei der Abrechnung geklappt, aber trotzdem blieb dieser Wermutstropfen.
Date: Date of stay: February 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Not very African
Review Content: It was  a standard Hilton, though I guess quite new as everything was in good condtion . Arrived with our tour group from the airport and had to wait for about 1.5 hours until our rooms were ready .They did  give us (free)coffee etc but my husband just wanted to catch upon his sleep after an overnight flight and I just wantted to get out there and look round .It was a tad frustrating and the rest  of our 20 strong party didn't arrive  until  much later so I would have thought it should have been possible to have our rooms ready  .It 's very well located(Windhoek is small enough to walk around) though I was quite amused that the (5) ladies behind reception had trouble marking its location on a map for me .Totally unecessary as you can see it from all over the city  I did wonder why they had 5 reception staff and presumably not enough chambermaids ..  Its about 15 mins  walk from the 'Gingerbread' church (beautiful and I got a free organ recital) and the vast memorial to the 'father of Nambia' which houses the museum Ate somewhere else so can't comment on dinner. Breakfast was probably the best we had in Namibia . Staff very courteous and definitey had benefited from training delivered by an international chain.
Date: Date of stay: October 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great Hotel and location!
Review Content: The hotel is very clean and the staff are super friendly. We stay here every year and love it. Some of the staff remember us every year, it's amazing! The food is very good and they offer a great breakfast buffet. They have parking and a great sky bar with incredible reviews.

Name: Review of Hilton Hotel - Windhoek
Review Content: Excellent Hotel in terms of service, convenient location, staff friendliness, cleanliness, facilities, quality of room, breakfast and dinner options, ease of booking in and out and general experience, etc.
Date: Date of stay: December 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Ok, but I expected more
Review Content: Stayed here on my first night and my last night of the trip. It was ok, but given the comparative price, and five star status, I was disappointed. Room was nice enough, with air con, tv, shower and bath. Both times I had problems with check in, and staff couldn‚Äôt find my booking (but found the others in my group). WiFi was apparently free, but could only be obtained if you put in your credit card details. I queried with staff, and said I didn‚Äôt want to do this, but was told not to worry about it, and that any charges would be refunded on check out. This sounds ridiculous to me, and I would not be putting in my credit card for a free service, just so I could be ‚Äòrefunded‚Äô later. Not what I expect from a Hilton. Rooftop pool was lovely. Had a gym with a great view, but one of the treadmills just spontaneously stopped a couple of times, which was dangerous. Member of staff came in whilst I was on it and told me not to use that one as it stuck often!! There was no sign on the machine, despite staff clearly knowing there was a problem. Also, the gym door gave me a static shock every time I went in. Breakfast had potential to be great; lots of choice and lovely tasty food. However, staff took ages to seat us even though there were free tables, and the first day we had to ask for coffee three times before it eventually arrived a long time afterwards. Plates, bowls, glasses all ran out and took ages to be replaced. On my second stay, the clock radio (which had the wrong time on it) regularly made static noises all night, which was irritating. Not worth the extra money, and not as good as previous Hilton‚Äôs I have stayed at.
Date: Date of stay: November 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Finally a very very good place to stay in NA
Review Content: After 3 weeks in NA we were soooo happy to finally find a place where the staff is friendly and smiling, the beds are comfortable (not hard as hell), the food is (finally) a la carte and is very good, good wine, a good pool, and last but not least the breakfast is incredible. Finally finally a choice of bread, after 3 weeks of only toast and some strane pink sausage. The only thing we didn't find was smoked salmon and champagne, but the rest is worth flying for! Thanks!
Date: Date of stay: September 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: ITS ALL RIGHT

I didnt know that the hotel offer to the guests, shuttle service to the mall.........as well as if you offer touristic tours in the city. These informations were not noticed to me.  All other items are okay.

Name: Great hotel but slow staff
Review Content: This is the best hotel in Windhoek, albeit somewhat pricey.  Great rooms and facilities and perfect location. Only problem is the consistently lame and slow front desk staff and sometimes slow/forgetful service (like having to ask for coffee at breakfast 3 times before actually receiving it, check-in taking 10 minutes, check-out taking forever, printers not working and them being unable to produce invoices etc.)
Date: Date of stay: May 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good choice
Review Content: Wife and daughter stayed there at the tail end of a safari vacation. They liked it a lot. Great room. Good service. Liked the restaurant. Only fly in the ointment was the $18 charge for internet access (I hate it when hotels nickel and dime you this way) but the hotel waived it for a day.
Date: Date of stay: April 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice hotel but a smokey smell
Review Content: I stayed here for 2 days while dealing with Namibian Home affairs, its the perfect location for anyone needing to be in the CBD or suburbs. The CBD is a short walk away so no need to worry about parking etc. If you need to get out north then the main roads run right past the hotel so going north is easy, getting out south or west is just as easy and so is east towards the airport.Breakfast was great, service was very courteous, from check in to check out.I had two complaints during my stay, the first was that I wondered if I had been given a smoking room, I actually called down to reception the minute I walked into he room. It had the old smoke smell, I was informed that all rooms are non smoking. I have no idea what that was then...The second, on my previous trip to Windhoek I mistakenly picked a hotel without a pool, this time I was going to be sure that after a day of running after Home affairs I wanted to have a swim.Just my luck, the pool was closed for renovations during my stay..Its a very nice hotel, nice location, stunning views of Windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: March 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good location and friendly staff
Review Content: Well located in Windhoek with easy access to sites and locations.  The Hotel is clean a simple room design.  Friendly staff but need to work at services.  Wifi ain't the best in the room and you need to be either in the lobby or club room for the best signal.  The food was really good!  Just a pity the waiters let the chef down.  It is ok value for money and the best Windhoek has to offer.  The roof top is stunning for sunset drinks and offers great views of the city. Once you sit down you don't want to move...
Date: Date of stay: September 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Windhoek
Review Content: Really enjoyed stay at this hotel. The view from the amazing roof bar/restaurant was simply stunning. The rooms are modern and extremely well equipped. The bed was so comfortable I could have stayed there the whole day.

The apologised saying all beds were being used, which would have been helpful to know at check in. Not great for a 5 star hotel

Review Content: Very Good - centrally situated. Staff /chef very accommodating in preparing me Moslem/Halaal meals. Front desk manager is going out of his way to assist me with a problem I have with Hilton Hotel in Madinah Saudi Arabia.

Name: Staying at the Hilton has always been great experience for me.  I would recommend staying at the Hilton to any of my fr
Review Content: Staying at the Hilton has always been great experience for me.  I would recommend staying at the Hilton to any of my friends and family.  The staff was very nice and helpful.  The executive lounge could have had more items to select from.
Date: Date of stay: November 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice place to stay in the centre of Windhoek
Review Content: The hotel is well located with the whole city centre within walking distance. The building is just a few years old, but one shouldn't look to closely if everything is in good shape. The room was quite big with an open bathroom and a comfortable bed, but without slippers and a bathrobe. Wifi is free for members of the Hilton loyalty programme and worked well at all times. I liked the rich breakfast buffet as well as the rooftop bar that gives a great view over the city. Some staff members were  nice and did a good job, indeed, but all in all the staff is not really noteworthy. The price for my stay was in line with the reputation of the hotel brand and the service level, though certainly not a bargain.
Date: Date of stay: October 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: My Hilton Always No. 1 Forever
Review Content: Hilton is the best of them all. The Hilton Group is my Hilton. My home away from home. It goes without saying that Hilton is always No. 1 forever. The only world class hotel in Namibia and the world over. I cannot imagine staying in any other hotel which is not Hilton. I love my Hilton!!!
Date: Date of stay: October 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Stay was too short!
Review Content: I stayed at the Hilton in Windhoek on a business trip, only 2 nights.  It was such a lovely experience.  The check-in was very smooth, the staff were very friendly.  The room was lovely, very spacious and the bathroom was spotless.  I really enjoyed my meal there, the restaurant was great!  The whole experience was awesome, I would definitely return.  Well Done !!!

Name: Lovely stay at the Hilton after a week Etosha
Review Content: We needed after a week Etosha some luxury. We found it at the Hilton. We did some shoppings for presents in Windhoek for our children and family. The Hilton was the perfect location in the center of the city with all malls in the vicinity. The Hotel is clean, has an excellent service, but the food is mediocre.

Name: Corporate style hotel in African Capital
Review Content: This felt like there hiltons in terms of standards I have stayed in European and Americian cities.  It is clean, modern and well equipped with spacious bedrooms.  I enjoyed a visit to the roof top bar for our first cocktails of our trip.  The staff were very courteous and welcoming.  Breakfast was excellent.

Review Content: The Hilton is very upscale and impressive. The rooms, bars, dining facility, Executive lounge, Fitness Center are all top notch. The Staff from the counter to the housekeeping are exceptionally friendly and helpful.

Name: Avoid the Windhoek Hilton at all Cost!
Review Content: Never ever stay at the Windhoek Hilton. This is not Hilton standard. The front desk is utterly dysfunctional. I went up and down the lifts about 5 times to reset my card upon check-in. I booked online for  special deal, just to be charged the normal full rate upon check-out. You have been warned!
Date: Date of stay: August 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Superb luxury!
Review Content: This hotel was an awesome way to end a few weeks of camping!  The bathroom was beautiful, there was a nice soaking tub, the bed was super comfortable, and everything was spotless.  The service was excellent- meeting Western European/US standards.  Breakfast is to die for, so don't miss it. The only problem with this hotel is if you stay here first you'll be disappointed with most of the hotels in the rest of the country.... Not a bad problem to have!
Date: Date of stay: August 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great place to start/end your Namibian holiday at Windhoek
Review Content: We had a 2 week Namibian holiday and ended our stay with Hilton for a night. The rooms were great, service was good and the concierge booked a restaurant and the transportation to and from the restaurant - great place
Date: Date of stay: July 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Awesome First Experience
Review Content: We stayed at the Hilton in Windhoek for our first anniversary and the overall experience was great. We arrived late Friday afternoon on the 1st of July and we were welcomed warmly by the staff and check in was easy because we only had to collect the key because we had already checked in online. We pretty much stayed at the hotel and did not go ou tmuch and we loved how the hotel have a variety of entertainment on site. We loved the Skybar (the view is to die for at night), Ekipa restaurant had a very interesting buffet and menu and also excellent wine selection. The staff were very friendly and attentive. Breakfast is a delight! Really loved the fresh juice bar and fruit smoothies. Room service was great too and the pizza we ordered was sooo goood! I mostly loved the stay and my only complaint was we never had water bottles in our room when we checked in they only put them in the next day.  After house keeping had cleaned up on Saturday they did not immediately make the bed we had to call them to do it (but the lady did say w=she was waiting on the sheets to be ironed). Other than that we loved our stay and we look forward to the next time we go back! Would higly recommend it!
Date: Date of stay: July 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Memorable hangout with colleagues
Review Content: For those who love live music--The Hilton will be an ideal place to visit on Thursdays and Fridays. I was impressed  that the chef himself came out to deal with a query on the food served and took extra-ordinary measures to respond the request. Friendly staff who take customer service seriously. Enjoyed a club sandwich and  a platter of grilled meat.
Date: Date of stay: June 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Very comfortable
Review Content: As others have said, very nice rooms but such an odd bathroom arrangement.  You can tell that it was carefully thought out, but it must have been a single person who did so!  Generous breakfast buffet. Very competent staff particularly the front desk and the young man hosting the breakfast room.
Date: Date of stay: June 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: My stay at Hilton, Namibia
Review Content: Organize with the hotel to pick you up from the airport, it just makes things easier. What an efficient check-in process with a personal touch. From the sentinel to the reception staff, they take interest in you the moment you walk into the hotel. They are very friendly and they love providing relevant information you will need for your stay including mingling with the locals at the Sky bar on the 9th floor. All I can say is, give them an opportunity, you won't regret it.
Date: Date of stay: May 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good service, building lasting well
Review Content: This Hilton is now five years old, having opened in 2011. It's lasting well and still feels new.The rooftop bar is definitely worth a visit, particularly if you can be there for the incredible (though rather quick at this latitude) sunset. There is a pool at the rooftop bar, too.The staff and service are very good and attentive.The rooms and bathrooms are large and well-fitted, with good soundproofing and quiet rooms for a good nights sleep.However, the pillows are rather thin and are of the European type where all the stuffing seems to escape to the ends. (I did not ask the hotel if they had any other pillows on request.)The bathroom in the particular room type we stayed in has a frosted glass window from the outside of the building, to the shower enclosure. A lot of light comes in here, and because the bathroom is open plan, the room is quite bright at night, and there is no way of blocking the light out. This is in a deluxe room at the corner of the building, and the layout has been the same with the same problem on both occasions we've stayed. If you are light-sensitive you may want to check at reception (I am not light-sensitive, but I did notice it being unusually bright.)We didn't use the spa on this occasion for any treatment, but did have a massage on a previous visit, again a very good experience.The hotel has extremely fast and reliable wifi, which was useful.
Date: Date of stay: May 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: MR
Review Content: The hotel needs to live to its stated service provision values.  Staff must be helpful, and feel confident, they seemed to be constrained by " big brother", hence they try to cover up problems , which is apparent to guests.
Date: Date of stay: April 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hotel is nice, service hit or miss
Review Content: This is definitely the nicest hotel in Windhoek, but I am not sure it's worth the trouble.   IT was a bit shabby if you looked at anything closely and the service was SUPER spotty.  In some cases it was great - smooth checkin, nice bellman.   Other cases the ball was dropped repeatedly.   We learned in our short stay in Windhoek that people will readily agree to help or do something, but they don't always mean it.  It happened several times, not just here, so it's something to keep in mind.
Date: Date of stay: March 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Love the sky bar!
Review Content: Perfectly located in the middle of Windhoek.  Rooms are spacious, very clean and comfortable with good views of the surrounding area.  Only stayed for one night as on a business trip but would definitely return with my family and use this hotel as a base to explore beautiful surrounding area.
Date: Date of stay: March 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: HILTON WINDHOEK
Review Content: The staff is extremely friendly and helpful.  The rooms are fantastic and spacious.  I have stayed at the Hilton Johannesburg and Cape Town but Hilton Windhoek's rooms are the best.   I would highly recommend the Hilton Windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: February 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Convenient location but poor business facility
Review Content: The Hilton is quite centrally located with all the relevant stuff you need for a good night's rest. The breakfast is good and served at a decent time.  What is most disappointing is the quality of the Wi-fi. I would not mind adding R200 to my room rate to just have easily accessible Wi-fi. Instead here, you pay per hour! and the voucher doesnt work the first time. You must just grin and bear it having to go up and down to reception (because they wont come to your room) and ask for re-issue.
Date: Date of stay: February 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Comments
Review Content: It was my 3th time I staid at Hilton and it was a good experience. The hotel is well located and the people are friendly. The fitness centre is an additional value of the hotel and I would suggest it would have a person to assist the new users.
Date: Date of stay: January 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Average at best
Review Content: The Hotel does not live up to Hilton standards.The check-in and check-out process was tedious to say the least.Hotel staff do not concern themselves nor focus on service standards at allYou feel that they are doing you a favour.It is modern and relatively new, however towels and linen are poor and tatty.Situation is great.
Date: Date of stay: January 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Windhoek Hilton
Review Content: Staff can be less than helpful, but the hotel facilities and rooms are clean and comfortable and that's worth a lot in Africa so you can get over the staff problems. The location is fine and right in the center of town.
Date: Date of stay: December 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Full luxury!
Review Content: The Hilton Windhoek is a beautiful hotel. It is located in the center of the city, but one can have a great time without ever leaving the property.We had a large and lovely room that spoiled us. Warming rack for the towels, big bath tub, luxurious bed, and power outlets for South Africa, Europe, and Australia.The rooftop pool is narrow but warm as bathwater. Also on that same floor is a fitness center and executive lounge. The lounge is comfortable with two levels, It has lots of tables and upholstered chairs, computers (one of which is attached to a printer), a supply of fruit and nuts always available, and printed sheets with news of the day from various nations. We saw UK, Portugal, France, Germany, and USA.We ate at the hotel's restaurant, Ekipe. It serves a buffet with a variety of choices, some of them typically Numibian, others more international in scope. The buffet includes a dessert bar with many choices. The kids were in heaven and particularly delighted by the "pot o' gold" dessert. It is a dark chocolate pot with chocolate mousse inside.The room came with complimentary breakfast, also served in Ekipe. It had all the foods you would expect and a few more local delicacies, such as fresh granadilla (it's a fruit).The staff was friendly and helpful and always happy to make our experience better.
Date: Date of stay: December 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Excellent hotel and extraordinary service
Review Content: It was my first trip to Windhoek and the stay at the Hilton Hotel was a positive experience. The hotel is located in the city center and the rooms are large, comfortable and clean. The staff is very friendly and professional and I would like to specially mention Anna Asser who was very friendly and extremely helpful. She went out of her way to help me with check-in, printing of important documents urgently and other issues. I would like to commend her as an example of a staff member who went beyond the call of duty to help. I will be in Namibia in February and definitely plan to go back to the Hilton. I will not hesitate to recommend the Hilton to friends, family and colleagues.
Date: Date of stay: November 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Not to International standard expected of a Hilton
Review Content: Severely disappointed by my recent stay, and will certainly not return: - I made my booking in March 2015, and specifically stated non smoking on my booking, yet when I arrived at 16.00, I was told there were no non smoking rooms left. Surely a room should have been allocated with my booking? I was offered to wait in the executive lounge, however no one could tell me how long I would have to wait. Having travelled down from Ongava, this was not appealing, so I took a smoking room - which was awful.- Wifi was atrocious. Tried to free wifi access in the lobby area, but no success, and I was told by a girl at reception that the wifi was down. Tried to access the paid wifi from the room, and this didn't work either, I was told a call could be put through to the Internet Service Provider so they could manually connect my device. This is again not acceptable. I should not have to speak to an ISP to access a service the hotel provides. If it doesn't work, don't offer it. And if you want to have it as something to offer, make sure you get good service.- Breakfast on the whole was good, as it is a Buffett, but there is no coffee stand to help yourself, so you are at the mercy of the very slow wait staff. I requested a coffee when I sat down, and didn't see the waitress again...and finished my breakfast without any coffee being brought. It was not very full either, so the wait staff need to be retrained on international levels of service.- Finally there is construction going on next door to build a Hilton Garden Inn. There was no mention on check in (or before when booking as a warning in case customers would prefer another location). Anyway a word of warning, the construction starts at 6.30, so if you are in holiday, I would suggest you ask for a room that does not overlook the construction site.
Date: Date of stay: November 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hotel luxueux

Ausserdem muss ich betonen, das niemand vom Personal gel√§chelt hat, alle waren sehr unfreundlich. Endlich haben wir unseren Zimmerschl√ºssel bekommen,. Das azimmer war ein raucherhimmer. Es hat unglaublich schlecht gerochen. Als wir uns beschwe haben, sagte man uns, dass sie das Zimmer sauber machen k√∂nnten mit Stsubsaugee. Nat√ºrlich haben wir das abgelehnt. Name: Carefree Business
Review Content: A great place to stay and be looked after so that I can focus on the important things that I need to. Also a relaxing place to come back to for meals or sitting by the pool to catch up on reading. The chef is a creative genius who takes pride in what he does and with his staff endevor to give guests a warm, friendly eating experience. Very centrally situated in Windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: September 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: impressed
Review Content: I have been impressed when traveling through a natural bush for finally entering a Nice hotel in a wonderful city, Windhoek! I swore to return with my family spend a few days in Hilton Hotel. May God bless Namibia and keep its people united and hospitable.
Date: Date of stay: September 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good hotel, typical Hilton
Review Content: The Windhoek Hilton offers the good service and room amenities one would expect of a Hilton. The rooms are spacious, clean, and comfortable. We stayed here for one night when we had to get friends to the airport early the next morning. It's centrally located and served our purposes just fine.
Date: Date of stay: June 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great Location for Sundowner
Review Content: Probably the best place in Windhoek to start / finish family vacations, next to Independance Avenue.  Employees are very friendly and helpful (luggage, service, restaurant tips and advice).  The rooftop terrace with pool is a great place to enjoy the Namibian sunset.
Date: Date of stay: August 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Short Stay in Windhoek
Review Content: The room was great, had a shower and a bath tub. The food was excellent, a bit pricy compared to SA standards. The sushi chef was great. The Skybar has a great view and yummy cocktails. Wifi is a bit tricky though. Service good, friendly staff and a very clean hotel. Would love to go back to stay here.

N√£o percebo e n√£o apreciei o facto de ter de pagar pela internet estando no quarto quando √© o local que mais se usa, sendo que nas √°reas p√∫blicas a internet √© de gra√ßa. Name: Disappointing staff- problems all around
Review Content: First impression of the building and check in we thought it was going to be fine.  Given an upgrade for Diamond Status, which was a nice start.  We had booked 2 massages 45 days in advance.  Written confirmation from Spa Manager Virginia.  When we arrived, in much need of a massage after all the international travel, learned that only one massage would be available as the other employee had quit.  We had not been notified so we could make other arrangements or take a different time slot.  That was really disappointing. So we went to the executive lounge, which had several unsupervised children in there alone.  Ok. That is strange.  We had a burger at the bar which was below average.  The next morning the bill was under our door. Charges from the bar on the bill which didn't belong to us. We immediately notified front desk to recheck the bills we had been charged.  They called back to say they had removed the charges that weren't ours.  When we went to check out, we saw that the wrong charges were still on our bill and the charges that were ours were not on our bill.  We were still be over charged by about N$330.  We waited and waited at the front desk for resolution.  Charges coming on and off and still after 30 minutes it couldn't get resolved. Eventually we had to leave for the airport and couldn't wait any longer. They said they would correct. But the larger amount still ended up on our credit card.  Won't be staying here again.   Prepare yourself for disappointments and frustrations if you decide to stay.
Date: Date of stay: December 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice hotel - some rude staff
Review Content: This is everything you expect from a Hilton and it delivers. Great location and facilities - the roof top pool and terrace was great. Very nice luxurious quiet rooms. However the staff at the Skybar restaurant were extremely rude. The service on check in was fantastic as were all other staff members - and therefore quite different to the service at the pool bar. I'm sure just a rogue member of staff that is spoiling everyone else's hard work on making it such a good experience. Apart from that though - a great place to start/end your Namibian holiday.
Date: Date of stay: November 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Gorgeous
Review Content: The Hilton is very new. It has really improved my stays in Windhoek. The rooms are beautiful. The bathrooms are ultra modern with tons of room.The breakfast is great. Dinner is a little overpriced for the buffet but is very good. There are lots of options within easy walking distance. Travel to the airport takes awhile and the check out process has been a little slow so give yourself plenty of time.
Date: Date of stay: January 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Executive Business accomodation
Review Content: A great hotel for the business traveller. Great service and setting. Confernce facilities are well appointed and convenient. Restaurant meals were dissapointing tho. Lack of free wifi in the rooms is a real bug bear for me!
Date: Date of stay: November 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good start and finish in Namibia
Review Content: We stayed there at the beginning and at the end of our three weeks holidays in Namibia. The hotel is conveniently located in the center of Windhoek. It has nice rooms and bathrooms and is a perfect spot to get you going after a long flight. There is a nice rooftop bar and swimming pool. It would be perfect for laps, unfortunately the water is overheated. Also, it tends to be overcrowded on week-ends. The breakfast is great, with a large variety of cold and hot food, fresh juices, fruit, pastry, etc. The wifi is slow and expensive. The parking is free, but you have to ask for your exit ticket at the reception desk. The staff is very helpful in making diner reservation.
Date: Date of stay: September 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great Hotel but......
Review Content: A very decent hotel as can be expected from the Hilton Group of hotels, but my biggest gripe is the charge for WIFI, what hotels charge for WIFI nowadays? You can walk across the road and get free WIFI at the Wimpy! Another thing why should guests have to pay for parking, come on guys, get with the times. There are a lot of hotels out there taking care of these necessary things.

Review Content: We stayed here for one night early Sept 14, our room was very spacious and well laid out, luxury feel bathroom, and the roof top bar was an added bonus, I have to say all the staff were so friendly and helpful, highly recommend !!!! And a great central location for Windhoek.

Name: Very good to stay

Name: Un tr√®s bon h√¥tel au coeur de la capitale namibienne
Review Content: L'Hilton Windhoek r√©pond √† toutes les exigences que l'on pourrait attendre d'un Hilton. L'h√¥tel est bien situ√©, en plein centre ville. Les chambres sont spacieuses et propres, avec une grande salle de bain.C√¥t√© restaurant, le soir des plats √† la carte et un buffet sont propos√©s, nous avons bien mang√© et √† prix raisonnable. Le matin, le petit d√©jeuner, sous forme de buffet √©galement, comblait aussi toutes nos attentes, mis √† part un service tr√®s lent.L'h√¥tel dispose sur le toi d'une piscine chauff√©e en hiver, mais qui ferme √† 20 heure malheureusement.Dans l'ensemble un h√¥tel agr√©able pour commencer ou terminer son voyage en Namibie.

Name: Back to the same hotel, not the same experience though ...
Review Content: I revisited Hilton Windhoek after 1 year. Of course it remains the best hotel in the city, no doubt, but... Yes but... in 1 year the shine had started to fade away... The rooms, the cleanses, the food, not like 1 year ago, when I first visited and it was just opened. I had to change the room, cause there was no hot water (although the staff was helpful and trying to fix it), the dinner quality was average both nights that I had dinner, the breakfast was abundant but... The espresso though in the coffee shop in the entrance floor was great (for a European having a decent espresso is crucial... :-))  The internet, I paid like 12 Euro per day for internet, and there is no free area anywhere in the hotel. I will come again next year, hopefully, and I hope I will not be disappointed.
Date: Date of stay: May 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: The Hilton an excellent stay
Review Content: The Hilton is really one of the most remarkable places to stay in Windhoek. Food is excellent and quality of friendliness of staff amazing. I personally feel it is the best hotel on Namibia. Will any time recommend especially for business trips. Was not so impressed with the architecture as well as openness of rooms, however the climate control makes it good to sit in an open air bath. This is however personal taste and others might like it again.
