Name: Central and Convenient for Business
Review Content: Stayed at Hilton Windhoek for almost two months, and as checked in and out for circa three times I stayed in different rooms, while in the same category. Overall is a good business hotel, The hotel is new and the rooms are spacious, with plenty of light and with a very good desk, where you can put your computer, printer and even some paper files. Here and there you can find some maintenance problems, but mostly related with low-quality material on construction. Air-con is good and room design is very modern and confortable. On the top floor there is a small but convenient pool with a bar, as well as a relatively complete gym and a small Spa where you can find a relaxing massage (the gym was the reason I chose the hotel). The staff is VERY friendly although sometimes lacks a little experience. Other great advantage is that is located downtown, on walking distance to banks, malls, shops of every kind. One of the best business travelers options in Windhoek. If the internet were free of charge I would rate Hilton Windhoek as "Excellent".
Date: Date of stay: April 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Very nice hotel....internet is highway robbery
Review Content: I stayed 7 nights and personally found the staff incredibly friendly and helpful, despite reading several reviews to the contrary.Admittedly I had never stayed in a Hilton before so I do not have a good reference to compare this hotel to other Hilton's, but I thought the room was very nice, the lobby was beautiful, and the restaurants/bars had good food.One thing that I did find annoying is the elevators.  You could easily find yourself waiting a handful of minutes for an elevator, as they often passed right by my floor even when I was trying to go in the same direction.My last issue, and it is a big one, is the internet.  I know all Hilton's charge for it, but the price is excessive.  N170 per day!  This needs to change!

Normalerweise ziehe ich in Afrika eher stilvolle lokale Unterk√ºnfte vor, muss aber sagen, dass das Hilton sehr zentral gelegen und gut konzipiert ist. Das Hotel verf√ºgt zudem √ºber sch√∂n eingerichtete Zimmer. Die Bars und Lounges sind gem√ºtlich, im Restaurant habe ich nur gefr√ºhst√ºckt. Die Preise sind nat√ºrlich √ºberdurchschnittlich hoch, dennoch wird z.B. die Dachterrasse mit ihrer Bar intensiv auch von der v.a. jungen einheimischen Bev√∂lkerung genutzt.

Name: F√ºr den Sundowner
Review Content: Die Hilton Rooftop Bar eignet sich hervorragend f√ºr einen Sundowner. Faire Preise f√ºr die Location und ansonsten ein gigantisch, toller Ausblick. Man muss hierzu kein Gast sein. Die Bar auf der Terrasse ist zwar nicht sonderlich gro√ü, aber es geht ja auch darum den Sonnenuntergang genie√üen zu k√∂nnen.

Name: A disappointing Stay
Review Content: We stayed at this hotel between 12 December and 20 December 2013 and it was not a good experience.We were in an Executive Room- but it lacks bathroom and toilet privacy; terrible if you have a visitor and also if one uses the facilities when the other person is sleeping.One night we could not sleep for a couple of hours because of a noise from the shower, probably because it was in use in the adjacent room. There is constant noise from the lift throughout the night.The lighting is poor and the room is semi dark.Though Wi-Fi is advertised at the Hotel's website, it is not free and I was quoted N1000+ for a week's use and so I had to do without. So effectively there is no Internet except for a shared computer in the lobby for all guests.My wife tendered for a currency change GB¬£90 and was given a receipt for 90Euros, we made several attempts to get this rectified until we had to give up. I tried a couple of times to change money and found they did not have enough local money. The staff also keep telling you that their rate is very low.We ate breakfast and Dinner there. The meals are boring monotonous and not great, the last breakfast we asked for fried egg and we were given one egg each. Sometimes room service food is brought in a warmer and sometimes it is just placed on a trolley. If you want room service breakfast you have to ring for the order card every time. For three days the hotel Restaurant had no soft drinks. The tea bags in the rooms are rationed to one bag a person in case one wants to use the tea making facilities in the room.Over all, the staff seem to lack proper training although they are very cheerful and try to be helpful.This was a trip arranged by our children as a present for our 40 wedding anniversary and it would break their heart if we told them of our experience. This is not the Hilton service and facilities I am familiar with.
Date: Date of stay: December 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Beautiful hotel, terrible staff
Review Content: Spent 2 days while on business in Namibia. Found the hotel absolutely beautiful and everything was brilliant from check in to stay, however after my stay I got an email from the Manager stating there was damage to the TV. On further investigation, it seems there was physical damage which was not observed at the time of my check-out, but later in the day. It was obvious that the damage was done post my check out however I was horribly harassed and abused by the Director of Operations, TEUN ENGBERS. This went on for weeks and my company had to get involved. Never before has this happened to me!

Name: Hilton Hotel Namibia
Review Content: Very modern and pleasant hotel with wonderful staff to assist. The rooms are clean, wonderful and spacious. I will stay at this hotel again should I travel to Namibia and certainly will recommend it to friends and family traveling to Nambia.

Name: Personal opinions

I will surelly visit again, especially with the spoffer of bringing my wife with and only pay as if alone. I can't wait to enjoy the comfort of "King's bed" with my wife and the rest that the Hilton Hotel offers. It was redally a great experience being housed there, NO regrets!!

Il servizio √® stato ottimo. Molto bella la terrazza sul tetto con bar e piscina, da cui si gode di un bel panorama sulla citt√†. Ottima la colazione, con piatti preparati al momento.

Name: tre stelle e mezzo
Review Content: diciamo pure che le cinque stelle le ha viste con un bele teleobbiettivo!!! tutto sommato una o al max due notti si possono fare come prima tappa x visitare la namibia o di ritorno dai safari! pulito, personale decente roof sulla terrazza ma niente di piu'!

Name: Nice stay
Review Content: Spent night in Hilton prior to take my flight the following day. It was just for one night and we couldn't see much.Room was comfortable, clean and we managed to rest well. Breakfast at Okipa restaurant met expectations. For sure we will be back and stay longer in order to use other hotel facilities.
Date: Date of stay: August 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A phenomenal Hilton
Review Content: Beautiful, modern, quite, comfortable, clean rooms and very friendly, very helpful but startlingly inefficient staff.  I recommend the hotel highly, just don't expect anything from reception to dining room to function very fast and you'll really enjoy this lovely, well-located (just a 5-minute walk to the centre of the city) hotel.
Date: Date of stay: July 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: The Best
Review Content: We had to find a night's accommo in Windhoek due to rescheduling of flights not fitting in with prearranged arrangements, so decided on something central.  It was a complete surprise for although Hilton's have a certain similarity, this was something out of the box.  For a start the design was open and had a good feel, but it all worked and the staff were fabulous.  Nothing was a problem and they obviously loved what they were doing - it came through just talking to them.  There is a fabulous roof pool-top bar which serves light meals and you can view marvelous sunsets over the city.  Their main restaurant was one of the best and for Hilton standards was very well priced.  Rooms are extremely well appointed and once you have worked out all the little buttons, everything  opens & shuts ... plus they have a gorgeous bath to soak away that safari dust.
Date: Date of stay: May 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: BUENISIMA OPCION EN WINDHOEK
Review Content: El Hilton de Windhoek es un "Hilton" nunca decepcionan a mi por lo menos.Esta centrico ,sus habitaciones son modernas ,tienen buenas camas y son grandes .Sus empleados son amables y el restaurante es muy bueno .El buffet del desayuno muy completoun peque√±o problema : el Wi-Fi no es gratuito y es caro , y los maleteros son lentos .En el ultimo piso hay un bar con piscina con vistas de la ciudad.muy agradable .Lo recomiendo. igual que el viaje a Namibia , precioso pais .
Date: Date of stay: May 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Sch√∂nes Hotel mit Schw√§chen im Service
Review Content: Das Hilton Windhoek liegt mitten im Stadtzentrum von Windhoek an der Independence Avenue. Alle Sehensw√ºrdigkeiten sind tags√ºber gut Fuss zu erreichen, man sollte zu diesem Zeitpunkt aber besser kein Mietauto mehr haben, da Parken eher teuer und umst√§ndlich ist. Die Zimmer sind gross und modern mit grossem Badbereich und separater Dusche. Der Poolbereich auf dem Dach ist gerade nach einer langen Namibia-Rundreise ein echtes Plus, auch wenn der Pool selbst mit 28 Grad eher Thermalbad-Temperatur aufweist. Echte Schw√§chen hat das Hotel, wie beireits in anderen Reviews beschrieben, vor allem beim Service: Der Check-In scheint sehr kompliziert und dauert unn√∂tig lange. Lange Schlangen sind die Folge. Auch die Tatsache, dass Wi-Fi hier noch extra bezahlt werden muss, ist meiner Meinung nach lange nicht mehr zeitgem√§√ü, solche Selbstverst√§ndlichkeiten sollten bereits bei der Kalkulation der Zimmerrate ber√ºcksichtigt werden. Auch f√ºr das Fr√ºhst√ºck findet man entgegen des Aufdrucks auf dem Room Service Menu beim Auschecken dann noch eine zus√§tzliche "Tray-Fee" auf seiner Rechnung. Hierbei geht es weniger um die H√∂he der Fee (wir hatten auch zu dem h√∂heren Preis bestellt) als die Tatsache, dass diese zahlreichen, immer wieder versteckten Charges schlichtweg aergerlich und damit geeignet sind, den an sich sehr positiven Eundruck des Hotels zu besch√§digen. Gleichwohl w√ºrden wir das Hilton nach wie vor als gutes Hotel empfehlen.
Date: Date of stay: April 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice hotel but not without faults
Review Content: Stayed here for 1 night on our 1st night in Namibia, we didn't get off to a great start as I had pre-booked an airport pick up with the hotel that didn't show up. For a chain with the reputation as the Hilton I was very surprised at this oversight. It's also quite daunting to arrive in Africa and then have to try and arrange a taxi. Anyway the hotel were very apologetic and upgraded our room to compensate. Apart from that it's a great hotel, the rooms were spacious and luxurious and a real highlight was the fantastic roof top bar and pool. Had a great atmosphere and seemed very popular with the locals. We ate at the restaurant which was also very good. For 1 night I was happy with my choice of hotel. I would only suggest to re-confirm airport pickups just before you set off on your journey.
Date: Date of stay: March 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: best hotel in windhoek
Review Content: Modern hotel with a high standard of accomondation , central and in walking distance to city center and retaurants.The open roof top pool and bar is amazing and the view overlooking windhoek is spectacular.The breakfats buffet was individualy and freshly prepared, everthing you need for a great start into your day. Never had a breakfast like that before!We highly recommend this hotel for starting/finishing your journey if you looking for comfort and care.
Date: Date of stay: November 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: First rate hotel - visit marred by one instance of poor customer service
Review Content: First the positives: This hotel in in a great location, close to downtown, craft markets, restaurants and the small downtown mall. The staff were friendly, attentive and professional, particularly in the Skybar and the Coffee lounge which are both excellent facilities. Food quality at breakfast and dinner was above average for hotel fare. The craft store in the foyer has some interesting things on sale at reasonable prices.  Now the negatives: The wi-fi internet provision is expensive and slow. There is no free service anywhere in the hotel.  There was a mess up with our airport transportation reservation and the reception staff, including someone we think was the reception supervisor, responded really badly, telling us repeatedly that it was  'on the way' when it wasn't, leaving us to resolve matters, after 20  minutes waiting, by commandeering a local taxi. Screw-ups will happen in the best run establishments.  How they recover from them determines the lasting impression of customer service, and outstanding recovery starts with 'Mea Culpa' and honesty.
Date: Date of stay: March 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Look no further: THE hotel in Windhoek
Review Content: Gorgeous in every way. Don't bother looking for anything else if you want a five-star experience. The rooftop bar is an extra special bonus - terrific view! Underground parking makes things comfortable also.
Date: Date of stay: June 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great Hotel
Review Content: I traveled to Windhoek, Namibia for the first time in Oct.  I stayed for 3 week in the Windhoek Hilton.  I have to say it was the highlight of all my stays in Africa.  The hotel clean, modern and loaded with amenities.  On the 9th floor, which a roof top, has a really nice lap pool.  In addition it has a roof top bar with great views of the city of Windhoek.  Also a good fitness center and spa.  The fitness center has several of the ellipticals and bikes with a gym with weights.  No free weights.  Also the Executive Lounge is on the 9th floor and has two levels with commanding views.  The staff are excellent providing anything you need.  I do have to said they ran out of Jack Daniels which I prefer for two weeks.  The wine and other selections were provided.  The food provide was very good.  I can't say enough about the Executive Lounge staff they truly made our stay exceptional.Breakfast was provided in the restaurant and had many choices to include a full cooked breakfast.  Staff were wonderful but had to get their attention for refills or coffee.  Half way during our stay they changed the hours of service from 0630 to 0700 in the morning.  This was not relied to us and we showed up at 0645 and it was closed. This was an issue as we had to depart at 0730 and change did not provide adequate time for a breakfast.  The Hotel is very convenient to all of the shops with in 2-3 blocks.  This includes all of the Namibia arts shops, markets, restaurants and clubs.I would highly recommend this hotel if you travel to Windhoek, Namibia
Date: Date of stay: October 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Mediocre
Review Content: How on earth this hotel can have a 5 star rating is beyond me. Admittedly I have never stayed at the hotel, but I have attended functions and spoken with several other people who attended similar functions independently of me. The consensus: Service, food and organisation is mediocre at best. The prices for drinks are ridiculously inflated, and only a few years after completion the hotel is already showing signs of wear & tear.Then there is the parking area. Yes, I know it doesn‚Äôt actually belong to the Hilton group, but seriously?! With the main entrances adjacent to the parking lot, the implication is most definitely that it should be associated with the hotel. I am ashamed every time I have to use that parking lot. What will foreigners think of us Namibians when they see the potholes, the broken terrain, the mess?
Date: Date of stay: September 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A great hotel for Windhoek
Review Content: The Windhoek Hilton is a very well appointed hotel that stands apart from most options in Windhoek. The room was modern with a good range of fittings, large bath and comfortable bed. While the desk offers a suitable work area, I caught my knees on the sharp edged drawers a few times. There is a general aura of exclusivity to the hotel that is less evident from the outside. Staff are friendly and service is overall excellent.
Date: Date of stay: June 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Best hotel in Windhoek
Review Content: I stayed in the Hilton for the first time and I was really satisfied. As it is new the interior is very nice and clean. The location of the hotel is also perfect as it is in the center of the city.Also perfect is the "Sky-Bar" on the roof top. You can have nice drinks and snacks there and enjoy the sunset after your day. Seems that also some local people are coming there to relax.A little bit bad is the slow service in the other bars of the hotel. Took quite some time to get a waiter to the table. This should be improved.Also the pool (again on the roof top) is a little bit small. If you would like to swim you have to be alone. Otherwise you could have trouble with avoiding collisions.All in all I will be back in this hotel when I will be back in Windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: May 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great property, but the service is a bit raw
Review Content: Very nice property - centrally located and at a walking distance away from some good malls. The slightly elevated location and short buildings around the hotel make for great sunset views from the rooftop bar and pool. The coffee shop is nice, albeit offering limited choices.Now for the negatives: I am a vegetarian - and veggie food options were virtually non-existent. Had to survive on juices and boiled vegetables most of the time. But if you are non-vegetarian, you will not be disappointed. The other aspect was the service: the staff tend to be a bit cold and lethargic in attending to you. I was actually left waiting for ~ 20 minutes just to get a cinnamon bun at the coffee shop!  They definitely need to train their staff a lot better if they need to justify their top-dollar rates.
Date: Date of stay: February 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Das bisher beste Hotel f√ºr mich
Review Content: Das Hilton in Windhoek ist erst vor wenigen Monaten er√∂ffnet worden. Es hat alles was das Herz begehrt. Phantasish eingerichtete Zimmer und noch besseren Badezimmer. Ich hatte ein Zimmer mit einer kleinen privaten Terasse, einfach Spitze. Der Pool oben auf dem Dach ist auch besonders Eindrucksvoll. Ich hatte dort Zugang zu der Lounge, die Bediensteten war √ºberaus hilfreich. Ich freue mich schon auf meine n√§chste Reise nach Windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: July 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Outstanding
Review Content: We stayed at the Hilton Windhoek for 1 night. It was great. Only been open for 3 weeks. Very welcome amenities after being on a safari for a week.  Very modern. Great open roof-top bar. Everything was very nice.
Date: Date of stay: June 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: unefficient service
Review Content: We were a party of 19 adults on our way to see the fantastic Namibia Wildlife.Windhoek Hilton hotel has a good location  downtown  and great food but a very disappointing service. check in procedure very slow. This does not combine with the rest of the Namibians good education. In the hotel restaurant we asked for some beverages after having ordered our meals, but to serve soft drinks took almost a half hour. My mobile charger broke and i had to ask for a wake up call in the morning in order to get our flight out from the airport very early, as well as breakfast box due to the time of departure. Both things was forgotten.
Date: Date of stay: March 2020This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Outstanding hospitality
Review Content: The hotel is centrally  located in the heart of the town , malls and streets shops near by . Coffee shop and restaurants has good options and choices.  Starting from the check-in  team to housekeeping  department  all are very helpful and goes out of their way to make it a great one   . Thanks to miss Violet van for making out stay amazing by giving is excess to executive lounge .All together we had a lovely stay. keep shining  and keep up the great job team Hilton windhoek. Thank you .
Date: Date of stay: September 2024This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Something wrong here
Review Content: Service while pleasant generally poor and slow, seemed like Friday night in the bar the managers were hanging out looking very dictatorial unnecessarily ordering staff around.  Had a room service issue (took over 50 mins to arrive), wrong order, and wanted to send the order back but the staff member said if I sent it back he would have to pay, terrible practice and when I asked to see a manager to resolve, seemed like genuine fear. Hardly saw any management around the hotel for the week apart from in the bar on Friday night, shame as good location, rooms ok, lovely views of sunset from the rooftop bar‚Ä¶.
Date: Date of stay: August 2023This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great place to start a Namibia tour
Review Content: The hotel is situated near the Christus Kirche and the museum, close to the Independence boulevard. Spacy rooms, good bathroom. Service is OK, but as capitals go a bit less warm than the rest of the country. Roof terrace is the best part.
Date: Date of stay: July 2022This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: The perfect self-love stay
Review Content: Professional, luxurious and a real treat. Exceptional casino, spa, food, sky bar and other facilities. The spa topped it with the most beautiful set of nails - THANK YOU for making me feel like a princess when 1 so needed it.
Date: Date of stay: November 2022This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hilton Windhoek
Review Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of our Namibia trip. Perfect located for shopping and sight seeing in the heart of the city. Staff is very helpful and customer oriented. Even during the covid-19 situation we felt safe at any time.
Date: Date of stay: April 2021This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Very pleasant hotel
Review Content: Very good place to stay for a few days or to begin or end a trip in Africa. The restaurant was good and the breakfast buffet had a largew choice of food. Very nice staff and well situated. I'll go back there without any hesitation.
Date: Date of stay: December 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great hotel
Review Content: Large, comfortable rooms, very welcoming, helpful staff, wonderful rooftop bar and pool for sunset cocktails.  Stayed for 2  nights (one prior to tour of Namibia and one before flying to Cape Town).  Would stay here again
Date: Date of stay: September 2023This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Sehr gute Lage f√ºr den Besuch von Windhoek im Zentrum.
Review Content: Das Einchecken war professionell. Das gesamte Service-Personal ist hervorragend ausgebildet und serviceorientiert. Sehr zentral gelegenes Hotel mit Dachterrasse und Pool.  Unser Mietwagen wurde in die Tiefgarage (5,- ‚Ç¨ pro Nacht) gefahren und bei der Abreise wieder zur Weiterreise bereitgestellt. Zimmer in einem guten, gepflegten Zustand, allerdings teilweise etwas altbacken, coole Roof-Top-Bar, gute Lounge war leider geschlossen.
Date: Date of stay: December 2020This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Modern hotel, nice ambience, poor service.
Review Content: First Impressions are very important. Our group of 4 arrived at the hotel around 7pm in the evening, very excited to be spending our first night in Namibia, and also very excited for the beginning of our safari/tour through the country. When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted and brought to the front desk for checking in. That is where first impression should have been a good one, however, it was not. The Front Desk agent was a trainee and was working with another woman who appeared to be his manager. We provided him with all four passports and gave the name that room should have been booked under. After a one second glance at the screen the manager looks back at us and says very very rudely, "No. We have no rooms under that name we are all booked.". (not exactly something you want to experience on your first night of a tour. After a brief discussion with her, we had to instruct her to recheck for our names, and try each of the names on the 4 different passports that she already had in her hand. Then she actually refused to instruction and said "no, we do not have any rooms" I then had to show her that it is possible the room may have been booked under one of the other names on the passport and then she says to us "Ok, but I have only two rooms booked for the four of you" We were traveling as two couples on safari, and did not understand how anyone working in hospitality for a company known worldwide could not put two and two together to figure out we only needed 2 rooms. So that was our great first impression. The room itself was new modern clean, and pretty much everything you should expect from a new hilton.  After settling in we decided to go have a drink at the roof top bar. Unfortunately this was another place where we received poor service. Finally we figured that we would head downstairs to the Bar/Restaurant that has a great singer on Thursday nights, and it had a nice atmosphere. It took almost twenty minutes for a server to even acknowledge us, even though there may have been about fifteen servers running around and behind the bars and chatting with each other. The service here was extremely poor and I am amazed that there was absolutely no form of management that was leading by example. Unfortunately we had to return to this hotel for our last night in Namibia until we returned from South Africa. The service was slightly better but still way below par compared to any of the lodges, hotels, and resorts that we stayed at. The airport hotel in Doha, for a good four hours of sleep, had better service than this hilton.
Date: Date of stay: August 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Lovely
Review Content: The customer service, rooftop bar, and the size of the rooms was the best part of this stay. I was solo in Windhoek waiting to take a trip to Sossusvlei and I stayed here for the start and end of my journey. First, the location is good. It looks like it's on an isolated hill but in reality it's just a 5 minute walk to the "downtown" area where there are restaurants, drinks, shops and a post office. There's also a casino at the bottom of the hotel and to the side of it is an arts & crafts expo where you can buy lots of crafts. Second, they have a rooftop bar with really great views of the small city of Windhoek. I' just go for the fries and to see the sunset. There's a bit of pretentious after work vibe and there's a pool, but I was fine drinking wine solo in my jeans as people around me were dressed up nicely. Third, the customer service. If you need anything, phone and they are right there. They guys who manage the doors and greet the clients are always friendly and ready to offer advice on how to get around and where to go. Even one guy walked me out back to show we a short cut to the post office. They make you feel wall taken care of,Fourth, the bed was huge and comfy. The room was huge. Prob. bigger than most NYC apartments and it had everything I needed.
Date: Date of stay: November 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Gute erste Station in namibia
Review Content: Zum Auftakt unserer zwei Wochen in namibia zun√§chst das hilton. Gute zimmer. Sehr gross.  Sch√∂nes Bad.  Getrennte Toilette. Dachpool klasse. Direkt im stadtzentrum. Wobei windhoek m.e. nicht so doll ausschaut. Zz grosse Baustelle am hilton. Insgesamt als Auftakt hotel absolut zu empfehlen.
Date: Date of stay: December 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great! Hightly recommended
Review Content: Really fantastic hotel - for both business and leisure travelers. The staff were attentive - perfect check-in, arranging our taxi's in the evenings and looking after us at the deck-bar. Rooms are modern and comfortable. Have been to other hotels in Windhoek - this will always be first choice going forward.For smoking, proper comfortable area catered for downstairs (although far from the bar)Not much more to say - highly recommend
Date: Date of stay: March 2022This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great location
Review Content: Traveling to and from Windhoek I stayed here with my friends.  We enjoyed! Very nice - good location and our rooms had a small garden. We were able to enjoy the benefits of the Concierge floor and lovely pool and bar on the roof top
Date: Date of stay: October 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Cos√¨ cos√¨
Review Content: Molto probabilmente quando si va all Hilton si ha una idea di eleganza e stile che qua ho trovato solo in parte consierge poco attenti alle richieste di taxi ,camera con vetri sporchissimi ,colazione sufficiente ,posizione buona insomma si potrebbe migliorare
Date: Date of stay: May 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: 4days at the Hilton
Review Content: I arrived on Tuesday 10pm. My journey was slightly over 8hrs. I was tired and irritable. I needed my room key at the speed of lightening. Guess what the key doesn‚Äôt work! so I‚Äôve to pull my bags downstairs again and try validate the key again. A SECOND time and the key wasn‚Äôt working. The third time I was ready to walk out of the hotel and go to Avani Hotel.It‚Äôs now almost 11pm, my door won‚Äôt open without the duty managers key, I‚Äôve no TV remote and the sockets don‚Äôt work to charge my phone and laptop. I‚Äôm fed up, on requesting for a room change I‚Äôm quickly informed the hotel is full and my door cannot be repaired until the following day. I push all the movable furniture to door and fall asleep In the morning I go for breakfast and I need to acess my room before going to my meeting and they can‚Äôt find someone to open my DOOR.... another 30minutes the engineers arrive!So is there anything good about this hotel?1. At breakfast they have a juicer for fresh fruit and vegetables and you get a fantastic drink in a minute.2. Roof top bar with a fantastic view of Windhoek3. Restaurants within walking distance - I especially like an Italian one that has very good wine called SicilyWould I stay there again?I prefer Avani and that would be my 1st choice when in Windhoek!
Date: Date of stay: December 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Flawless experience
Review Content: Having traveled all over Africa, I often tone down my expectations about what major international hotel brands will deliver. At the Hilton Windhoek, nothing could be further from the truth. World-class experience in every way, and one of the better Hiltons I've stayed at anywhere in the world.
Date: Date of stay: April 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: pleasant and comfortable
Review Content: Nice staff, feel homely, clean and tidy. Comfortable beds and clean big rooms. We arrived early in the morning and had to check in quickly and comfortably. good breakfast and good food in general. Missing the hairdryer and ironing board in the room, but the staff quickly fixed.one negative that there were cockroaches up on the roof bar, it was not fun to sit comfortably when it's a little nasty.
Date: Date of stay: October 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Outstanding service
Review Content: I have stayed in Hiltons in various parts of the world but this has to be the best one so far. We had to wait a little while for our room but this was not problematic as we were upgraded and given access to the executive lounge.  We were kept up to date with the progress of the room clean. Once we got the room on the 7th floor it was large with a separate shower and bath. We had two double beds which was perfect as there were three of us.  We ended up eating what was called the light evening meal in the executive lounge which was very substantial and we didn't need to eat at the restaurant.Breakfast was outstanding with a huge choice of fruit, cereals and cooked foods both European and Namibian. We paid $N195 each which was value for money.We used the gym on the 9th floor which was perfectly adequate for our needs with CV machines, weights and stretch mats. We were given access codes for the wifi which was responsive.Parking was underground and secure.Although we were only spent one night here we would highly recommend a stay here.
Date: Date of stay: December 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Staff is overwhelmed; hotel cuts corners to save
Review Content: The hotel itself is nice enough and is very well located in Windhoek.  When we arrived, our rooms were not ready despite it being two hours after check-in time.  The staff failed to address this in any meaningful way despite numerous complaints.  Service in the hotel is generally slow and the staff appear overwhelmed and poorly trained.  The room is clean and comfortable, but the towels are yellowing and fraying; they do not smell fresh.  Despite an aircon control in the room, the aircon can in fact not be manually adjusted for each person's preference.  The management apparently controls it.
Date: Date of stay: June 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: An embarrassment to the Hilton brand
Review Content: Looked nice upon arrival.. fell apart soon after!Nice reception.Was placed in room 810, which smelled of sewer.  Management sent someone up to check, and confirmed that it smelled.They moved our bags to another room - but they never brought the new keys!  Took them 12 hours to change rooms in the system.Room service took 80 minutes for a dish that was only halfway complete. By far the worst dinner we have had in 2 months of travel in Africa. Many calls came through to the room - all hang-ups.  When I called to the front desk to inquire and block all calls to the room, they told me to take the phone off the hook! Knock at the door at 11:30pm.  They didn't have our room in the system (duh, they had changed our room!), and couldn't figure it out for room service billing. We were asleep! Couldn't it have waited?Shining star - Vivian, a true gentleman, staffing the executive lounge.No manager on duty the next morning. Voiced my concerns to the maintenance manager, who promised that the GM would write me (never did!).
Date: Date of stay: August 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Not what you think! Beware
Review Content: The lobby and the restaurant look nice but the rooms are not 5 star. They are 2-3 star at the most. The rooms were not very clean and smelled a little. There was a break in the water lines contaminating the whole system and no one seemed concerned! We couldn't shower, brush our teeth, wash our face or eat anything that was washed or cooked with the water.  We had to ask for bottled water to at least brush our teeth. We had a room booked to stay there on our way out of the country 8 days later. I canceled it. It cost me double to book another hotel last minute but their lack of concern for bacteria in their water system made me wonder what other standards are so low???
Date: Date of stay: August 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: No free WiFi
Review Content: I was very angry during 10 days stay in Hilton. The high-class hotel should have open WiFi everywhere. But here you should pay ‚Äì per hour, day or week. Price is high, and if you don‚Äôt disconnect properly, you will pay a penalty (19 $). So, if you need WiFi for business communication, or just to be in touch with your family, go somewhere else.Also, people working at reception desk are totally incompetent ‚Äì they can‚Äôt convey any message, provide help, or something like this. A day before early departure for one day trip, a group of us asked for breakfast packages to be prepared at 6 am. In the morning there was a total mess ‚Äì nobody knew about these request. After a long quest they finally delivered our breakfasts, but without bags (sorry, we are out of bags!). So, we left without it.
Date: Date of stay: February 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hilton Windhoek - scoring low on service in the restaurant
Review Content: The hotel is nice and comfortable with spacious rooms, good beds and a beautiful roof top terass to sit an enjoy the sunset. That is what we did after a long travel from Europe arriving at the hotel early evening and being reassured when checking in that dinner was served until 1030pm - both a la cart√© and buffe.  Arriving at the restaurant at 0900 pm we were told that a la cart√© was no longer on and that we could have buffe only. A buffe where quite a few of the dishes were finished already. Even more frustrating was that some of the guests arriving after us were served a la cart√©.  After ordering from a promising wine list, we had to change our choice three times as the year of the wine chosen from the list was no longer available. We ended up by asking for cabernet sauvignon similar to our first choice and found out when paying the bill that we were charged almost 800 rand for the bottle. Our fist choice was priced at 300 but the waitress chose not to inform us about the high price of the wine she brougth instead. Not a very pleasant evening and start of our vacation.
Date: Date of stay: December 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Gross aber trotzdem pers√∂nlich
Review Content: Der Name b√ºrgt f√ºr einen gewissen Standard. trotz der Gr√∂√üe wird man recht individuell behandelt. Die Zimmer sind relativ gross und sauber. Im Restaurant gibt es am Abend ein recht reichhaltiges Buffet oder man kann Gerichte direkt aus der Karte bestellen. der Weinkeller ist erlsen, die Preise sind gerechtfertigt.Um die Innenstadt zu besichtigen werden Transfers angeboten, kostenlos f√ºr Hotelg√§ste. F√ºr eine Stadtf√ºhrung kann ich Gourmettours ans Herz legen. Wer mit Mietwagen zum Hotel kommt, kann einen kostenlosen Parkplatz nutzen.

Non c'era il posto per  tenere la valigia che √® stata lasciata per terra tipo profugo! Name: Good stop off in and out of Namibia
Review Content: Good Hilton standard hotel easy to find when driving into Windhoek from the airport.Friendly staff.Has a nice roof top bar which includes a pool and lounging/ sun bathing area.It was a Friday night when we arrived and the rooftop bar seemed something of the ‚Äò in place‚Äô for the local in crowd.That was all just fine.However part of the local scene seemed to be blasting out Afro hip hop/ rap music which presumably is popular with the local clientele or they wouldn‚Äôt be blasting it out.However for the more sedate elderly ‚Äòfuzzy daddies‚Äô such as myself it would have been nice to sit out on the roof in the warm evening having a few beers without being blasted and being able to hear enough to actually have a conversation with my companion.I have a suggestion.There are speakers all around the roof area.Why not just have the speakers in the bar area for the younger ‚Äò cool cats‚Äô and not have speakers in the area furthest from the bar so that the more mature punters ,such as myself,can enjoy a quiet drink.

Name: Loved our stay here

Name: Could be in any city in the world
Review Content: This feels like a Hilton you'd find in any number of world cities, and for a couple of quick overnights in between visits to other places, that was all I wanted and it served its purpose well. The rooftop bar is OK, but I'm guessing that if you're coming through Windhoek as a tourist you are on your way to or from any number of much more spectacular vistas than the Windhoek skyline. Proximity to the Independence Museum and a few malls was great.  I had the game medallions for dinner one night and they were delicious. One downside/caveat: there's no ATM on premises so I had to go to one on the street to pay my cab back to the airport, which was a bit dicey (though ultimately worked out fine.)
Date: Date of stay: August 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Mucho que mejorar

La habitaci√≥n tambi√©n bien. Pero el √∫ltimo d√≠a todo se torci√≥: cuando llegamos, nos dijeron que el sistema se hab√≠a ca√≠do y nos tuvieron una hora y veinte minutos esperando para poder darnos habitaci√≥n. Despu√©s de ese tiempo, resulta que podr√≠amos haber hecho la reserva online. Bueno, la hicimos, nos dijeron que necesitaban otros veinte minutos y ante nuestras protestas, nos dieron una habitaci√≥n con cama doble pero preparada para un hu√©sped solo, asegur√°ndonos que ser√≠a provisional. Lo provisional se convirti√≥ en lo definitivo. Cuando requerimos hablar con la responsable de recepci√≥n, nos dijeron que estaba reunida y lo mismo pas√≥ a la ma√±ana siguiente cuando al ir a pagar insistimos en hablar de nuevo con ella. Huelga decir que nos quedamos all√≠ porque era el final de un largo viaje y ya est√°bamos demasiado cansados para buscar otra cosa.

Name: Hilton Hotel mit leichten Abstrichen
Review Content: Wir starteten unsere Namibia-Rundreise im Hilton. Wir wollen nach einem langen Flug immer ein standardisiertes Zimmer, deshalb Ketten-Hotel. Die Zimmer und der Standard entsprachen denn auch dem Erwarteten (gen√ºgend Platz, vern√ºnftiges Badezimmer, kein Schnickschnack).Bei der Ankunft liess man uns mit unserem Reiseb√ºro-Voucher eine gute halbe Stunde warten, bis dann die Aussage kam, "die Reservation sei jetzt gefunden worden".  Ein Getr√§nk oder eine Entschuldigung fehlte leider...Das Nachtessen im Restaurant war √ºberraschend gut. Normalerweise essen wir nicht im Hotel, aber da einige uns empfohlene Restaurants geschlossen hatten, kehrten wir ins Hotel zur√ºck und waren sehr zufrieden.Dass man f√ºr den WLAN-Empfang zahlen soll, ist f√ºr ein Hilton doch merkw√ºrdig.

Name: 11 days based at a Central spot
Review Content: The hotel is modern and the staff were great. This hotel is centrally located at the top end of the small business district. You can walk to most places. There is a fresh vibe and energy. The standard room is fairly large with excellent space. The rooftop deck/sky bar/pool is fantastic.My only frustration was housekeeping. Things were perpetually skipped, however it wouldn't influence my decision on coming back at all.I got stuck in the lift before a big meeting and must say that the staff handled it professional. A good stay at a great hotel.

Name: hilton Namibia
Review Content: The lobby of the hotel give a nice image. it is clean and the staff seem to be efficient. however, once we pass the door of the room, we are deceived first by the smell ofthe dust. I have found out during my staying that the rooms does not get vacumed oftened.  The shower room is of a nice quality but very dirty. I did not use it once during my stay and was lucky to have a bathtub too.  I have discussed with one of the cleaning lady and she told me they were 15 to maintain 300 rooms. I understand that it is too much work for them but I was so unhappy to suffer allergy during my entire stay that I needed to share this.

Name: first stay excellent, second one disappointing
Review Content: our first stay at the Hilton before setting off to our Namibian adventure was very good.The second one, before setting off to Botswana was disappointing.On our first stay we got a very good room, clean , spacious enough and good service.Staff always very friendly.On our second stay, however, we got an awful room, no wifi connection, had to stand outside in the corridor to get the connection, bathroom shower overflowed and wet whole bathroom, making floor extremely slippery and dangerous, no turndown sevice ,no bottled water, had to specially ask housekeeper to remove soaked towels from bathroom floor, because of the overflowing.But still staff is very courteous and friendly.

Name: Shocking
Review Content: I think some needs to remind this hotel that they are in Hospitality.check in : slow....waited 20 minutes to be spoken to and checked in -there was only  1 other guest checking in at the time...i had to wave my arms so they could acknowledge and call someone from the back to assist.(the back office door opened and there seemed to be that everyone was hiding in the back office)Ver very expensive Hotel - you do not get what you pay for :Room - 1 towel no hand towels....finally housekeeping arrived 11pm and woke me up to give me the hand towels.mini Bar Fridge - had not been re stocked - was also a rotting salad in the bar fridge from the previous guest ... i guess the previous guest got away without paying for mini bar usage - hint to Hilton - you're losing money here.Mineral water bottle opened and replaced in fridge! toughest fillet and most expensive fillet steak i ever had the embarrassment to watch my guest eat very slow internet - 0.37Mbps download speed AND you have to PAY R185 or around $15USD PER DAY PER ROOM the rest of the globe Hotel internet is expected to be free of charge people on business book hotels where they can get good wifi.we co-sponsored an event at the very same Hilton Namibia hotel with several Vendor leaders in IT - I will definitely be taking our business elsewhere.We brought around 6-8 people to stay at the hotel and attend the event...all found it very poor.we had local Namibian guests that refused to come to the event as it was being held at Hilton...due to the overpricing and shocking service.....in the lounge areas we did not once actually get served coffee...one waiter complained to a guest about feet on the outside table but couldn't be asked to actually take an order and disapeared.of greatest concern was that after my complaints and requests to see manager - the Manager did not get back to me  about room issue - the IT manager did not get back to me regards IT and Internet issues.i found the staff generally unhelpful  and i was forced to pay the full bill as this was pre cleared on my credit card....apart from the fact that i could never get to speak to a manager.this is not a 5 star Hilton - looks fancy from outside but it stops there.i would certainly recommend one of the many other local Windhoek hotel options...for the price of Hilton Namibia you can get a much better experience at a local boutique guest house !
Date: Date of stay: June 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A good hotel in central Winhoek
Review Content: Modern architecture for Winhoek, the hotel is very good. With a roof top swimming pool and bar area that is very comfortable. There is also an executive lounge on the top which is a lovely place to have breakfast.Service is very good. Early leavers for the airport can get a pack-up before departure. If you are lucky you might get upgraded to a garden suite [as we did] The room is the same but you get a little desert garden and loungers! [The only room drawback is the lighting in the ensuite which is not separated from the main room]

Name: Decent option for Windhoek
Review Content: I just completed my 6th or 7th stay at this hotel, so that tells you something: I wouldn't keep coming back if it was awful.  It's got a good downtown location and staff are friendly and helpful. Having said that, it always seems there's something to niggle about; this time it was the AC in my room.  Middle of summer and it did not cool well, and whole hotel was very warm (although some cooled areas were fine).
Date: Date of stay: January 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A nice hotel but some teething problems!
Review Content: This was a first stay at this hotel. The rooms were lovely and the staff were friendly, helpful and pleasant. Breakfast was adequate but nothing extra special. The 'big downer' was their elevators. We were about to leave and I was stuck in the elevator for 20 minutes. They had to call out the servicemen from the elevator installer and as the elevator has an exterior window and the sun was up it became rather hot encased in the square box! On this incident the staff were not very concerned and I was mostly ignored. I had to try to prize the door slightly apart to find out what was going on and then they were not all that forthcoming. Apparently this had also happened the day before. As the title says hopefully a teething problem and maybe it's all in good order now - I hope so. We will be staying again.
Date: Date of stay: June 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A Decent Hotel in a Developing City
Review Content: I read with interest some of the reviews of this hotel and some I found somewhat pompous and unfair. We stayed in the Hilton for just one night on our arrival in Namibia. There is no doubt that Namibia is developing its tourist industry and I congratulate Hilton for establishing a presence here. The hotel appears to be well run, it is comfortable and the food on offer is good. What it does lack is that professional touch which should come with time. I agree the bathroom arrangements are quirky - but one should lighten up and go with it!

Name: Hilton Windhoek
Review Content: Excellent hotel, convenient location. Helpful staff. The pool bar on the roof is just amazing, with a stunning view. The rooms are clean, quiet and comfortable. Nice breakfast. Nothing wrong here...<< cccc wwww xxxx ,,,qxLMQX?M?X

Name: Probably the"WORST HILTON IN THE WORLD"
Review Content: This is the second time I post a comment about this hotel.After a bad experience two year ago I decided to give them a second chance because the room is nice and the swiming pool is great and two year ago this place had just open and that can explain the bad service at that time.So two year later it is worst than ever!!!1- less than half of the staff where on duty because of a stryke for more than a week...2- this is probably the only one five stars hotel in the world where you don't have a botle of water in      your room ( and the minibar)! I had to go at the gas station 500m. away at 10pm to get one!!!3- 2 of the 3 bars and restaurants where simply close!!!4- the only one open restaurant was running without a chef ! and on the menu you have the choice     of 5 main courses only!5- I was expecting a massage at the Spa, It was close!6- they pretend to be short of staff but for a private fonction at the Skybar they have enough staf     and the next day this bar was close...Conclusion, regarding the staff problem they should close the hotel at that time or the minimumthey can do is sending a mail before to their clients to give them the choice to cancel their booking!It look's like the politic of Hilton is to get the money of their customers at any price include the worst service ever... Shame on you Hilton!P.S. The general manager was simply gone...
Date: Date of stay: December 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Liked it, didn't love it
Review Content: Spent two nights at this hotel after 1 night at the Durban Hilton. The room was excellent, with an open plan bathroom design that I've never seen before. This made the room seem huge and certainly less claustrophobic than many hotel rooms I've stayed in. Strange that a complimentary bottle of water is not placed in the room in the Windhoek Hilton, but was in the Durban one. I ordered a room service dinner on my first night as I'd gotten to the hotel in the early evening after a long trip and wanted an early night. A number of items on the menu were not available, especially the types of bottled mineral water they claimed to offer. When my meal arrived, the waitress had 'forgotten' the salad I had ordered(which was on the bill), bringing only the main course. She ran off to fetch the salad, saying it was ready and she would 'bring it in 5 minutes'. It arrived 15 minutes later. On my last morning there, I was scheduled to check out before breakfast (they start serving at 7 a.m., which in my opinion is a bit late if you have an early start to your day planned), but they confirmed they would pack me a breakfast box which I would collect from the reception the following morning. When I arrived at the reception to check out, there was no breakfast box in sight so they sent a waiter from the restaurant to hastily pack one. The contents were a croissant, a Danish, a banana and a yoghurt. This for the full breakfast charge on my room bill!Despite the issues I've mentioned, my overall experience of the hotel was positive and I would definitely stay there again.
Date: Date of stay: September 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Best choice for business stay
Review Content: One of the better Hiltons I have stayed. Comfortable, good service and food not bad. One of the places you feel comfortable travelling solo. I was here just for a quick business trip. Will come back but not when on holiday.
Date: Date of stay: June 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hilton Wndhoek
Review Content: Clean, staff are well presented and helpful, no kids activities and menu for families with small children - one communal pool which tends to get very full becuase of the extreme heat, the menu is very limited for the kids - the service on the meals is extremely slow at the pool deck
Date: Date of stay: January 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Classico...nel bene e nel male
Review Content: Andare all'Hilton significa sapere cosa si desidera e si ha la certezza di trovarlo sempre. Caso tipico questo Hilton della capitale della Namibia, posto in posizione invidiabile al centro della citt√†, lungo la via commerciale per eccellenza. Struttura moderna, molto acciaio e cristallo soprattutto all'interno, inserita perfettamente nel contesto cittadino. Camere razionali, ben arredate e con tutti i conforta, sia a livello di dotazioni per il bagno, sia per quello che riguarda tv e connessioni internet. Gradevoli il ristorante e il bar all'ultimo piano e quello CGE si apre sulla balconata al piano terra. Servizio desk e ristorante professionale quanto basta. Neo piuttosto grosso, ma probabilmente un caso, l'ora abbondante per avere le camere, ancora non pronte alle 6 del pomeriggio....insomma, tutto troppo normale, visto e rivisto, come dicevo all'inizio. Nella media, nel bene e nel male.
Date: Date of stay: August 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Naja...
Review Content: Wir hatten uns f√ºr das Hilton entschieden, da es uns als das beste Hotel im Ort erschien. Vergleiche kann ich keine ziehen, au√üer zu Hilton-Hotels in anderen Teilen der Welt. Insgesamt hat es die Erwartungen erf√ºllt, allerdings fiel hier auf, dass der Service sehr sehr schleppend war. Der Poolboy ben√∂tigte morgens ewig, um die Liegest√ºhle herzurrichten, will man mal einen Sonderwunsch wie einen Schirm oder das Verstellen einer Liege, muss man sich auch auf l√§ngere Wartezeiten einrichten. Wir hatten einmal dort zu Mittag gegessen (a la carte) und mussten 1,5 Stunden auf das Essen warten. Als wir abends zum Buffet wollten, sagte man uns, wir sollten sp√§ter wiederkommen, alle Tische seien belegt. Als wir dann sp√§ter wiederkamen, war das Buffet schon fast abgegrast. Wir bekamen zwar noch frisch gebratene Steaks, diese waren allerdings kaum genie√übar, da z√§h. Das Fr√ºhst√ºck war gut und reichhaltig, die Dame an der Eierstation war aber auch nicht von der allerschnellsten Sorte und so waren die Eier meist nicht weich- sondern hartgekocht, auch weil sie zwischendurch √∂fter intensiv mit ihrem Handy besch√§ftigt war. Name: What a visit
Review Content: We thought the Hilton was just wonderful!  They have a great program whereby one lucky guest can become the guest of the day and get complimentary high tea in their room, free sunset drink at the sky bar, light dinner at the executive lounge and free breakfast.  When the wonderful young lady who checked in my wife and I realized we were the guests of the day, she literally did a ‚Äúhappy dance‚Äù in front of us for about 30 seconds.  We were stunned and appreciate of this very personal display of happiness for us. And had she realized it was our 25th wedding anniversary, she would have shared our huge admiration for her welcome.   After that, every other staff member at the Windhoek Hilton went above and beyond to make us feel welcome from the rooms cleaners, the bar staff at the sky bar, to Giovanni at the executive lounge and the concierge who gave us great advice where to explore Windhoek.  Honestly we felt special, very special and we cannot thank the Hilton Windhoek and it‚Äôs special staff enough for the best hotel stay We have ever had in our lives.

Why can‚Äôt hotels prepare the rooms for those whom they know are coming. The restaurant menu is limited if you don‚Äôt want the buffet. The night of the Indian buffet left us a disadvantage! Breakfasts are excellent although the over zealous breakfast supervisors in sashes were a little OTT. No doubt the new expanded Hilton will have increased facilities and lifts that are always working! We were marooned on the 6th floor and were rescued by a housekeeper who took us down in the service lift!

These factors could make or break your stay, but if these do not bother you, you can look forward to an amazing stay, incredible views from the rooftop Sky Bar and the heated pool, whilst the restaurants and buffet breakfast is certainly top class.

Review Content: I enjoyed Namibia to the fullest. It is one country that I will like to visit over and over again. The humanity and hospitality from Namibians is very remarkable. My Stay at the Hilton Honors Namibia was remarkable. The Tourism industry in Namibia is evolving very fast.

Name: Flawless
Review Content: We had a two night stay at the beginning of our vacation in Namibia and an additional night at the end of the trip. Both stays were pleasant.After 24 hours of flying we arrived late in the evening and we're quickly checked in. We had pre-ordered a sandwich and cheese plate and they were delivered to the room a few minutes after we arrived. There was more than enough for two people. All staff members were professional and helpful. The room was clean spacious. The bathroom has an open design with a lot of glass and the only absolute privacy is in the shower and toilet area. This is something to seriously consider if you or your travel partner require/desire privacy.The breakfast buffet selection is incredible and was delicious. The checkout process was fast and the bill was accurate.
Date: Date of stay: August 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Digital reservation not respected. 2 hrs waiting to get an alternative room
Review Content: My digital  reservation was not respected.  Upon arrival at 15:00 the room which I made digital check-in was not available anymore and I has to wait until 17:00 to get an alternative room without being informed properly on the situation.  The internet connection of the Hotel is very bad.  Not possible to work with such internet speed.  Concierge service not friendly

Name: 3rd time to stay @ Hilton Windhoek
Review Content: It has been now 3rd Time staying at Windhoek Hilton within 2 Years !Every Time i travel to Namibia it is the best and easiest place to stay and refresh after long and exhausting Flights !  On the Hotel Top you have the Pool/Gym and a Bar with an amazing View all over Windhoek...... Have your Sundowner up there...You wont regret it! Rooms are clean and es expected as in any other Hilton around the World. Breakfast Buffet is huge! Great Selection from European as well American Cuisine ! You are in the Center of Windhoek from where it is easy to get anywhere from !
Date: Date of stay: June 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Id√©alement situ√©, moderne et √©l√©gant

Il dispose d'un parking privatif et le personnel est accueillant. Deux petits b√©mols : le WiFi est payant et notre chambre avait vue sur un chantier.** La chambreNous avions la chambre de base, la King Guest Room, avec un grand lit double. Spacieuse (environ 30m¬≤) et contemporaine, la chambre dispose de tout le n√©cessaire : fauteuil et table basse, coin bureau avec t√©l√©viseur, salle d'eau compl√®te (lavabo, baignoire, douche √† l'italienne) et wc s√©par√©s. La literie est tr√®s confortable.** Les parties communes : salons, rooftop et piscineL'h√¥tel dispose de nombreux salons spacieux, √©l√©gants et fonctionnels. Le parking privatif dans les sous-sols de l'h√¥tel est un vrai plus. Seul inconv√©nient, il faut prendre un ticket √† chaque entr√©e.Gros coup de coeur pour le Sky Bar et la piscine panoramique sur le toit. La vue sur la capitale est dominante et la nuit, c'est superbe. La ville s'illumine de mille et une lumi√®res et prendre un verre en la contemplant est tr√®s agr√©able. On a beaucoup aim√© !** Le petit-d√©jeunerLe petit-d√©jeuner est tr√®s bien fourni et propose aussi bien des mets locaux qu'internationaux. C'est qualitatif et quantitatif. Il y en a pour tous les go√ªts, que vous soyez plut√¥t sucr√© ou sal√©. Nous n'avons pas test√© le restaurant, nous ne donnerons donc pas d'avis.Le Hilton Windhoek est un h√¥tel id√©alement situ√© et fonctionnel. El√©gant et moderne, il est pratique mais manque un peu d'√¢me. Le bar sur le toit et la piscine panoramique sont un v√©ritable atout d√©tente !

Review Content: Windhoek Hilton is een zeer comfortabel hotel van hoge kwaliteit. Personeel is zeer vriendelijk en service gericht. Kamers zijn goed ingericht en comfortabel. Het hotel is centraal gelegen in Windhoek.

Name: Excellent hotel
Review Content: A great hotel in central Widhoek..great staff and facilities. Breakfast is outstanding & room quality zs good as anywhere. The staff are well trained and polite. The heated pool is worth the visit. I stayed twice & qualify was same on both occasions
Date: Date of stay: June 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Mixed Thoughts
Review Content: As a Lifetime Hilton Diamond member, we were at the Hilton Windhoek twice before and after our tour across Namibia with Ultimate Safaris.  Our experiences between the first and second stay was noticeably different.  The first stay we were in Room 302 and it was not a very good room.  It was a handicapped room and the bathroom corners were dirty.  For the second stay, we were in room 811 and it was noticeably nicer.In room 811, I had a complimentary bottle of wine and in room slippers that I did not have on the first stay.  I'm not sure whether it was because I used points for the first stay and cash and points for the second but the rooms were noticeably different.There is an Executive Lounge on the top floor that serves hot and cold food.  For the first stay, the gentleman there provided great service.  For the second, a lady was there and she wasn't as attentive.  Seating is limited and since all the tables on the first floor were occupied, we had to sit on the 2nd level.  However, for the second stay, the Lounge was quite empty.  You can also help yourself to alcohol at the Lounge.We took a taxi from the airport.  The rate is fixed at 350 NAD.  For the return, Hilton arranged for Hertz to take us to the airport for 341 NAD and you can charge the fare to your room.  It takes about 30-40 minutes to get to/from the airport.In Windhoek, this is considered a luxury hotel but the rooms could use some updating.  Overall, our stay was mediocre.
Date: Date of stay: May 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: The Best Hotel Windhoek has to Offer
Review Content: This is the best hotel in Windhoek in the business district.  The rooms are up to date, clean and comfortable.  The gym is spartan but it works and is nicely located with good view of Windhoek.  The evening rooftop lounge is a wonderful place to relax, shake the dust off and hydrate.  Breakfast is sterling.  Excellent bread and pastries and a wide selection of fresh fruit. They had the typical eggs, meat and other breakfast items.  Lunch time salads in the same restaurant were very tasty.  In all the food is reasonably priced and great for a hotel
Date: Date of stay: November 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Staff needs an overhaul
Review Content: Comfortable beds and great rooftop bar; staff, on the other hand, were totally inattentive, rude and the concierge lacked all knowledge of what to do in Windhoek. Do yourself a favor, stay at the Marriott for the same price and FAR better service.
Date: Date of stay: April 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
