Note that there is no mini refrigerator with drinks,its empety and if you ask for it, they will charge all the drinks that are placed at the time of check out and you are obliged to pay even for the ones you did not consume.
Date: Date of stay: April 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great breakfast, OK Wifi and a leaking rooftop pool
Review Content: Stayed here for one night on a business trip. Had a great sleep given that I was completely jetlagged. Wifi was indeed not the best but manageable. Highlight of the trip, however, was the breakfast which is truly excellent. Overall good hotel - but with one potentially fatal flaw...Despite this being a very good hotel, I strongly urge the management of this place to look straight up and note the gigantic wet stain that can be seen directly below the rooftop swimming pool. Clearly the pool is leaking and I frankly fear for the structural integrity of the roof over time if nothing is done. Hopefully, the hotel staff aren't planning for a remake of the swimming pool scene in "The Mechanic: Resurrection"...However, as the roof held during my stay, I had a very good stay
Date: Date of stay: April 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Wifi
Review Content: I would have classified this hotel as 4 star, but what is supposed to be a business hotel, is let down by poor/non existent wifi. Sorry but in this day and age, this is totally unacceptable. I will be travelling regularly to Windhoek henceforth, but won't stay at this Hilton again.
Date: Date of stay: March 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Sch√∂nes Haus,  schlechter Service.
Review Content: Wir verbrachten die erste und die letzte Nacht unserer Namibia-Rundreise im Hilton Windhoek. Das Haus liegt sehr gut und ist modern gestaltet. Der Check-In verlief beide Male professionell, aber eher unpers√∂nlich und distanziert. Echte Freundlichkeit schaut anders aus - und genau das zieht sich dann wie ein roter Faden quer durch das ganze Haus. Das √ºberrascht umso mehr, als wir Namibia als ein sehr freundliches und herzliches Land kennengelernt haben. Grunds√§tzlich funktioniert alles gut und professionell, allerdings hinterlassen die Mitarbeiter keinen wirklich motivierten und kundenorientierten Eindruck.Die Zimmer waren angenehm gro√ü, sch√∂n eingerichtet und sauber. Nichts au√üergew√∂hnliches, aber guter Hilton-Standard halt. Das Fr√ºhst√ºck war unterdurchschnittlich, sowohl vom Service als auch von der Qualit√§t her. Der Service hinterlie√ü einen √ºberforderten Eindruck.Eine echte Entt√§uschung war die Sky-Bar: die bestellten Burger bzw. Sandwiches waren kalt und die French Fries komplett versalzen. Auf unsere Reklamation hin brachte man uns nach 30 Minuten frische Pommes, diesmal nicht gesalzen daf√ºr aber laff. Dass wir die reklamierten Pommes dann doppelt auf der Rechnung wiederfanden rundete das Bild ab.Wir haben schon viele Hiltons gesehen, aber dieses ist vom Kundenservice und der gebotenen Qualit√§t mit Abstand das schlechteste. By the way: es war auch der schlechteste Service auf der ganzen Rundreise. Echt schade! Die 3 Bewertungspunkte sind sehr wohlwollend und der guten Infrastrukur des Hauses geschuldet.
Date: Date of stay: February 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Exceptional
Review Content: The hotel is very well located and easy to get to. It is quite new and the space is very open and modern. The staff were very friendly with check in and the room was very clean. The rooftop pool is quite nice although the weather did not cooperate with us. The bar as well has a nice view of the city. We had breakfast included in our stay and the restaurant was very nice. The buffet had numerous hot and cold options which were all very delicious. Would definitely recommend staying here in Windhoek if here for business or pleasure. It was a very nice way to end our Namibian self-drive road trip with some pampering.
Date: Date of stay: February 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Not up to par for an international top brand
Review Content: We stayed at the Hilton twice, once arriving in Namibia and the night prior to departure. To say the least, we would have expected more from a hotel of this reputation and size.The rooms are spacious and nicely designed but not well maintained.Doors need to be slammed shut for the locks to close.The staff was very friendly, the concierge took care of dinner bookings and transportation which was super helpful, yet compared with other hotels we visited in Namibia - and rated recently- we wouldn't do any other place justice if we gave the Hilton more than three stars. There is too much to do.
Date: Date of stay: November 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hilton at its best
Review Content: I chose Hilton as starting point of my Namibia trip and it was the right choice after the 20 hrs flight from Europe.Room - I had an executive suite in the 7th floor, spacious, clean, nice view, all necessary amenities available. Strong wifi, comfy bed, the bad was with shower and tun, strong hot water.Reception, check-in: top-notch and very helpful - exactly what you would expect in this category. I arrived at 6 pm and was urgently looking for a grocery shop - the receptionist inquired promptly if there is one still open, where and how to get there.Restaurant - good variety of meals, for dinner it is either a la carte or buffet. Parking - if you are first time driving a 4x4 it is a bit difficult to navigate inside as the parking is built for standard 2x4. How to get there - when I was there, the Rev Michael Scott St was under construction so we had to drive through the Himba market on the Independence Avenue to get into the parking deck.Location - CBD, close to many shops, grocery shops, the Christ church, gas station on the Independence Avenue when driving towards Rehoboth. Safe neighborhood
Date: Date of stay: September 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Wow!
Review Content: Fantastic hotel, fantastic service, fantastic food!! In the heart of Windhoek, very centrally located. Roof top bar with most fantastic sunset views over the city! Will most definitely be back! Night light in toilet means you don't need to switch on lights at night and battling to get back to sleep. FIRST hotel ever I have been to where there is a conveniently located plug next to bed for phone or laptop charging. Enough light at bathroom mirror for ladies to make up with even a make up mirror. Room standard with ironing board and iron and hair dryer! Beautiful views from room.

Das Personal an der Rezeption ist sehr freundlich und aufmerksam. Bis auf wenige Ausnahmen ist das Personal generell sehr nett.

Name: Top Hotel

Einzig einen Punkt Abzug, da man an der ein oder anderen Stelle sieht, dass nicht immer zu 100 % M√§ngel behoben werden (z.B.fleckige Teppichb√∂den). Dies w√§re in anderen Hilton Hotels in anderen L√§ndern definitiv nicht so. Insgesamt w√ºrden wir aber das Hotel wieder buchen.
Date: Date of stay: September 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Ok, but not more...
Review Content: If you go to Namibia then try get out of Windhoek ASAP! Windhoek is quite an ugly city and there is really nothing to do! It is difficult to even stay at a good hotel. As we had to spend 3 days in Windhoek, we decided to spend 2 nights at Hilton (cause we thought that might be one of the only places that are acceptable). Even that it was ok there (clean, food was ok, service was good) don't expect it to be on a European or similar standard... Quite funny clientele (we had the feeling local people were hanging around by the pool, even staff and some funny arrangements)! Unfortunately it is totally overpriced for that quality, means the sky bar, restaurants, wifi and even a simple bottle of water. I'm sure the room cleaner took 20‚Ç¨ out my purse when we've been at breakfast. She left the 50‚Ç¨ in it, maybe so that I don't notice (so please make sure you use the safe there!!!). All in all the stay was acceptable, but we've been to other places in South Africa or other countries for less money and a way better experience. The atmosphere at Hilton Windhoek is cold and more of a business hotel (where you PAY for the wifi!). I don't think I would go back there, but to be honest I wouldn't even come back to Windhoek.... On the other hand, if you have to spend a night in Windhoek then the Hilton might still be one of the only options.
Date: Date of stay: August 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Amazing hotel
Review Content: Probably one of the best in Windhoek, we had such a good experience. The price x benefits is really good and compared to hotel Hiltons this one has the nicest staff I've ever seen among the chain. Internet fairly good and the pool in the rooftop is amazing.
Date: Date of stay: July 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great city stopover
Review Content: Stayed here twice - One night at the start and one night at the end of a two week trip across Namibia. Both times check-in was fast and pleasant - very friendly staff who remembered us when we returned. Rooms are very clean, Wifi was good (for Namibia) and enjoyed our stay.The breakfasts are excellent and all that you would expect. We dined both times in the restaurant, which was very good - buffet style but great choices and very good staff service.Will happily return
Date: Date of stay: July 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: lovely hotel
Review Content: The roof top bar is great and there are out door heaters too as it was a bit chilly at night. The bedroom was lovely apart from the open plan bathroom which was awkward for a grown up family.The breakfast buffet is excellent. When we arrived late at night we were offered parking outside by an odd man and told to buy a ticket from a shop. However at reception we were told this was unsafe and should park in the hotels  underground car park which we did.

Review Content: Visit this hotel for work but enjoyed a weeks stay. The roof top pool and bar were amazing lining across the whole of windhoek to the mountains. The restaurant had fantastic food doing a different style buffet every night.  Would highly recommend.

Name: Great African hospitality
Review Content: I arrived the Hilton Windhoek around 11 pm after a long flight feeling tired and in a sullen mood.However as soon as I alighted from the bus, I was met with a  cheery welcome from the doorman and this started to lighten my mood.Claudia who attended to me at the reception desk brightened it further by her quick and efficient check in and her friendly countenance.I was impressed with this hotel. A gleaming modern structure with contemporary decor and kept sparkling clean.The rooms were well appointed and roomy.What I didn't quite like was the bed. It was too springy.That,and the bath that was open to all without privacy.The restaurant served varieties of dishes local and international and  they were quite a delight to taste.The staff attended to you promptly and courteously.Indeed what stuck me most about the hotel was  the attitude of staff.They were friendly and welcoming and in the true African tradition ,not only greeted you but asked  after your health and wether you were enjoying your stay.In some other places I had visited you were only entitled to a curt ' good morning ' or a nod.However, it was Gabriel the concierge who embodied the true African spirit.I had forgotten my phone in the taxi that had dropped me one evening. When I related the incidence to him,he went out of his way to trace and locate the taxi and had the driver bring back my phone to the hotel in no short time.If ever life's journey brings me back to these parts again,I will head straight to the warm embrace and hospitality of Hilton Windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: June 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Yet again, excellent
Review Content: I am possibly prejudiced as I have stayed in this hotel a few times before but it is one of the best Hiltons in Africa. Better than home, as someone makes my bed and cleans the room very well. Facilities are excellent, staff are always courteous and helpful. I will return
Date: Date of stay: April 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Just the one night
Review Content: Good location, rooms very nicely laid out, friendly and efficient check in, excellent breakfast, great views from the sky bar and pool deck. Coffee in the room horrible, why does a 5 star hotel give you a sachet of bog standard Nescafe
Date: Date of stay: May 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hilton Windhoek TOPS
Review Content: This is a must stay if you want EXCELLENT staff and service. The staff really go out of their way to make you feel special. The food at the restaurant is of high quality and prepared fresh. the best was that I could go into the kitchen and help making my own pizza. Awesome.
Date: Date of stay: May 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good hotel
Review Content: Well positioned hotel,good location 30 min from airport The room is well equipped but Internet was poor,staff were very helpful and friendly.Breakfast lunch and dinner were excellent with a varied choice.Lesuire facilities were very good and the roof top bar is invitng for the evening with a  view over the city.The city is a very safe place to walk round alone Would recommend this hotel
Date: Date of stay: March 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Courtesy, courtesy, courtesy and more courtesy!
Review Content: Great location. Very clean and comfortable room. Staff very courteous; 'Make it Right' policy being applied. Had an early start one morning, requested breakfast in bed between 06h00 and 06h30, and it was brought to room on time. Enjoyed some sundowners while reading a book on rooftop. Was later joined by some new friends who were staying somewhere else. Will definitely be going back.Not advised that cab fare charged per trip or per person. Shared a cab with some new friends and were all shocked when driver requested ridiculous amount! Negotiate before jumping in! Rooftop restroom quite messy.
Date: Date of stay: March 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: REALLY BEAUTIFUL
Review Content: You will enjoy the decoration. Those white lights , I HOPE IT WAS NOT JUST BECAUSE OF THE FESTIVE SEASON.I enjoyed the lift. In most of the hotel , the lift is usually sad. someone feel alone. But because the hotel lift is transparent and out of the wall.The design of the rooms are very original with communication between the bath rooms and the room. The hotel can equally organize pick up by taxis and charge to your room. The hotel can make  a take away for your breakfast if you wish to leave earlier. Being a HHONOURS member gives you advantages. The reason why I did not rate the hotel excellent is because of the weakness in terms of business centers. You can not easily do scanners, and printing if you would like to do some kind of personal administration. When you are many, pay equally attention not to get your luggage mixed as it could take time to get it  in your room.
Date: Date of stay: December 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great location, poor value for money, Banquet staff need to be trained
Review Content: the food was average, lots of very laid back staff who like to stand around all day. Drivers openly touting for off bill fares, while standing at the concierge counter, no less. Housekeeping standards were good and the rooftop bar has the best views of the city
Date: Date of stay: February 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Best place to stay
Review Content: I had a good service from Elize Swaartz and her team. She was available to help and solve any problems we had every time. The went above and beyond to make our stay memorable. If you ever in Windhoek, Namibia. Stay at the Hilton and you won't be disappointed. Safe and clean. Ask for Elize Swaartz and she will make sure you enjoy your stay. The security supervisor Jacky was also the best. He made sure we were safe every where went.
Date: Date of stay: October 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Accommodation
Review Content: My accommodation was great! Support members drastically improved their customer service skills. They were patience and attentive with clear communication skills. The hotel room was clean. The overall service was satisfactory! It is essential for continuous improvement for better quality assurance.
Date: Date of stay: January 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Deceptive advertising
Review Content: Hilton proudly advertises live jazz entertainment on Thursdays. Hence, we enthusiastically arranged our schedule to fit this in. We tried several times to call for confirmation--always busy signal. Got a taxi that took us there, but no jazz. The barman in Kalabar did not know when or if jazz might resume, but there sure was none that evening. I checked with Guest Relations, where the staff member had no clue. I do understand that sometimes plans change, but what annoyed me was that  neither of these gentlemen saw any problem whatsoever with advertising an activity that does not take place.
Date: Date of stay: January 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Excellent Location
Review Content: The hotel was a perfect base for the beginning and end of our trip to Namibia. The staff was courteous and helpful, the suite very nice after a long journey, and the food was very good. Both stays were great. They took excellent care to safely secure valuable items. We would definitely stay here again.
Date: Date of stay: September 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Business trip to Windhoek
Review Content: Well maintained hotel, with courteous staff. Dining area was well maintained with well thought menu items. Breakfast options were excellent and service for dining was excellent as well. I very much enjoyed my stay.
Date: Date of stay: November 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Exquisite Accommodations and Great Location
Review Content: Hilton is the Premiere and Best Hotel in Windhoek. Luxury rooms, good restaurants, excellent personnel. The only issue we had was the upper management.They did not honor their original deal with us. If you are staying longer than a week make a deal to receive food, internet, laundry included in your room price.
Date: Date of stay: November 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great hotel, pity about wi-fi
Review Content: I stayed here while on a business trip in Windhoek.The hotel offers comfortable, clean rooms and a good buffet breakfast. There is a skybar with beautiful expansive views over Windhoek with a gym and a few eateries on the premises. The hotel is conveniently situated within walking distance from a small shopping mall and banks.The only negative was the wi-fi in rooms; it took numerous tries to sort it out and offered unstable coverage.
Date: Date of stay: November 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice Hotel
Review Content: Designed a little different than your typical Hilton. Clean, comfortable and good service. The Restaurant was good food and service as well. For dinner they set up a buffet and you could choose the protein you wanted.  You could either have the chef prepare it or you could cook it yourself.  Kind of neat I guess. Gives a traveler something to do.
Date: Date of stay: October 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Perfectly pleasant
Review Content: Perfectly nice. As expected really of a new, massive Hilton hotel. Roof bar nice but views not amazing. You will see much better views elsewhere in Namibia. Standout feature are the staff who were very helpful.
Date: Date of stay: September 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Awesome rooms great location and the very close casino
Review Content: This hotel gets as better as it gets in Africa.The rooms are huge, but the bathrooms are juts gorgeous and amazing.Huge bathrooms with separate toilet shower and bath tub area with a nice sink area.The room has  nice study area where you can sit and do your office work.Bed is also good in size and in any case more than enough if you are travelling alone.the restaurants are very nice and they even make something special for you in case you are a veggieat the only thing i didn't like was they charged the food they prepared very high although it was juts a portion of fried rice.The best part is the casino which is almost practically in the hotel building.i spent my maximum time there.Location is great almost city centre with a many shops and eateries within walking distance

Name: buon servizio con confort di prima classe
Review Content: Buon servizio, ottimi confort con piscina e fitness aperti 24/7. Da migliorare la connettivit√† internet nelle stanze, bene invece nella lobby e nelle zone comuni. Buono il ristorante e ottima la colazione

Name: Lovely hotel but fraught with shortcomings
Review Content: This is one of those hotels that looks really nice and is a stand out in Windhoek CBD.  But up close you can see all of the problems--the staff does not seem to know what to do half the time, the internet was so slow I could not even do research on the web, towels and sheets late (they seem to have a perennial shortage of these and have to wash them first), and one of the most ignorant concierge teams ever encountered.  On the pro side: very nice rooms, excellent location, and dinner buffet at their restaurant was a great bang for my buck. I stayed a total of four nights last week and would think very carefully about coming back here to stay.
Date: Date of stay: August 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: luxe voor de safari
Review Content: Geboekt met airmiles aan het begin en het einde van onze safari. De eerste nacht hadden we een executive room. Enigszins gedateerde inrichting. prachtig uitzicht vanaf de 8ste etage. Gebruikt van wat extra faciliteiten in het hotel waren inbegrepen. Echter het eten wat werd geserveerd heeft waarschijnlijk een hele dag gestaan. De kazen waren behoorlijk uitgedroogd. Tweede nacht als afsluiting van de safari hadden we een deluxe kamer. Qua inrichting veel beter, retro thema. Ontbijt zeer uitgebreid echter jammer dat dit pas vanaf 7:00 kan.Skybar 9e etage, erg aangenaam bij warm weer, ook als je niet verblijft in het Hotel met spectaculaire zonsondergang.
Date: Date of stay: July 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Luxurious but very noisy
Review Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hilton Windhoek for two nights at the end of a safari trip to Namibia. The hotel is very new and clean. The rooms and bathrooms are huge and beautiful, with a very modern and trendy design. The breakfast is not free but is worth the price, being much more extensive than your typical continental breakfast and including fresh, custom-made juices. The rooftop pool is heated and you get a great view of Windhoek. There are some issues, however. Although Wi-Fi is free in the lobby, you have to pay approximately $15 US for Wi-Fi in your room per day. Despite charging this amount, the Wi-Fi is painfully slow. You may be able to check e-mail, but you will not be able to use Skype for example. Also, DO NOT accept a room on the first floor as we did. There is a bar/nightclub on the mezzanine level directly below and you will hear music in your room well into the night, disrupting your sleep. On our last night, we had to wake up very early in the morning to catch a flight and as a result we had almost no sleep due to the noise.
Date: Date of stay: June 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: World Class Hotel
Review Content: Great stay. Super friendly and efficient staff overall. Sushi bar chef was knowledgable and incredibly affable. Look forward to my next stay in this hotel. Internet speed and connectivity issues were rather frustrating  however. HHonours loyalty program is a must!
Date: Date of stay: May 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Sch√∂nes Ambiente
Review Content: Das mitten in Windhouk gelegene Hilton ist ein sehr sch√∂nes Hotel mit sehr freundlichem Personal und einer sehr sch√∂nen Dachterasse mit Pool. Da sich ebenfalls eine Bar dort oben bedindet kann man den herrlichen Sundowner mit einem fantastischen Blick genie√üen. Absolut empfehlenswert.
Date: Date of stay: April 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A Good Choice
Review Content: I stayed at this hotel my final night in Namibia after nine days out in the Bush.  I had stayed in a guesthouse (bed and breakfast) the prior time and I wanted to try a hotel instead. I was generally pleased with the Hilton.  It is fairly new and looks it.  It is large, so it has a lot of facilities.  My room was very large.  The bathroom was large and very functional.  The staff was friendly.  The location is good as far as things to do in Windhoek but is distant from the airport.  I would consider staying here again.  I liked it better than a guesthouse.  The only negatives were that the hotel charges for internet in one's room, which really annoys me.  In this day and age, internet should be free to guests.  Also, I asked for a wake up call and the call never came.  Fortunately, I woke up anyway.  If I would have slept in and missed my flight, I would have been very upset.
Date: Date of stay: April 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Namibia Capital
Review Content: Excellent position, close to city centre, well appointed rooms - typical of Hilton Hotels. Lovely views over Windhoek. Excellent breakfast. Room maintenance needs attention - black mould growth in shower. UNBELIEVABLE - no decaf cappuccino, and normal cappuccino is of instant type in hotel lounge!! All-in-all excellent hotel to stay.
Date: Date of stay: March 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: sehr gutes Hotel in zentraler Lage
Review Content: Das Hilton in Windhoek ist gut organisiert. Das Personal vermittelt einen gute Ausbildung und ist um den Gast bem√ºht. Die Preisgestaltung  ist in Afrika immer fragw√ºrdig, niedrige Lohnkosten, niedrigere Baukosten, selbe Preise wie in Europa. Aber es erwartet den Gast gutes Personal, sehr gutes Fr√ºhst√ºck und eine zentrale Lage.

Name: Great hotel, ideal location, fair price.
Review Content: Great hotel, spotless, ideal location, friendly staff, fair price. Convenient to many of the sights in town, including the German church and new liberation museum. Lovely little rooftop pool with view and bar. Would definitely stay there again.
Date: Date of stay: February 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good
Review Content: This hotel offers very pretty rooms and facilities.The service of the hotel has room for improvement though- NOT be misunderstood as meaning that service was poor: the staff was very friendly and helpful, but a bit disorganisedI would defineret stay there again, and would recommend it!The pool was very nice, too;)

Name: A good place to stay
Review Content: Everything was fine with this hotel, except the internet.  The rooftop bar and pool area is particularly alive and fun.  The location in downtown Windhoek is convenient for the overnight traveler, flying out the next morning.
Date: Date of stay: January 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Zentrale Lage in Windhoek
Review Content: Das Hilton liegt zentral an der Haupteinkaufsstrasse von Windhoek. Man kann von hier aus alles zu Fu√ü unternehmen. Allerdings wird derzeit um das Hotel gebaut, aber im Hotel selbst merkt man nichts davon. Das Personal ist sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit. Die Zimmer modern, etwas unpers√∂nlich, eingerichtet. Ein typisches Business-Hotel. Auf dem Dach befindet sich eine sehr sch√∂ne Roof Top Bar mit herrlichem Blick √ºber Windhoek (bietet sich f√ºr Sundowner an). Hier befindet sich auch der Swimmingpool mit Liegen, Sonnenschirmen und Lounge M√∂beln.Das Fr√ºhst√ºck ist reichhaltig und gut. Allerdings zwischen 8 und 9 Uhr etwas laut und hektisch, da dann sehr viele Gesch√§ftsleute fr√ºhst√ºcken. Eventuell kann es zu Platzproblemen kommenund der Service kommt nicht mehr mit dem Auff√ºllen des Buffets nach.

Name: What a massive turnaround. Fantastic Service
Review Content: My first 2 visits to the Hilton were an absolute nightmare. This is however no longer the case. With my last few visits, the service improved significantly and the efficiency and friendliness of the Staff was phenomenal. I commend the Hilton Hotel Windhoek for the changes they have made. I would also like to mention one of their Reception Staff, Aubrey. This young man is very efficient and a true ambassador of the Hilton brand name. Thank You for the massive service improvement and you will definitely see me there. For any visiting guests, try their Sushi bar... The sushi there is one of my top 2 I have ever tasted. Wesley is a fantastic Sushi Chef. Well done !!! and keep it up because I will hold you up to the high standard you have set.
Date: Date of stay: November 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hilton Windhoek - the place to stay
Review Content: The Hilton Windhoek is the place to stay when you are visiting Windhoek. You will be greated by very friendly staff, who are happy to assist when asked. The rooms are very luxurious and offers great views of the city! The rooftop bar is an excellent place to unwind, catch some sun and have an afternoon drink. Just incase you need pampering, the spa facility provides that too!  For the travellers who still need a workout, there is a state of the art gym, that will help you keep in shape, and lap pool too.
Date: Date of stay: November 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Clean and convenient
Review Content: Stayed here when we arrived on our way to the Namibian desert.  Convenient, quiet, clean, one of the best hotels in the city.   Nice bar and good food for breakfast.  Typical Hilton with helpful staff and quiet rooms.
Date: Date of stay: September 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Ultra Modern
Review Content: What a surprise to find this ultra modern hotel in the middle of Namibia!  The rooms are all understated elegance and the public spaces invite lingering.  We only had breakfast here; the food and selection was great, but the staff seemed a little distracted and not too attentive.  Maybe it was the day......
Date: Date of stay: September 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Classy Hotel in Windhoek
Review Content: The Windhoek Hilton is a shining beacon in Windhoeks hotel wasteland, standing head and shoulders above its peers.The rooms are superb, with comfortable beds ideal for the weary business traveller in search of a good night‚Äôs rest.  The room are exactly what you would expect from any top international hotel: spacious, clean and modern. The other hotel facilities are equally worth mentioning. The pool deck on the 9th floor (and overlooks the whole of Windhoek) is a must see ‚Äì even if you aren‚Äôt staying at the hotel. The hotel staff have a single mission ‚Äì to serve. And they do it well. The reception team phoned a number of restaurants and bars at 11pm on our behalf in an attempt to help us enjoy a good night out (Windhoek, being the city it is, was less obliging). The few negatives of our stay included the hotel bar not being open at 11pm, the 24 hour wifi pass which actually means ‚Äúaccess until 7am‚Äù and the fitness centre which half heartedly catered for weight‚Äôs enthusiasts.
Date: Date of stay: September 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great for a one night stay
Review Content: I stayed here with my 2 kids on our way up to Etosha. The hotel is well placed on the road from the airport but was a bit tricky to get into as there were roadworks and we had to drive around to get to the entrance. The room was very well appointed, the bedding was of an excellent quality and the bathroom beautiful, large bath and large shower. The items in the bar fridge were expensive and wifi was as at an exorbitant charge, far lesser and cheaper hotels offer wifi for free so this was a surprise. I did not get breakfast included as apparently if you book online this option is then not included I was told on arrival, a pity as the breakfast then became a very expensive buffet option so we did not eat there on leaving. Visit the top floor as the view is well worth the visit and the pool was heated, had we know we would have had a swim on arrival.
Date: Date of stay: August 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hilton Hotel Windhoek
Review Content: Generally speaking hotel B&B accommodation in Windhoek is expensive and not to an exceptional quality. The Hilton Hotel far-and away breaks with this mold and is an extremely high quality established, comparable to any high class establishment in any major City of the world. Well done and keep up the high standards you have set.
Date: Date of stay: August 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Windhoek wildly wonderfull Hilton
Review Content: Great all round service facilities and stay.  At this price, I just think that wifi can be free. Perfect location if you are in Windhoek for business.  Most friendly staff. Lovely room with a variety of items in the bar fridge.  LOVE the rooftop bar, just a little bit too over prized.
Date: Date of stay: July 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Survey of Windhoek
Review Content: Best hotel in Windhoek Convenient to shopping and restaurants Hotel staff will help you find points of interest and driving directions.Food in restaurant was great as well as reasonable priced I will stay at this Hilton property next year when I return and commute on to the Estosha pan
Date: Date of stay: June 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Surprisingly Good
Review Content: Before landing in Windhoek I have been reading set of comments from different sites about Hilton Hotel. There were not always positive. Since I intended to stay only two nights I decided that location is the most important factor.To my surprise it was excellent choice. Yes, location was perfect but not only. Rooms are newly refurbished, clean and pleasant, breakfast very good and staff very helpful and competent. Representative of travel agency has organized all our requests for sightseeing and travel around in no time, professionally and efficiently. Thanks to that we have got very good impression about our staying there.
Date: Date of stay: April 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Oasis of impeccable service
Review Content: Stayed for a week on business.All staff were polite, efficient, and went out of their way to assist you.  Even the trainees were excellent and the concierge even helped setup a game drive for our day off (Oka Puka lodge).Rooms was spacious (rain shower is amazing).  And room service and cleaning was excellent.If there was anything to complain about, it might be that hotel restaurant service was a little inattentive, but judging from other Windhoek restaurants, it's the norm.Definitely the Sky bar on 9th floor was one of the top attractions with incredible views of Windhoek.Highly recommended for business.
Date: Date of stay: April 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: QUALITY
Review Content: quality service is the secrecy of sucess. this time i bacame very upset with most of the services in this hotel. service improvemente. service improvemente. service improvemente. service improvemente. service improvemente. service improvemente. service improvemente. service improvemente. service improvemente. service improvemente.
Date: Date of stay: April 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Single night in Hilton
Review Content: Spent a single night here on my arrival into the country. Even as just a Gold HHonors member I was given club access and treated well. The hotel is smaller than most Hiltons, but appropriate for the location I am sure. It is centrally located and easy to access from the airport. The car rental agency in the lobby is very useful if you get there and realize later that driving is easy. The service was very good as well, with everyone friendly and kind to all the visitors. The pool is small and more of a single lap pool about 25 meters long. The food offerings in the lounge on the top floor were very good and from the restaurant, although there were not many choices it was more than sufficient. I had plenty of hot water and no broken items. Very comfortable room with a nice view. Quite a few TV options and decent speed internet to wind down from a long day of flying. Internet is free for status level, but as is typical for all high end Hilton hotels, it is not free for everyone. The one thing I would improve though is it would be nice to have free wifi in the lobby, as the airport has few flights and it would be nice to wait in the lobby rather than at the airport after checkout. I would not hesitate to return here again if I am back in Namibia.
Date: Date of stay: February 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Beautiful Hotel
Review Content: The hotel is beautiful on the inside and the rooms are well appointed. The hotel is right next to the center of the city. The Sky pool is wonderful and offers a wonderful view of the city. The executive lounge is one of the best I've seen in a Hilton.
Date: Date of stay: February 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good hotel - poor service and exorbitant internet charges
Review Content: Fantastic hotel with great rooms and convenient location. Very good for business trips. New and modern feel.  Improvements required: 1. Hotel staff service levels need to be improved 2. Charging for internet is crazy and then per device is insane!!!
Date: Date of stay: January 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: new hotel in town
Review Content: it was the last night we stayed here before we flew home from our namibia trip. Very nice hotel and new hotel, very modern. Excellent location in the city centre of Windhoek - close to restaurants, mall, bars and main tourist attraction. it is safe to walk everywhere. the skybar and pool on the 9th floor are great and it is wonderful to relax up there. the service at the sky bar needs improving though - unfriendly and slow. there is also a very good fitness centre and a small spa. The restaurant and bar on the mezzanine are great - food is very good and service friendly and prompt. especially the terrace on the sports bar is great to lounge and relax. the breakfast was outstanding and what you expect from a Hilton Hotel. there is a underground car park, too. you need to pay for WIFI which we found odd, but it was in most hotels or lodges in namibia.
Date: Date of stay: December 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hilton windhoek
Review Content: excelent hotel. very friendly and helpfull staff and a very good price. they also gave us a nice special gift for our wedding aniversary when we checked in. i will definitely be booking at and recommmend the hilton again.
Date: Date of stay: December 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: They should have told us staff were on strike!!
Review Content: This is one of better Hilton Hotels and i am a hiltons member so they knew my email address.  So you. An imagine my surprise when i got there to find a full strike on by staff!!! The people who were on duty really tried so congratulations to those overworked staff members.  Worst part!! They had locked me out of my room and could not open it for 1 hour, plus they FORGOT TO CLEAN MY ROOM, plus rooftop restaurant was closed and trying to get any service was a real challenge, and a computer system that did not work.BEST PART.  The lovely rooms and amazing staff.  Hilton please pay them an extra bonus and credit for putting up with all the angry and frustrated guests with a big smile.Overall have always had very good experiences which is why this is poor not terrible.
Date: Date of stay: November 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Impressive hotel
Review Content: I really enjoyed staying in this hotel. It is of excellent quality and the service was good. It's definitely the best hotel in Windhoek.I have travelled a fair amount in Africa and this is one of the best.The Executive Lounge was of high standard and the Sky Bar on top of the hotel had some great views.  The room I stayed in was quiet, and the internet connection was good. All round a very good stay.
Date: Date of stay: October 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Excellent Hotel
Review Content: Stayed 2 nights.Very nice staff, clean rooms and a great Rooftop Pool with a fair priced Bar :)staff very helpful in all maters, would definitly stay there again!The only thing I didn't like was non free wifi, but thats Hilton standard unfortunately =(
Date: Date of stay: February 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A really nice place to stay
Review Content: A business trip to Namibia saw us at the Hilton Windhoek and we were pleasantly surprised at how good this property was.  Rooms were very good and spacious with comfortable bed.  Kind of strange bathroom arrangement with lots of glass used.  Too much to be frank.  Not a fan of the current fad (please let it not be a trend) of open plan bedroom/bathroom combinations.  Call me old fashion but I prefer a little privacy when showering..... That aside though the room was nice.  The roof top bath was fabulous, although a little breezy, but a top place for an afternoon drink and it comes free with a view of the fabulous African sunset.Ate twice in the restaurant and on both occasions the food and service were first class.
Date: Date of stay: August 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hilton Windhoek
Review Content: Well located hotel, with excellent staff overall. I was disappointed though at check-in that the person who checked us in did not acknowledge our membership of the Honours program and did not inform us of the benefits due to us because of the room we booked. This, however, pales into insignificance when the overall service of the staff at the hotel is considered. Had an excellent stay and could definately iuse this hotel again.
Date: Date of stay: August 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: great rooms - solicitous staff - wonderful sky bar
Review Content: We bookended our travels in Namibia with stays at the Windhoek Hilton - centrally located in the city.  Both times, we really enjoyed the comfortable, generous rooms (great beds and amenities) and were well taken care of by the solicitous and friendly staff.A visit to the Sky Bar, overlooking the lights of the city, is a fine way to end the day.  The cocktails are excellent and one feels on top of the world.  We also enjoyed the Executive Lounge with its fine coffee and pastries.  When in Windhoek, the Hilton will be our place to stay.
Date: Date of stay: August 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: New is not always better - very noicy
Review Content: Consider alternatives as well. I have stated at Hilton Windhoek a number if times. Rooms are not sound proof The design of building emphasise late night nouces from coffee shop on ground floor Better to choose room to the west of buildinf those close to entrance is very noicy. Horel frequented by many fireign tourists who stay up late and with little or no regard to other hotel guests. My room did not have laundry bag or extra blankets.
Date: Date of stay: July 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Excellent Stay !
Review Content: The Hotel offers excellent service. Food is great and staff is very friendly and helpful.  I really enjoyed my stay.  Rooms are well equipped and the restaurants are spectacular with excellent food choice.
Date: Date of stay: June 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Not the Hilton service expected very poor impression!!!
Review Content: First, to give credit where it is due, the hotel is reasonably clean and located central in Windhoek, the hotel rooms are ok (though some of our bathroom fixtures were broken) and the overall hotel atmosphere is fine.  As the hotel is now two years old I thought the staff would be better trained. What was unacceptable was we made a booking directly with the hotel on the same day as arriving which was on a public holiday. The lady who answered the phone said they can not take any bookings , I asked if they were full and she said no they can't take any bookings even for tonight as the bookings staff were away for the public holiday . I asked if I could book with the front desk and she reluctantly put me through. I made a booking with the front desk agent, a gentleman who gave me an agreed rate .Upon arriving the Duty manager said I could not get my rate as booked because it had to go through her even though the gentleman taking my booking said he checked with Management for my best rate. So she, the duty manager up my agreed rate by 15% which we accepted after a long drive. (We felt cheated.)After checking in we ventured to the full rooftop cocktail bar on the roof and found it took 20 mins to order a drink then another 10 mins to receive it. We saw the lady taking the pool side orders was also helping make the drinks with the barman. They are certainly understaffed in this area to provide service one would expect from this hotel. I don't mind paying for drinks at high prices though the prices charged were outrageous for poor service.The same day, the room service order was very late and we got a call to say that they were delayed . When the food arrived we could not eat half of the dishes , no care or passion was delivered in the preparation and it seemed that the menu's recipes weren't followed. The poorly cooked and flavourless food was sent back and management refunded our bill on the unconsumed orders - no questions asked.   The breakfast buffet was pleasant though trying to get one of our waitresses attention was very difficult as she was wearing headphones and listening to music and and couldn't hear us for attention. Overall I think the hotel has a long way to come in service and quality . There are excellent boutique hotels and short stay pensions in Windhoek and Namibia that would make a much better choice currently.
Date: Date of stay: May 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: From Great to no-good in no time
Review Content: After frequenting and testing most of the "worthwhile" hotels in Windhoek, my wife and I called this our "home-away-from-home" in Namibia.  We have stayed at this hotel every time we visited Windhoek over the last two years+. Apart from the average service in the restaurant, everything else was superb.  Our last visit in April 2013, was a nightmare. everything from mini bar to general amenities and the parking pay system were wrong.  Gown and slippers provided for only one person where they knew we were a couple. We showered with cold water for the first day. The bed turndown was done on some nights, on others not.  We were some days required to call for room cleaning.   Arriving at breakfast one hour before closing leaves you with very little choice on the buffet.  I am normally the critiquing party, but this time my wife was soooo upset with the poor performance that she insisted we don't go back there again.  After numerous complaints management tried to make up with a cheese and wine platter, which almost helped us to forgive them. The very last straw was when a service staff member bursted into our room at 06:00 whilst we were still soundly asleep. This is so sad because finding good service in Windhoek in general is an issue.  I hate to think that I have to go back to Namibia and start scouting for a new hotel again!!!!
Date: Date of stay: April 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: FANtastic....... Period.
Review Content: Thats all I can say to describe this hotel.Booked adjoining double rooms ( Family rooms )Staff went out of thier way to accomate our family off 4, Friendly and ever helpfulRooms are beautiful, modern and fuctional. great decor and layout, glass and mirrors through out.lovely roof top pool and bar, an excellent cooling off area, after sunset.Beds where a bit too high off the ground and the key card failed a couple of times BUT these where no biggies.Warning, Area regarded as rife in ATM pick-pocketting. The Hilton security was ever present to escort us to the ATM that was just a few minutes walk away. great guys, thanks for going the extra mileOverall great place.
Date: Date of stay: March 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Almost there
Review Content: An excellent hotel with a high standard of accommodation, mostly excellent staff who are most helpful and a good quality of cuisine. What does let it down is the attitude of some staff. My luggage went missing en route from the UK and I asked for some toiletries, mainly a razor and foam. After repeated promises over a period of 5 hours I went out to a supermarket and bought the items I had requested. The only detraction from awarding 5*
Date: Date of stay: March 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Doesn't quite meet the expectations that the company creates
Review Content: Overall, the appearance and facilities are good at the hotel.  Our room was large and comfortable and the pool and bar are very pleasant.  However, it is part of the Hilton chain of hotels and is llisted as 5 star; regardless of where it is, the expectation is that it will deliver the same standards.  The restaurant was a massive disappointment - the vegetarian food was truly awful and I don't expect to find a buffet bar for salads etc in a hotel of this class.We were also woken up at 6 in the morning by an incredible noise coming from the plumbing system in a neighbouring room.The staff were all very pleasant but the service was a little haphazard.  For example, there were no towels or ashtrays at the pool on one occasion despite the fact that there were plenty of staff and 'managers' around and when we asked for a towel, the staff member went off to get some and didn't come back.The fact that they charge a lot for wifi access and then restrict the access to a single machine is inexcusable in this day & age.  We stayed at plenty of smaller, locally owned hotels & B&Bs in Namibia where internet access was free.I'm sure that if we had been staying in an independent hotel these little glitches would have been acceptable but a huge chain like Hilton that trades on its name should live up to the expectations it creates.  The problem is that if you want to stay centrally in Windhoek there isn't a huge amount of choice and I suspect that the choice will reduce even more with the Hilton there.  I would ceratinly try to find an independent, locally owned, hotel if I go back to Windhoek - at least the money stays in the country that way.
Date: Date of stay: February 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nicest place in Windhoek
Review Content: Great service + staff. Very helpful. The restaurant is brilliant (managers gave special attention to ensure everything was up to par. Great breakfast buffet and brilliant evening cocktails on the roof top bar. I especially recommend their martinis. A fantastic view of Windhoek's spectacular sunsets! Highly recommend this hotel for travelers looking for a more posh Namibia experience. Within walking distance to many nice German fusion style restaurants. I loved staying here and did not want to leave!
Date: Date of stay: June 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A great place to wash the sand out of your hair!
Review Content: We stayed in the Hilton on our last night in Namibia. We had travelled for 14 days and came from the Namib desert-covered in sand and full of wonderful impressions. This was a great hotel to scrub up before a long haul flight back to Europe and to let all the impressions sink in. We spent the afternoon on the rooftop bar, enjoying the view and the wine and one last Namibian sunset. We were too tired to head out for dinner so we enjoyed the luxurious buffet very much. Its a modern hotel but is located right in the heart of Windhoek, luxurious but unpretentious.
Date: Date of stay: November 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: New & modern Hilton; a good option in Windhoek
Review Content: We spent the first and last nights of our Namibia trip at this hotel and we were very happy with it. We prefer modern to old style so we had chosen Hilton over Hotel Heinitzburg and did not regret our choice.When you spend a week in rather rustic camps with limited comfort, it feels great to be able to spend a couple of nights in "luxury". We liked: the design of the room, the comfort of the bed, the very professional service, to be upgraded to a suite with access to the lounge at the top floor; the complimentary bottle of sparkling wine (honeymooners), the buffet breakfast, live piano in the lobby.Exemples of the good service: the morning we left, we had to catch an early flight and breakfast was not available yet; they provided us with a breakfast box to go. Also, we booked our transfer with the hotel on the night before our departure and the clerk had told us it was a certain price. When we checked out, a higher price was charged, and when we told them, they quickly adjusted the invoice according to the price we had been told the night before.We did not use the pool as it was too cold for that, but the view from the pool area is nice. Same in the business lounge next to it.There is not really anything worth mentioning that we did not like, except maybe that the restaurant had ran out of the dish we wanted to order (local fish) one night and the piece of carrot cake we ordered from the bar in the lobby area was old and dry.Besides these small details, I recommend this hotel if you are looking for something comfortable and modern.
Date: Date of stay: August 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great Business Hotel
Review Content: I've stayed here twice now, both times were positive.  The rooms are modern, clean, spacious, and comfortable.  Customer service is friendly.  The food is inconsistent from okay to fabulous depending on the chef on duty.  There's a shopping district within walking distance, everything else is by taxi.
Date: Date of stay: May 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hotel had just opened....probably better now.
Review Content: Travelled there just after it had opened and for me it was the location that was great. Rooms had no wifi but were normal Hilton standard. Restaurant wouldn't let us in as we arrived 10 minutes before closing so for me not great but sure it's worth a visit.  Loved the rooftop bar
Date: Date of stay: May 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Best In Class
Review Content: As a frequent business traveler, I have the opportunity to enjoy or, G-d forbid, ‚Äúsuffer‚Äù from many hotels and accommodations all over the world. Having recently spent 4 nights at the Hilton Windhoek, I can testify this place is definitely one of the greatest hotels I have stopped by for a long time. With a friendly and well-intentioned staff, spacious and well-furnished rooms, a comfortable business lounge, a generous buffet breakfast, a lovely sunroof terrace with a pool and a nice view of the surroundings and just 5 min. walk from the main business and shopping areas, it provides you everything you need to make your stay the most productive and enjoyable one. Simply said, this hotel is a ‚Äúmust-stay‚Äù for anyone traveling to Namibia.
Date: Date of stay: November 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Clean, world class, conveniently located
Review Content: A new, clean, luxurious hotel located at the city centre, very convenient for the business traveller but not so much for relaxation. Excellent facilities and high quality food at a fair price. Really enjoyed our stay. The only improvement is  the staff....they need to introduce guests to hotel rooms, I dont have to ask where the mini bar is for example.
Date: Date of stay: July 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Service needs attention
Review Content: The facilities at the hotel were excellent and the decor inn the foyer was very appropriate to Namibia. The room I stayed in had an extremely comfortable bed and was beautifully decorated. I would return in the hope the the niggles I mention below will have been addrressed,The temerature of the water during my shower fluctauated continuously without my adjusting the tap, varying from uncomfortably hot water to cold water in an instant. What also needs attention is the level of service provided. despite the staff I met being eager to please there were some problems. I alerted the IT department thatt the internet in my room was not working. Very soon after an maintenance person arrived but could not fix the problem, stating that a technical person from T would need to attend to the problem, only to be told then that this could not happen as the IT person was asleep - this at 20:30!. The other incident was when I went down for breakfast at 07:20. I arrived to closed doors, with the explanation that the restaurant manager had not arrived yet to open the doors despite the opening hour being 07:00. A staff member did kindly offer to take my order and bring my breakfast up to my room, which they did within 12 minutes - but unfortunately did not deliver what I had ordered.
Date: Date of stay: June 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Lazy Staff
Review Content: The Laziest Food and Beverage staff I‚Äôve encountered in all my business travels. They will give the silliest excuses not to serve you. From ‚Äúsorry we are busy with breakfast and cannot attend ur order, at 11:00 am‚Äù to ‚Äúsorry we can make u a sirloin but not a rump steak, we are low on staff‚Äù The FnB manager does not exist, and the ironic part is that they manage to get the job done only after you complain.5 star? I think not.
Date: Date of stay: January 2020This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Overall Okay
Review Content: Breakfast excludes cappuccino, hot chocolate, etc... no disclosure- they let you know when leaving dining room. Otherwise a good hotel overall. Well located in Windhoek close to all ammenities. Safe area and neighbourhood- nearby restaurants and restaurants on site.
Date: Date of stay: October 2023This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Friendly and helpful staff, good location, rooms a bit tired.
Review Content: The staff is very friendly and helpful, rooms are a bit tired, broken mirror, loose handles etc.Location is good, in the middle of the city and you can see the Himba ladies from the hotel (stay away though, pick-pockets everywhere).Breakfast was nice, especially the omelettstation. Coffee taste like water.Rooftop pool is Nice but tiny.
Date: Date of stay: October 2023This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A welcome travel respite
Review Content: We were on the road for 2 days and were given a free early checkin and room upgrade to a 2 room corner sweet with 2 bathrooms. Lovely room, soft bed and a welcome fruit plate. The dinner which was great with lots of choices and drinks was included making it a wonderful experience and deal as well. Hilton was good as it‚Äôs name and made me happy to be an honors member. The staff was very helpful and the manager Jacob chatted with us at dinner.  I would happily stay there again, they arranged transit from the airport making it all seem less.
Date: Date of stay: May 2021This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Comfortable option downtown
Review Content: The hotel and room  were comfortable. Room a little worn but overall met expectations. It was spacious and had everything I needed. Hotel located downtown and you can take a shortcut via the casino. It is irritating that beggars are quite pushy downtown (but not dangerous) meaning I had to escape into a shop on a mumber of occasions. Parking uncomplicated under hotel at small charge. The bar had a great viewover Windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: December 2023This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: The Worst experience I have ever had at checking out
Review Content: The charged me unknown bill at bar which I have never visited. Although I asked to delete it immediately, they didn‚Äôt do so until they confirmed, which forced me to wait for 30mins keeping waiting for a taxi to the airport.  Although this was caused by their negligence of checking of signing information at the time of consumption in the bar, they never apologized to me.
Date: Date of stay: August 2022This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Outstanding
Review Content: Stayed with them for 15 days. Excellent service, location, rooms etc. Highly recommend! Food great and try the Skybar on roof. Breathtaking view of the city and nice and reasonably priced drinks. Nothing bad to say!
Date: Date of stay: October 2020This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Beautiful hotel and rooftop
Review Content: This is a really wonderful hotel. Room was huge, with a big bathroom and beautiful view. The rooftop is stunning, with a bar, pool, and pretty decent gym for a hotel. Breakfast was really good with a very big selection. They organised an airport transfer for me as well.
Date: Date of stay: March 2022This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A real shame for a Hilton
Review Content: What a bad experience...I have been there for 3 days and believe me never again...This is not Hilton quality for the folowing reasons- the food is terrible- service at the front desk is poor ( they have charge my credit card twice )- I had a TV problem in my room not fixed after 3 days- I have been awaken at 8 am for a minibar check !!!Conclusion : RUN AWAY
