Name: Stay at hotel
Review Content: Had a bad experience with regard to my passport that was misplaced by reception staff and staff were not very responsive to my needs and I miss my flight due to this and not even an apology from management.
Date: Date of stay: November 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Sleepless night
Review Content: Rooms very nice. Service ok.Gave me pass to internet, but only good in lobby. Was about $15 for internet in my room. Sad that this is Hilton service.But the bad stuff was when I went to bad the night before a two week Safari. All night long I was kept awake by the beat from a night club. Would never stay here again.
Date: Date of stay: May 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A wonderful and perfect place to Begin  and  to End your journey through beautiful Namibia!
Review Content: Hilton Windhoek thoroughly met our needs snd expectation at the beginning and the end of our 22 days self-drive road trip tour through out beautiful  Namibia.Somehow when I was looking for a hotel in Windhoek  to springboard our trip through out Namibia it was not easy to find an accommodation  that meets location + comfort... and I was lucky to disregard some of the negative reviews of this hotel and trust my travel experience and intuition by going ahead in booking the Hilton Windhoek ....This hotel is exactly what is expected to find in an international hotel... it's beautiful, elegant , modern public spaces ... its restaurant in the second floor where breakfast is served is spacious and well appointed its restaurant -bar-pool lounge area is perfect for a beautiful sundowner and a quick dinner under the stars overlooking Windhoek cityscape...What comfortable beds were awaiting for us after our long 20 hours long flights from Los Angeles, Ca  and a very delicious buffet breakfast with a great variety of choices was awaiting for us in the next morning ....The staff through out the hotel were all equally very gracious  and ready to help with a wide warm smile ... I definitely highly recommend this hotel for anybody no matter if you're in Windhoek for business  or on a holiday ...or if you're part of a tour group or you're a solo traveler... the hotel will meet your needs and expectations ...
Date: Date of stay: July 2021This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A pleasant stay in Windhoek.  The elevators were an issue...
Review Content: I stayed at the Hilton Windhoek for two nights while in the city for business.  I'm a Hilton Honors member and tend to chose Hilton hotels where possible.  I had thought my office had booked a car for me from the airport but there wasn't one on arrival.  I phoned the hotel and they said they had no record of that (which was correct as I had been mistaken).  I was disappointed however that they didn't offer assistance or use their initiative to offer advice on transfer options.  The hotel is well presented, modern and clean.  My room was comfortable and had the ability to open a window (which I always prefer to AC). I tripped the electricity in my room while using the iron. The most irksome part of my stay was being stuck in the elevator for 50 minutes on my second evening there.  The elevator wouldn't open and I was stuck inside with a guest from Germany and his son.  We waited patiently to be released.  Upon finally getting free there was no real acknowledgement of the inconvenience at the time.  I mentioned this to the front desk on checking out and the staff member kindly refunded my lunch bill from the previous day.  I would stay at this hotel again. The roof top pool and bar are wonderful.
Date: Date of stay: September 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Best hotel in Windhoek
Review Content: The hotel is well situated in the city centre. Every major attraction is within walkable distance.Service was also great, the hotel arrange transfer from the airport and all staff were lovely and helpful.Breakfast had plenty of choice, I especially liked the juice bar.The rooftop terrace with the pool and the bar is the best place to see the sunset.The only weird thing for me was the bathroom being sort of in the middle of the room: it is completely open, so if you get out of the shower or bathtub, you don't have anywhere to hide!
Date: Date of stay: March 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Guter Start f√ºr Namibia Rundreise
Review Content: Das Hotel liegt sehr zentral in Windhoek und daher optimal die Stadt zu entdecken. Das Personal ist super freundlich und hilfsbereit. Freundlicherweise bekamen wir ein upgrade. Zimmer sind grossz√ºgig eingerichtet und das Bett war 1A um sich von der langen Reise gut zu erholen. Das Fr√ºhst√ºck war sehr fein und die Auswahl so gross, dass hier sicher jeder etwas findet.
Date: Date of stay: October 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: F√ºnf sehr tr√ºbe Sterne
Review Content: Sowohl im J√§nner nach der Ankunft ( Zimmer 415 ) als auch im Februar vor der Abreise leider das Hilton gebucht. Es war entt√§uschend. Personal an der Rzeptin unfreundlich bis desinteressiert, Zimmer mangelhaft bis abgewohnt. Polsterm√∂bel sind verschlissen, Fernbedienung f√ºr den TV funktionierte nicht, Lampe beim Bett war defekt. Beim Pool am Dach sind die ohnehin nur 6 vobrhandenen Liegen derart durchgelegen, dass man mit Wirbels√§ulenbeschwerden aufsteht. Die nordseitigen Zimmer bieten zurzeit und wohl noch l√§nger einen Ausblick auf eine Gro√übaustelle.Zusammenfassend kann gesagt werden, dass selbst der g√ºnstigere Wochendtarif √ºberzahlt war.

Name: Entt√§uschender Umgang mit den Hotelg√§sten
Review Content: Wir haben zum Abschluss unseres Namibiaurlaubs und nach einer anstrengenden Rundreise das Hilton gebucht, um uns noch zwei Tage zu erholen. Die Zimmer sind sch√∂n und sauber, auch das Fr√ºhst√ºcksbuffet ist toll, aber die Poolarea einen ganzen Nachmittag und Abend f√ºr eine Veranstaltung zu sperren, bei der Hotelg√§ste nicht zugelassen sind, ist eine Frechheit! Meine Beschwerde wurde mit einer lapidaren Entschuldigung abgetan, aber nicht die geringste Entsch√§digung. Ich habe den vollen Preis bezahlt, warum bekomme ich nur einen Teil der Leistungen? Warum muss ich meine Freizeit im Zimmer oder in einer Bar verbringen, anstatt am Pool liegend? Das h√§tte ich nicht von einem Hotel in dieser Kategorie erwartet! Entt√§uschend!!!
Date: Date of stay: October 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Restaurant
Review Content: wir sind hier sp√§t abends angekommen, schon m√ºde gewesen wollten schnell was essen. Leider war um ca. 19.00 Uhr kein Platz mehr in Restaurant. Wir hatten dann drau√üen auf der Flur Platz gekriegt. Der Service war gut, das Essen auch. Morgens das Fr√ºhst√ºcksbuffet war auch sehr vielf√§ltig und reichlich.Was sehr schlecht war im Hotelzimmer ist mein Schuh verschwunden direkt am ersten Tag. So bin ich bis zur Victoria F√§lle ohne feste Schuhe unterwegs gewesen. Von der Rezeption Seite keine Hilfe, nur Ausreden, das ich nicht gut f√ºr so ein renommiertes Hotel, daf√ºr Service mangelhaft.

Name: eleganza e ampi spazi con qualche ma...
Review Content: Abbiamo pernottato in questa struttura appena atterrati a Windhoek, all'inizio del nostro tour della Namibia. CAMERA: molto ampia , silenziosa, pulitissima e confortevole, letto comodo e grandissimo. Il bagno rimane a vista nella camera, scelta stilisticamente originale ma suggerisco la scelta di questa struttura a coppie o amici molto in confidenza...COLAZIONE: il punto forte! Pur avendo girato parecchie strutture credo di non aver mai visto un buffet cos√¨ ricco e curato nel minimo dettaglio, sia nella qualit√† del cibo offerto che nell'esposizione, veramente complimenti!WI FI: piccola nota dolente: era a pagamento (e anche decisamente caro), inoltre abbiamo avuto pi√π di un problema prima di riuscire a connetterci (nonostante mio marito lavori nel campo dell'informatica)SPAZI COMUNI: receptionist molto cortesi, hall molto grande ed elegante. Peccato fosse chiuso il bar all'ultimo piano, ciononostante abbiamo trascorso una piacevole serata nell'altro bar presente nell'hotel, peccato solo ci fossero le prostitute!! In conclusione, consiglio vivamente questo hotel, ma non posso dare il voto massimo per i due piccoli nei gi√† indicati (le prostitute al bar e la connessione wifi assai cara)
Date: Date of stay: August 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Gutes Stadthotel mit schlechtem Service
Review Content: Das Hilton Windhoek liegt sehr zentral und man kann fussl√§ufig das Zentrum von Windhoek ereeichen. Wir waren w√§hrend unserer Namibia Reise drei Mal dort . Das Hotel ist sicher das beste und komfortabelste, was die Stadt zu bieten hat, Der grosse Schwachpunkt ist jedoch die Rezeption. Das Personal ist √ºberwiegend unfreundlich, beim dritten Check-in hatte man immer noch keine Check-in Daten und bei der Frage, ob ein Fax angekommen ist wird man unfreundlich zum Guest Service abgewiesen, bzw zum Portier. Keiner ist hilfsbereit noch serviceorientiert . Telefonate innerhalb Windhoeks werden abgelehnt, kurzum es gibt trotz der Kategorie null Service.  Die Zimmer sind sehr komfortabel, besonders die Betten, jedoch haben die Zimmer z B  schlechte Verarbeitungsqualit√§t- die Badezimmer weisen z,B in der Dusche schon Besch√§digungen an den Amaturen auf. Ein Pluspunkt ist die Dachterrasse mit der Bar und Pool (insgesamt sehr sch√∂n) und der Sevice im Hauptrestaurant. Die Gastronomie ist sehr gut. Aktuell gibt es zwei Baustellen um das Hotel herum.
Date: Date of stay: May 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great hotel; but I'm not going back because of its wifi policy
Review Content: I've just stayed at this hotel for the first, and last, time. A two night business trip took me there this week, and on my immediate arrival I was impressed. For about 3 minutes. Whilst a brilliant receptionist was taking me through the amenities of the hotel, I enquired as to the wifi access code. Here's the shocker... There's no free wifi at this hotel.  (How any hotel in this day and age can charge nearly US$20 a day for wifi and not even high speed wifi at that, is beyond me?) So, whilst I loved my room, the food and the all round service; I'm sorry to say I'm not going back until this policy changes. Nor is my client, who was similarly shocked, and has now turned her attention to other Windhoek hotels for her next required set of hotel nights, which number some 12 or so in the next few weeks. A US$20 rip off has cooked the Hilton's goose.  They 'took' us once; but no more!Incidentally TripAdvisor lists free high speed wifi as an amenity on this hotel's listing; something I'm informing them about immediately.  I'm very, very disappointed.
Date: Date of stay: July 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A nice stayover hotel, not much more
Review Content: This is a very well-located hotel, especially if you are getting to or from the Windhoek airport. The parking downstairs is quite ample and free (at least for the Platinum or Diamond members). Not much around within walking (if you are that kind of a person) or driving distance....The hotel is clean and proper, well-kept and well-run - though I cannot hide the bitterness of being completely mistreated as a Diamond Member of the Hilton chain, but that's just venting :)Rooms are very nice, well-equipped, have at least one European plug, so you don;t have to worry about those weird Namibian/South African adapters. Air conditioners are quiet, efficient, though the elevators ding quite loudly, so make sure to be away from them. Linens and towels are top notch, with the usual Peter Thomas Roth toiletries on offer.The restaurant food was the blandest I ever had, the service was awkward, white wine warm, and the food choices were amazingly unimpressive. Avoid, at all costs.The pool on the top floor is a pathetic little water hole, so do not get your hopes up, but the views from up there are quite nice.The lounge is poorly stacked - no food, just snacks, and I was charged for the white wine, as there were none in the refrigerator -  the lounge clerk told me that of course it will be delivered right away, and it was - with a bill, what a ripoff! In general, the service was surprisingly subpar. Someone has to re-think the whole strategy of addressing the clients' need and reboot the employees' training from point zero.Nice location, bad service. Your choice! :)
Date: Date of stay: November 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Your place if you want new, with a view
Review Content: This sparkling hotel makes quite a statement in Windhoek's subtle skyline. Hotel still looks brand new with its chic and modern design and decor. No outdated brass doorknobs here; this place makes you want to redesign your bathroom when you get home. Stayed here for a week on business. Rooms were large with a full size desk, bath, and separate shower stall. I requested to not have an adjoining room, but still got one. I was too jet lagged to bother moving, but would HIGHLY recommend that you avoid one as the noise from the next room will likely wake you up several times in the night. Housekeeping was great at the beginning, but toward the end of my stay, started to look too rushed, for example, taking the old bath mat and not leaving a new one. The gym is sufficient, with a nice view. A few cardio machines, a universal, and free weights. The pool is very small, but the deck and view make up for it. Visit the Sky Bar or pool deck at least once during the day and once in the evening for views you won't forget. Restaurant options are decent, service is typically on the slower side, and food is average. (Slightly over priced even by hotel standards, but cheap compared to the outrageously priced shoddy Internet service!) Operational bloopers, such as the room key access for the elevators not working or taking the stairs only to find yourself on another floor with no doorknob on the door to get out, caused me to scratch my head a few times in confusion and realize that not all of their actions are well thought out.Overall, a good stay. The look and feel could rival the swankiest hotels of major cities across the globe, but kinks in service delivery and operations keeps me from giving this hotel a perfect score.
Date: Date of stay: November 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice new hotel in Windhoek
Review Content: The hotel is very new and the rooms are nice and very modern. Also, the bar and pool area on the roof is great. I think service can be improved a bit (delays with cleaning the room and responding to guest requests), but otherwise, in my view, this is the best hotel in Windhoek and I will definitely say there again.
Date: Date of stay: July 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: High class hotel
Review Content: The hotel is located in the middle of this quite small city with its 320 000 inhabitants at the high fields of Namibia (approximately 1700 meters over sea level). Beautiful hotel with high standard rooms. Friendly personell and room service with great and tasty food. Recommended.
Date: Date of stay: December 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hilton ist auch in Windhoek fas Hilton
Review Content: Das Hilton in Windhoek liegt tats√§chlich sehr zentral in der Innenstadt. Alle Sehensw√ºrdigkeiten sind zu Fu√ü sehr gut zu erreichen. Der Service ist leider nicht so, wie wir es von einem Hilton erwarten w√ºrden, aber f√ºr Nambia schon OK.Die Zimmer sind gro√üz√ºgig und sauber. Der Badbereich ist zum Zimmer offen gestaltet, was das Ambiente insgesamt sehr modern wirken l√§sst.In der 9. Etage gibt es einen Pool mit Poolbar, ein kleines Gym und einen Spa-Bereich. Hier oben hat man einen sehr sch√∂nen Blick √ºber die Innenstadt und kann sich ein wenig auf den Urlaub in Namibia einstimmen. Ein Tip: Die Handt√ºcher f√ºr den Poolbereich gibt es im Spa.F√ºr das Abendessen gibt es 3 Restaurants, eines davon bietet ein sensationelles Sushi, das zwar super lecker, aber f√ºr Namibia doch recht teuer ist.Das Fr√ºhst√ºck ist tats√§chlich ein absolutes Highlight. Hier gibt es wirklich ALLES was das Herz begehrt. Eine fantastische Auswahl.Sehr positiv ist auch die √ºberwachte Tiefgarage mit direktem Lift in die Lobby.Ein weiterer Tip: Ca. 10 Gehminuten entfernt liegt die Mall ‚ÄûWernhil Park‚Äú die auch am Sonntag ge√∂ffnet ist. Wer also z.B. Noch auf der Suche nach einer Handykarte von MTC ist wird hier f√ºndig. Das Hilton ist aus unserer Sicht auf jeden Fall zu empfehlen.

Name: Premium Stuff
Review Content: I enjoyed the king size bed. It was so comfortable, the bathroom was also great. They could do better with the interiors aesthetics though, there is too much brown. The breakfast buffet was good too... generally a very decent place to stay.

Name: Confortable et pratique.

Buffet breakfast included. They are building a significant addition and this will become a large ‚ÄúGarden‚Äù version for Hilton (open Feb 2019). Recommended.  O

Name: Great and family friendly staff
Review Content: Extended stay at the Hilton with family. Enjoyed the hotel's facilities, great location and good food. Breakfast was excellent and so was the staff. Even if the hotel caters mainly to corporate customers and tourists, as family with children we felt very comfortable and would always come back.
Date: Date of stay: October 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: great hotel, except for housekeeping
Review Content: This is a very modern hotel located near the city center. Rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. The bath was very modern and provided both a bath tub and shower. The sink was very shallow, so washing any clothes in it would be hard. The exec lounge offered a nice breakfast, which included a few hot options (contrary to what a prior review noted). The lounge manager even ordered an omelet for me one morning! Dinner time in the lounge offered a few hot entrees plus desserts, wine, beer, and spirits, all complimentary. We tried room service for lunch and were pleased. Housekeeping did not do a great job; they failed to honor a couple of simple requests, twice. Otherwise out stay was very pleasant.
Date: Date of stay: August 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice people but needed process improvement
Review Content: It's important to note that I arrived here with 18 other people, all experienced travelers heading to the desert. The employees I eventually spoke with were pleasant and helpful; but the process of getting 19 people into 10 rooms didn't go smoothly. It took a long time, and when my roommate and I finally got a room, we opened the door and surprised the heck out the person who was already staying there. We did get a room next try. I also didn't have my luggage as Air Namibia had left it behind. The hotel's amenities kit was only a toothbrush and paste. I don't know what I expected but maybe a little lip balm? Small deodorant? And there wasn't a sundries shop on premises - I'd have begged them to open it. As I noted, there was no problem with any of the employees. I think it was a process issue and might relate only to groups, but that's how a lot of guests come - in a bundle. The room was a standard Hilton room with standard Hilton amenities. The hotel dates from the time when bathrooms featured a lot of glass, so my roommate and I had to consciously respect each other's privacy. At least the WC was closed.
Date: Date of stay: June 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Namibia Safari
Review Content: We spent a day in the Hilton prior to starting our trip to the Skeleton Coast. The hotel is very nice, clean and the staff was welcoming. The rooms were very nice, clean and comfortable. This hotel is close the the craft mart which is a great place to visit.
Date: Date of stay: April 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Wundersch√∂ne Lage, tolle Zimmer, super Service
Review Content: Es war unsere letzte Nacht in Namibia. Wir waren 10 Tage unterwegs und t√§glich in einer anderen Unterkunft. Wir brauchten mal ein bisschen Luxus... Im Hilten haben wir fantastisch geschlafen, keine st√∂rende Klimaanlage, tolle Betten und hervorragendes Essen und Service. Wir kommen gerne wieder.

Name: Central location but rooms already musty for a new hotel
Review Content: I choose to stay at the Hilton most of the time due to its central location. However, the showers are badly designed so that they fill up with water and some of it leaks out when you open the shower door and seeps into the carpet. This gives the rooms a mouldy and musty smell. Some rooms are worse than others but I am yet to get a room   that didn't have this smell. The one room I had was so bad that my sinuses started acting up. I didn't bother to complain as I was there for only one night and was tired and had an early flight the next day. The rooms are otherwise well furnished and stylish. They either need to replace the carpet with tiled or add some sort of barrier strip to the shower cubicles. The service itself is mixed. Room service is great and food is yummy. Concierge and valet service is also wonderful. However, the restaurant staff at breakfast seem to not be bothered about serving their staff. I do not expect to a) need to hunt down someone to order coffee from or b) follow up with them once I have placed my order at a 5 star hotel.
Date: Date of stay: July 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Business stay in Winhoek ( at the Hilton)
Review Content: An enjoyable business hotel, wonderful location and views.  Great food and service with good opportunities for meeting clients / suppliers.  Some wonderful staff that take care of the guests and ensure their stay is productive.
Date: Date of stay: May 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: No Peaceful Sleep
Review Content: The hotel made their problem my problem. The room they allocated to me was next to a construction site, which began working from 5am until 7pm. I never did get a peaceful nights sleep and hotel management said that they were full and couldn't help. They should have blocked this room and not let it out in the first place!!!

Name: Business hotel located in Windhoek CBD
Review Content: Located in Windhoek CBD, Hilton is a good option for such ones that arrive to Namibia for their first time.Location: great, near of any important point of the city.Rooms: large rooms, equipped with iron machine and nice views of Windhoek.Gym: yes, located in last floor. Small for a hotel like this and wifi has not coverage over there (to improve).Breakfast: good, combination of buffet and on-demand.Staff: friendly and always available.

Name: My stay at the Windhoek HHotel
Review Content: It is a very nice place for anyone. You can be a couple, family, business, friends or just you trying to get away from everything and everyone. This place will suit you. It is strategically located. Not that you will lack anything while staying there but if you are new in town then you will find it easy to get to important places.  I liked the security of all the things as it is tight and makes one carefree. The staff were super nice too. I will definitely recommend anyone to stay there.

Name: Could have been better
Review Content: Although the rooms are stylish, the staff is very friendly, the breakfast was exquisite and the hotel in general looked great, the Windhoek Hilton has some issues.We had two separate rooms (one for me and one for my grandparents), both rooms appeared to be very clean, in one room we even found a dead bug in an obvious spot. Also the mini-bars in both rooms weren't stocked (which was annoying after a late arrival and wanting a drink) and simple things like shower caps etc were missing.So although its a nice place, they need to re-educate housekeeping!

Name: NO TRANSPORT/SHUTTLE SOLUTION
Review Content: The only concern was that the organising of transport was poor. On two occasions we arranged transport from the Hotel and they confirmed, however on the day transport was needed - no one knew anything about it.

Name: Clean & tidy
Review Content: Good location for a business trip.Bed comfortable.  Shower door did not want to keep all of the water in, so, bathroom floor was a bit wet.View of the car park and it's construction noise not so great.Breakfast good.  Evening meal quite good and reasonably priced.Staff very friendly and helpful.I would stay again if visiting Windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: July 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great Breakfast
Review Content: We stayed at the Hilton in Windhoek on our first and last nights in Namibia this year. It is a nice western style hotel in a city that seems to be moving away from a very  colonial style built environment towards a more modern style with mixed results. The rooms are ok and the double beds comfortable.Standard tea and coffee making facilities and flat screen tv.The bathroom area is open.The restaurant was reasonable with a decent selection on the menu. Danny tried the Springbok Carpaccio as a starter which was very tasty and I had  fish for the main course which was ok- It wasn't amazing but it was alright, and  for dinner in western terms not very expensive. The gym on the top floor is small but adequate - the machines are new and it was never busy when we were using it so it was pretty good all in all and has anything you would need, perhaps some heavier free weights would have been useful but thats quibbling! There is a lovely small pool outside the gym next to the rooftop bar area that give a nice rooftop view of the capital. The Breakfast  was exceptional,with a massive  selection and undoubtedly the highlight of our stay at the Hilton. There were some downsides, paying for the wifi is a bit disappointing, especially when we were asked to pay per device when we were told that we wouldn't have to and that it would be just for the room.Having to pay for the parking was also disappointing. The staff at the desk were a mixed bunch also, some were very nice and others not so much.Upon checkout we were asked to pay for  things we had been told were included, which was cleared up eventually to our satisfaction, but as the receptionist himself said somewhat ironically some staff members need to step up their game. This raised a slight chuckle as the person saying it was probably the one we had most qualms with.
Date: Date of stay: June 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Coffee at breakfast can be quicker and breakfast in-room needs attention - the speed not the food itself - that was good. Would like to see more specials for locals like us.

Name: Good enough
Review Content: I like the title I saw below in a review "Your place if you want new with a view" because I thought that this really captured it in someone else's review. It's new, it's nice enough, we got a great price and it's centrally located. I found it a bit awkward and strange and it felt like it just wasn't a very active place. It may be because of the timing of our visit (26th December) but it just didn't feel lively. It was clean but the staff weren't helpful, the way the building is organized wasn't very obvious and we got stuck in a staircase and also stuck in the parking lot another time. I don't have much to say. It was good enough given the price but the place we stayed on our way back through Windhoek was much more charming--if you want something special try a boutique hotel.
Date: Date of stay: December 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Convenient location & Modern
Review Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on a business trip.  Rooms are comfortable and reasonably sized. Had a front facing room on the 2nd floor and the road was somewhat of a nuisance.  Service was average, but better than what I've had elsewhere in Windhoek.  Will stay here again.
Date: Date of stay: June 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A strong showing for a young hotel
Review Content: The Hilton Windhoek is on its way to being a world-class hotel, but it still in the growing pains phase.  The food and rooms are exceptional.  The location is great for exploring Windhoek.  Service is on-par with other top-rated hotels.  Their attention to detail is where you find some little doubts.  Our small complaints were:1. No wi-fi in the rooms, and we had to pay for common area access in the business center2. The trash room by the elevator smelled really bad, stinking up the hallway near our room3. The inability of the front desk to change more that $200 USD a day into local currency4. As it seems to cater to mostly business travelers, those of us not on an expense account found it annoying that everything was $5 here, $10 there.  A lower base rate, but the little extras add up.Overall, we were pleased with our experience and would not hesitate to stay there again.

This was not a solution in our opinion as we were only there one night before our long journey home and would have had to  get dressed, packed and then unpack again all when we should have been sleeping!  We felt the offender should have been moved. We were advised that the hotel was non smoking but did not seem to matter.

Name: Comfortable and well situated hotel
Review Content: We stayed here at the beginning and end of our Namibia holiday and found the hotel to be very good.It is easy to find from the airport and there is underground parking available. Check in staff were very efficient and helpful and the room was clean and comfortable.Service in the restaurant was variable, with some friendly, helpful staff and some quite offhand staff. The food was fairly good, although the breakfast buffet was a little disappointing. Would definitely stay here again if we were in Windhoek.

Name: Nice facility, terrible internet
Review Content: This was my second stay at the Hilton in Windhoek and I will likely stay there again when I return. The facility is nice and it is centrally location. The sunset from the rooftop bar is unequaled. As a business traveler, my main complaint about this Hilton is the internet, which was not working the majority of my five nights there. I was able to buy a data package through the local phone company, but ideally this would not be necessary. I also found the front desk service to be hot and cold. The staff seemed very annoyed at times and completely lovely at others.

Name: Rip Off Credit Card Scammers STAY AWAY!
Review Content: On check out we were presented with Bar charges that were not ours. After demanding to see the invoices it was clear it wasnt our signature, nor at a time we were even at the hotel. The charges were removed after much discussion. The next day other charges appeared on our credit card. We called several times paying high long distance rates only to eventually be told the charges were for transportation to the river. OVER AN HOUR AFTER WE CHECKED OUT!!!!!!!! Each person said they would look into it. No one ever did nor did they call back. Then other fraudulent charges turned up on the card from unknown sources in Namibia, and we had to cancel the card. Finally, we complained to Hilton Customer Service and they called the hotel and then we were told by them it was a mistake and charges would be reversed. They never were...when we contacted Hilton again they said they were sorry but had no way to get into the billing of that hotel and so couldnt reverse the charge!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! IMAGINE THIS?! So disappointed in Hilton Main Office Customer Service!Eventually, we contacted our credit card company and had the charges disputed and reversed.What an awful experience.
Date: Date of stay: June 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Comfortable business stay
Review Content: I stayed here during a business visit - comfortable and clean rooms. Rooms have all the amenities needed for a comfortable stay.Breakfast is included and is a buffet breakfast in the hotel. The hotel offers a gym, rooftop bar, coffee shop environment as well as two restaurants. Room service is on offer with an extra charge added to the bill.Wi-Fi is included if you're a Hilton Honors member but you have to pay for it if you're not. Signing up is easy and worth getting wi-fi.All in all a comfortable stay in Windhoek and walking distance from shops and some of the attractions in the city

Name: Nice hotel at central Windhoek
Review Content: We stayed just one night, and we arrived very late, and leave at early morning. The staff was very friendly and cute with us. We were in our Honey Moon and we found our room decorated for the occasion with a really nice bottle of champagne, a card (Signed by several members of the team) and even a courtesy massage coupon. The room was big and very nice with all the comfort you can ask for. The breakfast was very good. Huge quality buffet with several options. The installations of the hotel are very nice and new. We wish that we had more time to enjoy the hotel.We were a bit in a hurry waiting for a suit to get steamed that supposed to be ready in 1 hour. But they solved everything at the reception. Thanks!

Name: Best option for downtown Windhoek
Review Content: Stayed for 2 nights here on way to swapkomund.  This hotel has a lot of potential with good food, great location and an awesome skybar!  The staff needs better training for it to be a 5 star.  All rooms are very well done and up to date.Few examples of lack of staff training.  We needed a roll away bed and called for it.  Never came so called again.  Was told they don't have a sheet set or blanket so it wasn't possible.  But they never called to tell me this!!  And my kids are super tired and want to go to bed.  I think they just didn't want to do it cuz of the time.  No blankets in a hotel?Other things was calling for a pot of coffee and receiving a cup.  They just need more through training as their attitudes are very good and always helpful

Name: Best bed we had in Namibia
Review Content: The hilton in Windhoek is very comfortable. Spacious rooms, very good bathroom with seperate bath and shower and very important a very comfortable bed. After travelling through Namibia for 2 weeks it was great to have these comforts. Hotel is in center and as we had a 4x4 pickup with camping gear it was great to be able to park the car (free) save in the parking garage of the hotel.Breakfast was very very good, lots of choice. Fresh egg and juice station, capucino's etc.Pool is on top floor, good views of windhoek. Only few sunbeds so be on time.Stayed for two nights. Wifi is good in hotel. Hotel is very central, easy to get taxi to restaurants.If in Windhoek i would stay here again

Netter Empang durch die Portiers. Schnell und effizient. Wir hatten schliesslich einen 6 st√ºndige Kleinbus-Fahrt hinter uns.  Front Desk war langsam, nur weil wir 2 Zimmer mit 2 Betten wollten, welche schon so gebucht und vermerkt waren aber nicht so zugeteilt wurden. Im Normalfall ein Ziehen der Maus. Aber dies konnten die Mitarbeiter wohl nicht. Zimmer sind sch√∂n gross, WIFI sehr schell, Badezimmer gew√∂hnungsbed√ºrftig, da alles aus Glas und sehr offen. Viele hochwertige Amenities im Bad. Auch ein 2 TV war da. Ausblick des Zimmers war nicht besonders. Die Hauptstadt Namibias hatte noch nicht viel zu bieten. Dies wird sich sicherlich bald √§ndern. Das Abendessen war aber eher m√ºhsam. Muss eingestehen wir kamen auch sehr sp√§t, was aber nicht unsere Schuld war.Wir wurden an einen kleinen Tisch platziert. Speisekarte wurde gereicht, Wein und Wasser wurde sofort bestellt. Es dauert aber eher lang bis die Getr√§ke kamen. Das Essen wurde lang nicht aufgenommen. Wir musstne immer wieder rufen.Vorspeisen kamen und der Tisch war schon fast zu klein. Nach Brot und Butter mussten wir 2 mal fragen. Ein Beistelltisch wurde keiner gebracht. Aber auch ein gr√∂sserer Tisch wurde nicht angeboten, wenn auch viele freie Tische waren. Die Gerichte waren sch√∂n, die Steaks auf den Punkt gebraten. Service musste aber immer wieder gerufen werden, wenn wir etwas wollten. Nicht gerade G√§steorientiert. Wir verliessen das Restaurant nicht gl√ºcklich. Wir besuchten noch die Bar. Obwohl schon geschlossen, servierte man uns noch einen Drink und war sehr h√∂flich und zuvorkommend. Das hat das Bild des Hotels schon recht aufgewertet.Beim Fr√ºhst√ºck wurden wir nett und schnell empfangen. Die Speisen waren alle Frisch, oder wurden gerade √† la minute zubereitet. Grosse Auswahl. Der Kellner war super effizient, fragte immer wieder nach Getr√§nken, brachte frische S√§fte, Tee usw. Das Geschirr wurde immer wieder abger√§umt. Weshalb konnte dies am Vorabend nicht auch so sein. Auf dem Dach gabs eine Roof-Top Bar, Dazu ein Pool den ich leider nicht mehr brauche konnte.  Auch ein kleines aber sehr sch√∂nes Gym gabs mit vielen neuen Ger√§ten. Die Fahrt vom Zentrum zum Airport war dann ca. 40 Minuten.

Name: Great Place to Stay
Review Content: I've stayed at this Hilton at least four time over the last five years, and I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else in Windhoek. That staff is very friendly, and very responsive to your needs. The Breakfast spread is incredible, and the wide variety of breakfast selections is unmatched. I really miss the fresh  juices.   After a long day, unwind at the Sky Bar and enjoy the  beautiful sunset every evening. If you have access to the Executive Lounge, they provide a good spread, and a wide variety of drink.It is the place to stay in Windhoek.

Name: Really good city hotel.
Review Content: It would be easy to find some minor faults with this downtown hotel, but the plusses vastly outweigh any negatives.   The breakfast buffet was as lavish as we've seen anywhere in the region.  There is a nice craft market one block away, and lots of interesting sites in close proximity.   The rooftop pool, bar, and executive lounge are really great -- but your level of enjoyment may be affected if there's a boisterous crowd.  For a short stop in the center of town, it's just right!

This is not correct, we guests pay a lot to stay in the hotel, we support the hotel and can not use the swimming pool because it is allowed people who are not in the hotel to take towel, etc. Next time I will stay in another hotel shipper and will do the same, spend the day in some one else hotel.

Name: Tampering with luggage
Review Content: Stayed at the Hilton Windhoek for two nights in March 2016. Hotel design pleasing on the eye. Open spaces. Room was spacious with splendid balcony with two deck chairs and two loungers. However, room was not cleaned properly especially bathroom and toilet floor grimy. Towels and bed linen looked half washed. Carpets in passages dirty.On first night luggage was tampered with, nothing taken. On check out over heard another guest complain that a wrapped gift box that she handed to porter was opened. Tampering with guest luggage is a problem at this place.Had dinner and breakfast at Ekipa restaurant. Delicious, well presented food, buffet style with excellent selection of food. Service at Centrum restaurant very poor. Waited for an hour for veggie burger. Executive lounge nothing to write home about. Small room with handful of chairs and few snack dishes. Uninviting room. Had a look, walked away.Service at front desk okay.Hotel good for stopover.

Als wir dann jedoch gegen 21 Uhr in eines der Restaurants gingen, wurde uns dort gesagt, dass die K√ºche bereits geschlossen sei - wir k√∂nnten aber √ºber den Zimmerservice etwas bestellen (ist das eine andere K√ºche?). Nun gut, auf unserem Zimmer lag aber keine Men√ºkarte f√ºr den Zimmerservice. Der Rezeptionist rief dann zun√§chst irgendwo an, damit uns eine Karte aufs Zimmer gebracht wird, ging dann aber selbst. Als er zur√ºckkam, sagte er uns, es w√§re bereits jemand auf dem Weg zu unserem Zimmer. Als wir wieder auf dem Zimmer waren, warteten wir jedoch vergeblich. Ein Anruf brachte uns dann den Hinweis, dass jemand bei uns war, wir aber nicht auf dem Zimmer - wir waren da wohl an der Rezeption, aber wieso stellt man uns die Men√ºkarte nicht vor die T√ºr? Internet auf dem Zimmer kostet leider extra und in der Lobby ist es sehr langsam. Die Lage ist gut, wobei man sich in Windhuk vermutlich ohnehin nicht lange aufh√§lt. Gefr√ºhst√ºckt haben wir nicht im Hotel, sondern im "Bean there" im Spar in der Maerua Mall. Das ist sehr zu empfehlen (leider kein TA-Link bisher). Das Hilton w√ºrde ich nur empfehlen, wenn man sp√§t landet und nicht mehr bei Dunkelheit √ºber Land fahren m√∂chte und auch dann gibt es vielleicht bessere Alternativen in Windhuk.

Name: Beware if you are running a meeting at this hotel.
Review Content: We conducted an international meeting at the Windhoek Hilton last week.  Our experience was very mixed.  I would not recommend running a  meeting at this hotel unless their management significantly improves.  Cons: (1) For months prior to our meeting we tried from the U.S. to obtain a hotel contract for meeting and only finally got the contract the day we were leaving the hotel.  They did not respond or responded insufficiently to our multiple requests for the contract which delayed our ability to get visas for our international participants from across Africa and lead a number of our invitees not to be able to attend the meeting.  A month prior to the meeting did get some attention from the International Hilton office but that in the end didn‚Äôt really help.  Very frustrating and a tremendous waste of our staff time.(2) The projector that they provided for us was very old and outdated which meant that the wonderful powerpoint slides that our participants proudly brought to our meeting either couldn‚Äôt be read on the screen or looked like they had been faded in the desert sun.(3) Two of our participants had serious allergic  reactions to their rooms. The symptoms were reduced only when they opened their hotel room window.  Both lost their voices and had horrible congestion and coughs from the exposure.  Coincidently their  two rooms were next to each other on the third floor.  None of our other attendees had such a reaction.  Mold or a cleaning fluid was a possibility since there was mold around the shower of one of the rooms.(4) Fitness center was completely inadequate.  The two treadmills were broken for the week we were there, the one bicycle would only work when on the very lowest tension setting, the weights were very limited - but the two ellipticals did work.Pros:  Food was great, the hotel porters and room cleaning staff were great, the hotel has a beautiful interior and a wonderful top floor view of the city, and two of the the front desk managers were very helpful.
Date: Date of stay: May 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good facilities. Service needs improvement
Review Content: Back at the Hilton and the facilities are still good. Menu has been refreshed, including the in dining menu - excellent menu which caters for different palates. Gym and spa facilities are excellent. Experienced some problems with  room access (low battery?).Staff were generally helpful  and gave updates on a daily basis; for 3 days which is too long a time for basic maintenance.  Will be back!
Date: Date of stay: March 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: quasi 5 stelle
Review Content: soggiornato nel febbraio 2015, hotel e' ben localizzato, con una vista sulla citta' e sulla chiesa cattolica, stanze grandi, , letto king size, bagno completo con vasca e doccia, ma con un difetto nel lavello :il rubinetto e' di design come pure il lavello, ma quest'ultimo e ' poco profondo, per cui dai un poco di pressione alla acqua rischi di bagnarti dalla cintola fino ai piedi.la stanza poi aveva gia' bisogno di alcune manutenzioni urgenti..la piscina all'ultimo piano , anche se  piccola ha un discrete spazio per prendere sole o solamente per un drink allo sky bar.Anche qui c'e' pero' un notevole errore:le chiavi elettroniche a carta di credito ( che una volta al giorno perdevano la loro funzionalita') servono per accedere ai piano, ma attorno alla piscine ho notato che la maggiorparte delle persone non erano ospiti dell'hotel.per ultimo, in un 5 stelle , non ho mai visto che il Wi-Fi della stanza fosse a pagamento e che nelle zone comuni ( hall-bar -ristorante) e' sufficente chiedere una password che permetteva di navigare gratuitamente per 8 ore.e veniva data a qualsiasi persona , anche senza dimostrare che si era ospiti della struttura
Date: Date of stay: February 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: One of the best places I have ever stayed in
Review Content: The best staff, bar, swimming pool, rooms, and facilities I have probably ever stayed in.0 complaints, and maybe a very minor one would be location. Though the location I think is perfect it is still within a reasonable walking distance from interesting places.I have no idea how this is not the #1 place in Windhoek but if this isn't the #1 then I really want to visit those other places because it is incredible how they can be higher than this.I believe most people's main complaint would be the price and I'm not sure about that since fortunately I had hhonors points to pay for my stay.

Name: Not Quite Ready for Prime-Time When We Visited (September 2014), But Real Possibilities!
Review Content: The hotel was brand-new, and seemed not quite fully ready for prime time at the time we were there. The building is most impressive architecturally, with great design inside and out.                  Our room was, nonetheless, in some ways, daunting in terms of a rather confusing layout and a very modern bathroom that lacked real privacy (all-glass walls!). It definitely took some getting     used-to, and, to be fair, our one-night visit did not really allow for that. I would guess that a visit now or in the near future would be a better and more complete experience.

Name: Good Hotel, Good Location
Review Content: My trip was for business, where wifi is essential. The rate for wifi is extremely expensive but since the hotel was having problems they waived the fair which was a big bonus since the price to pay is very expensive. Definitely has alot more to offer than most of the hotels in Windhoek. Would return.

Name: Hilton Hotel Namibia
Review Content: Great hotel, everything is perfect except that they dont have free Wifi, you pay for it and that shouldn't be the case in 2014. The club downstairs music can be distrubing but nothing to worry about. I would stay here again!

Name: Excellent location for city!
Review Content: We were warmly welcomed to this beautiful hotel. We loved our stay (with our 1 year old baby). The room was spacious. Lovely bathroom. Breakfast very extensive and good personal service. Stunning roof pooldeck, just breath taking.

Review Content: Leider WI-FI kostenpflichtig! Wichtigste Sehensw√ºrdigkeiten zu Fuss erreichbar.  Top Servic. Sehr freundliches Personal.  Alle Bedienelemente funktionierten einwandfrei. Sky Lodge  super Lage mit toller Aussicht.

Name: Very Nice Hotel
Review Content: I stayed here for 1 night in April on a short visit to Namibia. While I am not the biggest fan of Hilton's, I choose this hotel for its location and also, the fact that the competition didn't look great. I was initially a little weary after reading some previous reviews on this site, but I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised by the hotel and it exceeded my expectations.My room itself was very bright and spacious - it had everything I needed. The pool area was also very nice and I enjoyed at the bar overlooking the city - a very nice way to spend the late afternoon. It appeared to be a popular spot. The breakfast buffet was a typical Hilton affair - lots of choice and good quality.If I had one complaint, it would be a re-occuring Hilton one - lack of free wifi. The outrageous charge is impossible to justify today, yet you are left with no option but to pay it - as Hilton knows.
Date: Date of stay: April 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Review Content: Double rooms big and could easily accommodate two adults and our two young boys. Service was good and we enjoyed the rooftop sky bar and the pool. Very convenient in the heart of the city and easily found when driving in from the airport for the first time. Very good value for money!

Name: Lovely stay at Hilton
Review Content: Awesome stay! Service was excellent and the staff went the extra mile to ensure my business trip went smootly. I had some packages delivered 2 days before I was due to check in. When I checked in, shortly before midnight, the check-in staff had been informed about the packages and had it delivered to my room, in perfect condition. Will definitely go back for a holiday stay.
Date: Date of stay: February 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great location, professional staff, lovely rooms
Review Content: I was in Windhoek for a conference and was booked here.  The hotel is handsome and the rooms very, very nice.  Staff was helpful and professional at all times.  A lovely common area in the lobby, with inside and outside seating.  Location is superb and you can walk to all locations in downtown Windhoek from this hotel.  Would highly recommend it.
Date: Date of stay: October 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hilton Windhoek
Review Content: very average i expected a lot more from the Hilton Hotel group as a Brand , i was not collected from the airport as pre arranged and my bar fridge had a half drunk cold drink in it and was not stock when paying a premium price i expect to receive this service.
Date: Date of stay: December 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Beautiful Hotel and very nice Staff
Review Content: I had reservations to stay in the Hilton but there was a labor strike so I was put in another hotel down the street.  When I arrived in Windhoek I was notified that the strike was over and I was back in the Hilton.  The hotel is beautiful and so was my room.  My room was located on the 6th floor with a great view of the city.  Everything in the room worked and I did not have any issues or problems with my accommodations.  The staff was very friendly and polite.  The hotel has an excellent breakfast buffet.  I ate in the main restaurant three nights and the steaks and braised pork belly were excellent!  On the 9th floor is a roof top bar call the sky bar.  The views were wonderful and it is a great place to watch the sunset.I am not sure if it is true or not but I charged one of my meals to my room and I let the waitress know I was leaving a tip on the room tab.  She told me not to do that because the management takes ALL the tips that are left that way and on credit cards and divides them among all the waiters.  If this is true, I am not happy because my tip is for the individual that waits on me...not those that did not provide me the service.  I ended up bringing her cash the next day so she would get it.Also, I had to pay N$185 ($18.50 US) per day (24 hours) for WiFi.  This was crazy!  Come on Hilton.
Date: Date of stay: December 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A much better standard of a Hilton, with some service issues
Review Content: Located in the centre of town, this Hilton is ideally placed to get around Windhoek. When arriving by car, ensure you park under ground at the hotel and not what seems to be the car park next door in the open ground floor parking. You drive up to the hotel where the front desk can order taxis etc and helps with the bags. The reception area is large and impressive, the front desk staff on checkin and check out were very helpful. I was lucky being a gold member I got upgraded to the president suite so I can't comment on the rooms but my colleague said they were nice and new. On the first floor is the restaurant and bar area. Service in the bar was not great, closed at 11.30pm for last orders and at 11pm they would not even do coffees. There is a wine room which smells like it is also a smoking room and an outside bar area.The restaurant was large and looked impressive but we ate out. The room doors all face inwards in an american style hotel and have views outwards across the city. On the top floor is the exec lounge which is very small and with 10 people in there, there are no more seats. It has a fairly decent gym at the top, a roof pool with about 20 beds which is nice and a roof sky bar with glass protection from the wind. Overall a nice new modern hotel and worth staying at.
Date: Date of stay: November 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: -personal

Name: Good, but pricey for what it is.
Review Content: The place is good: very clean rooms, great terrace bar and dining area. Modern, friendly staff. Location is a little isolated and far from fun dining areas. It is a good stop to start or end a Namibian trip. But it is difficult to get excited by this place.The reception area is always busy and you must patiently wait your turn. The immediate surrounding of the hotel are rather drab. \\Bottom line: It is OK, very expensive for what it is. You still feel like you are in a stopover at the airport.
Date: Date of stay: April 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Sundown
Review Content: The rooms are very well designed and comfortable. Modern and clean. Roof terrace is great for sunbathing in the day and then watching the sunset from the bar. Get your spot early as its not so big. If and when I go back, I'll book in here.
Date: Date of stay: August 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Best option in Windhoek
Review Content: Spent one night at the Hilton before the start of our safari. The hilton is the only upscale option in town. Very nice and brand new Hilton- opened only 2 years ago. Staff was consistently nice and helpful. The hotel spoiled us by upgrading us to the diplomatic suite which is the size of an apartment. Very nice fixtures and decoration.  We enjoyed the executive club which bas great food. We also had drinks at the rooftop bar from which we enjoyed the view and the cool breeze at night.
Date: Date of stay: August 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: BUSINESS TRIP
Review Content: The country of Namibia has a population of only 2 million and this must be borne in mind. Was on a business trip with an overnight stay.Best hotel in town, excellent food, clean, very good service. Bathroom slippers required for the wet area tiles.
Date: Date of stay: July 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Fabulous newish hotel in town
Review Content: Having stayed at the Kalahari Sands on a previous visit 6 years ago, I was pleased to see a new hotel in town. I was certainly not disappointed. From the moment you walk into the reception, through to the detail in the standard hotel rooms, everything is as you would wish it to be, and very nicely designed. The Sky Bar and pool (more plunge than swimming) are a nice touch on the roof. Only downside was the organisation for the  meeting room - very slow to organise water and internet which was included in the package, but I got an immediate apology from the hotel as soon as I submitted their own questionnaire. Would certainly stay there again.
Date: Date of stay: July 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice & clean
Review Content: One night stay before our safari. Very clean quiet. We had lunch at the sky bar and had quick service with great view of the city.Very friendly service and coffee in morning was great!Gift shop employees also very friendly and helpful.
Date: Date of stay: May 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Business Hotel of Choice
Review Content: The Hilton is the business hotel of choice in Windhoek as it has an excellent location in the Center of town. However, the hotel's Business Center needs to be re-opened as soon as possible for the convenience of the business traveller.
Date: Date of stay: May 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: superb
Review Content: Excellent friendly staff, and great accomodations! Cafe downstairs is lovely (although Breakfast was only 3/10). Great convenient spot to hold conferences and meetings!Stunning roof top pool & bar, thank you for a lovely stay!

The bed simply swallows you feels like you are in the clouds. It offers total peace even from loud neighboring rooms. The Executive lounge is extra-ordinary.

Name: Guter Stopp mitten in der Stadt
Review Content: Das Hotel wurde Anfang 2011 er√∂ffet und liegt so zentral, dass man sein Auto in der Tiefgarage lassen kann (5‚Ç¨ pro Tag) und fast alles zu Fu√ü unternehmen kann. Die Standardzimmer sind sehr ger√§umig und modern eingerichtet mit 2 Kingsize-Betten und einem sch√∂nen Badbereich. Deutsches Fernsehen wird angeboten. Wir waren schon einmal hier vor 18 Monaten und dieses Mal etwas entt√§uscht, da das sch√∂ne Abendbuffet nicht mehr stattfindet. Es gibt eine gro√üe Speisenkarten mit durchaus ordentlichen Preisen f√ºr die Menus. Die Getr√§nkepreise sind abgehoben. Das Fr√ºhst√ºcksbuffet ist allerdings vom Feinsten und dort klappt auch der Service.Unversch√§mt teuer ist das WLAN mit 15‚Ç¨ pro Tag! Man kann auch nur  f√ºr 7‚Ç¨ eine Stunde online gehen, sich aber dabei nur einmal einloggen. Das ist Internet-Steinzeit und unw√ºrdig f√ºr ein Hilton-Hotel.Der Pool mit Bar in der 9.Etage ist zwar sehr sch√∂n, aber auch sehr stark benutzt. Das zu warme Wasser ist sehr stark mit Chemikalien versetzt, so dass sofort die Augen tr√§nen.
