Name: Very good hotel. Lovely staff
Review Content: It's a great business hotel. It's well located. Well appointed.THe internet is very very slooooooooowwwww.The staff is lovely. Smiling and friendly. Loved the Skybar view and their hamburger! The drinks are so so (too sweet). And they could have better wine selection.
Date: Date of stay: February 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Best in Windhoek.....slim pickings though
Review Content: Nice modern Chinese built hotel (looks like it is in Beijing)....very modern, but Chinese built, so ...falling down a little already!Exposed wires in my bathroom, no security lock on the door, flooding shower, etc...but all LOOKED nice. Food was horrible and never correct in the restaurant or room service (both involved a nice 2 hour wait for the wrong food, which was BAD), but you know what? This is Africa and this is the best hotel in Windhoek, so frankly I dont care!I was just happy for a cool, western hotel - and the staff are superb and so nice. Free parking too!I especially want to say that Mario and Mark in the executive lounge are stellar! Promotion to management should be on the books.Improve the food and the little things and this place would be a gem. At least it is cheap and clean and safe!
Date: Date of stay: December 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Three Nights in Windhoek
Review Content: We recently enjoyed a Wilderness Great Namibian Journey with a great guide Jerimia, everyone knows him, and had the pleasure of spending three separate nights at the Hilton.The staff were exceptional and the rooms more than comfortable. On the third night, the night before we flew to Zambia, we were upgraded. What a wonderful surprise. Pity we hadn't had more time in our room...ah suite. It has a great breakfast and dining choices. The Hilton is in a great location right in the middle of the action and the better restaurants in town. As the ads say: we wouldn't stay anywhere else. We're fans.
Date: Date of stay: September 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Convenient and clean
Review Content: Stayed for 2 nights, very comfortable rooms and very nice to stay in. The hotel has nice amenities and the pool area upstairs is very nice. I used the room service and the food was great.  Staff were ok however could have been a little more helpful. Would stay again, if I got the same deal, as it is safe and comfortable.
Date: Date of stay: July 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: The Executive Lounge and its staff really make this place - without them it's just so-so...
Review Content: I stayed at the Hilton while in Windhoek on business.  It's a very nice new hotel - everything you expect of a five star place in terms of facilities - so it all looks very stylish and luxurious...The service level at the hotel is inconsistent, however.  I give them a five based on the service in the executive lounge and the staff that work in the lounge (also the concierge is excellent and the reception service is ok).  These are the people I mainly dealt with - they get a five - everyone else doesn't deserve that, but as I said I didn't really deal with everyone else too much...The executive lounge is on the top floor (along with a pool and related bar).  It has a private reception desk and staff.  The staff in the lounge are excellent.... there is no other word...They remember your name, what you like to eat or drink, they are welcoming, attentive, hospitable and can do most things for you without you having to deal with the public reception desk.  They serve cocktails and some light food complimentary in the lounge every evening, and they also do breakfast there - so if you go to this hotel you should definitely get an executive room so you have lounge access. The service in the hotels public restaurants and bars is not good.....On my first morning, I went down to the main restaurant for breakfast - it was about 8:45am.While there were ample staff on duty, many of the tables were dirty - they had been occupied and not reset.  The breakfast was a buffet setup laid out in front of an open kitchen.  I was very surprised to find that the buffet line was out of scrambled eggs and sausages - plus some other things.... at first I thought i had my time wrong and they must be closing for the day!!There were two cooks in the kitchen but the entire time I was there I don't think those dishes were replenished....A restaurant manager was nowhere in sight and the staff seemed mainly occupied with socializing with one another....I had a similar experience with the hotel's 'sports bar' one evening.  The service was inattentive and slow despite their being ample people on duty.... Needless to say I didn't really go to the hotels main restaurants or public bars after those experiences!!Anyway, as I said, get an executive room, use the executive lounge facilities and rely on the employees there and you will have a fine time - I recommend the hotel (provided you have the executive room).
Date: Date of stay: June 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: I'll be back!
Review Content: Booked a very last-minute trip when my husband was granted some unexpected days off work.Arranged transfer from the airport through the hotel which was punctual and comfortable.We had a room in the "tower" part of the hotel. Very spacious, clean and modern with a superb king-size bed and nice sitting area with comfy chairs and a table. More than adequate wardrobe and drawer space.Loved the bathroom with it's "rain" shower. We chose not to make use of the huge bathtub ( trying to be "green" and conserve water ) but it was tempting!The breakfast buffet was among the best I have sampled anywhere. Good selection of hot and cold food and most importantly, really good coffee, a rarity in many hotels imo. Dinner was good value for money also (with a bread and butter pudding to die for!)Everywhere appeared clean and well maintained. Service was always with a smile and help readily and willingly given if required.Well done Hilton Windhoek......can't wait for our next visit!
Date: Date of stay: April 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A very good upmarket business hotel.
Review Content: We stayed one night at the end of our Namibia trip ‚Äì and to be honest the only reason we did was the exceptional room rate I got. The room was great and the rooftop pool perfect for chilling out after the drive down. Our arrival from 2 weeks travelling coincided with the expected arrival of the President to visit a conference being held at the hotel. The speed with which our (very dirty) car was removed and we were whisked down the red carpet and out of sight without in any way feeling aggrieved says much for the tact and humour of the staff. Well recommended ‚Äì if the price is right.
Date: Date of stay: November 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: When I return to Windhoek, this is where I will stay
Review Content: Very comfortable hotel in the middle of Windhoek. Friendly and helpful staff, the business center is really good. Very nice bar with fantastic view from the rooftop and extra +++ for the breakfast! Try the spa, very good indeed.
Date: Date of stay: July 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Chic style in Namibia?
Review Content: If you are looking for an Africa experience, skip it. But it you want a true 4 star westernized-urban business-like hotel in downtown Windhoek then go for it. Did this whole place just drop into Namibia? Very lovely modern setting, room decoration is strange with bathtub open to the whole room. Roof top deck is fantastic, but small.  BEWARE of flaky wifi service that only works in some seats in the lobby, does not work in the rooms or roof top deck. Internet in the room is plug in...no plug on an iPad or smart phone so worthless for me. And they charge for internet access - annoying.
Date: Date of stay: July 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Robert
Review Content: Great hotel and great service. Not quite 5 star but really good value for money.We had a room with it's own garden, like being home away from home.The service was excellent and the covid protocol strictly adhered to and all in all we spent 21 nights there and had different meals all really good including the local food on offer.
Date: Date of stay: November 2020This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: An ageing Hilton, but definitely a good option.
Review Content: Windhoek doesn't have much high end hotel space.  This is one of the few options, and by international standards it is cheap - $150 per room level.Pro- big rooms- Executive lounge is excellent if you have access- Rooftop pool, gym and bar is a good space- we stayed 2x in one week, and the second time upgraded to the Presidential Suite.  It was not more than twice a normal room, and hilariously lavish.  Upgrading your room here is worth it.- loved the breakfast juice bar (choose raw fruit and veg for your custom juice)Cons- restaurant does not have great ambience (although the wagyu beef is delicious and reasonably priced)- the rooms are tired,  but perfectly fine.   I can see why a refurb is not viable at the v low room rates in Windhoek.That I stayed the 2nd time in one week proves I  recommend.
Date: Date of stay: August 2024This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Poor service give it amiss
Review Content: Clean hotel, good breakfast. Service on check in and the sky at was shocking. We had to stays here on arrive to Namibia and on departure. The first one was ok, bags taken and reception quick. The service on the sky bar was slow to the point that we decided not to stop. On our return for a day stay, no one to help with bags to the room, check in took 30 min with a wait to get served and the sky bar was shocking. Not open on time, had to ask for service back at reception and the. Limited availability of the menu. For 100 GBP a night this needs sorting
Date: Date of stay: January 2022This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Awesome Hospitality
Review Content: The hotel is located at the heart of the beautiful city of Windhoek which makes it very convenient to get around. Most of the historic sites and the tourist attraction in the City are within rich. The rooms are so tidy and spacious. The highspeed internet makes working from  the hotel very comfortable. The staff are charming. The food is really good. The skybar is a place to be. You see all the corners of Windhoek  while enjoying a cold one. I highly recommend Hilton Hotel and Resorts in Windhoek. You will most likely get awesome hospitality.
Date: Date of stay: November 2023This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great Place to stay
Review Content: The place is located in the center of Windhoek.The rooms are very nice although a bit of renovation would be required.The service is very good from the reception to the restaurant. A nice spot is the Sky Bar on the 9th floor. The service food like pizza and the biggest Hamburger I ever had in my life. All is reasonable priced and the food is very tasty.Highly recommendable.
Date: Date of stay: February 2020This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Excellent hotel
Review Content: Excellent facilities. Sky bar, gym all excellent. Rooms have big spaces and bed. Showers with modern and great looking designs. This hotel is great for both business and leisure as well as family. Loved the staff friendliness and their willingness to help and go extra mile.Break fast is top notch dinner I opted for Buffet which was very good and well priced.
Date: Date of stay: November 2022This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great stay and great staff
Review Content: A wonderful experience. They upgraded me for being a gold member and it exceeded my expectations. Excellent food and drinks at the executive lounge and great room service. Location is perfect for walking around downtown near the Craft Center. Every employee was polite and respectful. Glad I stayed there.
Date: Date of stay: December 2021This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Excellent value for your money
Review Content: A very enjoyable stay, nice staff, good food, great massages! It¬¥s central, confortable and everybody is always happy to help you.The food is great and not pricey. Will definitely come back to enjoy a few more days of city stay1
Date: Date of stay: October 2022This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Unm√∂glicher Service
Review Content: Ich wollte dieses Hotel buchen; das scheint unm√∂glich. Eine Anfrage per Internet wurde auch nach 3 Tagen noch nicht beantwortet. Per Telefon nicht zu erreichen; die angegebene Nummer ist dauernd besetzt. Leider kann man so die scheinbar positiven Erfahrungen der anderen Nutzer nicht machen. Ich nenne sowas schlicht unm√∂glichen Service.
Date: Date of stay: January 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: The Very Good and Very Bad
Review Content: It is simple really. I stayed at the Hilton Windhoek in November 2012. The hotel is modern, with excellent rooms and facilities. However, I was asked to pay N$185 per night for WiFi access, which I was prepared to do, as stated on the Hilton's website. When I got to the hotel and tried to access the internet, I realized that it is PER DEVICE. In other words, if you have a smart phone and a computer, you had to pay N$185 per device, per night, so that would be N$370 per night. Needless to say if you have any other wireless device, it would be N$185 more per device, per night.I could not believe that in 2012 a brand such as the Hilton was misleading customers in offering WiFi broadband, but when you get to the hotel it is per device, which, in my view, defeats the purpose and the average person who stays at the hilton will have at least two devices.I have asked the Hilton to make that policy clear on its website, hopefully they will do so.Outside of that the hotel was very good. Some staff needs further training, but they were always polite and tried to address my needs.
Date: Date of stay: November 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Possibly the worst service ever
Review Content: While the hotel is nice enough, the staff have really soured the experience from the word go.Despite being a Hilton Honors member, I felt that my patronage was not appreciated and the lack of friendly and professional courtesy has left me feeling like I never want to support the Hilton brand ever again.To top it, the food is very average and expensive.
Date: Date of stay: November 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Terrible stay in a Hilton. Don't book it!
Review Content: I visited this Hotel in March, on the way to Namibia. It was really terrible, so terrible that it was almost funny. First, we arrived with the car and dropped the car to the valet parking... but none of the valet had a driving license. The took time to find a guy with a license to move the car. Then the room was not clean at all, the shower was disgusting, we even found rubbish in the wastebasket! We reported it, but no one took care. At 11pm, we decided to take a drink. The bar in the first floor just closed, but they asked us to visit the second bar in the 9th floor. Arrived there, they told us that they'd close as well. Result: Not possible to take a drink at 11pm... not 3am, 11pm! Incredible. But it was not the worse. Don't expect to sleep even 10 mins in this terrible hotel, because on each side, you have the redlight with the noisy system for blind pedestrian, and you get a beep-beep every 30 seconds in the whole night. Avoid it!
Date: Date of stay: March 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Irref√ºhrende Werbung
Review Content: Das Einchecken war professionell. Das gesamte Service-Personal ist hervorragend ausgebildet und serviceorientiert. Unser Mietwagen wurde in die Tiefgarage (5,- ‚Ç¨ pro Nacht) gefahren und bei der Abreise wieder zur Weiterreise bereitgestellt. Wir hatten ein Gartenzimmer mit 60 m¬≤ gebucht, mussten aber feststellen, dass es sich bei dem Zimmer um ein normales Hotelzimmer mit 30 m¬≤ handelte. Die dazugeh√∂rige Terrasse mit ebenfalls 30 m¬≤ wurde bei der Gesamtgr√∂√üe dazugerechnet. So war das in der Hotelzimmerbeschreibung nicht vermerkt. Zimmer funktional eingerichtet, Abnutzungserscheinungen nicht zu √ºbersehen. Das W-Lan funktionierte einwandfrei. Die Club-Lounge in der obersten Etage ist relativ klein und bietet nur wenigen G√§sten Platz. Die angebotenen Speisen (18.00 bis 20.00 Uhr) waren in Ordnung, ebenfalls der Wein. Das Fr√ºhst√ºcks-B√ºfett war nicht zu beanstanden. Das Hotel befindet sich direkt in der Innenstadt und alle Sehensw√ºrdigkeiten sind fu√ül√§ufig erreichbar. Fazit: Das neuwertige Hotel mit gutem Service und einem hervorragenden Preis-/Leistungsverh√§ltnis kann weiterempfohlen werden.
Date: Date of stay: February 2020This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Mostly very good
Review Content: The hotel is easy to drive to from international airport and it has secure parking on site at cost of ND 60 per day.  It is within walking distance of National Museum of Namibia, although we were not sure it would be comfortable to walk around in evening.  There is a restaurant on site. There is a Super Spa Shop within an easy 5 -10 mins drive for anyone wanting to get provisions before setting off on a trip ithrough Namibia.   It is also very easy to access the B1 down to Sossusvlei and up to Etosha from here. Sky Bar on roof is an excellent open air location for a sundowner. Seating.....and a small plunge type pool (although possible to do some widths if no-one else is in it).   There was also spa and gym, which we did not use so cannot comment. Room (deluxe) was very large.  Equipped with fridge, aircon, hairdryer, toiletries, iron and board, a safe. We stayed here 2 nights at the start of our trip at the beginning of Sept 2019 and one night at the end (19th).  The first two nights the staff were exceptional.  They made our first experience of Namibia a very positive and welcoming one. Zeroline on reception needs a special mention - she is an excellent ambassador for Hilton and did a fantastic job of making our stay enjoyable. Also the woman who supervised the executive lounge on our first two nights (2 and 3rd sept).   On our return on 19th the staff were polite but did not provide as much of a welcoming experience. We were a bit surprised when the executive lounge was all packed not long after 8pm on our third night, as we were under the impression drinks would still be available until 10pm??Breakfast is buffet style with lots of choice. Eggs and omelette cooked on request. Other hot items, including pancakes. Fresh squeezed juices of several types. Pastries, continental breakfast items, toast, cereal, bottled water, tea, coffee. Served early and until about 10.30am.  There were no problems getting seated on arrival at the restaurant. There is some outside seating area and place where you can get a coffee and cake during the day. Overall I would recommend Hilton in Windhoek.  I haven‚Äôt given it 5 stars as there were some small areas for further improvement - chipped cup in room, small points where room beginning to look slightly tired in places, such as stained carpet, etc,  lift bell could be heard in room and some noisy guests banging doors late at night (although 2 out of 3 nights guests were quiet), staff friendliness was not consistent over our two stays.
Date: Date of stay: September 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Theft
Review Content: I have resided many times in this hotel. Unfortunately it gets worse. Bad customer service. Rip off and the waitresses sign bills on my room even though I did not consume it. That is theft. After room cleaning they do not close my room so that anybody can walk in my room. The car service offered is a complete rip off and the drivers do their own deals with the hotel guests. Complaints at the reception do not help. Also this old white manager (didn't get his name) is completely useless. Never again Hilton hotel in Windhoek. The Thule Hotel will do it.
Date: Date of stay: February 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great hotel in downtown Windhoek
Review Content: Just back from a trip to Namibia.  Stayed at the Hilton in downtown Windhoek on 2 separate occasions after arriving and again just before leaving the country.  Both were great experiences.  It is a beautiful hotel in a great location accessible to major tourist sites such as the Namibia Craft Centre.  I had a ‚Äúgarden‚Äù room the second stay which had a beautiful, desert-landscaped garden on my balcony.  Staff were very nice and helpful.  Rooms are well appointed.  Laundry service good.  Executive lounge on the 9th floor was great with breakfast and a light dinner including alcohol provided.  Prices are very reasonable.  Definitely recommend it!
Date: Date of stay: October 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Ok
Review Content: F√ºr das Hotel sprich das sehr freundliche Personal und die Lage, auch wenn es in Windhoek nicht wirklich viel zu sehen gibt. √Ñrgerlich war, das das ‚Äúdo-not-disturb‚Äù Zeichen mehrfach nicht beachtet wurde, diesen Fauxpas macht auch ein vielfaches ‚Äúsorry‚Äù nicht wett. Das Zimmer, das ich mir selbst √ºber die HHonors App ausgesucht habe, kann ich nicht empfehlen (812). Das Wifi ist qu√§lend langsam, am ehesten noch auf dem WC nutzbar. Direkt neben der Zimmert√ºr befindet sich der Eingang zum Housekeeping, der nat√ºrlich gut frequentiert wird. Daf√ºr sind Aussicht, Air condition und Zimmergr√∂sse sehr gut. Ein B√ºgeleisen ist vorhanden, aber leider konnte ich keinen Schuhanzieher finden. Das Fr√ºhst√ºck ist durchaus ansprechend, die Executive Lounge in der 9. Etage nett und ausreichend best√ºckt. Die viel gelobte rooftop Bar wird sp√§testens zur blauen Stunde sehr voll und sehr laut, nicht nur durch die musikalische Beschallung. In Ruhe ein Glas Wein trinken kann man dort nicht. Die Taxipreise von und zum Flughafen sind unterschiedlich. Am Flughafen steht gleich au√üerhalb des Geb√§udes ein M√§nnlein mit Weste und Schreibblock, der das Ziel zu den Akten nimmt und sich einen der Fahrer greift. Ihm wird alles erkl√§rt, auch der bei Ankunft zu zahlende Betrag von 300NAD (ca. 22‚Ç¨) - ohne Diskussion. Das muss der Fahrer beim Mann mit der Weste quittieren, mit Unterschrift nat√ºrlich. Vom Hotel zur√ºck werden 358NAD f√§llig, weil man von einem der im Haus arbeitenden Hertz Mitarbeiter gefahren wird. Das geht sehr schnell und freundlich, auch hier bitte quittieren mittels Unterschrift - m√∂glichst mit kurzem Feedback! Fahrzeit 40-50‚Äô
Date: Date of stay: March 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A typical Hilton experience - good but with one bad episode!
Review Content: The hotel is about a 40 minute drive from the airport. Staff is friendly and the rooms were clean and neat. The hotel was definitely great value for money. I only had an issue with the airport drop. Initially, I had booked a drop for 4 am. However, the night before, I decided to leave an hour earlier for the airport i.e. at 3 am. So, I went to the hotel reception at 11 pm and requested the reception to reschedule my airport drop for 3 am instead of 4. Despite a long conversation, the hotel reception told me that it was not possible to reschedule the time as the drivers and the transport company's manager would be sleeping and they could not wake them up. I found this absurd. I have always been used to 24/7 service, and especially expect a 5 star hotel to be able to manage such a simple request such a rescheduling an airport drop by one hour, but they didn't. Eventually, I had to request another colleague of mine and squeeze into his car (which was leaving at 3 am) with all our bags, and go to the airport. I definitely felt quite panicky about missing my flight, since the hotel was least cooperative with my request. In terms of the property rating, i'm still giving this hotel a good mark. However, this episode definitely left a bad taste in the mouth. Lesson is: at the Hilton, Windhoek you must plan very well in advance about your airport drops.
Date: Date of stay: July 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Tr√®s tr√®s bien - une r√©f√©rence √† Windhoek
Review Content: S√©jour d'affaire √† Windhoek; chamber executive avec terasse tr√®s spacieuse. Tr√®s belles finitions. Personnel tr√®s sympa et agreeable. Bon restaurant; je conseille le filet de steak: un regal. Bonne selection de vins aussi. Le retsaurant √† Sushis est √©galement d√©licieux. Executive lounge au top!

Name: Conforme au standing
Review Content: Chambre propre et assez spacieuse, personnel tr√®s professionnel, l'h√¥tel est bien situ√© sur la route de l'a√©roport international. On peut balader en ville sans probl√®me. Le sky bar est sympa avec la piscine. Par contre l'internet est payant et lent. Mais, bon point, au moment de payer en quittant l'h√¥tel j'en ai parl√© et ils m'ont annul√© le paiement.
Date: Date of stay: April 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Sehr komfortabel und super Lage
Review Content: Alle Sehensw√ºrdigkeiten fu√ül√§ufig erreichbar. Hotel selbst sehr sch√∂n.Zimmer sch√∂n gro√ü mit Dusche und Badewanne und tollem Blick auf die Independence Ave. Au√üergew√∂hnlich gutes und reichhaltiges Fr√ºhst√ºcksbuffet - sogar Obsts√§fte kann man sich je nach Gusto zusammenstellen und frisch pressen lassen. Tolle Dachterasse mit super Aussicht √ºber Windhoek, Pool und sch√∂ne Liegen mit Handtuch, ebenso kann man dort gut sitzen bei Snacks oder einem Drink und die Aussicht genie√üen.Service generell auch nett und gut mit einen Ausnahme .- die Sportsbar KALABAR.Hier ist der Service katastrophal - alles dauert sehr lange und man hat st√§ndig das Gef√ºhl, man st√∂rt das Personal ihren privaten Unterhaltungen. Der Gipfel an Unversch√§mtheit war, als ich eine Einladung f√ºr 2 gratis Drinks vom Hotel hatte - der erste wurde gerade noch so etwas unwillig nach langer Zeit serviert und dann wurde ich konsequent ignoriert als ich den 2. bestellen wollte. Als eine andere Kellnerin die f√ºr mich zust√§ndige aufmerksam machte, dass ich noch etwas bestellen m√∂chte, gab diese laut und deutlich zur Antwort - " I am busy now".....Netterweise war am Nebentisch ein Angestellter mit Namen Erich, der meine Irritation bemerkte und als ich ihm den Vorfall schilderte, meinte er, so ginge es nicht und hat meinen Drink organisiert. Leider habe ich den Namen der soo freundlichen Kellnerin vergessen sonst h√§tte ich das Hotel auch noch direkt informiert.
Date: Date of stay: June 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: So Much Potential But So Many Problems...
Review Content: After checking in to the Hilton for a couple days before heading out for a safari, my wife and I had so much hope for an uneventful stay as we were celebrating our 33rd anniversary.  An impressive facility and probably one of the finest hotels in Windhoek (if not THE finest), Christian checked us in at the front desk and was the epitomy of professionalism, acknowledging my elite status with Hilton as well as recognizing our anniversary, which had been noted on the reservation.  He was complimented by Victor, who took our bags to the room and was extremely pleasant and articulate.  The evening passed without incident but we weren't quite as lucky the following day. The first problem was the internet with an outrageous charge of $18 but slow as molasses and certainly not worth the price.  Since there are no instructions in the room, I plugged the ethernet cable into my laptop and signed in without problem, but actually gave up on trying to check my email after waiting for 15 minutes without being able to bring up a single website.  I finally called the front desk and was told that they would have their internet technician check it out and call me back.  I waited another 30 minutes before calling again and got an apology and a promise that they would send someone right up.  Another 15 minutes passed and I finally went down to the front desk and Aubrey came out of the back office and followed me to my room.  He immediately diagnosed the problem as being the ethernet cable which needed to be unplugged after I signed on and was connected to wi-fi.  But how would I have known that without instructions and why couldn't someone just tell me that when I called if that's all it took? Aubrey apologized and asked me to call him directly if I had any more internet problems, which I didn't.But, shortly thereafter my wife realized that housekeeping had failed to replenish the soap or leave bath clothes when they cleaned the room so I called housekeeping and was again assured that both would be sent right up, to no avail.  We finally gave up and left for a couple of hours thinking that the soap and bath clothes would certainly be in the room when we got back.  NOT!  So I called again and the young lady who answered sensed my frustration and apologized and said she'd leave her post at the desk and bring them up herself as soon as she could, which she did.  But, again, why does everything take at least two calls?The only bright spot other than Christian and Victor at checkin was Francy who patiently worked with me to solve a problem with our tour and literally saw it through to the end and a timely and successful resolution.  In conclusion, this property has so much potential and a great staff but they just need more direction and customer service training. As a former hotelier and Director of Finance for Marriott Hotels International and Choice Hotels I know the importance of one call resolution of guest problems and complaints if the property intends to keep its clientele coming back again and giving recommendations to friends, colleagues and relatives.  But apparently the management at the Windhoek Hilton thinks that they are the best game in town so customer retention isn't an issue.  I can only hope they're right.  We are leaving for safari tomorrow but will be back for an overnight stay in a week and can only hope that everything goes off without a hitch. Regardless, I can't say that I could recommend this property as I Can't be confident that the service issues that we've experienced and others have expressed will be addressed and rectified.
Date: Date of stay: July 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good but some drawbacks
Review Content: Good.The rooms lovely. Spacious. Great beds. The interior very modern and just up to my liking. The staff very helpful and always alert. The breakfast amazing. Loved the freshly squeezed fruit juices. The roof bar was also very nice.Not so good:Sometimes the staff seemed to be confused. Booked transportation to the airport. Found out it was not booked. Booked again. Not booked. We managed the third time. The lunch order was not correct. I ordered a burger without majo, got it. Sent it out. Got it back without majo and without other staff, that I wanted. And the meat was cold....not acceptable for a five star hotel. They charged me twice for the same laundry. No excuse. Overall, I wouldn't rate this hotel as a five star one. Rather a four star.However, I will probably come back
Date: Date of stay: October 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A nice hotel lacking in management..
Review Content: A great hotel with some wonderful staff however it lacked Management and had some fundamental issues....I asked 5 times to setup a business account promised phone calls that never happened eventually gave up asking.  I moved several times in my three week stay firstly as my room number was given out by the night staff to a business associate I didn't want to see, other times for flooding rooms... It took 4 attempts to fix the rain shower not forgetting my daily room key change due to poor technology.Would I stay at the hotel again..... Probably not
Date: Date of stay: October 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: What a joke
Review Content: If you love horrible customer service and none of your concerns addressed like asking three times for extra towels for your kids, asking 2 different people to replace a bathroom light bulb and it never getting done in 3 days, or getting stuck in the elevator for over 30 minutes, or carpet cleaning outside of your room at 10pm, or waiting forever for food at the sky bar or even ketchup or to even order for that matter‚Ä¶..then this is the place for you. The breakfast is great but that was it.
Date: Date of stay: May 2022This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Not equivalent to a 5 star
Review Content: There was some really good things like friendly staff. But breakfast selection is extremely poor and they make you pay extra for an americano and the actual filter coffee is horrible. The housekeeping also wasn't grand and up to standards of 5 star. Won't stay here again.
Date: Date of stay: December 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: World traveler
Review Content: We stayed here overnight on our way to northern Namibia between flights. We arrived at about 6pm and went up to the sky bar for a drink and dinner before an early night as we had to catch an early flight the next morning. We purchased a drink and ordered a pizza as we thought that would be quick and easy.  This wasn‚Äôt the case. After an hour of waiting we told the bar staff that we had to go to bed early. We then rang room service when we returned to our room to get a pizza there. We were told that it would be a long wait so we then asked for a bowl of chips and we were told we would be charged extra for room service! I questioned this and made them aware of our experience at the bar. The surcharge was then dropped. I was willing to put that behind me as a one off bad experience.The next morning at 5am when we checked out we waited in line to check out as a trainee and another receptionist were slowly processing each person. To top it all off a customer pushed in front of me as he had to go and catch a plane!!! We were all in the boat! Surely they know that a lot of customers are in transit and catch early flights why put a trainee on at a busy time!I would expect much more from a hotel in this chain and as a result I will never stay at this chain again. I accept it was Namibia but surely Hilton hotels have a reputation to uphold world wide!
Date: Date of stay: May 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Disappointing Stay
Review Content: The shower was very cold, dirty regrigerator and the food quality is terrible.  Food took forever to serve and the waiters were not friendly, I hD to go get my own menu from the bar.  Disappointing stay
Date: Date of stay: March 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Comfortable but some problems
Review Content: Pros:Modern hotel in a central location. The room was clean, spacious and well equipped. Maid service was very efficient and items were replenished quickly.Breakfast was excellent and the selection was impressive. Staff at breakfast were polite and quick to assist. Coffee was good. The pool area was pleasant, clean and there were towels available. Food at the Skybar was tasty and well priced for a hotel bar. Cons:The wifi was very bad. It barely worked in the room and did not work at all at the pool. It would be impossible to work from this hotel. 1 out of 3 elevators worked, so the wait to get to the pool and/or your room could be upwards of 10 minutes. This was very frustrating. The pool area was pleasant but had very limited seating space. Non-residents are allowed to use the poo areal, which was frustrating, as it meant that residents could not get a seat. I don't think this is acceptable when you're paying a significant amount of money to stay there. Drinks at the Skybar were disappointing: the cocktails were bland and overpriced. Stick to the beers. Staff were hit and miss. Some staff were great, but a rude receptionist spoiled our check in. The hotel are reluctant to assist you in booking a local taxi/excursion and will only help secure their own services (which are grossly overpriced). All in all, could do better.
Date: Date of stay: January 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Diplomatic Treatment in the Diplomatic Suite
Review Content: Fantastic experience. Not much to do in Windhoek but the hotel and amenities were wonderful. We were in the Diplomatic suite, which was very spacious and comfortable. Definitely a winner. The Ekapi restaurant provided the most delicious meals - well done to the chef and kitchen staff. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. A wonderful, restful time spent in Windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: November 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Not worth the money spent.
Review Content: With half the price there are plaves in Windhoek which would delight you and Hilton isnt one of them. The food at Hilton is just there, cant be called the best in town. Rooms are smelly specially the linen, carpets are dirty. If you are looking for wifi, you cant run a netflix or skype over it as its from dialup days. Pity my idea and expectationa from Hilton are completely over now.
Date: Date of stay: August 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Niemals wieder!
Review Content: Wir haben viele Jahre bei jedem Aufenthalt in Windhoek im Hilton √ºbernachtet. Leider wird es immer schlechter. Buchungen werden nicht bearbeitet  - vielleicht vergessen? - der Service und die Sauberkeit sind unfassbar schlecht. Dieses Mal, als Kr√∂nung,  hatten wir wie immer ein Doppelzimmer gebucht,  ein Einzelzimmer bekommen... auch auf Beschwerden und Nachfragen reagiert niemand. Das Zimmer war nicht sauber, Dreck und Seifenreste vom Vorg√§nger in der Dusche, Blutflecke auf der Matratze, es war weder gesaugt, noch die Schr√§nke,  Spiegel,  Waschbecken geputzt.  S√§mtliche - eigentlich gl√§nzende Dinge - waren schmierig und klebrig.  Auf die Aussagen des Personals, insbesondere an der Rezeption,  kann man sich nicht verlassen.  Es wird alles versprochen, sich entschuldigt,  aber mehr passiert auch nicht. Urlauber werden beim Betreten des Gel√§ndes gescannt und gefilzt, die Prostituierten durchgewunken. Man kennt sich ja..... abends auf der Dachterrasse versuchen diese Damen dann ein gutes Gesch√§ft.... unfassbar f√ºr ein Hilton!  Es wundert mich sehr, dass an diesem Hotel noch der Name Hilton dranstehen darf. Wir werden nicht wiederkommen.

Name: Excellent location in Windhoek
Review Content: I stayed here for two nights prior to going on safari. The hotel is in an excellent location to explore Windhoek been right in the center of the city and within walking distance of the major attractions. The view from the rooftop bar and swimming pool are stunning and highly recommended for sundowners. The executive lounge is great with a great choice of snacks and drinks. I would definitely try and stay here again if I am back in town.
Date: Date of stay: June 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Il migliore in citt√† .
Review Content: Questo hotel √® forse l'unico con standard europei in tutta la citt√† , ottima piscina e ottima colazione , la camera con il giardino √® grande e ben arredata .Io Sky bar offre ottimi pranzi e ottimi cocktail a prezzi davvero vantaggiosi . Consigliato !
Date: Date of stay: July 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: It's all about location and service
Review Content: On a short family vacation to Windhoek and surroundings. Had some points to use and the reviews were mostly good. Hotel is situated in the city center. Modern style hotel with the expected amenities. Overall service was good and prompt. Room was decent size. Had to get used to the bathroom open concept (shower). Eating options good to above average for a hotel. Main restaurant provides √† la carte and evening buffet with themes. Breakfast buffet has a good selection and above average. Roof top bar and pool is one the main attractions of the hotel. Great view of the city and beyond. Main current drawback is the construction of the sister hotel right beside which generates some noise (not too much) but affects the view. Hotel is walking distance from a few attractions including Namibia craft center and craft cafe (worth trying), national museum and Christ church. A couple of restos in the area too. To go beyond best to use taxis or own transport. Overall highly recommended hotel. Will stay there again.
Date: Date of stay: April 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hilton Windhoek
Review Content: Great location great facility but very slow wifi, porters are not guest friendly. Breakfast was excellent and this was the highlight of my stay, towels in the room were dirty for such a hotel. Attend to those and you have a great facility
Date: Date of stay: December 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Not impressed, pretty basic
Review Content: positive: -downtown location-very friendly staff negative:-run down rooms although only 5 years old-bathrooms have no doors, you can watch your travel companion walk out of shower or brushing teeth etc. while you are in bed or watch TV.when bathroom lights switched on at night you have light in whole room- dirty plastic flower in bathroom is only decoration, even in "diplomatic suite" 600- windows inside the room very dirty, rain running from ceiling at window inside the room-windows can not be opened- rooms in tower annex have obstructed view due to "decoration" metal elements in fron of window- during my 2 day stay only 1 to 2 out of 3 elevators were working. according to other guests a problem existing for years. Annoying at evening when rooftop is a busy hotspot with local young crowd.-expensive wifi, when you book via travel agent and are not Hilton HHonors Member. (so you have to sign up and book at Hilton.com to get free wifi which you would get at any hostel for free anyway)- when you ask at front desk for a city taxi, they will use the Hertz Limousine service based in their lobby, even when there are taxi drivers around.All together I was rather disappointed. The Windhoek Hilton is the only Hilton I did visit not offering any special appreciation to Diamond Members. Not even any real flower, some sweet surprise or wine as other Hilton Hotels give to their most loyal customers.As recently the biggest shareholder of Hilton became chinese, I hope that the Hilton Windhoek does not only offer Furniture and Cosmetics made in China but also do bring over their Managers from China, were all Hilton Hotels are real 5 Star.A plastic flower in the room in a 5 Star Hotel definitely shows that the General Manager or his assistant never walk up their rooms.The dirty windows may also be a proof for that negligence.
Date: Date of stay: October 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Affordable!
Review Content: It is a business hotel designed and prepared for corporate events with some relaxing facilities.Nice environment with a fantastic rooftop with exotic drinks to appreciate a gorgeous african sunsite.The pool is lovely with a good view and the services were pretty good.
Date: Date of stay: August 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Truly an Oasis
Review Content: Spent two nights as we traveled to the northern Ondangwas region. Staff was wonderful in assisting us with shopping (luggage left in NYC). Food in the main restaurant really just mediocre but the friendliness of the staff made up for it. The roof top bar has spectacular views!!!
Date: Date of stay: November 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Still a great hotel
Review Content: This time I did not get a room with a view. Ask for one. I had a building sight. Around the hotel walking was difficult. I walked to and from the office and the pavements around the hotel are not great.The rooms are great. I will stay there again on my next visit.The breakfast did not disappoint. Excellent breakfast coffee (which is rare in most hotels).I had in room dining this time. The main was good, the desert was exceptional. I had a nut, brownie/mouse. Can't recall exactly what it was called. I don't have a sweat tooth and it was exceptional.

Name: Poor facilities but great rooms
Review Content: Had trouble checking in as their rooms were full. Had to use the "spa" area for freshening up before meeting - the shower room was dirty with empty shower gel bottles, hair, and stained towels. The rooftop bar is lovely though, with a nice outdoor pool, and the gym is open 24/7. However, most of the equipment is broken or in need of maintenance, but it's still good for a quick basic workout.The rooms are great with lots of space, all necessary equipment and amenities. Shower gel, conditioner, lotion etc. The location is also good. The reception are good at organising taxis and help for anything you may need. The gym and spa area, and the checking in problems, need to be dealt with however.
Date: Date of stay: September 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: underwhelming quality of service for the price
Review Content: Good location but overall quality of services found wanting.  The rooms appear worn out and in need of facelift.  Breakfast is good but takes herculean efforts to get tea or coffee--really annoying especially if one is in a hurry.
Date: Date of stay: September 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: price of a 4 star, service of a 2 star hotel
Review Content: Music from their Bar or club was clearly heard, our bedroom was on the second floor. Construction work opposite our bedroom was not mentioned. We were awoken by drilling machine noises at 7am. We practically had to beg for one more shower gel (though a double room was booked for 2) upon arrival then again in the morning since it was not brought the night before. There were no bathrobes in the room. We also had to ask for the dental kit twice upon arrival and next morning. We arrived by car, the receiving employees make less attempt to explain where the guest parking places are. I intentionally spoke to them in one of Namibia vernaculars (when I noticed Oshikwanyama accent in the one who tried to help, to his relief) to see how they treat locals. Yes, there is a difference. Having worked as a Service Checker in Switzerland, it wasn't difficult to spot areas of improvements. If Hilton Namibia is to demand European prices, then they should provide the same service standard as in Europe. The place is full now because it is new but risks loosing customers if it service remain worse than that of a simple Guest Farm in Namibia.  For us it was a one night test on our way to the airport. I would not want to be on a business trip here with all the noise and poor service. One have to pay to use Wifi in the room. The internet speed is still way way too slow.
Date: Date of stay: February 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Satisfactory stay
Review Content: Excellent new hotel. Check-in was fast and efficient. Room on the Executive floor very well appointed and clean. I liked the bathroom arrangement as it makes the area light, spacious and airy. Good bed, lots of power outlets, fridge and good view from window.Rooftop pool area quite small but lovely for the views. Nice bar for sunset drinks.Nice Executive lounge with two hours of light food and generous drinks in the evening. Service excellent.Dinner at the Ekipa restaurant was good and service efficient despite there being a lot of parties going on. Breakfast in the Executive lounge a bit restricted but the waiter offered to fetch food from the buffet in the main restaurant. Again service excellent and very friendly. Location good with a Chequers supermarket just across the street.Reception staff very helpful and went to a lot of trouble to sort out a problem I had with locating my rental car. My only negative is the cost of the wifi. Usually it is free in rooms on an executive floor.
Date: Date of stay: November 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Review Content: I love staying at the Hilton. These days with all my travels it feels more like a 2nd home then anything else. I get treated like I am family and am very well taken care of. I love the friendliness of the front desk staff and the breakfast at the Hilton is outstanding. A great expereince-

Name: Pathetic Room Service
Review Content: The room service was absolutely terrible at this hotel. I had to leave my room, get into my car and buy food at a garage because room service did not return 2 of the calls I made.  Another warning that prospective guests should be aware of is a letter they leave in front of your door when you're still a guest of the hotel asking you to pay an outstanding amount if it exceeds 4000 Namibian Dollars. I was absolutely offended by this because they're insinuating that I would not be able to make the payment
Date: Date of stay: November 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Fine but nothing special
Review Content: We booked our trip to Namibia late and sadly couldn't get into the Olive Grove which was our first choice.  The Hilton was fine as a place to rest our heads after travelling from London but it was nothing special.  The room was comfortable and clean, breakfast perfectly nice - really exactly what you'd expect from any 4 star chain hotel.  Treat it just as a convenient stopover before your Namibian adventure begins and you won't be disappointed.

Nous avons appr√©ci√© la bonne odeur d'agrume des produits douche et des serviettes.Un peu surpris dans un Hilton, de trouver un restaurant grillades, salades et pizzas, mais au final, tout est tr√®s bon pour un bon rapport qualit√©-prix, personnel au service √©galement tr√®s gentil, qui fait oublier la lenteur du service et...les traces de doigts sur les couteaux.Possibilit√© √©galement de se restaurer au 9√®me √©tage pr√®s de la superbe piscine.Pour finir, un petit d√©jeuner tr√®s complet comme nous n'en avions encore jamais eu en Namibie.Sans aucun doute, nous reviendrons.

Name: Best in town
Review Content: Unfortunately the initial welcome wasn't very friendly by the lady at the front desk, however overall the room and the dining area made up for it.Dinner was average, but after dinner drinks at the skyline bar was the highlight of the visit. With a 12th floor pool deck, amazing city skyline, and mature crowd, it made for good end to the night.
Date: Date of stay: January 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Modern and Well Appointed
Review Content: Only stayed for one night on business.From the moment you walk in, you notice that this is a new hotel and very modern.Reception service was very good.Rooms are fantastically appointed and decorated.I never had time to dine at the hotel, nor enjoy the popular Sky Bar, which is a bar on the roof of the hotel. Apparently a great place for a sundowner or a drink under the stars.Would definitely stay there again on my next trip!
Date: Date of stay: July 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Top quality hotel - Service still developing
Review Content: We stayed one night and pre-booked direct to get a good rate.  Excellent value for money.  The rooms were quiet and of excellent quality together with the common areas of the hotel.  Great central location.  Reception service was a bit hit and miss.  Some of the staff are still feeling their way around the running of the hotel.We ate dinner (a la carte) and breakfast at the hotel.  The food was well cooked and of a good standard.  The service in the restaurant was disorganised and a lengthy ordeal at dinner.  Reading a previous review any dish containing mushrooms seems to be a problem as we ordered a menu dish containing mushrooms and it was delivered minus the mushrooms but also without any explanation or apology.  Our dessert choice (from the small number available) was "out of stock" however one of the waitresses did offer an apology and provided us access to the buffet desserts.  The mushrooms seem to be reserved for the breakfast buffet as there plenty on offer the following morning.The massage at the Spa was exceptionally good and well worth the extra effort we had to make to secure the booking.  Both therapists were very well trained and it was one of the best massages we have had in a very long time (massage connoisseurs).  The Spa was unattended so left the Front Reception to make the booking.  They failed to do this so we tried again later in the day and finally managed to make the booking.The rooms very much have that brand new feeling.  The bathrooms could do with a main door however were very spacious and luxurious in the King Deluxe room.The wireless service in the rooms is "still to come" however is available in the common areas for a fee.All in all was an enjoyable 5 star experience and we would stay there again.
Date: Date of stay: December 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Lovely short stay in Windhoek
Review Content: Very comfortable stay !!! Room is clean and spacious. Food in restaurant was very good. Location is convenient to walk around.Key highlight is about the staffs. Caroline, Casiorina were very friendly, helpful and accommodating.Will definitely come back again !

Name: 5 star hotel but 3 star service delivery
Review Content: Very disappointing. Allocated a room which had a shower drain that emitted a permanent sewage smell. Did report it but continued to smell. Overpriced drinks in skybar. Service from most reception staff was unfriendly and they spoke more to their colleagues whilst they were meant to be assisting us. Security/doormen were extremely friendly and helpful. Disappointed with Christmas lunch. Meat was tough. Supposed to have crackers but they were finished by 1.30pm! Did not offer black tea bags in room. When requested we received 2 bags for 3 people over the entire 3 days we spent there.  We also had to ask for a 3rd bath towel. Disappointed that the gift shop was closed over peak festive season. One of the lifts was faulty over the entire stay. Unlikely to recommend or visit again.
Date: Date of stay: December 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Service at the sky bar was much better and the staff more visible, oh ofcourse they were right infront of us;-).

Name: Stylish skybar
Review Content: A relaxed skybar with a nice pool and a very nice spot for a bar meal or a sundowner. The hotel has two good restaurants and has a small sushi bar. Both buffet and a la carte dining was good. Off street parking upto 2.40 m (LandCruicer with rooftents OK). Rooms a bit dated but still nice. TV channel offering news and sport only DStv. Location downtown is excellent. Friendly staff. SPA decent!
Date: Date of stay: July 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Really nice
Review Content: We had one night here after 36 hours of travelling from Canada. We arrived early and were lucky enough that our rooms were available. We had 2 rooms as they did not have any that slept 4 . Rooms are large and well appointed. Modern open plan bathroom with large soaker tub, separate shower and separated toilet. Room had tea and coffee facilities and a mini fridge. The staff were friendly the hotel well located. We had a lovely sunset cocktail on the roof deck where we had enjoyed an earlier embracing ( cool) swim in the pool. We had breakfast and it was a really good breakfast. Omelettes to order , French toast , pancakes , fruit , cereal,pastries, toast cold meat , bacon Etc.  I would definitely stay here again.
Date: Date of stay: June 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: The place to be.
Review Content: Great rooms. Sky bar is the place to be on a weekend, great views of Windhoek. Staff always couteous and go out of thier way to make you feeel home away from home. Breakfast is always fantastic and on point. LOcation is in town whihc makes it easy to visist the very intersting sites arund city centre
Date: Date of stay: May 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good enough but not outstanding
Review Content: We stayed here twice, one night at each end of our tour of Namibia.The allocated room was comfortable enough although the bathroom layout seemed most strange with bathroom itself open to the bedroom.  The shower unit within the open bathroom is enclosed with frosted glass as is the toilet except that, in the room we stayed the first night, the frosted glass door does not shut.  We had to use the litter bin to jam the door closed for some privacy.Otherwise the room is perfectly adequate and the beds are comfortable and with plenty of fluffy pillows.Reception staff at this hotel are polite and always helpful but doormen, concierge, porters are surly, unfriendly and seem to have no respect for the guests or belongings of the guests.  The greeter at the front door is not welcoming at all and seems to eye all comers with suspicion.  The portering staff appear to be always pushing for tips and if no tips are forthcoming are often rude and leave the luggage by the door or in one case actually throw items onto the floor.The breakfast here is very good with plenty of the usual choices.  The restaurant can be busy and somewhat crowded at the normal peak times but staff can be helpful when needed.
Date: Date of stay: May 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great service, awesome location
Review Content: The staff at the Hilton Hotel in Windhoek are all very friendly and helpful. They also have very good English skills and had no trouble understanding our American accents. Parking costs were very cheap. Rooms were clean and comfortable. The breakfast buffet was very enjoyable and had a good selection of food and drinks for everyone. We also highly enjoyed the sky bar on the roof where we could enjoy a nightcap and the beautiful sunset. The hotel is also in a great location on Independence Ave, making it easy to walk to restaurants, SlowTown Cafe, the Namibian Craft Centre, Christchurch, and St Mary's Cathedral - or flag down a taxi easily.
Date: Date of stay: April 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great stay, excellent service
Review Content: We had a lovely stay at the Hilton. Location is brilliant with easy access from the road to and from the parking area. Paying R60 per night for parking is a bit unnecessary as there were more than enough parking available. I feel that parking should be free, especially when paying for an executive suite. We had access to the executive lounge. Snacks during the day consisted of nuts, dried fruit and biltong. This should be reconsidered by the hotel by adding more variety. Staff is friendly and very helpful. Will definitely stay here again next time we are in Windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: March 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hit and miss
Review Content: Some aspects of this hotel were very good but, unfortunately, some were also rather poor. The rooms were comfortable with great air-con, and the breakfast was excellent. The pool area is very pleasant, gets the sun all day and the food is decent. The gym (just off the pool area) has a water cooler so you can help yourself to cold water. However, they allow non-residents to use the pool which meant that sometimes paying guest could not get a lounger. This was particularly bad on Christmas Day when non-residents took over completely and getting a space and/or any service at the bar was impossible. One of the main drawbacks for me was the staff, which were a mixed bag. Some were lovely, whilst others fell far short of what I would expect from the Hilton. One receptionist in particular, Zeroline, was very difficult to deal with and was actively hostile to us when we politely raised an issue with the wifi (which is so poor it is almost unusable). Criticism and client feedback is clearly not welcomed at this hotel. Every time we encountered her after that was very awkward and she really took the shine off the first few days of our trip. Reception/reservations would not telephone a local taxi and instead would only call the hotel taxi, which was up to three times the price of a local taxi.  We asked for assistance in booking an excursion with an external company and again they refused and said they would only assist if we used their taxi to take us on the excursion, which I thought was outrageous. The reason we were asking for help was because the wifi was so bad we could not book online. I would advise pre-booking any trips before you arrive. All in all, not a bad hotel but I would not return.
Date: Date of stay: December 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good location, nice rooms, excellent restaurant
Review Content: But perhaps best -- quiet!  There is construction going on next door, and we feared the worst when arriving. We asked for a quiet room, and were given one more-or-less in the middle of the hotel.  In the hall, you can hear the pounding of the pile-drivers.  Open the door, enter and close it... and you can hear nothing from outside at all. Very nice insulation.The location is within walking distance of many of the downtown tourist sites (church, artist market, etc). The rooms are nice, though a few touches seem to prefer "form over function."  None big enough to complain about though.

Name: Disappointing

We arrived at 3 pm and the rooms were not ready, on asking they replied they coming back to us, at 4:45 pm I then had to threaten them that I want my money back and I‚Äôll move to another hotel only then 10 min I got my room, the reason I mention this is not that I would not wait for the room but if you tell me 2 hrs then I can plan around that maybe go out etc but every time you tell someone it will be ready soon you kind of wait and waist time. GIVE A PROPER ANSWER WITH A PROPER TIME. Please And fellow travelers how is this a Hilton and I have to pay parking and for Wi-Fi really. Other then that the food was excellent and the chef that walked around speaking to clients well done that is the way.

Name: Nice hotel but strange service
Review Content: The room was nice, clean, and comfortable.  The food was fantastic and tempting for any cautious travel eater to throw all caution to the wind.  However, the service is quite strange. Emailed the hotel before my stay seeking assistance for airport transfer and received email after my stay offering a pickup.  Room service served two meals and two drinks but only one glass and one set of cutlery.  Concierge ran out of city maps and gave me a book with a sketched map in it for me to go for a jog.  Offered late checkout till noon but then had 3 different staff call my room between 1000 and 1200 to ask me when I expected to checkout.

Name: Accommodation and decor good, bad service spoiled my birthday
Review Content: Room was lovely and clean and the bed wonderful. Shower lovely. Aircon a bit cold - one cannot control the temperature like with a normal aircon - most probably to save power ??, Switched it off and it was okay.  Would have liked the room warmer though.TV not so good - dark and the titles would not disappear like - just stayed there. Complained, they fixed it , but afterwards the same again. Reception gave good service and the porter was outstanding. Dinner was not so good - the food okay, but the service really bad. Waiter came to the table and then disappeared completely. Waited very long. Breakfast was a disaster. Table was not set properly, no coffee offered, had to ask over and over again. In the end they actually apologized by not letting our guests pay - ours was included - so we obviously paid. We warned them about it being my birthday the next morning, and they really tried to make it better. One should not make a scene and only then get service. Service at the Sky Bar was also VERY slow and waiter did not even clean the table before serving the wine.

Name: Business Trip to Windhoek
Review Content: During May 2016 I visited Windhoek for Business.  I stayed in the Hilton Hotel Windhoek.  The reception on my arrival was great. Friendly, confident and skilled staff confirmed the booking and within minutes I arrived in my hotel room.The room is spacious, with a full bathroom with bath and shower.  Everything was neatly arranged and the room is well lit.  It accommodate Euro, British and South African wall electrical wall plugs.  I do like the fact that the Toilet is separate from the bathroom.  Luxury bath towels and a range of soaps, shampoos, shower caps etc. are supplied.  There is a small minibar fridge and it is well stocked.The suite I where in had a king size bed with a nice firm mattress ideal for someone like me with back issues.  The pillows and duvet are also of good quality and aid in a restful sleep.A buffet breakfast is available in the morning and what a spread of food.  I am sure that the breakfast buffet caters for almost all tastes and the service is excellent. There is a wide variety of restaurants on site and one almost don't need to go and hunt for good food and restaurants. If you like steak and fillet you will not be disappointed.  If you prefer fast food type food like hamburgers and pizza is also on the menu.  If it is a lite snack, a toasted sandwich or something sweet and decadent you will feel at home.  If you want to stay in the room there is a 24/7 room service available as well.  The gym facility, with spa and heated pool is a huge add-on.  When away on business I do like to keep up with my exercise and training routine.  All and all his is an excellent place to stay over for a few nights.
Date: Date of stay: May 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Poor internet
Review Content: Recommended to me, I knew there were reviews on the poor internet and yes it is poor. Downloading and checking news and emails is fine, but I can't upload a document (not that big a file size) at all and no matter how many staff 'help' the problem remains I can't upload files I need to. Check in took a long time. The Executive rooms ( all that were available) are roomy and I haven't showered yet to try the pressure out. All I know is internet is important and it isn't working and there are other places where it works really well. There's off street parking and it is close to the city centre. I was slightly perturbed when told I would be unsafe walking around the city by checkin staff although I have been for days.
Date: Date of stay: April 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
