Name: Disappointed in Windhoek
Review Content: this Hilton compared to others around the globe is marginal to average at best. The hotel, location and amenities are great--what is lacking is the "can do" attitude of the staff. So many mistakes from checkin and throughout my stay that all these small things ended up adding up. Noisy room, no recognition for loyalty, check out not complete and had to pay difference, etc..
Date: Date of stay: February 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Ms
Review Content: The Hotel itself is very beautiful, it's the staff that I had an issue with. My mom, my sister and I came to the hotel for an early lunch at around 11:30. The lady at the Skybar had told us that they only start serving at 12:00 which we had no problem with and were willing to wait. When the time came to order, the waitress had a problem with taking my order. It was fairly simple, a club sandwich with no bread or mayo and a poached egg as opposed to fried. She literally made me repeat it three times and she said they could not give me a poached egg because the eggs are pre cooked, which by the way is very hazardous. Eventually she finally took our order, by then it was already 12:15, mind you we were already so hungry as we had skipped breakfast. It should not take 15 minutes to explain an order!! Then we waited another 30minutes for our drinks. I'm not sure how complicated a bottle of water could possibly be. When our food finally arrived at about 13:00 it was a total disaster. Firstly why did it take so long? The restaurant was not full!! The chicken fillet I got was probably boiled and tasted totally bland, the poached egg was rock hard even after I had especially  requested a soft one and there was no lettuce? My sisters "Caesar salad had the same boring and tasteless chicken. I'm pretty sure the "Caesar Dressing" was mayo!! My moms Chorizo salad was dry, the chorizo was as hard as a rock and the portion sizes are way too big!! Ultimately it just a bad dining experience all around. We don't classify ourselves as difficult guests, but the staff need to be more attentive and accommodating. The service was really poor, I actually had to get up to ask for the bill? Hilton is a Worldwide brand and they have a certain standard that I have become accustomed to. I can't speak for other departments, but as far as Food and Beverage, you need some serious improvement. As a Hospitality graduate this my area of expertise. Management needs to train staff on improving customer service, guest relations and service excellence? You are running a risk of not having return customers, people take their food seriously.
Date: Date of stay: February 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Overall, Hilton Windhoek offers a luxurious stay.

The restaurant staff was friendly, the house keeping staff great, and I should also add that my room was kept spotlessly clean throughout my stay. Breakfast was very good, with lots of options. I had dinner in the hotel a couple of times and I was less impressed with the dinner buffet offerings. Location was perfect since my meetings were all in the center of Windhoek, and I could walk.

The rooms and beds were very comfortable and we would not hesitate to recommend this hotel .

Review Content: This time around I have travel with my staff to 6 African state for business meeting and our last hotel stay is in Hilton Windhoek.The hotel is nice situated in the middle of the town very convinience for shopping and to look for food.But I don't think the hotel should be listed at five star rating, because the service and the staff are not professional and rude.My opinion if you check in I don't feel like I'm in a HILTON.Overall the Hotel is fine not more than that.Thank you. Happy Travelling.
Date: Date of stay: July 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great hotel and great location
Review Content: The best hotel in Windhoek right now..Nicely located with lots of restaurants within a walking distance and 5 mn from down town Windhoek! This is a great hotel with modern amenities and friendly and qualified personel.
Date: Date of stay: June 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great, comfortable stay
Review Content: Stayed for 2 nights for business and Hilton living up to its own. Even in Namibia, the service and cleanliness was great. Hotel food buffet for dinner was served with varieties, tasted great. Highly recommend to those who visit for business or pleasure.
Date: Date of stay: June 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Very good to begin and end vacations
Review Content: We stay there at the beginning and at the end of our trip. It is perfect ! The hotel is in the Centrum of windhoek, so very easy to visit by foot. The swimming pool at the roof is relaxing. The restaurant is very good and not do expensive. Rooms are very good ! Very good experience. Will do it again next time in Namibia...

Name: Best Hotel in Namibia
Review Content: The hotel is centrally situated in the city of Windhoek with a variety of amenities for all tastes (young and old, leisurely or business) and preferences. The ambience is great and with great vibe. Highly recommended.
Date: Date of stay: March 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great choice for business travellers
Review Content: Conveniently located, spacious room with great quality finishes and excellent breakfast made my stay at the Hilton Windhoek a very pleasant one.  Having to pay separately for wi-fi access in the room seemed unnecessary at the room rate charged - this should really be included.  Otherwise, would definitely recommend it.
Date: Date of stay: March 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice surprise
Review Content: Pros-Probably the nicest Hilton I have stayed in, a rather wonderful surprise given I was in Namibia.-Service: prompt and friendly.-Rooms: large, nicely decorated, hot water, very large bathrooms, lots of pillows (I like at least 3 myself, so this is an important feature for me), good wi-fi.-Gym: small but has everything you need.-Other: nice rooftop bar.Cons-None that I can think of, but I did not pay for the hotel as there for business so cannot comment on value for money.
Date: Date of stay: February 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Der Name verspricht mehr als die Wirklichkeit
Review Content: Wer ein 5-Sterne-Hotel bucht, erwartet auch einen 5-Sterne-Service. Aber da ist das Hilton in Windhoek meilenweit von entfernt. Habe mit meiner Frau 6 Tage in diesem Hotel gewohnt und von dort diverese Aktivit√§ten gestartet.Das gleich nebenan befindliche 4-Sterne-Hotel "Kalahari-Sands", in welchem wir 2 Jahre zuvor gewohnt hatten, hat eine andere Qualit√§t.Das Hilton ist ab dem Eingang schon unpers√∂nlich und steril, - hat keinen Flair. Die Keycard f√ºr den Lift funktioniert permament nicht richtig und muss st√§ndig neu codiert werden. Die Zimmer entsprechen dem Standard in dieser Klasse, auch der Zimmerservice. WLAN muss teuer bezahlt werden - ein absolutes NoGo! Das Fr√ºhst√ºcksbuffett ist alles nur keine 5 Sterne wert. Der Service und insbesondere die Schnelligkeit lassen auch hier zu w√ºnschen √ºbrig. Die Skybar wurde mehrfach schon um 23 Uhr geschlossen, da angeblich keine Getr√§nke mehr vorhanden, die Bar, eine Etage tiefer, hatte volle K√ºhlschr√§nke.An einem Tag ben√∂tigten wir, da wir sehr fr√ºh zu einer Tour starteten, ein Lunchpaket. Aber was wir da bekommen haben, kann man nur als Frechheit bezeichnen, zwei trockene Sandwich-Dreiecke, mit K√§se und Tomate belegt, einen Apfel und einen Trink-Yoghurt.Mein Fazit: F√ºr weniger Geld gibt es in direkter Nachbarschaft bessere Hotels. Sogar das "Safari-Court-Hotel", leider nicht zentral gelegen aber mit kostenlosem Shuttleservice, ist besser.
Date: Date of stay: January 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hilton Windhoek Skybar
Review Content: Hilton Windhoek is a great place to stay;Skybar is the best place to enjoy a sunset cocktail in Namibia. The bar's rooftop location on the 9 floor  is open air, breezy, and provides panoramic views of the city. If this isn't enticing enough,  cocktails are always availibil
Date: Date of stay: January 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice property
Review Content: We stayed here once again on our journey from the North to Cape Town. The annoying noise from the pervious year has been fixed and this made the stay very pleasant. The staff in general are friendly and the service in the various restaurants/bars is good. Nice touch was that the staff in the Exec lounge even remembers us - well done to her!! Makes us feel welcome.  The only problem is there is a lack of secure parking for 4x4.
Date: Date of stay: January 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: warm and clean
Review Content: Arrival experience is very good and so was the departure process, treated as a valued guest. There are a couple of service issues and the service staff can learn from the reception experience. engage with guests in the breakfast room, two days of my stay i stayed in the breakfast room for an hour awaiting my meeting and not once did the waitress ask if i would like coffee/Tea. rooms are great, the shower had the perfect pressure. would return
Date: Date of stay: December 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: 5 Stars Awarded
Review Content: I went on business to Windhoek and my wife joined to visit some of her family. Overall the Hilton was one of the best hotels we've enjoyed in our many years of world wide travel. Everything you need is on offer. The service was above reproach. The room was quiet, very comfy and generally it catered for everything. The Hilton is central to the CBD. Great breakfast and excellent sky bar with 360 degree views of Windhoek. It's not really a hotel for kids, but meets ever demand of an adult. Steve & Caron
Date: Date of stay: November 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Extremely comfortable
Review Content: I recently spent 2 nights with access to the executive lounge.  This is centrally located although there is roadwork and construction going on outside the hotel.  The executive lounge has free computer access, a wonderful and complete breakfast and dinner from 6 pm.  I took my meals in the lounge.  There are free drinks but only from 6-8 pm.My room was lovely and very quiet.  This is a good place to stay in downtown Windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: October 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great end to Honeymoon
Review Content: Exhausted from 38 hours of traveling and airports, it was great to walk into the beautifully decorated room, made up with rose petals, champagne and the pre-booked platters we ordered that were divine. Breakfast was all our hearts could desire after 3 weeks traveling not once tasting our own kind of food. The massages were relaxing and quickly worked out the knots from the long flights, leaving us rested and ready (though reluctantly) returning home to real life. It was the perfect ending to our honeymoon.
Date: Date of stay: October 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Un'eccezione in Namibia
Review Content: Ottimo hotel, ben gestito, pulito, con ottimi servizi, posizione ideale per visitare la city.In una nazione in cui l'hotellerie non brilla per efficienza e manutenzione, una piacevole eccezione.Centralissimo hotel con camere che spaziano sulla citt√†.Una piscina sul terrazzoe un moderno bar che attira tanti giovani della citt√†.
Date: Date of stay: August 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: zentrale Lage
Review Content: Riesiges Zimmer, wie man es von Hilton gewohnt ist mit gro√üem Badezimmer inclusive Badewanne und Dusche.  Allerdings zeigen Bad und Zimmer bereits einige Gebrauchsspuren, was bei einem 5Sterne Hotel, welches erst seit zwei Jahren existiert nicht sein d√ºrfte. Europ√§ische Steckdosen sind vorhanden. Internet ebenfalls, aber gegen Geb√ºhr.Das Fr√ºhst√ºck ist, wie ich es von Hilton gewohnt bin, umfangreich und reichhaltig. Man merkt aber auch hier die afrikanische L√§ssigkeit. Die Tische sind nicht immer komplett eingedeckt und es fehlt mal Zucker oder Besteck.Der Pool im 9. Stock ist nicht gro√ü, aber lang und auf der Terrasse kann man seinen Sundowner einnehmen. Leider wird neben dem Hotel gerade gebaut. Der L√§rm st√∂rt nicht, aber die Baustelle verschandelt etwas die Aussicht. Zur Sundowner-Zeit ist das Personal an der Skybar auch etwas √ºberfordert. Man muss dann schon selbst an die Bar kommen, um seine Bestellung loszuwerden.Trotz der kleinen M√§ngel (man ist ja in Afrika) werde ich auch beim n√§chsten Mal im Hilton √ºbernachten, da es zentral liegt.
Date: Date of stay: August 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: One night stayover
Review Content: I would most definitely make use of this hotel again when i travel to Namibia. The service was great and the food was good. The hotel is in a good location for both personal and business use. The next time I am in Windhoek, The Hilton will see me again.
Date: Date of stay: August 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Glamour priced worthwhile.
Review Content: It's a very nice place, clean and loved the buffet breakfast. I liked its security measures, where only hotel guests had access to floors with rooms. Also loved the safe that was very convenient. My room was spacious and had enough working space, which was very convenient for my visit. I didn't have to bother about looking for safe cab to take me around. I would definitely visit next time am in windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: August 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Perfectly fine
Review Content: Pros:Super modern designBig RoomsGiant bathtubAwesome rooftop barfree parkingCons:Wifi is more expensive than a steak from room service.Tricky hotel to findWalking around at night- not a great area.
Date: Date of stay: July 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good hotel
Review Content: Stayed here for one night at the beginning of a trip around Namibia. Was pleased with the service and the location is excellent (although Windhoek is small so this is not hard!). The roof top sky bar is great at sunset. Mostly though, I just veged. Room service was prompt and of a high quality - and not too expensive. Room itself was very good value and spacious, with a great lighting. On check out they waived the ND60 parking fee. Nice place.
Date: Date of stay: June 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good location to view the sights
Review Content: We stayed at the Hilton for 1 night at the end of our trip around Namibia. This is a sparkling, modern hotel that is well placed in the center of Windhoek. We arrived a little dusty after a long drive from Sesriem but check-in was quick and we were given a room even before the 2pm check-in time. The room was large and spacious, very modern and well equipped, complete with large flat screen tv and views across the city. The beds were large and very comfortable. I was very impressed with the bathroom that had a separate shower and bath tub. We ate lunch in the cafe near the reception and they had a good selection of foods. Breakfast the next morning was a grand affair, with an enormous amount of choice and lots of fresh and tasty foods. However, the skybar on the roof top was the most memorable experience. We had sun downers there (of good value) while watching the sun set over our Namibian adventure. I highly recommend the Hilton for a stay in Windhoek as all of the city's sights are in walking distance.
Date: Date of stay: May 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Excellent Accomodations
Review Content: I stayed at the Hilton Windhoek for work. The room  was very nice (comfortable bed, very modern bathroom including a soaking tub and a rainfall shower, lounge chair). I also thought the room service was efficient (I had heard that sometimes the wait was 2 hours from a colleague but all my food was delivered within 40 minutes). I would definitely stay here again. The rooftop views of Christ Church are stunning.
Date: Date of stay: April 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: At first glance it seems nice
Review Content: Horrible service, poorly trained staff. Crazy charges on our bill. I could not believe how poorly trained the staff were. Worst Hilton I have ever stayed at. The Chef served what was supposed to be Chocolate mouse, It was piped on a large plate and looked like feces on a plate. Art or food? Who cares when it look like feces. Shower flooded my room. No hot water in the morning. Should I go on? Don't waste your money stay at a guest house.
Date: Date of stay: April 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Wonderful start to our Namibia trip
Review Content: We had two nights here in January and it was a great chance to relax before we went off on 2 weeks safari around Namibia. I will always be biased about this place, as my boyfriend proposed to me as soon as we arrived! So if there were any negatives about this place, I really didn't notice them. Our room was wonderful - bed comfortable, great shower, quiet, well stocked. The rooftop pool area was a brilliant place to chill the day away reading a book. Food was great - we had the full buffet breakfast each morning, and steak dinner on our second night - service was good. I would recommend this as a great place to start or finish a safari, as I don't believe there was much to do in the city itself - though we didn't venture exploring at all..
Date: Date of stay: January 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Gorgeous
Review Content: The hotel is brand new. The design is ultra modern - simply gorgeous ! The rooftop pub a definate to try , the views are astounding. The food was great , the staff extremely helpful and friendly. I will be back - thanks to the management and staff for an enjoyable stay
Date: Date of stay: February 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Review Content: Very nice hotel, friendly and helpfull staff, excellent location in the centre of Windhoek - close to main city sites to be visited, incl. shopping malls, restaurants, etc. Hotel needs to improve some services in order to achieve excellent rates.

Name: Nice hotel but noisy
Review Content: Stayed a few days in this nice new hotel. The staff were friendly but u able to help when there was a problem. Our room was very noisy due to the water system but the staff continually ignored the request for a different room.Internet is very slow and far too expensive.

Name: Mr
Review Content: The overall experience was great with exception of the bar in which the beers were hot and no stock of one of the most drank brads of beer. I would stay there again as it is good value for money. The staff is friendly and helpful.

Review Content: Muy buenas las habitaciones, con todas las comodidades como no pod√≠a ser de otra manera para un Hilton, la atenci√≥n es buena y dedicada.La tarifa con desayuno tiene una importante diferencia con la que no lo incluye; el Wi-Fi en la habitaci√≥n es llamativamente caro.-Tiene una muy buena ubicaci√≥n y excelente vista de la ciudad.-

Name: Great start to Namibia
Review Content: Our party of 19 stayed here at the beginning of our 11 days in Namibia.  The rooms are comfortable, the service is good and the breakfast is great.  A particular highlight is the roof top bar and pool, especially good at sunset.  Highly recommended.
Date: Date of stay: September 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: the best view in windhoek!
Review Content: Very nice and helpful staff. Situated just right for tourist. Excellent service and food and love cleanliness in rooms and toilets. Great outside bar with a view die for. Will definitely visit again. Situated in the very middle of town with lots of activities surrounded it. Walking distance from nice malls and tourist attractions around. Some nice restaurants and shops just the other side of our main road independence rd.
Date: Date of stay: April 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: WINDHOEK HILTON--I NICE PLACE TO STAY
Review Content: I stayed at the Windhoek, Namibia Hilton twice in August 2013. Both visits were great. The best thing about the visit was the staff--they are responsive, respectful and nice. Congratulations on the good team.
Date: Date of stay: August 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good Hotel, excellent view, modern rooms
Review Content: Stayed on business, excellent room, clean, modern and great bathroom. Decor great. Check in had my laughing as they gave me the keys to a room someone was staying in, a lady, and I walked into the room to both our surprise, went down stairs and there was some embarrassed and confused faces, all got sorted out and I was up an running for the stay. Food was good and good selection for breakfast and a special order of eggs was done for me with little fan fare. Bar service was slow in the evening even though bar was not to full, we put it down to Namibia lifestyle, everything happens slowly, is the only negative that comes to mind. Would stay here again best hotel in Windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: June 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good Hotel but.......
Review Content: I was in Namibia from the 01st July - 04th July 2013 on business.There was about 10 of us and we decided to stay at the Hilton as its close to our officesCheck in was easy and straight forward, the only disappointment was that we checked in at 1545 hrs and some of the rooms were not ready therefore we proceeded to office without refreshing. Another member of our party quipped sarcastically that they expected a welcome drink from a 5 star.. ouchOnce checked in and settled the rooms were great,  clean and very spacious. They more than made up for the late check in procedure. I went to the gym three times and though small it was never full, I always had access to any equipment that I wanted. I was out most of the time and only had breakfast at teh hotel. The breakfast was excellent with a good variety of cereals, fruits and hot food (eggsThe skybar is the highlight of the hotel after a long day at the office and should not be missed. Nothing beats sipping a drink looking at the beautiful undulating Windhoek skyline Lastly and sadly being a business hotel its very disappointing that Internet access is charged separately and exorbitantly. To pay +/- US$200 per night for accommodation and get charged +/- US$20 for every 24 hours for internet access is ridiculous. To make it worse its US$20 per gadget, if you want access on the laptop and ipad you pay twice. The internet access issue is such a sore point for me that I will consider twice next time before staying there especially if am in Windhoek on business.
Date: Date of stay: July 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Fantastic stay in Windhoek!!!
Review Content: I visit Windhoek often for business purposes and usually stay at the Windhoek Country Club. I decided to try out the newly build Hilton Hotel in Windhoek during my last trip to the country and I was absolutely impressed with the design and feel of the hotel. It is, in my opinion, the only hotel worthy of a 5 star rating in WIndhoek - it really is a world-class establishment. Friendly staff, fantastic food. Definitely no better alternative in Windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: July 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Business or backpacker?
Review Content: I recently stayed at the Hilton in Windhoek with a group of 15 frequent travelers. Some were lucky enough to stay on the side of the hotel without the all night disco for our fri and sat night stays - I was not. I was placed in the room closest to housekeeping and the nightclub with the stairwell / rubbish door open. No need to say much more, although I was glad they closed the door next night of my two night stay, after asking.Why a business hotel would decide to have an all night disco running in their hotel seems like a poor decision to me.I would have turned a blind eye and thought "oh well" but for the fact it took us several attempts to get some towels in our room. When they finally came they were dumped on the bed like a pile of dirty clothes, unfolded and looking like the towels to wipe the floor. We asked for others but never got any. Accommodation and service in Namibia is very very good and perhaps this just showed up the flaws at the Hilton.
Date: Date of stay: May 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: No so good first experience
Review Content: I wanted the "Hilton" experience in Africa :), all i ended up was being left stranded at the airport, with miillions of men wanting to drive me to town for a reasonable price, not feeling secure at all. Upon arrival i was billed by the taxi that never showed up :( ...after one night in the hotel i decided to leave and check in into a B&B where i was treated like 5 stars!
Date: Date of stay: May 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: sun set at roof top bar
Review Content: great location with wonderful staff, helpful, fresh and always a smile in the facecongratulations the sun set with a GandT on the  roof top bar is just amazing !excellent FandB and serviceenjoy sal√ºds Robert
Date: Date of stay: April 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hilton tops in Windhoek
Review Content: Great hotel, great service, great staff! What a beautiful hotel and a great country. I never thought of putting Namibia on my list of countries but I am glad I did. The only recommendation I'd make to the staff is that everyone including the security outside need to know about the city...I asked many employees about certain sites and they had no idea... Other than that it's a great hotel and Namibia is one of the better countries of Africa!
Date: Date of stay: March 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good hotel
Review Content: I stayed for one night at this hotel. Everything was very good, especially the roof top patio. The dinner at the restaurant was very good.Otherwise I was upset that I have to pay such an high price for the internet.
Date: Date of stay: August 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: AMAZING Service!
Review Content: I visited the Hilton in Windhoek twice while I was in Namibia. I was very suprised by the amazingly helpful service. I was a lone 21 year old, visiting Africa for the first time, So I was nervous to be traveling alone.However at my stay they made me feel very safe and anything I needed they gave me instantly!They also were very quick in organising my taxi to the airport.The room was lovely, very clean and great for my 2 nights stay!Would definately recommend to any travellers all over!
Date: Date of stay: December 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Slow service, great views
Review Content: We had 2 separate visits of 2 nights, a week apart.  Spent quite a bit of time in the bar on the mezzanine - the one on the roof is pretty spectacular for views but usually very windy.  Service in the bar was always friendly but with only one exception (thanks Elrico), very slow indeed.  Restaurant was OK and bar food quite good.  Concierge very helpful and efficient.  Kettle with tea and instant coffee in room.  Did not have breakfast or use the spa.I don't understand why 5* international hotels persist in charging for internet access.  This is ridiculous in today's world and always leaves a bad taste.  It's a bit like charging extortionate minibar charges - why not just add a bit more onto the room charge and give 'free' access, making everybody much happier?
Date: Date of stay: October 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Very good experience
Review Content: We had a very good experience at the Hilton Windhoek.  We spent 2 weeks in Namibia to see the country, visit friends, and see the animals.  We spent our first night and last night in Namibia here at the Hilton.  As a frequent Hilton guest, they provided excellent service to us (2 couples, 1- 50ish, and the other in their 80s).  Everything was so shinny and clean, it was obvious the hotel was pretty new.  We got lucky at the airport, and when we called, it turned out that their driver was already there, so the return trip was very fast.  We never ate in the restaurant, so I can't comment on that; but, we did visit the lounge on the top floor (which was very nice), and they addressed us by name.  I‚Äôd have to say, this Hilton beats the ones I‚Äôve stayed at in the USA for its rooms and its service.After being out and about in the country at smaller places, the Hilton was incredibly luxurious by comparison.

Name: Superior jumping off spot for travel in Namibia
Review Content: Just opened, the Hilton in Windhoek, capital city of Namibia and the major international airport hub for this fascinating country in southwest Africa, provides travelers with an oasis of "western" style hotel including superb accommodations, wine bar/restaurants, lap pool and fitness facilities, and wonderful staff.
Date: Date of stay: June 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: European atmosphere in African Country
Review Content: This is a very good experience to stay in this hotel. Its standard room is really wonderful. It has a nice location in the downtown. A nice scenary from the room & another very special scenary on top of the hotel with the swimming pool & fitness center on the same floor. Professional service, good food & very suitable for business.
Date: Date of stay: March 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: No Complaints
Review Content: I stayed two nights by myself at the end of October and can truly say I have no complaints at all!Service was fast and I had assistance bringing my bags to my room. I stayed in a basic suite but still found it stunning. For my first night supper was great I got the oven baked pizza with baked strawberry cheesecake for dessert. the 2nd night had the buffet which was plentiful and delicious. The waitresses were great and came back frequently to refill drinks/ask how my food was. Breakfast was my favorite by far with many choices, and once again excellent staff. I needed internet and the front desk immediately found me a computer and got me hooked up. Also were able to tell me some good shops around and give me some helpful tips.All in all stunning place and I would stay again in a heartbeat!
Date: Date of stay: October 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Best Hotel in Namibia
Review Content: If you are looking for somewhere luxurious and comfortable to be spoilt Hilton Windhoek is the perfect choice when in Namibia. This new hotel with its stunning rooms and the wonderful staff make this one of the most memorable stays of our African trip.  We would not hesitate to recommend Hilton Windhoek for its great comfort and care.
Date: Date of stay: July 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Not that impressive
Review Content: On holiday with my family and stayed overnight in the Hilton Windhoek. I do travel a lot and is used to the best hotels in the world, this one was pretty disappointing.The Hilton is luxurious (as you would expect) with a friendly staff and good clean accommodation. This is were is ends. The heated pool was was cold (heat pump broke). We were allocated a room with an inter-leading door for the children. The children's room was not ready at the time of check-in so we initially unpacked our luggage in the 1 room. After numerous phone calls to reception (without response), eventually we were told we had to move to a different room all together. This is after we unpacked! I was not happy. We ordered Mojitos but they did not have mint leaves!We had dinner in the hotel restaurant and waited for our food for more than an hour and they got the whole order wrong!! The next morning we had breakfast in the same restaurant. On arrival the buffet area was empty with no sausages, eggs, bacon etc etc etc. I made a fuss and after 15 min this was stocked up again. I ordered a omelet, this never arrived. The whole experience was pretty disappointing and not what you expect from a Hilton hotel. I'm not convinced I will go there again.
Date: Date of stay: June 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
